677236789.name: Nice but very crowded
677236789.author: a TripAdvisor user
677236789.reviewBody: This beach is nice for swimming, tanning and surfing. The waves were quite strong but you could still go for a swim. The beach  is quite crowded with a lot of restaurants that provide loungers for a fee.

676419250.name: Surfing and swimming
676419250.author: a TripAdvisor user
676419250.reviewBody: This beach is beautiful for swimming and SURF LESSONS. If you have your own gear and are trying to get out on a wave I would recommend Punta Zicatela. The waves are bigger there but less locals. A local in the water at Playa Carrizalillo grabbed my surf shirt by the collar and said "you broke my board are you going to pay for it?" Also, "give me your board because you broke my board". After I calmly told this local I was not going to pay for either his board, nor give him mine, he said "get out of these waters, this beach is for locals only". I had surf lessons all week from a local guide and the first day I went alone this local surfer freaked out on me because I was on the wave he wanted to ride. Would not recommend this beach if you want to surf with your own gear or without a local guide.

669673232.name: A long  walk down.  163 steps to a perfect beach.
669673232.author: a TripAdvisor user
669673232.reviewBody: Beautiful small enclosed beach.  No rip tides.  Waves normally are not real big. Many venders on the beach for food and drink.  Also lounge chairs with an unbrella for a small fee.  Some say best beach in Puerto but 163 steps down and then up.

666150585.name: Great nice, small beach
666150585.author: a TripAdvisor user
666150585.reviewBody: To arrive at this beach, you need to take some stairs, but once you start descending,  you have a great view at the beach, is small,  beautiful and with waves so that you can surf. At the beach you can find restaurants and all service which you need once at the beach. Have fun and you sunscreen!

666011146.name: Gorgeous beach!
666011146.author: a TripAdvisor user
666011146.reviewBody: We enjoyed the beauty of the speech of the only downfall was the steep steps leading down to it and the lack of running water for bathrooms. There are lots of restaurants beachside and you can pay to use a reclining chair for the day!

663549967.name: Great Day at the Beach
663549967.author: a TripAdvisor user
663549967.reviewBody: This is a great beach for children.  The waves are big enough for them to play, but not so big it is dangerous.  There are surf lessons, food to purchase and chairs to rent.  You can also rent paddle boards or even go snorkeling.  The sand is hot and the water is cold.  If you swim out deep enough you may run into a sea turtle.  Definitely worth the trek down and up the stairs.

662400437.name: Nice beach for swimming
662400437.author: a TripAdvisor user
662400437.reviewBody: Nice beach for swimming or paddle boarding, for $250 pesos you can rent a lounger with umbrella. It can be crowded sometimes. Only downside is the stairs up after a long day in the sun and porta potties.

662198552.name: Relaxing beach!
662198552.author: a TripAdvisor user
662198552.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, can be a little busy at times but we still enjoyed it. Depending on the day/ time the waves can still be decent size, but it was the safest we felt swimming.\nThere are a few food spots on the beach, but we brought some coronas with us and all was well. \nBring a cooler if you\u2019re staying for the day, as you won\u2019t want to be running up and down the stairs more than you have to.

660895180.name: Beautifuy and breezy!
660895180.author: a TripAdvisor user
660895180.reviewBody: Though it\'s hot and humid in Puerto, you can stay cool under the palms on this beach. It will cost you 250-300 pesos for a lounge chair (camas), but if you eat you can stay all day at the tables. We thought the price on the lounges with umbrellas was a bit high, and you really need an umbrella, so we took a table. If you stay for a few hours, the price of the lounges isn\'t bad.

660300292.name: AMAZING!
660300292.author: a TripAdvisor user
660300292.reviewBody: Great Beach, low surf for swimming, but the stairs are a B*tch!   People do surf here sometimes, but I would think it is just for beginners, b/c I did not witness any huge waves.  However while dining at Espidine the evening before, I could look down and see ppl surf here.

659770208.name: Great beach!  Head down the steps to a delightful experience.
659770208.author: a TripAdvisor user
659770208.reviewBody: Gentle waves and no riptide with a  beautiful bay.  There were many people dispersed nicely - friendly atmosphere!

659662571.name: Nice beach!
659662571.author: a TripAdvisor user
659662571.reviewBody: Nice low tide, easy to go swimming or learn to surf. Very crowded however we went on a long weekend. Good food and relaxing day. About 170 stairs to walk down to get to the beach. Then at the end of the day you have to walk back up, but well worth it!!

659080609.name: Beautiful Beach - Great Memories!
659080609.author: a TripAdvisor user
659080609.reviewBody: We loved this smaller beach - enjoyed it so much we went 3 days in a row (at various times)  Mornings are less busy and water is just as warm.  We rented umbrellas and chairs from the various restaurants and ate lunch or dinner there too. There are outhouses for 5 pesos at one of the restos near the main stair.  My 7 yr old had a lifejacket on most of the time as he is not a great swimmer yet.  Neither am I so it took a while for us to get used to the waves as we haven\'t been to many ocean beaches before!  (Waves apparently get stronger in March - whereas Nov - Feb are more calm)  If you are like us, it\'s better to wade right in to the water than to stand where the water comes up on the beach - as the pull of the water is surprisingly strong there.  Once you are in the water, you can ride the waves.  My husband and my son both took surf lessons on this beach.  Although I was a bit hesitant for my son, they assured me that someone would be with him the entire time and they are trained to work with kids.  They were great with him and he loved the experience.  He ended up doing another lesson the next day.  They even saw 1 of the 3 sea turtles that live near the beach during their lesson! It\'s truly a beautiful beach!

657192727.name: Great beach
657192727.author: a TripAdvisor user
657192727.reviewBody: Beautiful cove with beginners surfing. 167 step down (and back up) to get to it. Rent the surfboard at the bottom. Chairs with umbrellas for $10 a day.

656871965.name: Swimming here is beyond fabulous
656871965.author: a TripAdvisor user
656871965.reviewBody: I have been swimming with my Carrizalillo swim group for about 5 years each winter. It is the most wonderful group and ocean swim I have ever experienced. And, I used to do triathlons, so I have open water swims to compare this one to! It\u2019s just perfect water ( most of the time). Today was so clear you could see every little fish. One year we put our heads under the water and heard a mother whale talking to her baby, and the baby answering! Now that\u2019s incredible!!

656146352.name: Playa Carrizalillo is a Beach Surrounding a Turqoise Pacific Ocean Bay
656146352.author: a TripAdvisor user
656146352.reviewBody: Once you walk down the safe cement and rock stairway you arrive at a beach having all you need for a delightful day. Excellent for swimming and snorkling or lounging on cushy beach lounges with umbrellas, eating and drinking with foods from several restaurants. The scenery of rocky, plant festooned slopes, the sun, the crystal water, the sand, and ocean will make you think you might just have found paradise.

655386886.name: Best place to swim
655386886.author: a TripAdvisor user
655386886.reviewBody: Had a wonderful time at this beach. Most beaches in this area, unless you are a string swimmer are a little to rough with under tows for the novice to swim. So great to bob in the waves and enjoy the warmth of the Pacific Ocean. You can also enjoy watching the surfers a little further out . Great beach !!

654961157.name: beautiful beach in spite of 166 steps to get there
654961157.author: a TripAdvisor user
654961157.reviewBody: beautiful water. quiet beach with some waves but safe to swim. For $300 pesos which goes towards consumption you can hire a table and chairs under the shade

654848923.name: Simply the best .......
654848923.author: a TripAdvisor user
654848923.reviewBody: Love this beach .... around 175 steps down (which means up) to this fantastic little bay. No boats which makes for nice and quite relax at the beach .... Love it !!

654173060.name: Worst restaurant ever!!!
654173060.author: a TripAdvisor user
654173060.reviewBody: We ate at carizalillo bar which is on the left of the beach when watching the sea. We paid 200 pesos for ceviche that were impossible to eat because too spicy. Since we had asked for not spicy we asked for a reduction. That is when the waiter threatened us to call the cops and told us \u00ab\u00a0franceses de mierda\u00a0\u00bb. Worst exp\u00e9rience ever!!!!

653911285.name: Nice beach for beginners surfing lessons
653911285.author: a TripAdvisor user
653911285.reviewBody: Hidding below a nearly endless flight of stairs, it is only when leaving the beach you hate them. The beach itself is nice and a little less touristy than Zicatella and El Punto, but it still has beach restaurants with cocktails and they offer surfing lessons.

652430482.name: Beautiful
652430482.author: a TripAdvisor user
652430482.reviewBody: One of the few swimming beaches, accessible only by a set of 167 steps. Didn\'t seem hard to do, but clearly not for the mobility challenged! The access is well maintained and the beach is worth the trek. Bathroom facilities tend to be outhouses, and the restaurants seemed overpriced (we didn\'t eat there). We brought our own umbrella, towels and spent many lovely hours there.

651771217.name: Playa Carrizalillo
651771217.author: a TripAdvisor user
651771217.reviewBody: This is a lovely beach that offers food, drink and toilets and is often busy.  Surfing lessons go on most days so fun and entertaining to watch.

651104611.name: Turquoise Waters
651104611.author: a TripAdvisor user
651104611.reviewBody: Such a beautiful beach! As everyone knows, its like 100 stairs to get down and back up from there but it doesn\'t stop a lot of people from visiting this amazing beach because the stairs are totally worth it! It\'s a much smaller beach so it is often pretty crowded. The water is awesome and the waves aren\'t nearly as big as at Zicatella so it\'s much better for swimming and families with young kids.

650916090.name: Awesome view!
650916090.author: a TripAdvisor user
650916090.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach!...lots of steep stone stairs down to the beach...and...back up! Worth the stairs for the view!

650720336.name: Love it!
650720336.author: a TripAdvisor user
650720336.reviewBody:
We spent a lot of time here during the week (not at the weekend).  We were here in early December and the beach was not crowded.

There are sunbeds and parasols for hire but there is also room in front of them if you don't want to hire a sunbed and just want to lie on your towel.  There were far fewer hawkers here than on Playa Zicatella etc..

The beach is small but we loved it.  It’s safe to swim in the bay and while we were there, on two days, we were joined by turtles who swam very close to us.  An amazing experience.

Just be aware of the steep climb up a lot of steps at the end of the day.

649926926.name: Vacation
649926926.author: a TripAdvisor user
649926926.reviewBody: Fun and beautiful beach for all ages come and learn how to surf or just get a tan with good sea food shacks all along the beach.

649583461.name: Soft samd amd clear water
649583461.author: a TripAdvisor user
649583461.reviewBody: Spent the afternoon on the beach enjoying lunch and cervasas.  Quite a few steps up and down to get to the beach but it was worth it.

649360627.name: spent 6 hours swimming and it was awesume
649360627.author: a TripAdvisor user
649360627.reviewBody: wonderful beach day.  must spend 300 pesos to get a chair and shade , but that is not hard to do if you are eating.

648525977.name: Very beautiful beach, but it can get crowded during high season
648525977.author: a TripAdvisor user
648525977.reviewBody: The key to enjoying this beach is to get there before noon -- especially during high season, when it can get astonishingly crowded. But the physical location is stunningly beautiful, and it\'s a lovely spot to hang out. Note that there are quite a few steps to go up and down to access the beach, but there are food and drink vendors at the bottom which is nice.

648300797.name: Beach
648300797.author: a TripAdvisor user
648300797.reviewBody: The beach is nice.not very high waves for swimming. The food not to bad. But the 164 stairs.going down is ok but going back up could be challaging. I would recommend it. The view is awsome.

646510442.name: Best beach to chill
646510442.author: a TripAdvisor user
646510442.reviewBody:
Beautiful beach located in a small bay.  Perfect to relaxe and swim, as it drops quickly to deeper water without too much currents. 
Sometimes, you can surf there, but not in January, really.  
Avoid going on weekends as it gets crowdy. 
And, get ready to pay 200 pesos if you want to lay on a chair!  Buying a consommation is not enough.

645232378.name: I visit this beach once a week...it is amazing.
645232378.author: a TripAdvisor user
645232378.reviewBody: I love that you can swim out a long way and the water is Sooo warm.  I also love that you have 150 stairs to go up when you leave - cause I get my exercise.  The cantinas have simple tasy food and lots of cold beer.  Life is good.tasty

644865954.name: Fantastic place to spend an afternoon
644865954.author: a TripAdvisor user
644865954.reviewBody: Waters are pretty calm and super warm.  Work a deal like 200pesos on the lounges and bring your own coolers of beer and sofa.

644814362.name: My Favorite Beach in PE
644814362.author: a TripAdvisor user
644814362.reviewBody: Carrizalillo is my favorite beach in PE. Make sure you get there early, or you might not get a good set of chairs. Bring cash for drinks and food on the beach.

643878395.name: Too crowded
643878395.author: a TripAdvisor user
643878395.reviewBody: Went here during the end of December. Was way too busy, felt like we were in an indian beach given how many people were theee. Can avoid

642537159.name: Crowded, but great for swimming
642537159.author: a TripAdvisor user
642537159.reviewBody: This is a tiny beach, but the shelf drops off quickly and the waves are gentle, which makes it good for a swim.

642136260.name: Top 10 most beautiful beaches
642136260.author: a TripAdvisor user
642136260.reviewBody:
This beach has got to be up there in my top 10 most beautiful beaches I have ever come across. Maybe not ideal for anyone with a push chair, wheelchair or elderly person as you have do go down quite a few flights of stairs in order to get down to the beach. But if there is any way that you can, then it’s definately worth it! 
The water is crystal clear and a gorgeous turquoise colour. The beach looks a bit like a cove in the way that it is surrounded by cliffs, which for some reason gives it a safe feeling. There are a few little bars/ cafes where you can get something to eat if you get hungry while down there (we didn’t go to any of these so can’t comment on what they were like). 

PThe photos attached to this review really don’t do the beach any justice, it was just incredible! Water was a refreshing temperature but it does get deep fairly quickly so be a bit more careful if you’re taking children there. We would end the day there by watching the sun set and it is such a beautiful sight. Everyone just sits and enjoys/ takes it all in. It made me feel somewhat at peace just relaxing on this stunning beach while watching the sun set for the day.

642109746.name: Amazing!!
642109746.author: a TripAdvisor user
642109746.reviewBody: Swim here, lounge here, enjoy the beauty here. Amazing place to go swimming, snorkelling and relax! However, stairs are killer, prepare !

641705795.name: Small beach with great vibe
641705795.author: a TripAdvisor user
641705795.reviewBody:
Great place to go during the week if you wanna feel local vibe.

Plenty of restaurants and shops a few steps from the beach.

One of the safest beaches for swimming especially with kids.

As this place is tiny, a avoid to go on Sunday as locals are off and therefore gets jam packed by the end of the morning.

Amazing view of sunrise and sunset from the cliff.

A good 5 -10 steep walk to go down to the beach itself is required to get there.

640233017.name: be ready to fork out lots of money
640233017.author: a TripAdvisor user
640233017.reviewBody: 200 pesos per person, the restaurants took the whole beach. You cannot even find a spot to sit down without paying. If it\'s your first time you can go down the 250 stairs to check it out the view is amazing. Used to be a little paradise 5-6 years ago but now they completely ruined it. Go down half the stairs and look at the view or else just don\'t go.

640211797.name: Beautiful Beach and surroundings!!
640211797.author: a TripAdvisor user
640211797.reviewBody: Attended Playa Carrizalillo on two occasions this past stay in Puerto Escondido.  We enjoyed it so much the first visit, we had to go back to enjoy another afternoon at the beach.  Swimming, surfing, paddle boarding,and relaxing. Water and sand are beautiful. Great service with the food vendors set up at the beach.  We can\'t wait to get back!

636370060.name: Cosy beach
636370060.author: a TripAdvisor user
636370060.reviewBody: Really cosy beach, but gets flooded at 5PM :)\nReally great to swim in this beach, but not recommended for children.

635484813.name: granny learned to surf
635484813.author: a TripAdvisor user
635484813.reviewBody: one of the best beaches i have ever seen to learn to surf.the break is soft but the waves still have power.\nnice wide sandy beach a few spot to snorkel.watch out for beginning surfers.the food shack on the far east end were the surf school is has great guac and quesadillas

634153635.name: Beautiful Beach
634153635.author: a TripAdvisor user
634153635.reviewBody:
This beach is worth the steep and long staircase entry. You will marvel at the views as you descend!

Great bay for a day trip of lounging, swimming and surfing (season permitting)! We had great food and service at La Palapa de Rosis.

One issue, clean bathrooms are a challenge. We recommend prior to the descent trying one of the restaurants on the street above called Benito Juárez! Don't forget about the bakery!

633512915.name: Love this spot
633512915.author: a TripAdvisor user
633512915.reviewBody: Beautiful gem and beginner surf spot, slow rolling waves, really fun.  It gets crowded fairly fast, enjoyed sunset here as well

631220154.name: Beautiful, #1 for beginner surfers
631220154.author: a TripAdvisor user
631220154.reviewBody: Coral based sand. Several food and drink shacks, a man sells oysters by the dozen. Beer costs 30 pesos, sodas 25 pesos. Chair rental without food or drink purchase is 200 pesos. It gets very busy on the weekends and try and find out the Hightide/Lowtide info before renting a surf board. You can rent a board on the beach 100 pesos per hour, 300 pesos per day until 6 pm. A very scenic view!

631058930.name: Cracking beach
631058930.author: a TripAdvisor user
631058930.reviewBody: Such a nice beach, worth the steps. Great waves to mess about it, few places to get food and drinks, loungers for 75 pesos. Can rent surf boards too. Go up to Espadin for a drink during sunset! Amazing.

630560520.name: Beach turning bad, people are smoking and disrespecting nature
630560520.author: a TripAdvisor user
630560520.reviewBody:
This beach used to be my favorite....now, it just makes me sad because people are polluting it, smoking cigarettes, playing loud music, leaving beer bottles around....

This used to be a special place that I loved....now I just feel disappointed. Too many jerks disrespecting the beach. 

Go to Playa Entrega instead....you can swim, you can snorkel and there is amazing fish. It’s cleaner too. 

Or playa oregano....very deserted, but beautiful to swim.

629098635.name: Nicest beach/cove in Puerto Escondido
629098635.author: a TripAdvisor user
629098635.reviewBody: Nicest beach in Puerto Escondido. Well sheltered with lots of surfers and simple bars/restaurants right on the sand along the half moon shaped cove framed by rocks. Long access stairwell to get there.

624962613.name: BEACH WITH WAVES
624962613.author: a TripAdvisor user
624962613.reviewBody: Beautiful small beach with lovely sand. You can go there by taxi from Puerto Escondido.\nIt has waves and surfers training. You can chill in the cafes and have a good time. We were there in August- October 2017, the water was always warm. Do not use headscarves or sunglasses while swimming, the waves will grab them. Have a great time.

624562769.name: Top spot
624562769.author: a TripAdvisor user
624562769.reviewBody: In Puerto Escondido the best place if you want to swim. Small bay in which one also wants to make his first steps as a beginner on the surfboard. Nevertheless, one should not underestimate the surf.

621584746.name: Nice beach
621584746.author: a TripAdvisor user
621584746.reviewBody: Amazing beach in a bay where you can swim among surfers and turtles, but the stairs to the beach may turn away older people. Restaurants on the beach are quite simple.

621436059.name: Worth every step!
621436059.author: a TripAdvisor user
621436059.reviewBody: This place is a beautiful cove, part of the greater area of Puerto Escondido. I took a surfing lesson there, then stayed there the rest of the day!  They have different restaurants with palapas, you have the option of paying for the palapa use or eat at the restaurant then you can stay without paying extra.  Because of its accessibility, it doesn\'t get crowded and it makes it a thing to do.  You can only get there thru a stairway...which is not that bad!  The restrooms are a trip, they have public ones, you pay 5 pesos for each visit, they are as clean as they can get!  People are very nice, friendly and accommodating.  After my surf lesson, wanted to change, there were no real dressing rooms but the gentlemen offered his storage room where he kept his boards as an alternative! Worth every step!

618301275.name: Perfect to go swim and start surfing!
618301275.author: a TripAdvisor user
618301275.reviewBody: It\'s a small but super nice beach, the only thing we didn\'t like is that most of the places charge you 200 pesos for sunbeds and umbrella. there is one place at the end of the beach that let you use the sun beds for all day if you consume 350 pesos with them and they were very nice.

598884294.name: Beatiful beach.
598884294.author: a TripAdvisor user
598884294.reviewBody: Very pretty beach, nice and quiet spot for relaxing and swimming without risk of drowning because of the big waves from the open sea. The thing is that the restrooms are horrible, stinky and dirty, and you even have to pay! Beside that, very nice spot.

596424829.name: Crowded and local surfers own it.
596424829.author: a TripAdvisor user
596424829.reviewBody: Overcrowded with restaurants. Surf guides think they own the break. Seen someone get their wave only to have an instructor push in front and get hit by his board, cut his cheek, then this bloke was surrounded by instructors claiming it was his fault and he had to go to hospital with the instructor to pay for his stitches.. rocks in the break so beware at low tides. Good break otherwise and sheltered beach for swimming.

594701554.name: Use to be magical, now taken by retaurants
594701554.author: a TripAdvisor user
594701554.reviewBody: Is a very nice and small beach, surrounded by rocks, with beautiful turquoise water and nice not to wild waves. Now all the space has been invaded by chairs, sand beds and umbrellas, that are rented for the day. The place is crowded with people and chairs and you could not even walk. The water is surprisingly dirty, because other beaches in Puerto are really clean. A shame ... :(

589613788.name: Serene and beautiful!
589613788.author: a TripAdvisor user
589613788.reviewBody: Looking for a chill beach to take a book and read?  Learn to surf or catch some waves in this lovely bay?  Do not miss Playa Carrizalillo!  Be ready to walk down a series of stone stairs and save some energy to walk up!

584229234.name: You choose your wave size
584229234.author: a TripAdvisor user
584229234.reviewBody: Super views, water calm, clean beach and very friendly people. A real experience.  will return.\nGood access with stairs

583912694.name: Beautiful hang out place, lot of work to go there and up
583912694.author: a TripAdvisor user
583912694.reviewBody: It is beautiful, however the stairs to get to, and back up, are a really work out, really good food, nice enviroment.

582321936.name: Beautiful and low key cove
582321936.author: a TripAdvisor user
582321936.reviewBody: We spent at least part of 3 of our 4 beach days in Puerto Escondido here. The ocean is warm and the colors are more vibrant than a lot of Pacific beaches are. Great to hang out all day, enjoy the water, and just chill.

580648837.name: Nice day spot or to learn surfing
580648837.author: a TripAdvisor user
580648837.reviewBody: It pretty much very hot from 11am till 4pm so grab one of the lounge chairs and umbrellas.  Drinks and food are a bit pricey so you can bring some or at least water yourself.   You can rent a surfboard or get a lesson, sometimes its crowded.   The part you can stand is not deep, and the part you swim in is very.  And the sun sets behind the mountain.  For best sunset, go to Coral Beach from 5pm or a few hours before, no umbellas or stands there, but a bit easier to sit in the water, decent snorkeling, and careful of the rocks....

578905245.name: By Far Best Beach in PE!!
578905245.author: a TripAdvisor user
578905245.reviewBody: We go to this beach multiple times when we visit.  We rent chairs and then we surf, we play frisbee, boogie board, swim, hangout, drink, eat ice cream, and more.  The people that offer these services are kind and not pushy. We will continue to go back for many more years!!

572525748.name: Nice little beach for surfing and swimming.
572525748.author: a TripAdvisor user
572525748.reviewBody: Went to this beach a few times during a surf camp. Very relaxed and quiet. Good for families. No loud annoying beach clubs. While there is still an active surf here it is smaller than the other local beaches.

572005989.name: Great surfing for kids
572005989.author: a TripAdvisor user
572005989.reviewBody: Our kids 7and 11 took surf lessons here and the waves are perfect for the beginner.  The beach is quaint and casual and away from the hustle of the main beach.  We loved this beach.

571932649.name: First Time Surfing
571932649.author: a TripAdvisor user
571932649.reviewBody: We went and took our first surf lesson then enjoyed a fruit plate for breakfast.  The area is nice but busy and not for long beach walks but watching the surfing is very enjoyable.

568542872.name: Best beach we\'ve ever been to
568542872.author: a TripAdvisor user
568542872.reviewBody:
Best beach Andrea and I have ever visited!

We have been to Maui, many in Florida, Belize, Cancun, etc.

Gorgeous!  Great waves, crystal clear waters, cool international crowd.  So much fun watching all the surfers!

It's a small, so I could imagine at the wrong time of year it could get overly packed.

Service at the palapa we used was awesome!

566698945.name: The place to go!
566698945.author: a TripAdvisor user
566698945.reviewBody: Loved going to Playa Carrizalillo.  We spent a month in Puerto Escondido and went to P.C. at least 8 times.  You can purchase food/drinks/lounge chairs or you can bring your own.  We usually brought our own.  Beach was beautiful and clean.  Lots to do there - surf, bogie board, snorkel, swim or just soak up the sun on the beach. Would go back to it in a heart beat!

565653021.name: Beach
565653021.author: a TripAdvisor user
565653021.reviewBody: Steep set of stair down to the beach. Not for the faint of heart. Expensive umbrella charge! And charge for bathroom on top of that! Food reasonably priced.

565526440.name: Step arobics in the sun
565526440.author: a TripAdvisor user
565526440.reviewBody: Didn\'t realze there were over 165 stps leading to the beach.  Not really compatable with knee or breathing issues.  Cost was $300 pesos to rent char and umbrella, which can be exchanged higher for food/beverage.  Prices higher than most.

565101078.name: Best beach in puerto escondido
565101078.author: a TripAdvisor user
565101078.reviewBody:
One of the most picturesque beaches ive been to (and i've been to Tulum, cancun, Thailand, Vietnam, Bahamas, aruba).  The steps are not bad at all- take your time if you need to..there is no rush :) we saw older people going up and down.  

renting a chair is nice but the prices vary between the bars. one place told us $400 pesos for two people and just pay for it in food and drinks. the next day, we went to a different place and it was $200 pesos just to rent (food and drinks were separate).  you could get away without a chair and umbrella but it might be sunny and hot.

The beach can be rough and it gets deep early on but its super fun to swim in. you will see people get rolled around by the strong shore waves. its so fun to watch the surfers.

564759563.name: Sun & Surf
564759563.author: a TripAdvisor user
564759563.reviewBody: Beautiful white beach with lots of restaurants serving cold cervaza on a hot day . You can rent a lounger with shade , sit & laugh & enjoy the great food . The waves & the current can be strong so watch the little ones AND be prepared for the 150 steps down to the beach & back up as well !

563449527.name: Our favorite beach in PE
563449527.author: a TripAdvisor user
563449527.reviewBody: Very pretty beach, clean water, lots of steps,over 160, easier arriving and leaving, but if you\'re in OK shape, not a problem.  Definitely worth the effort.

561941659.name: Breathtaking view from stairs
561941659.author: a TripAdvisor user
561941659.reviewBody:
This beach was my favorite of all!
To get to playa carrizalillo you have to take some good stairs, from the stairs the view is AMAZING.
This beach is small not to big but beautiful and simple, they don't have restaurant there so be prepared with your own water and snacks.

561795554.name: Themost beautiful Cove
561795554.author: a TripAdvisor user
561795554.reviewBody: From when you come down the 160 steps to the beach until you climb back it is one of the most relaxing settings I have ever experienced. Try the fish tacos at the furthest point to the left as you leave the stairs. They are the best I have ever eaten and Very Cheap. Enjoy this wonderful Place!

561356427.name: Quiet compared to others
561356427.author: a TripAdvisor user
561356427.reviewBody: There are some great palapas here, where you can sit and watch the waves tear into the cove. A bit hard to find, but well worth it.

561325925.name: Possibly my favoret beach in the world.
561325925.author: a TripAdvisor user
561325925.reviewBody: Other than the 169 steps down and up to get there, it is fabulous.  The swimming is terrific and there are lovely palapas along the back to provide you with chairs and tables, food and drink.  Swim out towards the ocean, come back and have a coco frio or a beer and lounge back for the afternoon.

560342217.name: Beautiful Carrizalillo
560342217.author: a TripAdvisor user
560342217.reviewBody: This is a gorgeous spot to spend a few hours/a few days/ most or all of your vacation \ud83d\ude0eAlthough it can get quite busy, most people here are very friendly (business people and guests alike). There will always be a welcome spot, get a coconut, a snack , a beer go for a swim, surf, etc. Also contrary to some previous reviews; there are bathrooms, even though they may be a little more \'rustic\' than what you are used to (and I think you may have to pay one of the kid \'attendants\' the equivalent of .50 cents to use.\nJust go and enjoy, it\'s a great beach !

559647294.name: Beautiful, but..
559647294.author: a TripAdvisor user
559647294.reviewBody:
The beach has a transparent water, waves for beginner’s surfing and amazing view from the stairs where you approach it. 
Sadly, there are no decent bathrooms, it gets crowded from around 12 p.m. and the service is very different from what one can expect of a Mexican place. 
The piña colada inside a real coconut was delicious though!

Bottom line: be prepared to be in crowded place, see overpriced beds and tables, and pee in the sea.

559443902.name: Beautiful beach
559443902.author: a TripAdvisor user
559443902.reviewBody: It was rated as the most swimable beach in the area. The downfall wad that it was ovecrowded to the point that you could not enter the water. I went back to it on my last day at 7am and wish i had done that every day. Simply stunning and only one more tourist around

558924098.name: Love this beach, stairs and all
558924098.author: a TripAdvisor user
558924098.reviewBody: This is a busy spot for swimming, especially on weekends.  It\u2019s very popular for learning to surf also, so keep your head up! Expect to pay about 250 pesos for lounge chairs, but if you spend that in food and drink it\u2019s all included.

558670822.name: Great for Swimming!
558670822.author: a TripAdvisor user
558670822.reviewBody: Playa Carrizalillo is great for swimming as the waves are not as big as other beaches. Several restaurants/bar are providing parasols on the beach as long as you purchase food and/or drinks. The prices were very reasonable and the food and drinks were delicious. \nPrior to visiting Playa Carrizalillo, we purchased some body boards from the market which were convenient while swimming in the ocean as we are not the best swimmers; it was lots of fun and very picturesque.

558427564.name: My go to beach
558427564.author: a TripAdvisor user
558427564.reviewBody:
The best beach in town- my opinion. The 156 stairs down a 90 meter cliff were no issue( coming up is a good work out). The crescent shaped bay has gentle waves at the shore, no undertow, a a break 100 m from shore for begginer surfers.
Many restaurant options. They ask you spend 200 pesos ($12.00 us) for a covered beach chair or table rental. With lunch and a few drinks it was well worth it.
I went 3 times a week for 3 weeks. It is 5 minutes from Caficito Rinconada

557577131.name: Do it, walk the 170 stairs to get here, then up.
557577131.author: a TripAdvisor user
557577131.reviewBody: Its totally worth the effort, and if the restaurants can carry all those drinks down those stairs you can walk it.  Be sure to stop to look, as walking and looking may get you injured.

556764435.name: Wonderful
556764435.author: a TripAdvisor user
556764435.reviewBody: This beach was the star of our stay. Clean, quiet with no boom boxes or loud music, except for the sound of the waves. Surprisingly, it had quite a bit of people, kiosks all along, but well taken care.the waves are good , not overwhelming! Loved the place!

556387165.name: A hidden gem
556387165.author: a TripAdvisor user
556387165.reviewBody: If you don\u2019t mind a little adventure and 160 stairs down to the beach then this is a \u201cmust see\u201d beach.  Warm water with very gentle waves and it stays shallow quite a ways out.  One of the most beautiful beaches in the area.

555303110.name: Beautiful spot
555303110.author: a TripAdvisor user
555303110.reviewBody: Close to the center of town, lots to do in the area, great views and a really nice walk around the area. Also a safe place to have a dip in the ocean

555294963.name: By far the beast beach for swimming and snorkelling in Puerto Escondido
555294963.author: a TripAdvisor user
555294963.reviewBody: It is relatively small but beautiful beach for swimming and snorkelling. No big waves like on Zicatela, crowds like on Puerto Angelito and Manzanillo, and rough access and rocks like on Coral, and polluted water on playa Principal. There are stone steps down to the beach but easily climbed up or down.

554999497.name: Perfect, except for those 168 steps back up
554999497.author: a TripAdvisor user
554999497.reviewBody: Our favorite beach.  You can pay to have a nice lounger chair under an umbrella.  the beach is not huge but certainly big enough to get in a good swim.  Waves are small, water temperature perfect.  There are a few small places to eat with tables and you also can get drinks on your lounge chair.  Hope to get there one more time before we leave.  Take a cab from Puerto Escondido and ask them to drop you off at Playa Carrizalillo.  Then walk down the 168 steps - with camera ready for the beautiful views.  Gets crowded on weekends.

554299247.name: Beauful beach.
554299247.author: a TripAdvisor user
554299247.reviewBody: Like crystal water. Can see inside of water. Very quite place beach. Very low wave and no deep water. If you travel with kids I will recommend.

553630467.name: Walk down is worth it
553630467.author: a TripAdvisor user
553630467.reviewBody: Great beach beautiful beach sandy great clear water  a bit of a long walk down but worth it good service .You get table chairs umbrella free if you food and beverage bill is at least 200 pesos really only $13.00 Canadian we spent 4hours

552220327.name: Fav. Small swimming beach
552220327.author: a TripAdvisor user
552220327.reviewBody: In my opinion this little beach is the best for swimming. Since you have to be careful due to open ocean, this little beach gives you security to watch your loved ones in a pls e with fewer waves than other places. For lunch, go to the inky palapa with a second floor

551908497.name: small and crowded
551908497.author: a TripAdvisor user
551908497.reviewBody: As its a small beach, its full of people, lots of kids. the few restaurants there ask for a minimum consumption of 300 pesos. So if you want to drink just a beer - forget it.

548524629.name: Prettiest Beach Ever
548524629.author: a TripAdvisor user
548524629.reviewBody: If you can manage a huge flight of stairs, the effort is worth it just to experience this sheltered treasure. This small beach offers several restaurants with shaded tables and lounges. A must see in PE.

548281039.name: Learning to Surf
548281039.author: a TripAdvisor user
548281039.reviewBody: We had the best time learning to surf with Julio and Negro \ud83d\ude0a they are great to learn with and fun to hang out with also - highly recommended - find them on the beach...

548130225.name: Perfect water
548130225.author: a TripAdvisor user
548130225.reviewBody: Great swimming - gentle waves, clear water, but arduous stairs! Save your energy for the return up 156 steps!

547238052.name: Very calm and beautiful beach.
547238052.author: a TripAdvisor user
547238052.reviewBody: Beautiful place to spend a few hours on the beach, however the food is not the best and kind of expensive compared to other restaurants in the area. I would recommend taking water and snacks down there. Getting there is not easy as you have to go through 170 steps down in order to get to the beach.

546507914.name: Perfection!
546507914.author: a TripAdvisor user
546507914.reviewBody: This place is incredibly beautiful.  Just walking on the stairs you have a spectacular view.  Definitively a spot to visit.

542753590.name: Nice surf spot
542753590.author: a TripAdvisor user
542753590.reviewBody: + nice wave, stunning view,  - too much stairs, too much swiming people! Be careful not to hit someone!

542007926.name: Gorgeous water and beach
542007926.author: a TripAdvisor user
542007926.reviewBody: Quaint secluded beach with aqua blue water. Worth the 160 steps down and back up. Crystal clear water with manicured beach, rental lounge chairs and nice sloping shore. Perfect for swimming, sunbathing and beginning surfing. Vendors offer drinks and food.

539842081.name: Great place to surf- snorkeling not so much
539842081.author: a TripAdvisor user
539842081.reviewBody: There a a bunch of places on this beach to camp out under umbrellas on a comfy chair for only the price of a beer. It is lovely and the surfing was crowded but good. It was windy and the snorkeling was less than stellar

539543470.name: Still the best !
539543470.author: a TripAdvisor user
539543470.reviewBody: Of all the beaches in Puerto, this is our fav. Yes you have to walk to it (with lots of stairs) but that deters the crowds. The most below, beautiful beach in Puerto. There are restaurants with tables and chairs but all you need is a towel or sarong and there is shade under the tress at the east end of the beach till 10 am. Very chill place if you want to hang out and swim. Easy pace to learn to surf or go snorkelling (to the left around the point where there is no sand and the water is clear). You can get food and drinks if you want or just hang out on the sand and leave when the crowds come (after 11am). Just try it and rate it less than 10/10. I dare you. 170 stairs going up though.

539235752.name: Beautiful Beach, tasty Coconuts, less waves
539235752.author: a TripAdvisor user
539235752.reviewBody: The beach is quite crowded but you will always find a spot in the shadow supplied by fresh Coconuts (30$), nachos (60$) and beer (25$). The people are service oriented and very friendly. On a crowded day you may be asked to spend a minimum amount like 100-150$. \nEspecially for people who do not like to go swimming in the wavy beaches around Puerto Escondido,  this beach offers an alternative.

538307192.name: Pretty bay
538307192.author: a TripAdvisor user
538307192.reviewBody: Fun beach , very pretty . Beginner surfers . There are snack bars and loungers that you can rent . A great way to spend the day . Waves are manageable , so you can cool\noff in the ocean .

534202555.name: The best beach around
534202555.author: a TripAdvisor user
534202555.reviewBody: This is the best beach in the area! It\'s a great area to learn to surf or simply go to chill for the day!

533908956.name: On Tour with the McLintons
533908956.author: a TripAdvisor user
533908956.reviewBody: 113 stairs to get to this little oasis, nice place for a swim or snorkle, lots of people learn to surf here, and you can stand up paddle.  You can hire beach lounges and umbrellas, & buy drinks and food.  Lovely day.

525781490.name: BEAUTIFUL BEACH
525781490.author: a TripAdvisor user
525781490.reviewBody: Playa Carrizalillo is the most beautiful beach in Puerto. Take yourself down the steep 167 stairs and feast your eyes on crystal blue waters. Good waves for learning to surf and some great surf schools to help you along the way. You must go and check it out!

521838076.name: A must go during puerto vacationing
521838076.author: a TripAdvisor user
521838076.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, fresh sea food, coconuts, shade, surf lessons and paddle lboard rentals. I live in ouerto and always take my friends and family here

521219915.name: There are better beaches
521219915.author: a TripAdvisor user
521219915.reviewBody: I only spent about 10 minutes on this beach. It\'s a steep walk down lots of steps and a hike back up. When I arrived at the beach I realised that there was no shade, so I tried to get a seat on a table (not even on a sun lounger) but each little cafe requires a minimum spend of 250 pesos (some 350), just to sit on a table! Most tables were empty (surprisingly). I was alone and as a backpacker, could not justify the spend. I therefore did not return to this beach and much preferred Playa Puerto Angelito, which is 10 minutes away.

517414108.name: Friendlier waves!
517414108.author: a TripAdvisor user
517414108.reviewBody: Carizallilo has lots of charm and has the best waves to start surfing but also to snorkel and swim on the bay. Definitely my favorite amongst all!

515019136.name: Nice little beach
515019136.author: a TripAdvisor user
515019136.reviewBody: It\'s a nice little beach, try and ge there early to get a nice spot on the sand. Food is meh but you can bring your own snacks, just please pick up after yourself. Beach beds and a nice umbrella will run you around 13 dollars. Get ready for a nice 100 stair walkway in or out of the beach. Bit tiring but well worth it. Have fun.

512946641.name: What a spot!
512946641.author: a TripAdvisor user
512946641.reviewBody: Playa Carrizalillo is a lovely little beach, Don\'t be put off by the steps they are not that strenuous. We had a lovely day on the chairs at carrizalillo ($250MEX minimum spend) at the far left of the cove. The team were so helpful and even taught us the recipe to their camarones en aguachile (spicy prawn ceviche).. I recommend both the beach and Carrizalillo!

511586165.name: A lot of fun!
511586165.author: a TripAdvisor user
511586165.reviewBody: We finally came across this beach at the end of our stay in Puerto! It was the most lively with lots of tourists and locals and brave people taking surf lessons! Nice range of fish restaurants and the waves were very strong so be aware if you are not a strong swimmer.

507256947.name: Cozy beach
507256947.author: a TripAdvisor user
507256947.reviewBody: A beginner - friendly beach for surf enthusiasts. Cozy, full of palapas and ideal for swimming. You will mostly find a young crowd. Beware of the steep long steps. The entrance is located in Rinconada, where you can find several restaurants like fabulous Almoraduz or Luna Rossa for great pizza.

503632898.name: The most beautiful beach in Puerto
503632898.author: a TripAdvisor user
503632898.reviewBody: 167 steps to get to the beach but worth it. Don\'t pay for a sun chair! Most of the bars let you use it for free if you spend over $100 pesos at their bar.

501025904.name: Bay with palapas and beginnerssurf
501025904.author: a TripAdvisor user
501025904.reviewBody: This bay is hard to reach, either go around by boat or hike the long set of steep steps up and down. You will be rewarded by a lovely beach, sweeping waves that are kinder than in Zicatela and thus more suited for learning to surf. Big selection of small palapas providing seating and shade are available

490446481.name: Simply stunning cove!
490446481.author: a TripAdvisor user
490446481.reviewBody: Get their for sunrise and have the place to yourself or chill out with a coconut as the sunset behind the rocks! This place is beautiful. Great beach for swimming, surfing or snorkelling. Plenty of bars down there although the toilet situ is iffy!

484234837.name: Great beach
484234837.author: a TripAdvisor user
484234837.reviewBody: Playa Carrizalillo has something for everyone. There is swimming, surfing, snorkeling, paddle boarding for the active folks in your group and wonderful lounge chairs under shade for those inclined to relax.  There are plenty of options for food and drink so you can easily make a day of it on this crescent beach.

476770873.name: Nice but very busy
476770873.author: a TripAdvisor user
476770873.reviewBody: Probably due to the Semana Santa but I found this beach way too busy. It\'s a great natural place but being small and one the easiest place to swim in Puerto Escondido it got really busy.\nNice beginner surf spot.

476623360.name: Nice Beach
476623360.author: a TripAdvisor user
476623360.reviewBody: The beach is located in a nice bay. The waves are not to high, its possible to swim here. Food and Drinks can be purchased at the beach.

476280019.name: Jewel Bay next Puerto Escondido
476280019.author: a TripAdvisor user
476280019.reviewBody:
One of my top 3 beaches (X'cacel and Balandra being the other two). 

Small bay hidden from the world by scores of stairs down the mountain. Palapas with local and Mexican food and beer, surf schools and board rental, snorkeling spot, little sand space. 

Depending on the month, waves will be medium (2-3m from the floor) to non existent. 

If you like to swim further in, watch out for surfers coming at speed, don't turn your back on them! 

You can bring your own food and beverages but consider going up the stairs loaded.

475525084.name: Small and crowded
475525084.author: a TripAdvisor user
475525084.reviewBody: Maybe because I came in high season, but it\'s just really small for the amount of people on it. A little dirty also for the size of the beach, and the have to many restaurants in there. Try instead Agua Blanca

475154169.name: Great beach for swimming
475154169.author: a TripAdvisor user
475154169.reviewBody: The waves at this beach are not as high and challenging like they are at Zicatela. It\'s a great beach for swimming but can get pretty crowded since it is quite small. Easy to get to but be aware that you will have to go down a fair number of stairs to get there.

473202906.name: Small waves.
473202906.author: a TripAdvisor user
473202906.reviewBody: This beach is much calmer than Zicatela and Escondido.  Safer for families with children and non swimmers.  It\'s also a great place to learn how to surf.

473187348.name: Perfect beach
473187348.author: a TripAdvisor user
473187348.reviewBody:
Just a wonderful place. 
Good eating
Nice water 
All in all a exquisitely nice place to go to the beach.

472001226.name: Lovely beach spot! Friendly locals. Rent surf boards and eat yummy homemade snacks. Great waves and family feel.  Many v
472001226.author: a TripAdvisor user
472001226.reviewBody: Many vendors but not annoying at all. Nice beach with rented chairs and umbrellas. Can rent surf boards too.  Food fresh and yummy!

470060580.name: Beautiful Small Beach
470060580.author: a TripAdvisor user
470060580.reviewBody: Nice beach for swimming once you master the 197 steps down...it gets easier the more you do it. \nSelection of restaurants along the beach and there are beds and umbrellas for rent.  There is little consistency in relation to pricing for beds!  Some were free if you ordered food and drinks and others ranged from $100 to $150 pesos depending on the day\ud83d\ude10. Washroom facilities are awful, and only to be used in an emergency, I would rather navigate the 197 steps and use the restaurant facilities than venture into one of these stalls again.

469745139.name: Great beach in puerto Escondido
469745139.author: a TripAdvisor user
469745139.reviewBody: Although surfers come here too, the  break is generally far enough out and gentle on the shore so that anyone but a beginner swimmer would likely swim here.  Beautiful water .

469109302.name: A perfect beach
469109302.author: a TripAdvisor user
469109302.reviewBody:
Playa Carrizalillo is relatively well protected, so there's the chance to learn surfing (there are several beach boys around who really do their best to get their clients up and moving)
The swell at the beach is modest, so even small children can enjoy playing in the warm water. 
It's also a nice place for a little snorkeling.
The locals have their huts and restaurants and rent chairs or benches with a minimum consumption, absolutely ok and support of the local business

467836170.name: Picturesque and local
467836170.author: a TripAdvisor user
467836170.reviewBody: 170 steps down and also up. Small bay and sheltered beach. Relatively steep beach. Great swimming but watch children, as the shelf drops off fairly steeply just beyond the breakline into deeper water. Snorkelling, beginner surfing lessons, sports fishing tours. A number of cantinas offering light meals, snacks, drinks, also sun shades, seats, loungers. Be aware, it is a sun and heat trap here. Toilets. It has become increasingly popular over recent years with everyone from everywhere esp gringos, as reflected by the separate fees now charged for loungers, sunshades & seats. Additionally, tends to be unbearably overcrowded at the various public holiday times eg. Easter. Hence my rating of 4/5.

467286068.name: Perfection with a little Action as well
467286068.author: a TripAdvisor user
467286068.reviewBody: This beach provides it all.  Swimming in the waves, with paddle boards and surf boards for rent.  Great spot to relax, with lots of little beach restaurants for drinks.  Food is ok  but not outstanding.  Rent a chair and umbrella and relax!

465993047.name: Smaller beach
465993047.author: a TripAdvisor user
465993047.reviewBody: With steep access via good stairs. Very clean with good facilities to sit and sunbath and enjoy snacks & a beer. Waves are not high here so there are surfing beginners on one side - but still plenty of space for swimmers. Not many beach vendors so ideal to relax.

464916904.name: Great calm beach
464916904.author: a TripAdvisor user
464916904.reviewBody: A super calm beach to relax and spend the day. The steps to get there are a bit long and steep, but a minor hassle to overcome for a beautiful and small beach.

463918456.name: Get a Day Bed and Chill Out
463918456.author: a TripAdvisor user
463918456.reviewBody: Awesome way to lose a day, grab a day bed (to the right as you face the ocean it was 350 peso for 2 or if you spent 350 or more peso\'s on food and drinks then the day beds are free....cant get much better than that...ocean can sometimes be a little rough for people who are not ok swimmers but good for beginner surfers or lessons...

463308655.name: Beautiful beach in paradise!
463308655.author: a TripAdvisor user
463308655.reviewBody: We spent the day here, parked under a beach umbrella, surfing, and swimming.  The food is cheap, as are the surfboards.  There are no boats at this beach, so swimming seems safer.

463275384.name: Well worth the walk!
463275384.author: a TripAdvisor user
463275384.reviewBody: Walking down the 160 plus steps is truly worth it.  The beach is beautiful with plenty of umbrellas and lounge chairs (for a price) or just bring your own like we did.  The water is great for snorkelling, boogeyboards, surfing, or just swimming.  Make sure to bring lots of sunscreen for it gets very hot and you can burn in a short period of time.  A great place to spend a relaxing day with someone close, family, friends or young children.

462253083.name: A pretty, safe swimming beach
462253083.author: a TripAdvisor user
462253083.reviewBody:
Make sure you slap on the sunscreen. Bright sun and water reflections will give you a nasty burn very quickly. 

There are semi permanent food vendors who wil cook up and provide sodas and beer and there is a basic washroom facility near the stairway. (10 pesos?) 

Significant stairway is only access and not friendly to folks with major health or mobility issues. Small snorkelling areas have cute critters but nothing worth buying equipment when you can rent. Paddle boards can be rented. 

Mobile Ice cream vendor on the beach is one of nicest people you wil ever meet and his ice cream is delicious- and safe.

461204701.name: Best beach in Puerto Escondido!
461204701.author: a TripAdvisor user
461204701.reviewBody:
After visiting the neighboring beaches (Bacocho, Zicatela and Angelito) I was beginning to get worried that I wouldn't find a real beach that I could swim in - Carrizalillo changed my opinion.

Unlike Zicatela, which is really for the surfers, Carrizalillo is far more approachable. As you walk down towards the beach, there's a wonderful view of the waves crashing into the rocks, but once you get to the beach you'll realize that it's very easy to swim in the water.

I went to at a restaurant that charged $150 MX for two shaded beach chairs. Once we were there, we could order drinks or food and easily get into the water without fear that our stuff would be stolen.

The water isn't too cold and the waves break farther from the coast, so you'll be able to swim around without having to constantly look over your back, just be mindful that the sea is strong, so it might take you a bit more effort to return to shore. The number of people was very manageable, even at 2pm the beach wasn't crowded. My only problem is that there's a walk up a long set of stairs to leave the beach and it'll be tiring after spending time in the sun. All in all, I wish I went to this beach the entire time!

461041271.name: Very nice quiet beach, good surfing spot for beginners
461041271.author: a TripAdvisor user
461041271.reviewBody: The beach is beautiful, you get there walking down the stairs from a cliff (unfortunately it\'s the same way back). The by is more quiet comparing to surrounding beaches which makes it a perfect surfing spot for beginners. Because it\'s one of a few places suitable for non-experienced surfers in the area, it gets crowded sometimes.

458907336.name: Beautiful Bay
458907336.author: a TripAdvisor user
458907336.reviewBody: Most relaxing and great swimming. Total chill. Look for the oyster man about 2pm coming out of the sea... with a couple bags full of the sweetest freshest oysters you can imagine. Plenty of other awesome food and beverage available. Keep in mind this involves a climb down and back out.

457734634.name: The perfect beach to chill and swim in puerto escondido
457734634.author: a TripAdvisor user
457734634.reviewBody: The place is fantastic, quite isolated and although you have to climb a long steep staircase to get in or out, it\'s totally worth it the water was perfect and it\'s calm, being suitable for swimming or paddling! It\'s a must!

457588957.name: Playa Beautiful!
457588957.author: a TripAdvisor user
457588957.reviewBody: Carazaillio is a gorgeous beach safe for swimming.  It is no a big beach and if you get there early you will find a chair to rent/ sit in which you can use all day for a fee which is used if you order food which is is usually delicious.  It is also exercise built in as it takes 169 stairs to get down and up!  It is our favourite beach by far.\nWe also love the local cultural exposure as many local families and others from other part of Mexico also frequent this beautiful playa!

457181600.name: A great little beach for climbers
457181600.author: a TripAdvisor user
457181600.reviewBody: Compared to the other main beaches this one is petit and at the base of very high hills with no road access. After descending almost 170 steep steps (well built with railings too) this bay offers a lovely little curved beach with safe swimming, snorkeling,  chairs for hire and several food options. Remember that you still have to climb back up those stairs....

456764553.name: Site seeing & swimming
456764553.author: a TripAdvisor user
456764553.reviewBody: Great beach for swimming.  Small but plenty of lounge chairs and restaurants to eat and drink at.  Long stair climb to get to the beach.  Close to Posada Real Resort (15 min. walk)  Safe.

456725419.name: Hidden Pardaise
456725419.author: a TripAdvisor user
456725419.reviewBody: The beach is a bit small but still feels like a hidden piece of heaven.  Be prepared to walk some long, steep steps to get to it, but it\'s worth it.

456588614.name: Our Favourite Beach
456588614.author: a TripAdvisor user
456588614.reviewBody: This is a very scenic beach that is well worth the 168 stairs you need to take down to it. Often good snorkeling and some good little restaurants.

456276773.name: Great swimming beach!
456276773.author: a TripAdvisor user
456276773.reviewBody: Head down the stairs and bring your own umbrella as most shady spots are already taken.   Bring your own food and water, enjoy a beautiful beach!!!

454138981.name: Worth the climb
454138981.author: a TripAdvisor user
454138981.reviewBody:
So the first thing you should know is that it is 166 steps down to the beach from Av Benito Jaurez. And that means 166 steps back up. If you are 62 with bad knees, this may be a limiting factor. Or it might be an enjoyable challenge. I'm going with the latter since I did it 5 times.

The second thing you need to know is that there is a steep drop off. Fifteen feet from the water line you are over your head. 16 feet if you are 6'6" So if you aren't a great swimmer, stay close. Fortunately the surf is gentle and the undertow practically non-existent.

But the food is tasty at the 8 or 10 little cafes and the beer is cold and cheap. And except on Sundays the beach is uncrowded.

453398793.name: Beautiful!
453398793.author: a TripAdvisor user
453398793.reviewBody: I have swam at many beaches in Mexico and this is my new favourite!  It is amazing and first thing in the morning there are not many people there which makes it even better

453192845.name: Lovely beach
453192845.author: a TripAdvisor user
453192845.reviewBody: This beach is great for swimming, paddleboarding, chilling out. There are some surf instructors around  offering their services. Also a couple of places to drink/eat if you fancy. It is beautiful!!!

453192266.name: Beautiful fun beach
453192266.author: a TripAdvisor user
453192266.reviewBody: Over 150 stair to gain access to beach .  Stairs are in very good condition.  Beach is awesome. You can take surf lessons on one side of the bay, snorkel and find turtles feeding amongst the rocks or go to the other side and swim in the waves.  Lots of little inexpensive resaraunt son the beach. Popular with locals. A great way to spend an afternoon. A fresh water spring is at one end of the bay where you can rinse off. No trinket sales people here.  If you are in fairly good shape you can do the stairs. Just take your time. I saw a few 70 year olds climb them.

451944625.name: Best beach in PE
451944625.author: a TripAdvisor user
451944625.reviewBody: Beautiful and lovely beach! It\'s picturesque, laid back, and safe for swimming.  With our group it was easy to order a few drinks and hit the minimum amount required for chair/umbrella rental (the sun is hot and the having the umbrella was a smart move).  We swam and swam- the water was comfortable and I never felt unsafe swimming.  You can rent SUP & snorkel equipment, as well as get surfing lessons here.  Don\'t be put off by the stairs,(unless you have mobility issues).  They are a bit of a workout but nothing to be worried about.

450514169.name: Magnificent oasis!
450514169.author: a TripAdvisor user
450514169.reviewBody: While not accessible from the beach,  it\'s an easy 20 min walk from the playa principal through the town.  The over 150 steps down mean a fantastic view and a perfect photo opportunity.  Go early to avoid the crowds and make sure to get a "cafe y pan" from El Cafecito at the top of the stairs to enjoy by the beach.  The waters here are calm and a beautiful turquoise.  Make sure you go in for a dip!

446745731.name: One of my favourite beaches
446745731.author: a TripAdvisor user
446745731.reviewBody: This beach can get very busy during the Christmas season so be sure to go early to get a spot.  You can rent lounges from all of the little restaurants located on the beach. There are 167 stairs to get to the beach so remember this when having to come back up!!

446578827.name: Best Beach in Puerto
446578827.author: a TripAdvisor user
446578827.reviewBody: Easily the best beach in Puerto, however it is quite small, and is becoming increasingly crowded. I do hope they start cracking down on the boats pulling into the beach (it is supposedly not allowed) as it creates a safety hazard. There\'s a long staircase down (and of course back up) to the beach, and it\'s due to some people\'s laziness that the boats even go in there. With that said, it\'s certainly a very great beach to swim, learn to surf (when the waves allow), snorkel, or just work on your tan and drink a cold beer.

444281863.name: Beautiful little beach
444281863.author: a TripAdvisor user
444281863.reviewBody: Worth walking down all of the stairs for. Lots of small restaurants and bars serving you in beach chairs. Beautiful sunsets. Calm water, good for swimming.

443353292.name: Beautiful but not Untouched
443353292.author: a TripAdvisor user
443353292.reviewBody: No question that this is the most picturesque, clean and swimmable beach in Puerto. The long walk down via the easily to navigate steps provides an amazing view.  Once at the bottom you see what appears as 3-4 bar / restaurants - each very small the expanse of the beach reminded of us Yelapa in Jalisco state - but the bay on which Playa Carrizalilo is located is smaller, water calmer and a joy to swim in or snorkel - unlike Yelapa.  Lots of toddlers playing in the water here.  We picked out chairs and hunkered down for some sun, relaxing and a cervaza. A taxi was $35 (MXN) from along Zicatela Beach to Playa Carrizalilo near the entrance at top of stairs. Our favourite beach place on our visit.

437264757.name: Mr
437264757.author: a TripAdvisor user
437264757.reviewBody: Beautiful beach for swimming,  beginning surfers and boogie borders. Great for children to go into the water. Lots of stairs to go down and up again so older folks or anyone with walking problems can go to some of the other great beaches.

437251245.name: Best Beach In P.E.
437251245.author: a TripAdvisor user
437251245.reviewBody: This beach is accessed from 157 stairs, although they are not that strenuous to climb. There are restaurants, boats and surfing lessons. During the week it is not too crowded, but it definitely fills up on weekends. This was my favorite beach to swim at in Puerto Escondido because the water was calm and clean. Overall, I find the beaches of Huatulco to still be nicer and cleaner, but this is your best bet for swimming in P.E!

437196360.name: Good place to start surfing in summer
437196360.author: a TripAdvisor user
437196360.reviewBody: Locals normally start surfing Playa Carrizalilo have to take stears to get beach. Left point brake and right. But right is not for first time surfers. Winter get flat here. It is time for snorkeling at right rock beach area. There are cozy restaurants up and down.

436971197.name: STAIRS!!!
436971197.author: a TripAdvisor user
436971197.reviewBody: There are some 180 or so stairs and the beach is small. It\u00b4s nice enough, little restaurants but the bay drops off to deep water fast. Playa Angelito is only 1 mile away with easy access, tide pools, gradual surf, calm water.

332293447.name: Dolphin watch
332293447.author: a TripAdvisor user
332293447.reviewBody: I would highly recommend taking a boat trip during the early morning to watch the sea life. We took the boat "Chonita" from Playa Carrizalillo and were given a tour by Chon who has a deep knowledge of the area. We spotted a couple of turtles, rays and hundreds of dolphins. It was amazing to see the dolphins swimming and spinning just a few meters from the boat. They weren\'t shy at all and kept giving us a show for at least half an hour. Great experience.

309179068.name: Only 157 steps...and you\'re there!
309179068.author: a TripAdvisor user
309179068.reviewBody: The beach is nestled at the bottom of  concrete stairs which are a little strenuous when departing but wide enough to allow for breaks to catch one\'s breath when leaving. It is well worth the effort to enjoy white sand, a not overly-crowded  beach, GREAT surf, good swimming....and service to boot! For a small tab, you can access chaises and umbrellas to make the beach experience (between dips in the surf) comfortable  - the food available is good and the drinks cold. Bathroom facilities are readily available. There is a seemingly endless stream of vendors but they are not intrusive and they have excellent wares available - from hand embroidered purses and clothing to necklaces of semi-precious stones. I would strongly encourage being prepared to make some purchases of  quality crafts - prices are negotiable....don\'t be too cheap - this is a living, not a hobby! The water offers swimming, surfing, searching for shells and sea glass and some rental options (boat trips, sea-do\'s, boards,etc.).  You can also make arrangements for boat excursions for fishing, dolphin watching, turtle spotting, etc. The surf can be quite strong so take precautions with young children. Dress is beach-casual and you do need sandals for the sand which can be hot - a hat and sunscreen is essential. If the surf is up, try some body surfing if you don\'t have a board.

299693656.name: Beautiful beach
299693656.author: a TripAdvisor user
299693656.reviewBody: Awesome little beach hidden away in Puerto. Great waves for surfing and also suitable for swimming. Could spend the whole day here chillaxin\' and soaking up the rays!

287026875.name: The perfect beach
287026875.author: a TripAdvisor user
287026875.reviewBody: I really loved hanging out at this beach! the size of the waves are perfect to learn how to surf and also to swim and spend some time inside the ocean. The people that go there is mostly young and some families with kids which makes it a very fun and safe beach. Since is a small bay you can see everything from your table and in case you need something there is always people form the restaurants ready to help. The surfing teachers are super cool and make everyone feel like they are locals. Is a very friendly place to hang out!

275338912.name: A beautiful small beach in a quite cove, perfect for learner surfers and sunbathers
275338912.author: a TripAdvisor user
275338912.reviewBody: This was a 10-15 min walk from our accommodation, and is one of two (I think) beaches where it is relatively safe to go for a swim (due to the force of the waves around Puerto Escondido). It is about 100 odd steps down to the beach where there  are bars, beach chairs and parasol rentals and plenty of surf lessons going on. Really chilled out beach full of young people and learner surfers. Had a nice time here just sunbathing and swimming out to watch the learner surfers catch small breaks.

259874079.name: Caribbean blue at the Pacific
259874079.author: a TripAdvisor user
259874079.reviewBody: Carrizalillo is a little treasure of Puerto Escondido. Not very well known by the tourists, is a small beach with a beautiful blue water. The tranquility of the beach associated with few bars in the sand will give you a complete relaxation.

250514731.name: Paradise- best beach ever
250514731.author: a TripAdvisor user
250514731.reviewBody:
The best beach I have probably ever been to. At weekends it can get busier, but it is still not too hectic, compared to most beaches. It may not be the easiest beach to access for anyone with sever mobility problems- accessed by approx 157 stairs! However, the sandy beach and gorgeous and warm waters were a perfect reward. 

I think it would also be an ideal beach for children as the waves were not too big. 

To rent one of the beds with an umbrella you had to spend 150 pesos (per person) on food and drink. So, we had prawns for lunch every day, snacked on yummy guacamole, and drank from coconuts. This was not unreasonable, and as the sun is very hot, and we did not have an umbrella with us, we thought this was the best option. However, it did mean that we did not sample the oysters that were freshly prepared on the beach.

Was a shame that there were no toilet facilities!

242757286.name: Paradise on the Pacific
242757286.author: a TripAdvisor user
242757286.reviewBody: This beach is one of the most beautiful beaches I have ever been to. It is secluded, yet offers some infrastructure. After going down some stairs, you get to a magnificent yellow sandy beach with turquoise water. You can have your favorit tropical cocktail and fantastic local food, fish and other treats. The highlight was the fresh oysters which is freshly cought and opened in front of you.

238014101.name: best swimming beach around puerto escondido
238014101.author: a TripAdvisor user
238014101.reviewBody: Best beach to swim safely in the Puerto Escondido area. Waves are small and the water is amazing. Food and drinks are cheap or you can bring your own.

233504556.name: Surfs up
233504556.author: a TripAdvisor user
233504556.reviewBody: Beautiful beach to learn to surf... great waves and the long walk down to the beach is well worth it.  You have got to see this little gem.

212970758.name: Opinion
212970758.author: a TripAdvisor user
212970758.reviewBody: Great beach for surf learning, the cost of surfing lessons is $350 pesos for about an hour, make sure to eat well two hours prior to that, I wouldn\'t recommend the beach for swimming, the waves are kind of strong.

209026928.name: Lovely swimmable beach!
209026928.author: a TripAdvisor user
209026928.reviewBody: Compared to Zicatela this beach is much more swimmable in terms of depth, safety and cleanliness. There are chairs, beds and food available but they are pretty jam packed so I\'d recommend arriving before lunchtime. Great for surfing learners!

201828653.name: Awesome
201828653.author: a TripAdvisor user
201828653.reviewBody: Clean, nice people, good food what more could you want we enjoyed the beach and took a ride on a banana

193361665.name: Very beautiful beach
193361665.author: a TripAdvisor user
193361665.reviewBody: This beach was beautiful. The water was clean and blue, and there were no dumping waves. It is a small beach, so the lounges are pretty jam packed. The drinks were more expensive on this beach than at Zicatela, but it was very quiet and scenic. If you stay for the sunset, I\'d recommend watching it with a drink from the Villas Carrizalillo. \n\nThere are a lot of steps to get up and down to the beach, so beware if you struggle with steps.

190863761.name: Best Beach in Puerto Escondido
190863761.author: a TripAdvisor user
190863761.reviewBody: We went to all of them, and by far Carrizalillo is the most beautiful, most swimable and cleanest.  Be warned that there is quite a hike to get back up but it is so well worth it.  There are great beach bars that have yummy drinks and food, and tables and chairs on the beach that you can sit at for a minimum of 300 pesos per table.  Pretty easy to do for any size group who wants a few bevvys - and I am sure that the minimum is negotiable.

186772968.name: Favourite beach in PE
186772968.author: a TripAdvisor user
186772968.reviewBody: I love this beach! Small and a little more tranquil than the other beaches in PE. The waves are more tame so swimming and body surfing are total must-do! Skim boarding is also doable! The cove is very beautiful and the walk down and up results in prime photo opportunities! So gorgeous! Must go! Can take a cab for 30 pesos or a 20 minutes walk from zicatela (careful with the walk it\'s a little perilous on the highway at night especially).

147916519.name: Beautiful Beach (Good Hike)
147916519.author: a TripAdvisor user
147916519.reviewBody: Perfect for swimming and many people learn to surf there.  It is less crowded at certain times during the day (morning and later afternoon, closer to sunset).  There are exactly 167 steps leading to Playa Carrizalillo, my husband and I are 26 and 29 in great shape and we are breathing heavy by the time we reach the top.  Well worth the hike for us.  Warning!  The bathrooms are porta-potties...the worst smell I have ever inhaled and it costs 5 pesos.  Make sure you go before you take a trip to this beach.  We never ate at any of the restaurants down there, so we can\'t comment on them.

146381654.name: My favorite Beach in Puerto Escondido
146381654.author: a TripAdvisor user
146381654.reviewBody:
Winter Time is my favorite time of year for this beach, its a very calm turquoise cover, Some people dont like walking up and down the stairway, but that makes a more tranquil hang out.
Food and drinks are OK, a little bit price, but if you take into account that vendors have to go up and down shose stairs, Price is right.

During the summer, learning how to surf here is perfect, 

A must in Puerto Escondido, MX

130678621.name: Perfect spot to learn to surf
130678621.author: a TripAdvisor user
130678621.reviewBody: Just north of Puerto Escondido centro is this great little beach. It\'s a bit hidden, and you have to climb down a staircase to get there, but it\'s well worth the journey. It\'s a great place to swim and especially to learn to surf. There are also lots of palapas and lounge chairs, if you\'re willing to buy a drink to sit there.

123405902.name: The best beach in Puerto Escondido!
123405902.author: a TripAdvisor user
123405902.reviewBody: Nicely hidden away but great for swimming and in the right conditions great for learning to surf as well. Nice little comida\'s on the beach too. Some steep steps to get down to it but worth every step.

669524582.name: Very touristic but amazing experience
669524582.author: a TripAdvisor user
669524582.reviewBody: Don\u2018t expect to be the only one. The lagoon gets crowded and it\u2018s kind of a moneymaker, but still in a good way that they take care of flora and fauna. Once you\u2018re on the boat it\u2018s much better and also swimming will be more relaxed! It\u2018s an amazing experience and l definitely recommend it.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

663630395.name: Best laguna tour
663630395.author: a TripAdvisor user
663630395.reviewBody: To be honest I wasn\'t super thrilled to do another Laguna tour on my vacation this time, as I have done a few in the past at other places.  However, it was part of the package I bought into so we went.  We had a great time, saw lots of birds and had an incredible boat ride.  There were so many pleasant surprises too, like the rest break between the laguna and ocean.  \nEveryone loved this trip including myself.  The food at the end was absolutely awesome.  Can\'t wait to go again.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

659607313.name: Incredible
659607313.author: a TripAdvisor user
659607313.reviewBody: Amazing time on this tour. It doesnt include food or beverage but well worth the tour... the ride in the boat and swim in the water with the plankton was amazing!!!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

654960721.name: yes, you glow in the water
654960721.author: a TripAdvisor user
654960721.reviewBody: so much fun swimming and playing on bio luminescence lagoon. excellent guide. pick up and drop off service.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

651594817.name: AWESOME
651594817.author: a TripAdvisor user
651594817.reviewBody: Amazing experience. We were picked up at our Airbnb & driven here in the dark. Twelve people total. Van parked & we were lead directly to a waiting boat. A fifteen minute ride & the phosphorus lights began to appear in the wake of the boat. The whole operation was relaxed, we all got in the water and played for about a half hour. Bright stars above w tiny crescent moon. Warm waters & im still delighted by the glowing waters. My hands were lit up as the moved. Excellent experience. Driver only spoke Spanish, mine is limited so didn\u2019t understand much and it really didn\u2019t matter!!! Excellent experience and only $300 peso each $15 USA - fabulous way to spend an evening.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

650102853.name: So worth it
650102853.author: a TripAdvisor user
650102853.reviewBody: We went on a moonless, star lit night. Just being out on the water under all those stars was worth it. The water was quite warm and the bioluminescence was just so beautiful.
