Well worth the trip. We just booked from a place on the street.  It was a comfortable enough van ride to get there and the price was about $15 each

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

648986919.name: Bioluminescence, Bird-Watching, and Untouched Beach Paradise - All in One Location!
648986919.author: a TripAdvisor user
648986919.reviewBody:
Swim in glowing water! Just make sure to go when the moonlight is at a minimum (or go on a cloudy night). And don't be afraid to jump in and go swimming. It's the only way to get the best out of the experience.

The boat tours are pretty cheap. You can book from Puerto Escondido to get travel included for about $300 pesos per person. Or just take a colectivo for $25 pesos per person up to the area and stop near Best Night Hotel La Laguna (south of the main Las Negras area). Tours can go as low as $150-$200 per person on a smaller boat from here. They leave around sunset.

The boats take you out to an area where the bioluminescence is the strongest, about 15 minutes out. Get over any fear and jump in the water to splash around! The movement causes the water to ignite. Splashing around is a lot of fun, and also a bit scary in the pitch-black water.

If you can, going out in the early morning for a bird-watching tour is great too. Not only is the lagoon beautiful and full of life, you can stop at an INCREDIBLE beach - Puerto Suelo. Our guide took us to La Palapa de Dona Juanita where we had an incredible fish and sopas for lunch at a great price - and basically had the entire shoreline to ourselves. You can even stay overnight here for $100 pesos per person. Just a simple cabana on the beach. There is parking just across one of the waterways and Dona Juanita will send someone in a boat to pick you up. Have to get in contact before you go. Or just take a tour out and make plans for them to come get you the next day.

This bird-watching and beach tour lasted 2.5 hours and only cost $700 pesos for the entire boat at the same tour operator near Best Night Hotel. This was after a bit of haggling though, so the prices may fluctuate and be higher if you have a bigger group.

The bioluminescent lagoon at Manialtepec is great. And Puerto Suelo is a hidden treasure. We honestly loved this beach more than Puerto Escondido's Zicatela, Carrizalillo, La Punta - and more than the ones near Mazunte as well. 

If you have any questions, don't hesitate to reach out to us for more information!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

648590329.name: Bioluminescence
648590329.author: a TripAdvisor user
648590329.reviewBody: If you are in the area you should really do a bioluminescence tour. It\u2019s not expensive and it\u2019s really worth it.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

646998995.name: One of the most amazing things you may ever see
646998995.author: a TripAdvisor user
646998995.reviewBody: The key is to go during a dark night, so try to plan for a new moon. Basically a boat takes you out into the lagoon at night where you swim for an hour or so, and every single move you make in the water causes plankton in the water to emit an eerie but beautiful pale golden glow. So your entire body lights up. It\'s  so gorgeous words cannot do it justice.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

646190206.name: Just wow!
646190206.author: a TripAdvisor user
646190206.reviewBody: My friends and i went to see the luminescent plankton, and i can truly say it has been one of the most amazing experience I\'ve had. We swam in the lagoon at night, and everything would glow. Very very recommended.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

644814081.name: Incredible haven for wildlife
644814081.author: a TripAdvisor user
644814081.reviewBody: Laguna de Manialtepec is one of the most incredible wildlife habitats in the world. I have done a birdwatching tour there which was fascinating and a good way to exercise while on vacation. Get in touch with Eco Adventures for the bioluminescent plankton tour. One of the most incredible experiences you can have!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

644775588.name: Don\'t miss it!
644775588.author: a TripAdvisor user
644775588.reviewBody: The tour arranged through our hotel, Casamar Suites in Zicatela, was SO GREAT. I wish I knew the name of the tour company, but maybe get the info from them? We did the bird/lagoon daylight thing which was nice, but the sunset on the beach with beers and a lady in a shack making you delicious food was SUPER GREAT and then the bioluminescence was truly out of this world. Just do it!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

644430098.name: Bioluminescence!
644430098.author: a TripAdvisor user
644430098.reviewBody: Such an incredible experience. Our group was taken out in a boat on this beautiful lagoon while the sun was still up. The guide pointed out birds here and there then delivered us to a sandy beach area to watch the sunset. The best part was when the sun was down and we jumped off the boat into the water filled with bioluminescent creatures. The water was warm, life jackets were available to help with floating. This is the the most memorable experience of our trip. Do not miss this!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

643989778.name: Best visited on New Moon +\\- 4 days
643989778.author: a TripAdvisor user
643989778.reviewBody:
We went 2 days before Full Moon and could not see much.
 The “covered shed” to which we have to swim to... and only inside can you see the phosphorescent light.
 I had asked the tour guide... and he promised that it was OK to go as the Full Moon was the only night that the visibility was bad.
  Bunch of lying agents line that strip on the beach. The next evening was the night before Full Moon, Dec 21st... and  4/5 said that there will be “no problem”. 
   Only 1 was honest enough to tell me that I should wait... and upon prodding said New Moon +|- 4 days is best time to do this.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

643364455.name: Bird Watching and Bioluminescent Swimming with Lalo Ecotours
643364455.author: a TripAdvisor user
643364455.reviewBody: My husband and I went on three tours with Lalo and had an amazing experience on each one. We went on a bird-watching tour, night swimming in the bio-luminescent lagoon, and horseback riding to hot springs. We were so lucky to have Eve as our bilingual tour guide! He was so knowledgeable about the area, showed us so many birds we had never seen before and told us all about them and their ecosystem as well. He felt like more of a friend than just our guide and we were so glad to have met him! If you are visiting Puerto Escondido please make sure not to miss this amazing opportunity to experience and learn about its natural beauty with this excellent company!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

643036275.name: One of a kind nature spectacle
643036275.author: a TripAdvisor user
643036275.reviewBody: We went there at night to see the bioluminiscence, it is crazy incredible! Something you do not see anywhere else. Cellphones or go pro\'s cannot take a good picture of this phenomenon, their lense is not good enough, you need a camera however, I think this is an experience you should live, feel and enjoy, no picture can explain what you see, it is just amazing and also, you need the environment to be as dartkest as possible so whenever someone takes a cellphone out to try and get a picture, the spectacle gets ruined becauseg light won\'t let you see the bioluminiscence and you will just see moving water so the best to do is just go and swim into the laggon or just move the water with your hands if you decide not to go swimming and just see from the boat. Also, it is very important to go when there is no moon, we were told that a lot of people get disappointed when going with full moob because the ligrh is so strong it won\'t let you see the bioluminiscence and it is not that the plancton is not there but any kind of light will offset plancton\'s own light. They let you swim around an hour, it is a really good and one of a kind experience you should not miss.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

637511017.name: Not as picturesque as the photos
637511017.author: a TripAdvisor user
637511017.reviewBody: We went with Manglar Bird Tours. The transportation from Puerto was about 1/2 hour and we went out in the boat right away. It was a beautiful evening with stars out and calm water. The water was very warm. Most of our group of 10 went in the lagoon. The phosphorescence was interesting but far from spectacular. I thought it would be colourful but it was just silver. I wouldn\u2019t do this tour again.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

633303202.name: Bioluminescence
633303202.author: a TripAdvisor user
633303202.reviewBody: This was ridiculously awesome. I went on my own as my husband was sick and was a bit nervous but there was no need. Got picked up by friendly driver, good communication and service when booking, competitive pricing, nice boat guide and good instructions when we got there, well organized. Generally great. Was one of the best things I\'ve done.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

632084350.name: Amazinnng.
632084350.author: a TripAdvisor user
632084350.reviewBody: The best place i have been.. Season was perfect and bioluminescence was wonderful. i paid like 15USD to a tour guys and they pick me up and leave me at my hotel.\nPaid like another 4USD for a 40 minutes ride boat.\nExperience is amazing, if you are in Puerto Escondido you have to go to this place.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

621076415.name: Amazing!
621076415.author: a TripAdvisor user
621076415.reviewBody: We went to see the bioluminescent effect on the lagoon. It was something out of this world, to see yourself become "flourescent" in the water was incredible. If you are in Puerto Escondido, you must experience this.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

614626264.name: Amazing
614626264.author: a TripAdvisor user
614626264.reviewBody: It was an amazing experience. Went there at night on a tour and saw the bioiluminescencia under the full moon. An unforgettable experience!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

605305591.name: Don\u2019t go, thank me later.
605305591.author: a TripAdvisor user
605305591.reviewBody: If I could give this zero stars, I would. The most underwhelming experience of my life to date, and we were here on dark moon. Also a note, this ain\u2019t no \u2018lagoon\u2019 (conjuring up images of secret Amazon junglesque imagery) It\u2019s more like a big warm manky hole, and most probably soon there will be an outbreak of parasitic disease that scientists will trace back to here.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

604639584.name: Nice place great food
604639584.author: a TripAdvisor user
604639584.reviewBody: Excellent place, good food around the only problem is hard to see the bioluminecence needs an specific time to do it we came two times y couldn\'t see it

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

569014910.name: Bioluminescense
569014910.author: a TripAdvisor user
569014910.reviewBody:
Is one of the best things i ever did
Go with your friends, Swim into the lagoon with millions of tiny green lights hiting your body. Open the eyes under the water and feel like if you are in other world
Its VERY IMPORTANT to ask the best day to go because not always is amazing and is for that a lot of people feel dissapointed
 
Sin duda es de las mejores experiencias que he tenido. Mientras vas avanzando en la lancha puedes ver los destellos de los peces que nadan bajo ella. Miles de luces verdes pequeñas te cubren el cuerpo despues de sumergirte en el agua.
ES IMPORTANTE preguntar por los mejores días donde la laguna tiene mayor bioluminiscencia pues no siempre se ve igual.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

568488325.name: Beautiful!!!
568488325.author: a TripAdvisor user
568488325.reviewBody: One of the highlights of our trip! We were able to learn so much about the local preservation efforts and saw a lot of beautiful indigenous wide life! Worth the time to take the tour!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

568361440.name: Bird watching lagoon tour
568361440.author: a TripAdvisor user
568361440.reviewBody: Great time...saw almost 70 different types of birds...our guide (Lalo Ecotours) was reall knowledgeable...stopped for a rest at a beach...great day..

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

566943832.name: bioluminescent plankton in the Laguna de Maniatepec
566943832.author: a TripAdvisor user
566943832.reviewBody: We went to see this Laguna and the bioluminescent plankton in November 2017.   It was a warm evening and we took a boat out into the pitch black lake.  The view of the stars was incredible.  The driver of the boat went in circles to stir up the luminescent plankton.   It took quite a few circles with a heavy smell of gasoline to get them to show up.  We jumped into the water and when we moved our hands, we saw the sparkles of the luminescence.  The water was very warm and easy to be in but it was a little scary since we could not see anything but the blackness of the water.   It was pleasant to swim in the warm water and look up at the sky but the luminescent plankton was very disappointing.  I expected  it to glow more and be bluish- green.  I think this was not the best time of the year to do this.   There was a place to change and use the restroom before we left.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

562825670.name: Don\u2019t miss this!
562825670.author: a TripAdvisor user
562825670.reviewBody: This was one of the top tours that we did this year while visiting Puerto.  There are two guides, take the ones with the red shirts - very informative and working hard to replant the red mangroves.  Your $8 admission goes to assist them in doing so.  We saw crocodiles, variety of birds and many, many iguanas!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

561356693.name: Amazing birdlife
561356693.author: a TripAdvisor user
561356693.reviewBody: Lots of great things to do here, from world class birding to late night glow in the dark algae trips, a must visit in the area whatever you come for!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

560896074.name: Great bird watching but the rest was a little disappointing .
560896074.author: a TripAdvisor user
560896074.reviewBody: Glad we did the whole tour not just the night tour. the birds and lagoon were fascinating but the bio ilumination was just so so. We were glad we did not do just the night tour. I was not about to jump into the lagoon in the dark. Putting the water on the boat floor was all I needed to see. It was like Christmas sprinkles. Needs to be done when there is a new moon for best results.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

559464778.name: Night time swimming tour not great
559464778.author: a TripAdvisor user
559464778.reviewBody: This is trip to see the glowing night time waters was just a short trip from our hotel and not expensive. we felt that it was really not very exciting and not worth the money.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

557527025.name: Javier Santos Nature Tours
557527025.author: a TripAdvisor user
557527025.reviewBody: More than excellent!!!!  Explore lake, lagoon, ocean, dinner at Juanita\u2019s.  Mue Bueno!!!!!  Javier excellent guide!!!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

556722179.name: Peaceful beauty
556722179.author: a TripAdvisor user
556722179.reviewBody: When we went it was 3 days before the full moon so swimming in the bioluminescence was not possible as to see it you must have a moonless night. Instead, we went to the Lagoon in the late afternoon to enjoy the boat trip and all the birds. There are birds everywhere and the boat ride through the mangrove lined channels make you feel like you are in another world. It was a wonderful, peaceful way to enjoy the late afternoon and watch the sunset at the spit separating the lagoon from the ocean.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

556352189.name: Bioluminescence
556352189.author: a TripAdvisor user
556352189.reviewBody: Don\u2019t go unless it is a moonless night. They   Will let you swim in a tent to see the effects but not really the experience we expected.  Don\u2019t pay a lot either. We paid 300 pesos each .

555539781.name: Beautiful tour

Love the laguna tour lots of birds 
And love the beach at the end
You can also have a nice meal at the restaurant 
Or rent a canu

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

555281824.name: The most amazing experience
555281824.author: a TripAdvisor user
555281824.reviewBody: This is a must do if you are in puerto escondido the \u201cshow\u201d is amazing is literally incredible ADVICE: if yuh don\u2019t have a professional camera don\u2019t bother taking one you won\u2019t be able to capture the plankton light without the proper equipment take extra cloths to use after getting in the water and go for winter season is the best time to see the lights

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

554860221.name: Fantastic Bird Tour with Laloecotours Ectours
554860221.author: a TripAdvisor user
554860221.reviewBody:
If you are interested in birds or are looking to add a few more species to your list-I would highly recommend Laloecotours for your next adventure. Eve was an excellent guide who was patient with everyone’s various levels of birding skills and spoke excellent English. He learned to bird from his father who was steering the boat. Really knowledgeable. I’m an avid birder and among the 51 species we saw, 5 of them were new life species for me. The views are gorgeous too! 

We also did the bioilluminance tour with Laloecotours and we were pleasantly surprised by how neat the glowing affect really was. You’ve gotta swim in the water so you can see your hands and body glow around you. My husband and son were skeptical when I told them about this phenomena but once they saw it with their own eyes-they were amazed and didn’t want to leave. 

Lalo Ecotours is no nonsense and affordable with clean vans. Would highly recommend.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

552220984.name: Complete day swamp experience
552220984.author: a TripAdvisor user
552220984.reviewBody: Amazing birthday, starting going through the swap and observing a crocodile, then watching how sweet and salty sea collide.. after hiking the mountain to the lighthouse and observe the fantastic view... the restaurants at Chacahua beach, not that good but it\u2019s worth the nature experience

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

551584820.name: Early morning bird watching - excellent!
551584820.author: a TripAdvisor user
551584820.reviewBody:
Wonderful excursion; saw lots of amazing birds at the lagoon. Private van picked us up at 6:30am, I think the tour company was "Mama Tava Tours". We paid 500 pesos / person (group of 5 people).

Spent a couple of hours at the lagoon; asked the boat driver to stop on the beach, where the lagoon meets the ocean. Since it was a private tour, he was able to do so. It was very calm & peaceful, no one was there that early.  

Definitely worthwhile to get out of bed early in order to see the birds; you won't see them later in the day, since they are asleep and hidden from view.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

543042818.name: Maybe wrong time of year?
543042818.author: a TripAdvisor user
543042818.reviewBody: We went last night and it was a laughably horrible experience. Way oversold and underdelivered. \n\nThe guides were pretty nice though.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

539605421.name: a journey worth
539605421.author: a TripAdvisor user
539605421.reviewBody: as the laguna is only like a 20 minhtes drive from the city, its worth it for sure. because of all pictures you first expect more, but for me it was incredible!! The water was glittery when we moved & it was an amazing moment!!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

538598897.name: Beautiful views, tranquility and peace
538598897.author: a TripAdvisor user
538598897.reviewBody: I liked the tour, we bought it in agency on main street. You go 25 min by bus, then take a small boat, and around one hour just watching beautiful views of mangroves and birds. Then you arrive to a spot, where is the ocean is on one side and fresh water of lagoon on another, there you watch the sunset.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

533909159.name: On Tour with the McLintons
533909159.author: a TripAdvisor user
533909159.reviewBody: Have dinner before getting on a boat and drive around the lagoon looking at birds, watch the sunset then as it gets dark see the plankton in the lagoon.  On the way back fish fly at the boat, quite incredible.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

525774514.name: A very different experience.
525774514.author: a TripAdvisor user
525774514.reviewBody: I came to puerto escondido mostly for this attraction. I decided to enter one of the tour guide places to book my tour, instead of online. It was only $15usd per person! Totally worth this price. I suggest you to not book online. \n\nThey pick you up from your hotel or airbnb and drive you just about 20mins away. You get in this small boat with a life jacket, later on you jump right in! I was scared at first. It was very dark. But once everyone went in the water, I put my fear aside and jumped. We saw the bioluminescent plankton when we got in the water and moved around. Later on towards the end we saw it even more! It was like glitter on my hands, incredible!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

517109031.name: So peaceful and pretty!
517109031.author: a TripAdvisor user
517109031.reviewBody: Came here with a group of 8 for 1/2 day - went around in a motorized boat and enjoyed the sights of many birds and monkeys. Visited a Mexican family living without electricity right on the lagoon for a fresh coconut refreshment, and finished the trip with a lunch right at the boat deck - fresh fish and shrimp, stuffed dumplings, salads and cheese - perfect variety of local delicacies. Next time I will try stand-up-paddleboaring on the still lagoon water!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

514487339.name: Unbelievable
514487339.author: a TripAdvisor user
514487339.reviewBody: Swimming in a warm lake with the luminescence effect is an amazing experience. It is UNIQUE and not to be missed. It is nice to know that the local community truly takes care of their environment consciously and in a sustainable manner.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

513809194.name: Indescriptible. You have to live it.
513809194.author: a TripAdvisor user
513809194.reviewBody: Without exaggeration, one cannot describe the phenomenon of bio luminiscence. All I can say is that It is a must see and live. Undoubtedly it\'s worth the cost (about $350mxn) and the trip (25 min from Puerto Escondido)

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

509973882.name: This review is for the Bioluminescent Tour ONLY
509973882.author: a TripAdvisor user
509973882.reviewBody: We traveled from Huatulco by car for a very bumpy, long 3 hour ride to see the Laguna de Manialtepec - which was lovely and filled with gorgeous birds and the most beautiful sunset - with the goal to stay until after sunset to see the bioluminescence.  I have seen this phenomenon in other places - Puerto Rico, Martha\'s Vineyard - and know what I should expect.  I also knew that it was a full moon night, which is not ideal - so we called ahead.  "Oh yes, you can still see everything!" we were told.  So, we went that night, about 9 PM - calling before we left the Laguna de Manialtepec to again confirm that viewing the bioluminescence was possible despite the moon: "Of course!  You can see 70%-90% of the bioluminescence!" we were told.  So we arrive and the sales pitch begins.  "Go with on a boat and it is $MP500 per person, or two on a private boat with your private captain for $MP1,000.  And you can leave now, no waiting".  We paid for a private boat and waited.  5 boats left before we were next.  We went out and it was totally dark.  The captain took us to 3 "casitas" (floating tents) in the water into which we were instructed to dive so that we could see the bioluminescence.  Understand....dive into the pitch black water to float inside of a 2 square meter cloth-covered floating cover in order to see anything in the water. There was NO bioluminescent activity anywhere else to be seen. We declined and went back to shore immediately.  We went to speak with the operator who said that yes, it was 70%-90% of the bioluminescent activity - INSIDE of the tent.  We did get our money back....and he had the audacity to ask for a tip.  I don\'t know what it looks like on a dark moon, but beware of the full moon - and of flippant promises.  Our trip was not ruined by this - the bay itself is a lovely day; but it was a huge disappointment at the end of a long day.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

507025753.name: Beautiful Bioluminescent plankton
507025753.author: a TripAdvisor user
507025753.reviewBody: Nature lovers must visit this place, there\'s a natural fenomenon called bioluminescence that the plankton produces when touched/disturbed, but don\'t waste your time trying to take pictures because you need a special camera lens to do that, it\'s better to just enjoy a trippy swim.\n\nThere are cheap tours you can take basically everywhere to go there

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

505839753.name: El Hombre Serpiente
505839753.author: a TripAdvisor user
505839753.reviewBody: We went on a tour on a motorless boat through the lagoon guided by Margarito, aka El Hombre Serpiente, who we met at the beach in Zicatela. It turned out to be one of the greatest natural experiences of my life, we saw a variety of fauna and got to swim surrounded by fluorescent plancton. The fact that we didn\'t have an engine made it far more intimate and helped us appreciate the sounds and smells of nature way better.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

488439848.name: Night lights!
488439848.author: a TripAdvisor user
488439848.reviewBody: I loved swimming in the lagoon at night - the water was warm and, thanks to bioluminescent plankton, silvery when disturbed by my hands or body. Or the boat. Or nearby fish. Our guide had life jackets for anyone who was an unsure swimmer. Really magical.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

479246003.name: went here on Santos Tour with Javier.  excellent
479246003.author: a TripAdvisor user
479246003.reviewBody: don\'t miss this great opportunity to see lots of birds, beautiful\nvegetation.    Go with Javier in his boat to his parents home on the "Barra."  You will love it.  Miles of private beach.  Eat a diner of Lagoon fish-- Yum Yum

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

478356606.name: Bio luminescent tour!
478356606.author: a TripAdvisor user
478356606.reviewBody: We did one of the night tours to see the glowing plankton! It was very nice and the water was actually pretty warm. The only thing that crosses your mind every now and then are the Alligators that actually live in the Lagoon, but our guide assured us that there are none around and nobody ever got hurt. So we all survived and had a fun time swimming in the glowing water! Make sure you check the moon cycle (you want the moon to be very weak - dark as possible).

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

476283809.name: Early Cretaceous Phosphorescence
476283809.author: a TripAdvisor user
476283809.reviewBody:
The title is a line from "The Descent", by Jeff Long. You'd have to read it to understand (5/5 novel, so go!) 

We went because of the bioluminiscent plankton in the lagoon. 

You go at night, ask around Puerto for the tour vans, they pick you up at your hotel. Take a couple of beers for the road. 

They give you a little boat tour of the lagoon, pointing (in darkness!) to the local fauna, and then you get to swim amidst neon blue colored foam and bubbles!

It's like nothing I've ever experienced. 

The water is quite warm. 
Swim doesn't last long, 4 stars for that, I guess you could always pay for more.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

476228160.name: Birding Delight
476228160.author: a TripAdvisor user
476228160.reviewBody: It appears that the night tour is the big tourist draw, but if you want a wonderful birding experience Lalo and his son are expert guides. We saw over 40 species on a wonderful morning on the lagoon. For lunch we stopped at a lovely cabana for good comida on a pristine and empty section of beach. Early morning the lagoon is beautiful and tranquil, with just a handful of net fisherman.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

473204247.name: Night swimming.
473204247.author: a TripAdvisor user
473204247.reviewBody: Touch the water to see it light up.  It\'s a peaceful place to swim at night with the stars above and luminescent water.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

471763500.name: Unique and Incredible
471763500.author: a TripAdvisor user
471763500.reviewBody: I can only comment on this natural wonder for its night time wonders. We took an evening boat excursion with Pascon Travel to enjoy this huge body of water at night. The night sky was brilliant ( living in Toronto, I had not really seen a real sky in many years.) Taking a lancha into the darkness, we used lights ( sparingly) to view birds in their habitat, watch flying fish accompany our speeding boat into the darkness and twice leap directly into the boat delighting and surprising the passengers!\nOur purpose was to swim in the darkness surrounded by the special glowing plankton that emits a special bioluminescence that surrounds one\'s movements in the water. This can be silver, blue or green depending on the time of year and the density of the plankton. This was truly a unique natural miracle that shall not be forgotten. It is especially impressive during a cloudy night or during a waning moon. Thanks to our guide Mauro for leading us on this very special natural excursion.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

468891606.name: Do a bioluminescent night swim, but beware the flying fish!
468891606.author: a TripAdvisor user
468891606.reviewBody: I was lucky enough to visit during a bioluminescent phase when there was no moon\u2014perfect conditions for a glowing night swim. We took a boat out into the depths of the pitch-black lagoon and then jumped overboard into darkness. The bioluminescence was thrilling, but be warned: the lagoon is also home to flying fish. One of them jumped out of the water right into my face! It was terrifying, but still amazing. \n\nIt\'s a testament to the understated (and undiscovered) nature of the Oaxacan coastline that this lagoon is not more famous. Bioluminescent bays have made other destinations world-renowned (i.e. Vieques) but few people outside of Oaxaca seem to know about this one.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

465912260.name: Great way to spend the day!
465912260.author: a TripAdvisor user
465912260.reviewBody: We went on a lagoon tour with Javier Santos who is very knowledgeable and friendly.  We also enjoyed lunch prepared by his parents on the beach at Puerto Suelo.  What a nice day!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

465653519.name: The restaurant
465653519.author: a TripAdvisor user
465653519.reviewBody:
Drove up from Puerto to see the lagoon and stopped for a bite at the restaurant. 
Don't know the name of the dish we had but it was excellent. It was 3 pastry shells fillled with shrimp and cheese with a small bowl of not-to-hot salsa.
Our server, Donald, who's English was excellent made sure to explain many of the dishes that were available and when we told him we wanted something light, he suggested the fare above, noting, " you can't go wrong with it."
He also took the time to answer our numerous questions about the lagoon and it's surroundings.
My wife and I have already decidedone to return next week to once again enjoy the food and the view.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

465313224.name: Mangroves, birds, good food and wonderful beach for a day
465313224.author: a TripAdvisor user
465313224.reviewBody: Brill one/two day trip. fresh fish, crocs, beautiful scenery and getting together with the locals. watch the undertow in the sea and the crabs under rocks in the lagoon. Chill for the day in real beautiful mexico. Dont forget to stop off in the village on the lagoon and get fresh coconut in a bag with chilli sauce.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

461043257.name: Beautiful, peaceful place
461043257.author: a TripAdvisor user
461043257.reviewBody: \nit\'s a beautiful, peaceful place. You\'ll find mangrove forests there, plenty of birds and foremost - luminescent, glowing in the dark plankton. The plankton is clearly visible only in good conditions so make sure you ask about it before you book the trip. Try avoiding full moon (or moon at all).

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

460135757.name: Mike Malone tour
460135757.author: a TripAdvisor user
460135757.reviewBody: Unbelievable. Excellent. Knowledgeable tour guide and sharp eyed boat driver make sure you see every creature along the way. If the light is the wrong way the boat is moved. Mr Malone is a long time winter resident and has a keen historical perspective of this ecological gem. Excellent binoculars provided for each guest during the trip. \n\nDo not miss this trip. It is exceptionally good value.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

459459617.name: Great trip to nature site.
459459617.author: a TripAdvisor user
459459617.reviewBody: I had such a great time at the lagoon--don\'t miss it to see wild life on the boat trip. Swimming in water that shines like neon when you \'dive in  - its just amasing!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

457948683.name: Birds, water, paradise
457948683.author: a TripAdvisor user
457948683.reviewBody: This enormous lagoon, 20 minutes from Puerto Escondido, is surrounded by mangrove forest, and separated from the ocean by a narrow sand bar which opens the lagoon to the sea during rainy season, providing a unique environment for an amazing variety of plant and animal life. We booked a tour with Lalo Eco-Tours, who provided early morning pick-up, boat tour with English-speaking guide, top quality binoculars, and fantastic knowledge of the area and its ecosystems. Eve (male person pronounced Ev-Vay) is probably the best guide we have ever had - cannot be beat. We were back home by 11:30, richer by 45 bird species and happy as can be.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

457734369.name: Go on a dark day!
457734369.author: a TripAdvisor user
457734369.reviewBody: The bioluminescent effect is something really cool, it\'s not as it looks on the pictures in the tour guide\'s place but it\'s really amazing, go on a dark day! My friends and I chose the day the closest to the new moon so we had a nice time!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

456724782.name: Great Outdoor Excursion
456724782.author: a TripAdvisor user
456724782.reviewBody: I went on an excursion here and had a blast. The boat ride through the natural habitat gave me a lot of great photo moments of bird sanctuaries, bio fish, etc.  Make sure you have on sturdy shoes and some warm enough clothes for the adventure.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

453590800.name: Must see
453590800.author: a TripAdvisor user
453590800.reviewBody: Do the bird watching and phosphorescence because it will give a clear picture of the beauty of the lagoon. Loads of wildlife will take you to where the lagoon butts against the sea with a shack to have a cold drink, watch the sunset, and when the stars come to life, a new journey to the phosphorescent swimming. Because of rain and an opening of the lagoon in July (annually) for drainage, visitors should plan accordingly. Oct to June are the best months and a moonless night the best time.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

451110384.name: Great Morning
451110384.author: a TripAdvisor user
451110384.reviewBody: I have visited the lagoon several times over the past 15 years and always learn and see something new and wonderful.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

446354640.name: bird watching
446354640.author: a TripAdvisor user
446354640.reviewBody: A fabulous experience.  We were led by a very knowledgable guide and had a wonderful day.  well worth the trip.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

445128197.name: Quiet, easy, interesting and safe evening
445128197.author: a TripAdvisor user
445128197.reviewBody:
We arranged a tour with Javier Santos Tours late in the afternoon on our last afternoon in Puerto Escondito via Facebook and telephone.  Javier came to our hotel (ArcoIris) in his SUV and we followed him along #200 in our car out to a property between to inns on the lake about twenty minutes north west of PE (just past La Alejandria). The road was good and the parking was free in the open, unsecured lot.  This is owned by Arturo who partners with Javier and who provided us with our guided 3 hour, 2 person private dusk /evening tour.  Javier will also provide transport to and from the tour.  His family operates the facility at Puerto Suelo, a beach out on the ocean side of the 
laguna, where a meal can be had.

We headed out on the lake (with life jackets) in the 20 foot fiberglass boat about an hour before sunset, prime time for birding and photography.  We were not disappointed with sightings of at least ten different species of birds, including King Fishers, Great White Egrets, Night, Blue and Tiger Herons, a Mangrove Black Hawk and numerous Cormorants, ducks and sea birds.   We did not see much in the water besides some very active small fish (one jumped in the boat) and a Sea Otter.   On the way back through the twilight and then moonlight, the frogs were at points extremely load.  Just before getting back to the car park we stopped at a small island which was filled with roosting egrets, herons and other large mangrove dwelling birds.  Though disturbed they appeared used to having lights played on them and did not take flight, though we were only a few feet away.

Puerto Suelo consists of a few palapas and a beautiful, unpolluted, unoccupied beach with relatively small waves gently breaking across smooth white sand.  For the two of us it was a strikingly beautify place.  Aside from being served a meal (paid for separately from the tour) we were left alone here to enjoy the experience for about half an hour.  There were some sand fleas and mosquitos for which repellant largely worked.  The grilled shrimp dinner we had was OK, and not something to be rated here given our tour's short notice and the fact it was paid for separately. This trip was a pleasant cool reprieve from the heat and hustle of the tourist beaches in PE.   The sunset and beach at this location is everything it is reported to be and worth the journey almost as much as the trip across the lake and through the mangroves   

We found Arturo to be very knowledgeable of the flora and fauna of the area.  He answered all of our questions (in English) and moved along at a pace seemed set more by us than him.  Likewise, while we did not have much of a chance to talk with Javier, we found his willingness to accommodate us to be exceptional and the price he charged, quite reasonable.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

443909243.name: Great birding: go early in the morning
443909243.author: a TripAdvisor user
443909243.reviewBody: Just a 20 minute drive from Puerto Escondido, this is a great site for birders. Visited 3 times with a group of friends: guided morning boat trip to see birds, evening bio-luminescence swim, and self-guided morning kayaking. \nThe boat trips can be arranged from tour operators in PE.\nTo hire kayaks, no tour operators are needed, just take a collectivo or taxi to Puesta del Sol lodge/restaurant. Go early, it gets very hot in late morning.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

439395145.name: Don\'t miss it!
439395145.author: a TripAdvisor user
439395145.reviewBody: The short drive from Puerto Escondido is well worth doing with this magical lagoon! Make sure to go after dark if you\'d like to swim amongst bioluminescent plankton, and be prepared to be wowed.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

439385129.name: Highly recommend Lalo-EoTours for bird watching
439385129.author: a TripAdvisor user
439385129.reviewBody:
Yesterday my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed a bird watching tour with Evi of Lalo Tours. Evi picked us up promptly at 6:30 am from our hotel in a clean air conditioned van. We drove 20 minutes to the north side of Laguna de Manialtepec. There we started an amazing tour of Laguna de Manialtepecon in an eight-person motorboat. Evi provided each of us high-quality binoculars and during the approximately three hour tour he showed us over 70 different species of tropical birds. Evi speaks excellent English and is a professionally trained Ornithologist. 

When he is not working as a tour guide Evi promotes wildlife education and conservation. Once a month he take local children on a free bird tour of the lagoon with the goal of increasing awareness of conversation. 

This tour was the highlight of our ten day trip to Mexico. Highly recommended!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

437880666.name: Magic experience
437880666.author: a TripAdvisor user
437880666.reviewBody:
Arrived in Puerto Escondido from a long UK flight and the evening tour a few hours later was suggested where we stayed. A bit hesitant but went for it.
The driver picked us up and made 2 more stops for others on the half hour trip to the lagoon.
We stopped at a bar near the lagoon and they gave us some basic info on the tour. How long it takes on the boat, how long you'll have to swim etc.
After a short boat trip to the other side of the lagoon, we jumped in and the water went luminescent! And when I say luminescent...really luminescent.  I didn't have high hopes, but wow. We were really treated too as there was a lightening storm about 5-10 miles away so even the backdrop was stunning. 
Word of advice, bring a towel and dry clothes as it was a little nippy out the water after. 
Also, you get a good 45 minutes in the water but you can get back on the boat whenever you're tired.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

437250442.name: Photoluminescent Plankton!
437250442.author: a TripAdvisor user
437250442.reviewBody: We did the evening photoluminescent plankton tour and it was incredible! There were lots of boats going out while we were there (our had around 10 of us on it), but the lagoon is very large and the boats tend to stay away from each other. Heading out on the boat, the boat driver was Spanish, and the guide tried to translate to English for us, but it was not very good. My boyfriend speaks Spanish though and translated for me that they were trying to explain about the different animals and plants in the lagoon, as well as how the plankton get into the lagoon and why they glow. Other tour companies may have been better with the English translation, but us Enligh speakers seemed to miss out on some interesting information on ours.\nOnce we made it to a dark location, we could jump out of the boat and swim for around 45 minutes. The water glows all around you, and it looks like little stars are dancing all over your skin. Its so amazing!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

433608234.name: glow in the dark
433608234.author: a TripAdvisor user
433608234.reviewBody: a trip by small boat to the middle of a lagoon in the middle of the night in order to jump into the water and experience the glow of the algae.  I would skip this event.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

431968893.name: Amazing evening visit
431968893.author: a TripAdvisor user
431968893.reviewBody:
I wasn't really sure what to expect on this one. We went with Manglar tours from Playa Zicatela, and they arranged everything. 

There were around 15 of us on the tour, and after a brief intro to excellent lain what we were going to see, we went out in a low-sided motor boat into the middle of the lake, where we had 45 minutes or so to swim and enjoy the phenomenon of the plankton. 

One person on the tour decided not to swim after all, and the crew were fine with that, although they really encouraged the rest of us - the first of us to jump in needed a lot of persuasion! The water is warm even at night, due to some thermal magic (they'll give you the technical reason on your tour), and the crew of the boat hoisted everyone back in. 

I would advise not taking anything but a towel: everything on the boat gets pretty wet, and phones and even decent cameras don't pick up the colours in the water - normally I take photos of EVERYTHNG, but there was really no point here.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

431955742.name: Interesting cruise
431955742.author: a TripAdvisor user
431955742.reviewBody: We did the lagoon tour along with the bio luminescence. Lagoon tour the best especially if guide is knowledgeable about birds and can speak your language...English in our case. The small boat cruises slowly down the channel to the beach by the sea...in time for a beautiful sunset. Bring drinks of your choice and swim attire. Mosquito repellant  and flashlight won\'t hurt either. We found this part of the "adventure " more satisfying than jumping in the dark, muddy lagoon to witness luminescence.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

427918254.name: Night Bioluminescent Tour
427918254.author: a TripAdvisor user
427918254.reviewBody: I would recommend going at night for the bioluminescents. Go on a night when the moon isn\'t bright, or better yet when its raining. The biolum\'s will be at there best when it very dark and the rain would add to the magic. Our night was dark, but no rain. Our tour started at 8pm with a van pick up out to Manialtepec. The van was new, clean and comfy. Then after a 25mins ride we took at boat out into the middle of the lagoon. We swam for about 30-40mins. You could get on and off the small ponga style boat at anytime. There was a small ladder over the side. We all had a really good time. Safe for anyone who can swim, or use water wings to help stay afloat. The water was really warm!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

426154385.name: A MUST!
426154385.author: a TripAdvisor user
426154385.reviewBody: We took a van with about 10 people out to Manialtepec to see the bioluminescent algae in the lake. The van left at 7:30PM, and drove for about 20 minutes to the lake. Then you get in a boat, which takes you to the center of the lake. (I recommend you leave your stuff, including your towel, in the van because everything gets wet in the boat.) It\'s so amazing to see the water light up at night. The water only lights up when something moves the water (fish, rain, the boat, you). If you stick your hand in the water it\'s looks like you\'re wearing a glowing glove. You can jump off the side of the boat and swim in the (brackish) glowing lake water, which is warm and feels delicious. Such an amazing experience! Definitely make time for this one!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

417302971.name: Great experience
417302971.author: a TripAdvisor user
417302971.reviewBody: We tour Laguna Manialtepec late afternoon for bird watching and evening for the fluorescent experience in the water. Words can not describe it; unfortunately, cell cameras or regular video cameras can not catch the fluorescent color in the water but the experience is for lifetime.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

389388606.name: Incomparable
389388606.author: a TripAdvisor user
389388606.reviewBody: The bioluminescent water is a must see in Puerto Escondido, we had a great guide and a wonderful boat captain. Everything was very safe even though you feel like you\'re in the middle of nowhere at night.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

385426649.name: Bio-luminus swim
385426649.author: a TripAdvisor user
385426649.reviewBody: May was our second visit to Hotel Escondido this year! In January our timing was perfect to swim in the Bio-luminus  Bay! Out of this world, rare occurrence that only happens a few places in the world. Definitely  a Bucket list check  off!\nAND, our second stay at Hotel Escondido  was as perfect as the first time.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

371542923.name: Great ecotour
371542923.author: a TripAdvisor user
371542923.reviewBody: Tour guid was very knowledgeable and we had a great time. I wish I would have had time to experience the bioluminescent your, but time didn\'t permit

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

370066132.name: Birds Galore
370066132.author: a TripAdvisor user
370066132.reviewBody: If you get to do this tour you should. Amazing! Beautiful scenery that makes you appreciate disconnecting from our very chaotic cold society. Amazing tour!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

369559733.name: Lalo Ecotours, very informative nature tour
369559733.author: a TripAdvisor user
369559733.reviewBody:
Eve from Lalo Ecotours was our guide for the morning birding tour. He picked us up on time, 6:30 am from our hotel, and safely drove us in a clean air conditioned van to their business at the lagoon. We are a family of 5, and were the only ones on that morning's tour, so we loaded up in the boat to leave immediately.

The boat was clean, and the seats were relatively comfortable. There was another man who drove the boat while Eve guided and spoke. Eve offered us coffee, and was very pleasant to talk with. His English is outstanding, and he was able to teach us a lot about wildlife on the lagoon. Eve is proud of his home, and we could tell that he really cares a lot about his community, as well as the nature that surrounds it. 

We saw many different species of birds along the tour, as well as many gorgeous views of the lagoon, mountains, the sunrise, and finally, the beach where we stopped for an hour or two to enjoy breakfast at Juanitas. I have no idea where we were, but the beach was absolutely deserted. It was just our family, there were palm trees, a thatched roof over a table, so we ordered our eggs and sopes and ate watching the waves roll in. It was so beautiful, and the food was one of the best meals we ate while in Mexico. It was made without electricity, and all of the supplies were carried to the beach by hand by Juanita's family, who lives in the area only during the dry season.

After our breakfast stop, we continued back in the boat to the end of the tour. By then, it was getting warm! At the end of the tour, Eve gave us a colored brochure that had many different birds pictured, and had marked all of the birds that we saw that day. 

I highly recommend this tour, it gives you an opportunity to get out of the city of Puerto Escondido, and see the other natural beauty that is nearby.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

363244592.name: Nature beauty
363244592.author: a TripAdvisor user
363244592.reviewBody: Beautiful lagoon, in the night time the water gets florescending like in the movie "the life of pi". it was a truly special experience i can just recommend to do!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

362585817.name: Bioluminescent nighttime swimming
362585817.author: a TripAdvisor user
362585817.reviewBody: Taking a tour to see the bioluminscent plankton glow of the laguna on a moonless night is perhaps the most magical thing I have done--in my life. Floating in the laguna, water aglow, sky full of stars. An experience to remember for the rest of my life.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

361488337.name: Something to do at night
361488337.author: a TripAdvisor user
361488337.reviewBody: This is a great evening diversion for people who are spending a week or more in Pto Escondido, but if you want to see the lagoon, go on a day tour. If you want to experience nature while on this tour, ask the tour guide to tell everyone to be quiet during the swim. I went on this tour with a group of 8 women (not on purpose!) and had a headache by the time it was over: they did not stop yakking, not even for a millisecond. It ruined the effect of being out on a beautiful lake under the stars. Be advised!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

357975691.name: Very cool.
357975691.author: a TripAdvisor user
357975691.reviewBody: Eve with Lalo Ecotours was our guide. He is a local with very, very good English. And he has a great knowledge of the ecosystem of the lagoon. If you are not a nature lover, skip it. If you appreciate nature, very well worth the trip. I am by no means a bird watcher but I appreciate nature and leaning more about it. \nBreakfast on the secluded beach was a bonus. My family and I had a wonderful breakfast at Juanita\'s....no electricity or running water....at her restaurant on this secluded beach across the lagoon. \nWe took the morning tour. We assumed that everything would be more active in the morning. And we\'d beat the afternoon heat. Eve picked us up at our hotel at 6:30 am and returned us afterward.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

357611420.name: Boat trip through the laguna
357611420.author: a TripAdvisor user
357611420.reviewBody: Good for bird watching, we saw a huge flock of storks in their nesting grounds. The guide could have been more informative and taken the boat closer to some of our bird sightings. He didn\'t seem to slow down so we could get a good look at Green Kingfishers or other small birds.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

357333142.name: Highly Recommended
357333142.author: a TripAdvisor user
357333142.reviewBody: We enjoyed 2 tours with Lalo Ecotours.  \nThe first was the bioluminiscencia...so amazing to have the opportunity to see witness such a awesome creation.  Night stars were the brightest I have seen in a long time and the tiny fish jumping in the boat were a fun surprise.\nBird watching was great...they don\'t advertise a enough the what is all included...coffee and sweet bread, the bird watching and the private beach lunch...and the tour guide new his stuff.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

352101146.name: Incredible!
352101146.author: a TripAdvisor user
352101146.reviewBody: Come here at night!!!! Pay between 150 and 400 pesos to see the luminescent plancton in the lake. You can jump in the dark, see the plancton shine while touched, and be amazed by the complete stillness. It is a great experience al around. If you are traveling with friends and wanna make a night of it, bring along some beers and a speaker for some music.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

351146631.name: Fantastic Adventure
351146631.author: a TripAdvisor user
351146631.reviewBody: We went on 2 adventures on the Laguna. One with Mike Malone on the 8 km. kayak trip - fantastic and he knows so much about the lagoon and birds.\nWe also went to see the phosphorescence at night and swam.  It was incredible.\nVisiting the Laguna de Manialtepec is a must!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

350659741.name: Beautiful birdwatching
350659741.author: a TripAdvisor user
350659741.reviewBody:
Three of us chose to visit the lagoon with Lalo Ecotours and thought the tour was excellent. We were picked up at 6:30 in the morning with two others and escorted out to the lagoon, about a half hour drive north of Puerto Escondido, where we hopped on our small tour boat. When we first arrived, we were the only boat on the lagoon; as time passed a few canoes with local fishermen appeared. Our boatman guided us down a narrow mangrove channel while the tour guide Evi explained how parrots lay their eggs in large termite nests, giving the newly hatched birds termites to eat and thus have sustenance when they’re born – smart creatures! Evi explained that this lagoon has three species of mangrove and that the trees reproduce in two ways: with long thin seedpods that go down into the water and with the hanging roots that do the same thing – very ingenious. 

Everyone on the tour is given a good quality pair of binoculars to spot all the birds that live here. Close to one hundred different species of bird make this lagoon their home and we saw examples of about two thirds of them. Off the main lagoon, we cruised down some very narrow mangrove channels and had to duck our heads to avoid the roots and branches. In the rainy season this lagoon opens to the ocean; this makes the water brackish, a combination of fresh water from the Manialtepec River and the ocean salt water: “Manialtepec” means “Place where the waters meet”. Our guide spent quite a bit of time calling to the birds, imitating the sounds of a tiny predatory owl to disturb the other birds who did start to flutter and flock and fly around the boat. Evi told us that the sounds of the pygmy owl cause the other birds to fly around in a fright; the owl then grabs as many as he can and eats them as they scatter – yikes! 

After seeing a number of birds of all kinds, we drove quietly down the river channel towards the ocean, passing, unexpectedly, horses on the lagoon side, grazing on grasses. Our tour concluded with breakfast and beer on a huge deserted beach where the family runs a cantina for incoming tour groups, of which there was one other group besides ours this morning. Really fantastic and highly recommended!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

348887818.name: Michael Malone knows this lagoon.
348887818.author: a TripAdvisor user
348887818.reviewBody: We booked with naturalist, Michael Malone, through Hidden Voyages Eco tours.\nFirst, we were introduced to the natural mysteries and wonders of the lagoon.  We met a Zapotec woman, who lives in a tropical mangrove lagoon that ebbs and flows with a river connected to the sea. We found her after navigating a canal full of many birds -like egrets, ibis, herons, parrots and parakeets, vultures, pelicans, and a perigrine falcon. She made us huervos Mexicana, and roasted bananas. Her hand-made tortillas were prepared on old pottery oven. The waves crashed on the beach, while we ate and thought about her life, and our own.  Michael Malone led us into the by-ways and secret canals, all the while educating in the most wonderful way.  For me, the most exciting siting were the large green parrots, but so many favorites to choose from!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

348620655.name: Great great great!
348620655.author: a TripAdvisor user
348620655.reviewBody: A beautiful attraction worth your time. We had a great guide really taking the time to stop for our pictures and showing us the bird. It is different, relaxing. A tip, go at sun dawn less hot and really beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

348336629.name: Beautiful birds
348336629.author: a TripAdvisor user
348336629.reviewBody: Hidden Voyages eco tours by motor boat or kayak is run by a Canadian, Mike Malone.  He has many years as an Eco tour operator with a wealth of knowledge.  He supplies everything you need.  Mike along with the boat man take you to a variety of spots where you are most likely to see a variety of birds.  He also explains the ecology of the area giving you a better understanding of the flora and fauna of the area and the stresses they are subjected to

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

348319433.name: Dreamy
348319433.author: a TripAdvisor user
348319433.reviewBody: To really get that best experience you are recommended to go at night, the darker the better, so it can get scary, but once you are there and swimming with the shiny water under the star covered skies you realise its an incredible experience.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

347769475.name: Lalo Tours is excellent!
347769475.author: a TripAdvisor user
347769475.reviewBody: Last week we took the opportunity to enjoy three separate Lalo Tours with Evi.  He is a youthful and extremely experienced guide who grew up in the nearby community,  He clearly is dedicated to his work, has a passion for the birds and nature of the lagoon.  He has managed to fit in studies towards a Masters degree in Ornithology.  His excellent academic and practical knowledge were evident.  We enjoyed it all - the morning tour with the beautiful calm of the lagoon and truly amazing beachfront lunch/breakfast of charcoal grilled fish, avocado salad and grilled plantains (normal sort of huevos Mexicana also available!), as well as the calm beauty and sunset of the afternoon tour and the evening luminescence tour.   Each had its own very special beauty, unique birds and ecological features.     We cannot recommend these tours and this company highly enough.   Thank you Evi!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

347561340.name: Lalo Ecotours!
347561340.author: a TripAdvisor user
347561340.reviewBody: Very well organised boat trip just for 2 people. Guide offered us sweet bread and coffee for breakfast which was such a nice extra!! \nLaguna itself is very special ecotype in the world scale. Mix of sea and river waters have created unique atmosphere. End of the trip theres a empty beach with one restaurant. \nWhen visible, fluorecencia night trips are organised where you can swim in glow-in-the-dark waters! Out of this world experience. Just Go and see it!!!!!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

346668761.name: Nesting Boat Billed Herons!! Wow!
346668761.author: a TripAdvisor user
346668761.reviewBody: Hidden Voyages Ecotours took our birding group out to look for birds and wildlife and we were not disappointed. The lagoon covers around 1100 hectares and has three rich aquatic habitats which make for rich biodiversity. We saw boat-billed herons nesting and mating, what a highlight! The mangroves are home and resting places for all the herons, egrets, ibis, and many raptors. We saw parrots flying overhead, both white fronted and orange fronted. A special sighting for me was the aplomado falcon pair.  We enjoyed a delicious lunch at a rustic beach front enramada where we watched local fishermen bring in their catch. Our group was large, so we took two boats and I enjoyed being captained by Lalo, a bird guide for 27 years! The other boat had Mike Malone who imparted an amazing wealth of knowledge about the area and especially about this impressive and beautiful lagoon.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

345596723.name: Don\'t miss it!
345596723.author: a TripAdvisor user
345596723.reviewBody: If you are in Puerto Escondido you must come to watch this spectacular phenomenon. The bioluminescence is the emission of light by a living organism. When you dive into the water you can see the blue light around you, it\'s spectacular! A boat with a guide will take you to the right point of the lagoon where you can see the bioluminescence.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

343649866.name: A Nice Evening Excursion
343649866.author: a TripAdvisor user
343649866.reviewBody: The 30-min plus boat ride to the actual lagoon where the bioluminescent waters are, was quite refreshing and fascinating...large white igrits and schools of silvery jumping fish all along the way.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

343219422.name: Laguna
343219422.author: a TripAdvisor user
343219422.reviewBody: We have done this tour twice. We were picked up on time at our accommodation and driven to the Laguna. It was an enjoyable and informative day...especially if you like the native birds.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

342650225.name: Beautiful boat ride, amazing birds!
342650225.author: a TripAdvisor user
342650225.reviewBody: We loved this tour during our visit to Puerto Escondido. We were taken in a nice boat (with shade) around the lagoon and saw beautiful wildlife - birds and fish mostly. We were taken to a little inlet where we beached the boat. We walked 100 yards and there was the ocean! We sat down for a beer and the next thing we know there is a whale 50 yards off the shore! It was an incredible sight that we will never forget. This tour is definitely worth it - they also have night tours...try and go when the effervescent is visible (not when there is a full moon).

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

342480526.name: Go with Michael Malone, Hidden Voyages
342480526.author: a TripAdvisor user
342480526.reviewBody: We went with Michael Malone of Hidden Voyages Ecotours and it was great. At breakfast on the beach ( not included but very inexpensive) Michael pulled out the bird lists and made sure we had the names of the 47 species we had seen.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

336651383.name: Beautiful view on the stars
336651383.author: a TripAdvisor user
336651383.reviewBody: We went there with only locals, who are still excited to see the biolumiscence. we went out on a boat and the guide explained everything, which was interesting. When we arrived at the spot where we should see the glowing, we were somhow disappointed at first, as the glowing was really weak. But the more people went into the water, the more it glowed. From the water it was an even better experience, as you can see the glowing spots running down your arms or face when you take them out of the water.\nHowever, the best about the trip was still the view on the stars, which we enjoyed on the boat trip.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

336226552.name: You must go
336226552.author: a TripAdvisor user
336226552.reviewBody: You must go, the place is amazing. Plan ahead. Puesta de Sol restaurant has the best organized tours (and their food is pretty good). We ate, did kayaking and did the bioluminescence tour. New moon is best, and during rainy season. Be prepared to swim

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

332573627.name: Best experience of my life.
332573627.author: a TripAdvisor user
332573627.reviewBody: We took a tour for 250$, it picked us up from out hotel and after 30 minutes we arrived to the laguna and took a boat to the middle of it. The water is warm and there are no fish swiming near you ( thank God). I have never in my life seen so many stars while swiming in warm water that glows green when you move your arms and legs. Amazing experience. A must for puerto escondido.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

332275678.name: Whoa!
332275678.author: a TripAdvisor user
332275678.reviewBody: I understand the experience can vary here from day to day, but when my husband and I went, it was amazing. This was a once-in-a-lifetime experience that I would highly recommend to any travelers in the area.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

332066855.name: Relaxing place to spend a few hours
332066855.author: a TripAdvisor user
332066855.reviewBody: We went there for breakfast one morning, the food here was just ok,however we had a lovely location that was right on the laguna and it was delightful to watch all the birds, etc

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

331271070.name: Phosphorescence, a wonderful experience
331271070.author: a TripAdvisor user
331271070.reviewBody: We always go to a restaurant at the lagoon called La Puesta del Sol, have a nice snack there and go by boat to see the phosporescence in the water. Jump in, it is amazing!!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

326159814.name: Cool
326159814.author: a TripAdvisor user
326159814.reviewBody: To go to see and experience the water that is bath water in temperature and to jump in a dark lagoon to see the glow of the algae that is in it a certain time if the year is super cool.  You glow in the dark as you swim in it.  Another nice thing is to go and see the stars away from the city lights.  This is a must.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

325840403.name: If you are here, don\'t hesitate, go and experience it!
325840403.author: a TripAdvisor user
325840403.reviewBody:
The lagoon was recommended to me by the air traffic controller of the airport. He showed me the outline that was visible and told me that it is a good place to visit by night. So I asked the hotel and they indeed had an organized tour in the night. 
Two words can describe the experience:
ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!
Totally worth the visit. The boat took us to the middle of the lake and since there is almost no light pollution you can enjoy two things, First the water with the luminous plankton and second while relaxing in the water you can enjoy the stars in sky. 
Water is salty and it is warm so you won’t get cold even after an hour in the lagoon and you will float easily.
So again find the time on a clear sky night and just go. Get your buddy, friend, wife, kids, lover etc and just enjoy.
I am going back there as soon as I have the chance to visit PXM again!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

323912617.name: Unique experience
323912617.author: a TripAdvisor user
323912617.reviewBody: Before the visit, I checked the comments other visitors made, and to be honest, I was expecting nothing. However, for my surprise, it was not only good, it was amazing. Totally worth going. it\'s a must go. And of course, go by night. It\'s absolutely safe. To see the stars, and the effects of the planctons, it\'s so beautiful. When the water is moved, it leaves a trace of a brightened blue. Also, the water is super warm, no problem at all to swim by night. Totally recommend it!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

322218839.name: its real
322218839.author: a TripAdvisor user
322218839.reviewBody: went there with my own car. its about 15-20mins north from puerto escondido. first they wanted to charge us 200mex per person we refused then suddenly it was only 100. we said yes had to wait twenty minutes and then we left by boat. best to go is when you have the least amount of light from the moon otherwise you won\'t see the glowing nicely. the trip then was only about 40mins but it was enough to see it

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

321511215.name: Take the night boat
321511215.author: a TripAdvisor user
321511215.reviewBody:
I went on the night boat tour with friends and it was awesome. You can ask around about it from the street fair in downtown PE. I think the night tours begin around 10pm. You take a cab about 10-15 min from the center of town and it drops you off at the building where an employee explains about the area, the warm, freshwater lagoon (manglades), and how it's a habitat for many birds and glowfish. I'm not sure what they'd be called in English as the lecture was entirely in Spanish, but from what I understood, these microscopic plankton are like lightening bugs, and they glow a phosphorescent blue when threatened. When the water is disturbed, it glows. It is AWESOME. 

 It happened to be thundering with lightening when we went (a little lightening over an open body of water is not a concern in Mexico - Safety shmafety), which made it even more awesome. Bolts of lightening illuminating the sky and fluorescent water glowing all around us as we swam. I think the guide said the best time to see this was in May. It was July. It wasn't overwhelmingly luminescent, but the water definitely lit up when we moved and splashed. The water spraying from the sides of the boat glowed on the way out there. 

The water is very shallow - ranging from about 4 to 6 feet - so don't dive from the boat. You probably don't want to stand, either, since the bottom is muddy and grassy. 

I can't remember now how much the tour cost. It's a fixed amount for the tour divided by the number of people going. We were only 3 people and I think we talked them down to about 50-60 pesos a person (it was around $5-$10), plus the cab (40 pesos).  We got a cab to take us to the launch site, then we just paid there for the boat tour. It was about 2 hours for just the 3 of us.
