There were about 6-10 other people in the lecture, but they went in a different boat, so we never saw another soul while we were out there. I'm sure if you arrange the whole tour including hotel pick up and drop off, you'd pay about 300 pesos a person. I never buy those rip-off tours. Always cheaper to get there yourself. Bring a towel. 

Our captain was funny and we had a good time. The only bad thing is you can't take pictures. You can try, but they won't turn out. Only professional cameras can capture the luminescence. Bummer. It's dark out there. The boat has a single spotlight, but once the guide picks a spot, he turns it off. He has a big flashlight, though, if needed to ward off any Swamp Things.  

Hope that helps!  Enjoy Puerto Escondido!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

319889752.name: Best thing I have done in my 3 months here in Mexico!
319889752.author: a TripAdvisor user
319889752.reviewBody: Went kayaking in the brackish lake yesterday... It was awesome with all these birds and what not....\nThen after a nice sunset I got to swim with the phosphorescent plankton!!!! Coolest thing I have done in mexico.................. pireod!!!!!!! I\'ve been in Puerto Escondido for 3 weeks and this is by far my favorite thing here or anywhere else in Mexico. If you are here for a at least a day DO THIS!!!!!!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

319111121.name: Night tour of Laguna de Manialtepec
319111121.author: a TripAdvisor user
319111121.reviewBody: Gina Machorro, the unofficial tourist expert of Puerto Escondido, booked us (and went with us) on a night tour of Laguna de Manialtepec to see the glowing water of the laguna.  It was amazing to see the water glowing with light from the properties in it.  Even when other guests went swimming in that water, they glowed also!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

314910583.name: Bird watching and swimming in the laguna
314910583.author: a TripAdvisor user
314910583.reviewBody: We visited Laguna de Manialtepec twice during our visit.  We were lucky enough to be there during the phosphorescence period, and we took a boat ride in the lagoon and swam in the luminescent water.  A once-in a lifetime experience.\nA week later, we did a bird watching tour of the lagoon, with a fantastic guide who was able to narrate the tour both in english and in spanish - completely fluent in both languages!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

314547494.name: Great nature adventure
314547494.author: a TripAdvisor user
314547494.reviewBody: Thanks to Michael Malone of Hidden Voyages and a group of very experienced bird watchers this 6 hour trip on the Laguna was a great experience. I saw and photograph quite a few new bird species to me and really enjoyed the expert commentaries by Michael not only about the birds but the history and controversy with fishermen about Laguna de Manialtepec. It was also very convenient to get to the Laguna since Michael picked me up just below my house in a group van and dropped me off after the trip. Not to forget the expert local Mexican driving the boat who can also spot birds before anyone else sees them. I highly recommend Michael Malone\'s Hidden Voyages Ecotours to the Laguna de Manialtepec!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

311441044.name: If you love nature you have to do it
311441044.author: a TripAdvisor user
311441044.reviewBody: This it\'s actually paradise went there with family there it\'s alot of things to do there\nWe rented the services from Lalo Ecotours and it was a great experience and a great value for the price. There is an island in the midle of the lake where you can appreciate like at least 100 different types of birds and they have the nest everywhere even on the floor it was amazing

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

298526676.name: Frustrating
298526676.author: a TripAdvisor user
298526676.reviewBody: We reached the lagoon with big expectation and it definately frustrated the whole group. It shined very little. Felt like a big rip off from the locals tht organize this, since it was pretty expensive for a 1.5 hour tour.\nDefinately wouldnt waste my money if I knew what it was.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

295858526.name: Excellent Adventure with Excursions Turisticas de Valfred
295858526.author: a TripAdvisor user
295858526.reviewBody: Our excursion was incredible this family owned business took excellent care of us.  They picked us up at our rental and took us out to the lagoon. The bioluminescence was incredible, water was warm the boat captain and his young attendant made the experience second to none.  Our two young adult daughters were taken aback by the sheer beauty of the experience.  The bioluminescence trip is a must experience for anyone traveling to PE.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

274849627.name: " Under the Moonlight "
274849627.author: a TripAdvisor user
274849627.reviewBody: What a great way to spend a hot evening and what a great enjoyable evening spent getting to know other travelers. We went on a evening where you experience a rare phosphorescence where the water lights up. We were out in the complete dark with this kid who spoke a few languages , born and raised in Puerto E and taught us all about the experience of the lagoon at night and how this happens rarely. Lots of boats out in this lagoon and they only carry a night light where they see where the best spot is to swim and light up is . I did not go swimming since there are crocodiles even though he said you could see them coming at you. My friends jumped in the water which they said was like bath water and swam for around a hour in the water. Every swish of their bodies lit up and it was very cool to watch. The boat ride is relaxing on a hot evening and its a great night to spend learning about the area we were visiting for the month. I would suggest this night trip to anyone. \nCool air on the boat , nice people to learn about and just a fun night trip. They will pick you up and transport you from where ever you are staying .

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

272808296.name: Rare opportunity to experience phosphorescence this way
272808296.author: a TripAdvisor user
272808296.reviewBody: I was a little suspicious as to whether this would be all it was cracked up to be but it turned out amazing and I am so glad I went. We travelled through channels in a lagoon area for about 15 minutes until we stopped at a spot where there were bioluminescent phytoplankton. Fish scattered through the water and their bodies lit up as they disturbed the phytoplankton. We then jumped in and had a swim which was incredible! The tour was the perfect amount of time to enjoy this natural wonder without dragging out the experience. A definite must do.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

269326754.name: Canooeing
269326754.author: a TripAdvisor user
269326754.reviewBody: I went with my husband one Sunday and we rented a Canoe for 2 hours, we took some music, water and fruis it was a lot of fun

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

264670241.name: Who woulda thought a Laguna could be so interesting
264670241.author: a TripAdvisor user
264670241.reviewBody: When I heard we were going to visit a Laguna, I imagined a small muddy lake. I guess that\'s why I\'m not an ornithologist. But Lalo is, and his tour of this paradise of migratory and native birds was the highlight of our trip to Puerto Escondido. He took us out in a small and quiet motorboat to the manglaves, and brought birds flocking to us with special calls he could vocalize. Then we toured the rest of the Laguna, which is absolutely huge, with islands literally swarming with hundreds of different varieties of aves, including blue heron, pelicans, vultures, parrots etc etc. Lalo and his son Eve (who speaks fluent English) are smart, lovely people with a real understanding of the area and the natural beauty that you can experience in an afternoon. Don\'t miss it!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

264326160.name: A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!
264326160.author: a TripAdvisor user
264326160.reviewBody: Here you can swim in the phosphorescent lagoon ... just like in the movie "The Life of Pi".  As the luminescence is activated by the movement of the water... it will be an unforgettable experience. Great to do with kids!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

260327296.name: Serene laguna filled with a paradise of birds
260327296.author: a TripAdvisor user
260327296.reviewBody: A must see location, go to this location just before sunset. Take the boat tour and see how many types of different birds you can spot and identify. A natural habitat made by a sand reef which separates  the lagoon from the sea. As evening comes you will see a display of glowing phosphorus within the lagoon. Spend you dinner at the edge of the lagoon in a local restaurant and try there local specialties. The restaurant provides outside seating and bar while you enjoy the evening by the lagoon.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

258800613.name: very quiet and nice place
258800613.author: a TripAdvisor user
258800613.reviewBody: Went there and stopped by to take a tour. We went with a young guy who knew a lot about the area and the fauna. Enjoyed it !

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

258668220.name: Kayaking!
258668220.author: a TripAdvisor user
258668220.reviewBody: We had a great time kayaking on this lagoon! Much of the local fauna frequents the lagoon, and several local guides offer tours. We stayed at the Hotel Santa Fe, which connected us with a guide who gave us great, bilingual tour of the lake, and even knew the names of the birds in both Spanish and English! Very impressive!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

258120765.name: Lalo-Ecotours is the best!
258120765.author: a TripAdvisor user
258120765.reviewBody: My husband and I just finished our 3rd trip with Lalo-EoTours; and our tour guide "Eve" is the best (pronounced "Evvy")! His English is excellent as is his knowledge of the local birds. He picked us up at our casita in Puerto Escondido early in the morning and drove to the Lagoon - about 40 minutes away. His launch was comfortable and clean, seating about 8 people.. He handed out binoculars to those who didn\'t have any (we brought our own) and off we went. We saw close to 80 different birds and animals in a little over 3 hours, before stopping at Juanita\'s where we enjoyed a delicious meal under her palapa on the Pacific (where we saw dolphisn and jumping rays!). A wonderful tour - I\'d highly recommend to everyone, even if you\'re not a birder. The lagoon is beautiful and Eve rocks!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

257673533.name: Spectacular!
257673533.author: a TripAdvisor user
257673533.reviewBody: A must go! Take some bug spray an a bathing suit and you are good to go! If you are in puerto escondido this is a must!!!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

257638004.name: Peaceful
257638004.author: a TripAdvisor user
257638004.reviewBody: A nice day to take in bird watching nature boating etc stop in Alexandria s place for great cheap food

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

257382144.name: Puerto Swelo
257382144.author: a TripAdvisor user
257382144.reviewBody: On the west end of Laguna Manialtepec is Puerto Swelo. We got there by boat(from the Laguna), great place to eat, Jaunita made us more lunch than we could possibly finish, then walked down the beach to where the Laguna exits into the Pacific...there were literally hundreds if not thousands of birds. After a swim,( it was a nice swimming beach), we sat and watched whales go by. It was the only place around Puerto Escondido that we saw whales. Great way to spend a day, exploring and on the beach.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

256618281.name: Bird eco tour with Michael Malone
256618281.author: a TripAdvisor user
256618281.reviewBody: Saw over 50 birds? Very well organized with experts and with high level of professionalism? Breakfast break was excellent!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

255415123.name: Don\'t miss it
255415123.author: a TripAdvisor user
255415123.reviewBody: My wife and I have visited Laguna Manialtepec on three occasions and each time have come away from the experience gobsmacked by the beauty and serenity of the nature on display there. We have always booked through Lalo Ecotours and always been fortunate to have Eve (rhymes with Chevy) as our guide. He is Mexican and lives at the little village, Las Negras, that is the setting off point for these fabulous excursions. His English is charming, as is his enthusiasm and intimate knowledge of the flora and fauna of Manialtepec. We have gone birding with him twice, and an evening bioluminescence tour once. If you can do one, wonderful; both and it\'s life-changing. Take it from a land-locked Canadian. For the bird tour, he picks you up in a van at whereever you\'re staying (early, around 6:30) and drop you back there about six hours later. The lagoon is just a 20 minute drive from PE. No bugs to worry about. Eve supplies good binoculars. There\'s a lovely late little lunch on an enchanting strip of solitary sand near end of tour. All for 550 pesos a head. (Don\'t forget to tip the boatsman.) I won\'t even start on all the incredible birds you\'ll see -- TripAdvisor would have to ban me for blathering on too long.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

254301405.name: Great tour!
254301405.author: a TripAdvisor user
254301405.reviewBody: We visited La Laguna de Manialtepec with Michael Malone\'s "Hidden Voyages Ecotours."  There are other companies one can go with, and it\'s possible to get yourself to the small jumping-off point and negotiate a boat (20 minutes north/west from Puerto Escondido) but I felt that Mr. Malone more than justified his tour price.  He and his driver pick you up at your hotel, he provides a short explanation of the trip before you board the boat, and his boat driver did an excellent job.  Although this is primarily a bird watching trip, and you\'ll see an amazing number of large birds, Mr. Malone also explained the local politics of the area and how it affects the lagoon.  We stopped on the beach for "late breakfast" at a no-electricity restaurant, rustic and fun, on a beautiful and isolated beach.  The tour lasted about 6 hours from pickup to drop off.  I\'m not usually a "tour person" but this one was well worth it.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

251916337.name: Serene evening on the lagoon
251916337.author: a TripAdvisor user
251916337.reviewBody: Manialtepec is a lovely lagoon created by a barrier sand bar near Puerto Escondido.  There are dozens of species of birds that all start roosting in the early evening so you\'ll have a good chance to see them.  The phosphorus at night, especially on a moonless night, is not to be missed.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

250652997.name: Life of Pi in real life
250652997.author: a TripAdvisor user
250652997.reviewBody: you get to experience bioluminecence in real life just as in the movie.  Just remeber there should not be a moon and best time is september to november according to the guide.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

248084778.name: not to miss a kayak paddle for the birds
248084778.author: a TripAdvisor user
248084778.reviewBody: one of the few truly natural spots to see birds and a beautiful lagoon.  Go at night for the phosphorus during the full moon, or a bird watching tour with Mike Malone.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

246429664.name: a must see for nature lovers
246429664.author: a TripAdvisor user
246429664.reviewBody: Great tour of the lagoon. Over 150 species of birds there. We saw about 50. First time I have seen a mangrove and it was a great experience. The guide\'s English was excellent.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

246269767.name: Glowing plankton night tour
246269767.author: a TripAdvisor user
246269767.reviewBody:
These 2-3 hour night tours are offered all over town. 300 to 400 per person. Find the cheapest one you can, they all pick you up in a van, drive you to the lagoon where everyone else ends up. You get in a 10 person boat for a short ride to where the bioluminescent plankton are. It was lots more fun than I thought it would be, to jump in the warm water and swim with everything glowing.
Make sure you bring your own towel and take a swim. They have life preservers to wear if you are not a good swimmer, and a ladder to climb back into the boat.

If you have your own transportation and can locate the boat launch in the dark the cost is only 200 pesos for the boat ride.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

245167539.name: Breathtaking beauty and magic! Must see for nature lovers!!
245167539.author: a TripAdvisor user
245167539.reviewBody: We ordered a trip from our amazing hotel Swiss Oasis. The ride there was about 30 minutes from Puerto Escondido. We got our own boat in the lagoon, guided by the native man Pepe. His english was not so good, but he was very kind and charming. We got binoculars and we got to see tons of beautiful species of birds and even an iguana. When sunset was comming, he stoped by the beach seperating the lagoon from the pacific. We watched the sunset which was beautiful, and afterwards he drove real slow back home. On the way, he stoped and let us swim in the dark. When moving in the water at night, the algea lights up real bright. It was very magical. When we stomped the bottom of the boat, we could see literally hundreds of fish as they swam and lighted up the water around them. A very very must see for any lovers of nature!!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

245097358.name: Eye Opening
245097358.author: a TripAdvisor user
245097358.reviewBody: So many birds I have never seen before. We took the guided canoe tour and the guide was excellent at pointing out birds and other wildlife. The brown bag lunch wasn\'t bad either. The night phosphors were incredable. Must do tour when in Puerto.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

244050997.name: night phosphors
244050997.author: a TripAdvisor user
244050997.reviewBody: think this is where we got phosphor swim at night, by day, it\'s eco center, lots of birds, easy to get there with a group bus and then there\'s a guide to either take you in boat or kayak

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

242755873.name: BioFluoresencia, a unique experience
242755873.author: a TripAdvisor user
242755873.reviewBody: I found the whole trip amazing. You take a 20 min boote ride in ther dark. Than you jump into the water which is ice and warm. Your bodywill be surroundend by biofluorescenting planctons. Around your hand and your whole body you will see a glowing halo.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

241170267.name: Great for bird lovers
241170267.author: a TripAdvisor user
241170267.reviewBody: Take the tour with friendly guides on their boats to enjoy calm unspoiled scenery and tons of birds.\nReally worth the approx USD 40

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

239304045.name: An easy trip to see nature
239304045.author: a TripAdvisor user
239304045.reviewBody: If you like being out in a boat, bird watching and seeing the richness of mangroves, this is the place to go from Puerto. You could take a tour from Puerto, or, take public transport (get a van from 3a Poniente and Calle 2a norte- 15 minutes, cost 15-20P) and get off at one of the \'resorts\' like Puesta del Sol. You can rent 2 person kayaks (120 P/hour) or rent a 10 person launch with a guide (1200P for 2-3 hours). You see a lot more with a launch since you go to the beach where the laguna empties into the sea. And the guide will point out birds and other fauna you would not see. Go early-6:30-7am) to see birdlife at its best and not get cooked being out in the sun. What you see is very similar to the Lagunas de Chacahua which is a long day trip.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

238743351.name: this is a must do.
238743351.author: a TripAdvisor user
238743351.reviewBody: this a place not to miss morning or eveining,very peacfull and lots of wildlife,but it is best to pick up a recommended guide,although I have never been disappointed with any of the guides round the lagoon,there is a great guide in Puerto Escondido by the name of mike Malone of eco tours who is the best.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

237308208.name: Night neon swim
237308208.author: a TripAdvisor user
237308208.reviewBody: I went there with all the people from my hostel and it was just amazing!\nWe went at night because when you enter the water glows and is just a unique experience, it can be a bit scary cuz\' is completly dark but totally worth it!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

237118806.name: Nice Kayaking Trip
237118806.author: a TripAdvisor user
237118806.reviewBody: Guide was Everardo Escamilla Martinez at Lalo Ecotours. Good guide and great birdwatching/photography.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

229399772.name: Many happy days here on the Lagoon
229399772.author: a TripAdvisor user
229399772.reviewBody: This is one of the best places to just go and chill for a day on the lagoon and by the see. No huge groups of tourists, complete nature and reality, and great food. Pick up a fresh bag of coconut with chilli sauce in the village - Yum !\n\nVisited many times over many years and never been disappointed. Even had a shoot out in the village one time which was different !

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

229094651.name: Pure nature !
229094651.author: a TripAdvisor user
229094651.reviewBody: Nice boattrips and bird watching early in the morning.  Kayaks for hire and a good local restaurant.\nMore information at GINA\'s information kiosk, Adoquin, Puerto Escondido.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

224342769.name: great nature tours
224342769.author: a TripAdvisor user
224342769.reviewBody: Eve from Lalo Ecotours took us on several tours in the Puerto Escondido area--turtle watching, birdwatching, and swimming in the phosphorescent waters of Laguna de Manialtepec.  The birdwatching early in the morning was great, and Eve is extremely knowledgeable about the local birds.  Swimming at night in the warm water of the lagoon was a bit spooky, but it was fascinating to see the glowing water as we splashed about.  The turtle watching was not at the lagoon, but it was extremely interesting to see the turtles come up on shore and lay their eggs.  This phenomenon apparently doesn\'t occur every day, but just for about 3 days every few months.  The beaches where it occurs are carefully guarded by the military to be sure the egg-laying process is not interfered with.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

221697119.name: Simply Amazing
221697119.author: a TripAdvisor user
221697119.reviewBody: We went to la laguna de Manialtepec on the night tour. It lasts from 8 o\'clock to about 10:30.\nIt\'s about a 20 minute drive from playa Zicatela and it is soooooo worth it.\nThey take out to a dark section of the lagoon by boat and you get to swim and the plankton light up with the movement of the water!  It is something that has to be seen to believe. It is completely magical.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

219859100.name: Phosphorescence was spectacular
219859100.author: a TripAdvisor user
219859100.reviewBody: We went with LALO Eco tours who picked us up from our accommodation in Playa Carrizalillo and took us to Manialtepec Lagoon to see the incredible Phosphorescence, the half plant half animal plankton shows up when it is completely dark so it was about 9:30pm when we came across it. We jumped into the pitch black water and we were surrounded by the most extraordinary shimmering lights, the water was as warm as a spa pool which made the experience delightful. This is a must do if visiting Puerto Escondido!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

218718450.name: Great experience with LALO-Ecotours
218718450.author: a TripAdvisor user
218718450.reviewBody:
We did three tours with LALO-Ecotours during our two weeks stay in Puerto Escondido. The first one was the phosphorescence. It was an amazing experience, swimming in the dark night in the highly lighted water in the lagoon Manialtepec. Our guide Eve was highly strive to explain everything very well and had a great knowledge of the nature in the lagoon Manialtepec. Moreover he could speak very well English which was great for people like us to understand well the Spanish language. What we really appreciate is that you could take your time to swim in the lagoon water.

The second tour with LALO-Ecotours was the horseback riding tour through the rivers of the wonderful region Manialtepec to the hot springs Atotonilco. The horses had a good constitution and well nourished (not like some horses on the beaches in Puerto Escondido which are very skinny and tired). The horses from LALO are moreover easy and safe to ride, as they had good and calm characters. We enjoyed every minute on the horse and were also highly overwhelmed of the beautiful nature. After more than an hour we arrived at the hot springs Atotonilco were we have made a stop for the time we needed. We took a bath in the hot springs and got some healthy mud for our skin. We recommend this tour to all horseback riding lovers and adventures, it is a very unique experience, especially swimming in the very hot water :-)

Thirdly we went with LALO to the Laguna Ventanilla and then to Mazunte to sea the turtles. Our guide was Eve again, as he is the only one who could speak such well English. He convinced us again with his bride knowledge of the animals and the nature. First we went with a little boat through the Laguna Ventanilla to see a lot of iguanas and different sorts of birds. Then we made a stop on a little island to see crocodiles, were we could rest and got a refreshment, fortunately, as it was very hot on that day.Afterwards we went back to the beginning and driving directly to Mazunte to see the turtles. During the whole tour, Eve explains you all the things in detail and as a tourist you feel to be in good and knowledgeable hands.

We really recommend LALO-Ecotours to everyone who wants to see the most important nature attractions of Puerto Escondido and who also wants to make tours with an organization that takes care of the nature and the animals.

Thank you very much LALO-Ecozoutd, and especially Eve, for the great experiences and fun, we had with you on our tours.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

217312455.name: OK trip but not one of the greats
217312455.author: a TripAdvisor user
217312455.reviewBody: We did the full trip down the lagoon so the river mouth at sunset and back to see phosphorescence. The phosphorescence was absolutely amazing and the lagoon was beautiful, but it is not as great as what people state on here. Note: I am not a bird watcher, the bird life is amazing here and if that is what you are looking for then you will be very happy with the trip.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

215009535.name: A Natural Paradise
215009535.author: a TripAdvisor user
215009535.reviewBody: We joined Eve from LALO Ecotours for an early morning Bird Viewing at Manieltepec Lagoon. The lagoon is "ginormous" and as you travel through it, you really feel transported to a different world! Eve (Ev-vy) was an entertaining and knowledgeable wildlife guide. He provided us with binoculars and directed us in viewing a bevy of birds! He explained the natural history of the local flora and fauna. We even took the boat to the juncture of where the lagoon meets the Pacific Ocean. What a stunning view this is! You will not be disappointed with this experience. Thank you Eve!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

208405327.name: Go with Mike Malone for this tour....for sure...
208405327.author: a TripAdvisor user
208405327.reviewBody: Go with Mike Malone for this tour.  His company name is Hidden Voyages Ecotours and you can read about his background under the "Your Guides section".  He is from Canada and has been coming to Puerto Escondido each winter for 32 years.  On the day of our tour, he picked us up at our B and B, arranged for our boat and local fisherman/guide, provided good quality binoculars and helped us to identify 56 birds on our trip on the lagoon.  Lunch (cost not included) was on a small sand spit with the Pacific on one side of our table and the lagoon behind us and consisted of just caught fish.  There are other items available if you don\'t care for fish.  Besides the fun of seeing and Identifying  the birds...was the history of the area and the lagoon over the centuries and what it means to the local people that earn their living in this magical area.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

205264159.name: This was a great half day of kayaking with a very knowledge local guide
205264159.author: a TripAdvisor user
205264159.reviewBody: This was a great half day of kayaking with a very knowledge local guide. We had a lovely lunch after the kayaking at the kayak rental site. A most enjoyable morning. Cannot wait to do this again.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

202640597.name: Lalo Ecotours
202640597.author: a TripAdvisor user
202640597.reviewBody: Evy our guide took us on the most amazing morning of bird watching we have ever experienced! We are quite well traveled and had the opportunity to see birds and wildlife we have never seen in any other country He was so knowlegable and knew every nook and cranny where the birds were nesting or liked to hang about. It was definitely a highlight of the trip!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

195324598.name: Peaceful kayaking from Las Negras base
195324598.author: a TripAdvisor user
195324598.reviewBody: An easy 20 trip on a collectivo bus from Peurto Escondido. We reserved the kayaks ahead and did a self-guided tour of the Laguna. The laguna was very calm, and the birds were very active. We went very early in the morning to avoid the heat, and we had breakfast at the little cafe. Yummy huevos ranchers made by an abuela (grandma!)

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

194953557.name: Can\'t Believe We Didn\'t Do This Sooner
194953557.author: a TripAdvisor user
194953557.reviewBody:
After 4 years of coming to Puerto Escondido, we finally decided to do the Maialtepec tour and did it with Eve Escamilla of Lalo Ecotours. Don't miss this trip! We spent about 3 hours on the lagoon learning and seeing so much, its difficult to recall it all if it weren't for the photos. Eve (pronounced Evvy) was our guide, Tim was his boats man. We saw countless species of Heron, Egrets, Storks, Parrots, Kingfishers, Hawks and more plus water snakes, Otters, There are over 300 species of birds in the lagoon area.Eve took us through the "brackish" mangroves early on and later in the trip where the Manialtepec River meets the lagoon, we went up the river, freshwater of course. Surprising how different the two areas are.

Eve took us to "Jaunitas" for a late breakfast. It is a place right on the beach nestled between the lagoon and the Pacific. We had traditional eggs, sopas, veggies, beans, fried plantain and more, all absolutely delicious and plentiful. Gracias Jaunita! 

Our trip back from breakfast was the "express" route but still took some time and it was awesome to feel the wind in your hair and experience the lagoon to its fullest. Gracias Eve and Tim from Lorenzo and Barb.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

194170909.name: Relaxing boat trip and bird watching.
194170909.author: a TripAdvisor user
194170909.reviewBody: The lagoon is small enough to be visited by boat or kayak.  We took the motor boat tour from Puesta del Sol.  Saw many birds, explored some noarrow canals, and enjoyed a cold coconut on the ocean shore.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

193548214.name: Dont cheap out on this tour.
193548214.author: a TripAdvisor user
193548214.reviewBody: We booked our tour with Hidden Voyages EcoTours. The guide a canadian who winters in Puerto for the last 30 years is a biologist that really knows his stuff. It appeared as though he actually hired the boat to run the tour from his competition. My wife took a tour previously with another operator and said that this tour was by far superior and went more places and saw way more then with them. Michael was fluent in both spanish and english and provided all on board with the best binoculars I have ever used in my life.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

193507346.name: Turtle release
193507346.author: a TripAdvisor user
193507346.reviewBody:
A must do in Pto. Escondido. They pick you up at 4:30pm and drop you back off just in time for dinner. It is only about 20 minutes out of town on a 30 mile long deserted beach. When you arrive, you get acquainted with the 1 day-old sea turtles you will be releasing at sunset. The guide, Ebbe in our case, is very knowledgeable on the topic and his English quite good. We got to release 300 Olive Riddley turtle in a 'race to the ocean' fashion. Our kids, and us too, loved the experience. 

We suggest you leave a tip to the ejido who runs the release program as they are all volunteers. They get no funding whatsoever. It is thanks to them the sea turtle is making a comeback in southern Mexico after being on the brink of extinction due to poaching. The freshly laid eggs are popular on the black market.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

192911857.name: Wonderful nature environment - brilliant guide
192911857.author: a TripAdvisor user
192911857.reviewBody:
We had an amazing kayak tour of the Manialtepec Laguna with Michael Malone, a Canadian naturalist / birder who has been in the area for 30 years. What an amazing day in his company at this beautiful Lagoon. As eager bird watchers we expected a lot from our visit and we were not disappointed. His knowledge, communication and enthusiasm made the experience memorable – not only for the nature and birds which we saw, but the way in which he brought it to life. Our tour in his excellent 16 foot single sit-on kayaks allowed us to get up really close to the environment, particularly with the fine Vortex binoculars which he provided.
We want to endorse his outstanding tour and expert guiding. He is a scholar and a real gentleman

The only slight disappointment was the lunch at the beautiful palapa beach restaurant. The fish was overlooked and thus dry. However the beers were cool, the views amazing and the ocean warm to swim in the surf

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

192561705.name: Great birding and mangrove tour
192561705.author: a TripAdvisor user
192561705.reviewBody: We used Lalo ecotours.  Mexican guide with excellent English took us out in a small power boat, early enough to see gorgeous sunrise.  We saw 70 species of birds, had a delightful trip thru narrow channels thru the mangroves, and had a good lunch at Juanita\'s, a  very rustic but charming spot on the beach overlooking the pacific.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

191380754.name: Beautiful, peaceful
191380754.author: a TripAdvisor user
191380754.reviewBody: We went a few times.  Great visit with Michael Malone--he is a good guide, knows a lot, not over-bearing, great equipment. Then returned by ourselves and kayaked at.... I forget name but Gina the information goddess recommended it, right by water, rented kayaks and had delicious just-caught fish in above-average setting.  highly recommend

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

190198264.name: Tour with Lalo Ecotours
190198264.author: a TripAdvisor user
190198264.reviewBody: We went on a tour of the 9km Lagoon by boat, dined at the ocean, and saw the glowing phytoplankton by moonlight.  45 friends and family joined. It was incredible.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

188958308.name: Day or Night
188958308.author: a TripAdvisor user
188958308.reviewBody: Day trips offer great kayaking, bird watching, guided lagoon tours. We use La Puesta Del Sol for our starting point. They have great guides, kayaks, and a nice restaurant. We also went back for the night phosphorescence ... simply amazing. We arranged for Puesta Del Sol to have a guide and we also had supper there. They are not normally open for supper unless you arrange in advance but are very accommodating. We swam at night, the water is warm. Make sure you check to see if this phenomenon is happening when you are there, it will be a highlight of the trip.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

188774070.name: Do not miss the night swim!
188774070.author: a TripAdvisor user
188774070.reviewBody: There is an amazing bioluminescence phenomenon here from June-December. Traveling with two families and kids with Lalo Ecotours (great outfit. reviewed as well), we had great service but the highlight is jumping into the inky black waters partly fed from hot springs and seeing the flashes of sparkles in the water. You are like Peter Pan and Harry Potter all at once, with magic lights coming out of your every move. An absolutely incredible experience not to be missed. You can contact Lalo at 954-118-9037. We paid about US$20 per person, worth every penny.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

188717953.name: Don\'t miss Mike Malone Hidden Voyages Ecotours
188717953.author: a TripAdvisor user
188717953.reviewBody:
We took a wildlife watching tour around the lagoon with Mike Malone, the owner of Hidden Voyages Ecotours (hiddenvoyagesecotours.com) and it was one of the best tours we have taken. There are a couple of companies doing this type of tour but my advice is to pay the little extra money (not that much, really) and join a true professional. Mike is a pleasure to be with, knowledgeable and very helpful. Binoculars are provided if you don't have some already. 

The tour provides transport there and back but we skipped the return trip and hired a couple of canoes instead. Obviously, we didn't see as many birds as with Mike but it was fun anyway :-). Getting back to PE by public bus is very easy too.

It is a shame that Mike doesn't have a separate listing on Trip Advisor as we would love to review him there. If you are into wildlife, this is a not-to-miss experience in Puerto Escondido.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

188603069.name: Magical Manieltepec
188603069.author: a TripAdvisor user
188603069.reviewBody: We took our family to see the phosphorescence in November! We had heard about it for years, and finally got to experience it. We took a tour through La Puesta Del Sol, and we were blown away. It was such a thrill and so magical! A bird tour during the day is wonderful and informative also.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

186937037.name: Kayaking with the birds
186937037.author: a TripAdvisor user
186937037.reviewBody: If you are looking for a peaceful yet educational paddling experience, try Lolo kayaking trips in Manialtepec lagoon. I spent the morning gliding through the mangroves spotting herons, pelicans...paddling allows you to get into the heart of the mangrove waterways. Wear a hat, sunscreen and bring lots of water.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

182298275.name: The phosphorescent plankton are amazing!
182298275.author: a TripAdvisor user
182298275.reviewBody: I took a tour with lalo eco tours, and I would definitely recommend the trip.  They picked us up at about 5:30pm, took us to the lagoon, and then we took a leisurely boat ride along the lagoon and watched the many birds there on our way to the shore.  The we watched a gorgeous sunset at the point where the lagoon and the ocean meet.  After that we got back in the boat, and were amazed by the jumping fish and phosphorescent plankton that light up when you move your hand in the water, or take a swim in the water.  A word of warning, the lagoon is fed by sulphourous hot springs, and has a bit of that odor if you swim, but I would still definitely recommend going for a dip if you are able to see the phosphorescence.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

181815983.name: Unique experience in the Oaxacan coast
181815983.author: a TripAdvisor user
181815983.reviewBody: The experience of luminescence in the water is someting I had not seen before. One of the highlights on my trip.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

179339354.name: Amazing Experience
179339354.author: a TripAdvisor user
179339354.reviewBody: There are many things to do in the Lagoon area, but my wife and I choose the phosphorescent tour.  At 8 pm, we met at the dock with several other couples, and headed out into the darkness.  Once you start leaving the lit area you begin to see the wake glowing.  Soon, you see underwater lights streak away from the boat as the fish are startled and flee.  We came to a stop in a very dark area.  That\'s when you start to see the really bright glowing.  Anything that disturbs the water will shine bright.  We jumped in and swam until we were exhausted.  It was unbelievable!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

178294706.name: magic!
178294706.author: a TripAdvisor user
178294706.reviewBody: Besides being a beutiful mangroe lagoon, beutiful views, varied birds, great sun sets, it has magic.Iif you go at the right hour, the right day, you will see a fantastic fenomena: flourecence. When the sun comes down and the moon is not up yet, you can actually see the water shine. You jump into the lagoon, very warm, and you feel like Tinkerbell. Yes the fairy in Peter Pan who throughs star dust all arround her. Well, when you move your arms and legs it is just like that. If you go under the water and open your eyes, the stardust comes out of your eye lashes. The people at the lagoon know when the fenomenon is there. Look for it. It is a wonderful experience!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

176504989.name: try Puesta del Sol
176504989.author: a TripAdvisor user
176504989.reviewBody:
I came with my friends weeks ago and we had an amazing time at Laguna de Manialtepec with PUESTA DEL SOL(01 954 132 8294)offering restaurant bar,camping,bird watching,kayaks and boat tours very helpful and friendly Mexican business family.
You should try the bio-luminescence,swimming in the dark lagoon at night and see all the water light up around is a unique experience! even we had a bilingual boat guide.
Very easy to get here from Puerto Escondido by collectivo 15$ pesos(fifteen minutes ride)
just go!!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

175970155.name: Beautiful
175970155.author: a TripAdvisor user
175970155.reviewBody: This place is beautiful, even if you don\'t usually go bird-watching. If you go on a tour, hopefully you get one that gives you a stop at the coconut plantation where you can sit peacefully by the ocean with only the palms, the beach and your fellow tourers while sipping a freshly cracked coconut. I also heard the canadian tour guide makes a great tour with kayaks, but you have to specifically ask for him, otherwise you get a tour in a power boat (which is still very nice).

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

173436548.name: Bioluminescence, once in a lifetime experience
173436548.author: a TripAdvisor user
173436548.reviewBody: Jumping in a dark lake at night is a bit scary at first, but when you see the water light up around you when you swim is an experience you\'ll never forget. It\'s very surrealistic and it only happens during certain times of the year, a must do when you are in Puerto Escondido.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

172540517.name: Just beautiful
172540517.author: a TripAdvisor user
172540517.reviewBody: We missed the bio-luminescence, but that should be an excuse to come back.  This lake is beautiful and serene.  Just go.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

170946790.name: Incre\u00edble
170946790.author: a TripAdvisor user
170946790.reviewBody: I was staying at Villa Lili and Claire recommended the night tour to the lagoon. On a moonless night a small group took the tour and dove into the bio-luminscent waters and it was amazing!  Check with tour guides to make sure the conditions are right but it\'s incredible!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

163372584.name: One of few places in world for Bioluminescence
163372584.author: a TripAdvisor user
163372584.reviewBody: Really cool experience.  We went during a time when the bio-luminescent phytoplankton was trapped in a lagoon.  At night, the water glowed when disturbed.  The wake from the boat was glowing and when we stopped, we got to jump into the warm water.  It was amazing seeing the bright blue/green glow of the water as others and Myself jumped into the warm water.  REALLY COOL.  I can only imagine how crazy it would look when it rains!  Only happens at certain times of the year though.  Look into it!

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

162125769.name: Mike Malone Hidden Voyages Ecotours---as good as it gets.
162125769.author: a TripAdvisor user

If you only have time to partake in one eco-type activity while in Puerto do it with M. Malone because he is as good as it gets.

The birds and scenery are a wonder even if you never thought you would get excited by spotting an Ibis, egret or magnificent frigate. 151752416.name: Great Bird watching and wonderful naturalist guide
151752416.author: a TripAdvisor user
151752416.reviewBody: 5 of us had a great 4 hour tour of the lagoon with Hidden Voyages Ecotours. 7 am -noon. Mike Malone and his driver picked us up in a van at our hotel. We took a short drive to the lagoon and boarded a 10 passenger motorboat with individual seats and backrest that glided us across the lagoon and through the giant mangroves. Each of us were provided with first class binoculars and our morning coffee. We spotted many wonderful tropical birds in the mangroves ie Magnificent Frigate-bird, groove-billed Ani and many, more along with tropical flowers and fisherman at work in their dugouts. The lagoon water was high which gave us access to waterways untraveled for years. We also stopped on the beach for a 45 minute brunch break "Great Sopas and cold drinks" Yum! Yum!.  Mike our guide has 30 years of experience and is extremely knowledgeable. The time flew by and the trip was tranquil and informative. We would recommend this excursion for anyone visiting Puerto Escondido. Bring your hat,sunscreen and camera for the adventure of a life time.

We kayaked, with a guide dropping us off and meeting us at a couple points along the way to show us where else we could go.  While the river our guide brought us to had more wildlife and I found it very peaceful and beautiful, we come from Southern Oregon where there is wildlife and nature in essentially every corner.  With that considered, it wasn\'t as impressive of an experience as it may be for others who live in desert or city environment.

141797629.name: Excellent Evening Excursion
141797629.author: a TripAdvisor user
141797629.reviewBody: My friend and I (two 25 year old males) took a tour of this lagoon in the evening in early august 2012. Lalo (of lalo ecotours) took us out on his boat. He picked us up at our hotel in PE and drove us for about 20 minutes out to the lagoon. It was just my buddy, Lalo and I on the boat, and it was an awesome experience. Lalo was very friendly and personable, his English is so-so, and my Spanish is so-so, but between the two of us we communicated quite well. The lagoon is beautiful, sporting a wide variety of bird life. Although the morning trip would probably be better for spotting wildlife. The boat tour lasted for about 3 or 4 hours, and included a stop at a beautiful palapa style bar on the beach, totally isolated from other people. During my two weeks in Oaxaca and Puerto Escondido, this excursion on the lagoon with Lalo was hands down the best part of my trip, and Lalo was one of the coolest people I met. You can tell he really cares about the laguna he lives on. Highly recommended!

140786426.author: a TripAdvisor user
140786426.reviewBody: If you love the outdoors and seeing tropical birds of every color in the rainbow then this is the place for you. This is a very large lagoon about 10 kilometers long that leads to the ocean and a deserted beach that must be at least 20 kilometers long. Everywhere you look there are birds of every type both aquatic and land dwellers. We went on a boat tour with Lalo Ecotours who happens to be very knowledgeable on all the wildlife here, but especially so on birds.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

137446265.name: Great place to see gorgeous birds, mandrakes, local fishing and villages
137446265.author: a TripAdvisor user
137446265.reviewBody:
The laguna is a haven for birds and other wildlife in the area and seems to be one of the better non-beach-related activities close to Puerto Escondido.  We enjoyed seeing dozens of different, exotic types of birds up close, including pelicans that skimmed overhead, and trees laden with birds with vast wingspans, a kaleidoscope of colors (including pink, red, yellow, orange!), and one type that oinked and grunted like angry pigs.  The 12-meter laguna can be seen by boat or by kayak and for the hearty among you we strongly recommend the kayaks, which allow you to go at your own pace, explore any bird or inlet that appeals to you, and permits you to run through the channels that local fisherman have hacked through the fascinating red mangroves ... the locals get access to the laguna and you can take a side-visit to get a long-distance peak at their rustic villages and boats.  A typical one-way kayak venture runs 2.5-3.5 hours depending on the diversions one makes ... and happily the tour includes a boat ride to return, as the one-way trip is pleasingly tiring.

The laguna is fed by a river that typically runs parallel to the ocean, protected by a sand bar.  The first sight of this connection from the laguna is a marvel ... there beyond the tip of your kayak lies the placid laguna and beyond that the sand bar loaded with colorful birds and beyond that the ocean with its 20-foot waves crashing in explosions and filling the horizon with foam and mist and frothy roars.  

We were fortunate to be there just two days after the sandbar connection to the river had been breached by Ernesto's after-effects.  As a result, a new connection between the river and ocean had been made, allowing ocean fish and saltwater into the river and eventually the lagoon, and creating an outlet for fresh water.  Local fishermen tossed circle nets into the connection and hauled their catches as we watched.  And the breach will apparently fuel the phosphoric phenomenon among the algae that is so widely written about ...  the locals were excited to see what will happen at the laguna in weeks to come.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

134243149.name: Phosphorescence and turtles; go in the evening
134243149.author: a TripAdvisor user
134243149.reviewBody: We were staying in Puerto Escondido at the Hotelito Swiss Oasis; the hotel supports the Escondido economy by recommending local people with whom to do eco-tours.We elected to do a baby turtle release and the lagoon visit. Job (not sure about the spelling), a fellow who lives at the lagoon, arrived to pick us up at 6:40 pm and we were off  to Playa Delfin (Dolphin Beach), a twenty five kilometer long beach a ways north of Escondido, to release turtles. After the turtle release, which probably took about two hours or so, we were off north again to the six kilometer long Manialtepec Lagoon, a body of water surrounded by mangrove swamp vegetation, its tropical climate lending itself to a diverse ecosystem. Dozens of migratory bird species such as herons and ducks make Manialtepec lagoon their home at various times of the year. Job told us that, in addition to birds and fish, crocodiles live here. We, and six other people, boarded the small tour boat and headed out on the cloudless night to tour the lagoon and see the phosphorescence created by the water\u2019s phytoplankton. Beside the boat, we could see streaks of bright silver zipping hither and yon; these were fish. Running our hands through the water produced long streaks of brilliant white and silver; resting in the lagoon, our hands appeared white and skeletal because of the phosporescence. Encouraged by Job, several people jumped in and swam, their bodies making white and silver patterns in the dark \u2013 fabulous. We were told that, in the rainy season, the area is completely dark and the falling rain makes the entire lagoon shine brilliantly against the black background. That would be amazing to see. Recommended. The cost per person was 500 pesos (about $38). See more info and pictures here: http://lmaclean.ca/2012/04/puerto-escondido-markets-turtles-and-phosphorescence/

Don\'t forget to have a great lunch at the restaurant located just off the river\'s edge.  The food is prepared fresh and it is a peaceful place to spend a few hours.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

123189729.name: Beautiful
123189729.author: a TripAdvisor user
123189729.reviewBody: We took the Hidden Voyages Ecotour with Mike (peleewings@hotmail.com - but you can also find him through the coffeeshop at Hotel Casa Dan in the winter) earlier today.  We usually do at least one ecotour on a trip with good natural resources, but they are typically a little more active than a quiet birdwatching lagoon tour in a skiff and we are definitely not avid birdwatchers.  Or at least we weren\'t.  But this tour was really great - we got to see almost 50 different birds, including big hawks, tons of egrets & herons, ducks, wild parrots + a huge iguana 100\' up a tree, the mangrove forrests are really cool and the boat maneuvers through the rivers via makeshift tunnels through their roots.  We also had amazing sopes with a fresh coconut to sip on at an essentially private beach for about $2 each while we watched tons of seabirds dive for fish.  Mike has been doing this for 30+ years and his knowledge of the lagoon\'s species and his respect for the locals and their way of life (his boat operator was a former fisherman who he has turned on to ecotourism) are really impressive, we enjoyed every minute of our tour.

92013969.name: Fantastic birds, Kayaking in solitude, and a great lunch on a secluded beach
92013969.author: a TripAdvisor user
92013969.reviewBody: Just visited Puerto Escondido during the busiest week of the year between Christmas and New Year\'s Eve, and was looking for a quiet day out of the city.  Pelee Wing\'s Birding tour of the Manialtepec Lagoon given by Mike Malone ended up being one of the highlights of our trip and should not be missed when in PE.  The tour can be done by motor boat or Kayak but we opted for the Kayak tour as we hoped this quiet mode of transport would allow us to see many more birds and explore more remote areas in the mangrove lined water channels in the lagoon. Given the number of birds in the lagoon,  we would have seen plenty either way but the Kayaks really allow you to experience the Lagoon in solitude but if birds are your priority, you can\'t go wrong with either tour. \n\nAfter picking  us up at our hotel, and driving to the lagoon, Mike provided great coffee as he provided an orientation of the lagoon.  As a naturalist who has been giving this tour for over 20 years, Mike\'s knowledge really shined once we hit the water as he identified numerous interesting and diverse birds.   My personal favorite was seeing flocks of storks.  After the birding tour, we finished up on a remote beach only accessible by boat.  It was by far the most beautiful beach I have seen in Mexico.  There was nothing on the beach but a small palapa with a local family serving fantastic food and beer.  Swimming and lunch on that beach really topped off the day and will always be a special memory of our time in PE.   I highly recommend this tour if you are visiting the Puerto Escondido Area.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

16373535.name: Most enchanting swim you\'ll ever have - good for kayaking too!
16373535.author: a TripAdvisor user
16373535.reviewBody:
Our family of 4 (mom dad two boys 6 and 10) visited the laguna as one of the excursions arranged by the spanish language school we attended (www.puertoschool.com)  I just have a couple of things to add as I think the other reviewers here have described the laguna quite well.

First of all, we made the trip to the "ocean" end of the lagoon partly by motorboat, but also partly by kayak.  It is a great spot for a calm kayak paddle, and we were paddling at dusk, so it was lovely.

When we got to the end (we had to find our boat first, it was getting dark) we loaded our kayaks back on the boat and headed back down the laguna.  All of a sudden we noticed the boat wake was glowing as if lit by lights, but this was the phosphorescence.
We stopped the boat and all jumped in and had a marvellous time, it was truly like swimming in starlight.  After some initial reluctance (we hadn't done a very good job explaining plankton I guess, because one of my sons was concerned that it was "bugs") my kids jumped in and absolutely loved it.  It was very hard to get back on that boat and leave the enchanted laguna.  On the ride back to Puerto I kept pulling at the fabric on my swimsuit because every time I did it set off a little shower of stars.  What a memory.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

11140445.name: Fascinating Tour of the Lagoon and the amazing amount of wildlife
11140445.author: a TripAdvisor user
11140445.reviewBody: Was in Puerto Escondido in winter of 2006. While getting info on the area from the (highly recommended) lady at the town info centre we overheard people in front of us booking a tour of the Laguna. The fellow guiding the tour was a wildlife biologist from Ontario, Canada . Who spends winters in PE and studies the Wildlife in the Lagoon!  We booked the tour and were absolutely amazed at the diversity of birds and other wildlife in this lagoon. The guide was so knowledgeable that you learned the names and habits of all the birds. If you are into nature, birds or animals, We were even allowed to free some baby turtles to the sea. very cool!!  this tour is a must , while in PE have fun

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

10649383.name: Beautiful in the daytime, too
10649383.author: a TripAdvisor user
10649383.reviewBody:
We were in PE during a full moon, so we missed the phosphorescence, but enjoyed a very nice half-day tour with the Lalos, father and son. We started with a motorboat ride across the eerily quiet morning lake, seeing about 24 species of marine birds. I'm not a birder, so I can't tell you what the most rare or interesting were, but I enjoyed watching the ospreys fish and admired the pink plumage of the roseate spoonbills. A few parrots flew overhead, and there were hummingbirds, warblers, and many other familiar refugees from the cold up north. 

We opted for both a kayak trip and a forest walk. For the kayak portion, we left the boat behind and crossed a shallow branch of the laguna to a place where we could disembark and walk through the half-jungle, half abandoned sesame farm nearby. If you go on this interesting walk, be sure to take bug repellent and sturdy shoes, as the acacia thorns littering the ground are wicked sharp. 

The laguna is an almost primevally peaceful place and a very interesting contrast to the lively beaches where you may be spending most of your trip. Thank you to the Lalos for sharing this special place with us.

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

5777381.name: The Phosphorescence at Night is AMAZING
5777381.author: a TripAdvisor user
5777381.reviewBody: We went on a night excursion with Lalo Eco Tours to the lagoon at night to witness the phosphorescent glow that occurs during the new and old moon. Basically, the lagoon fills up with a type of plankton that contains chloroform and a blue substance which gives off a glow when disturbed by currents. It\'s an amazing site to see because you can see the water glowing with a green light everywhere the boat would drive. The boat then stops and everybody jumps into the super warm waters of the lagoon to swim amongst the plankton. It\'s very dark on the water and serene but when you start swimming you see a green glow wherever the water is disturbed. When you pull your hand out of the water little green droplets fall from your skin and light up like a little shower of sparkles. It was absolutely an amazing phenonmenon to see and was definitely the highlight of our trip. I\'ve heard it\'s even more amazing if you bring a snorkel and mask so you might want to do that as well. Just be sure to check with the tour guide to make sure the phenonmenon is occurring the night you want to go.\n

address.streetAddress: Las Negras Mixtepec km 123 preguntar por Agustín o Gloria en el restaurant vista hermosa

660836954.author: a TripAdvisor user
660836954.reviewBody: One of a kind wonderful experience.  Sooo laid back...far away from the real world.  Great boat shttle.  Everone so nice y friendly.  Like going back in time.  Even helped open new bar by our small hotel right on the water...nothing fancy.\n.pretty rustic.  Fun!!!

648633334.name: Fantastic day trip from Pto. Escondido!
648633334.author: a TripAdvisor user
648633334.reviewBody: Visiting Parque Nacional Lagunas de Chacahua turned out to be a fantastic day trip from Puerto Escondido. I\'m not sure what my expectations were, but they were definitely exceeded. The boat ride on the lagunas was very interesting and relaxing as we worked our way through the byzantine mangrove passageways and saw all of the beautiful birds. We didn\'t see any crocodiles (they are very shy and not often seen), but it was great to visit the community of Chacahua and see how the people live there and eat a wonderful meal of fresh fish and explore the beach area, including the views from the sea wall.  Then, I really enjoyed checking out the views from the top of the lighthouse -- followed by an amazing sunset over the Pacific from the rocks below on the beach. But BEST OF ALL was the boat ride back in the dark experiencing the bioluminescent bay which glowed white and blue... and then swimming in the middle of the laguna and looking at the brilliant stars above... Something I will never forget! I highly recommend visiting PN Lagunas de Chacahua and making it a day trip that runs until after dark so that you can swim in the phosphorescent waters. Fantastic!

639015066.name: DEPENDS ON WHAT YOU NEED IS HOW YOU FEEL CHACAHUA
639015066.author: a TripAdvisor user
639015066.reviewBody:
This is my first review in english and i chose to do it so because ive seen that (as in any other places around the world) many foreign people have been scammed or not pleased by chacahua.
As my title says.....
Chacahua itself is paradise!
The thing is in what mood, stage of your life and what kind of things you expect as a traveler.

Me for example am super happy in isolated places....and in here at the mangrove i experienced the most amazing silence ever. i was very shocked by that.

I am simple and as long as i have a bathroom and a clean bed everything else is fine to me.

I stayed at "El General" cabins which aren’t the most fancy stuff but they had a clean bathroom a nice bed and a fan with a nice view to the beach and then I moved to his house for free.
His family practically where the first people to live in Chacahua and my experience there was completely awesome.
He took me to his fields and I saw this part of Chacahua that maybe no one sees often, acres of papaya, mango, coconut palm trees, watermelon fields. Such a beautiful experience.
Next day he took me to the lighthouse and the view is amazing you can see the lagoon, the mangrove, the beach, its unbelievable. That same night I saw the luminescence at 4am which is the best time to see it cause the moonlight is gone.
Then he took me on his boat to the mangrove and the swamp and it was just the most amazing experience I’ve ever had, during our way back to the house I saw the most beautiful sunset I’ve seen in my life…no joke it was like northern lights.
I was looking for peace and beauty and I certainly found it there but I wasn´t looking for luxury or amazing places to stay and I received a great gift.
Before purchasing anything there just make a research with locals.
To get there I took a bus in Puerto, went down in Rio Grande, then took a collective taxi to Zapotalito that left me on the boats terminal. (All that for 65pesos)
Take the collective boat (charges 40) and the boat tours are generally between 100-300pesos to see the luminescence, make sure you go at 4am.
El General (Don Hector) it’s a very nice simple man and he can offer you a choice to stay (don’t ask for prices to the wife she charges a bit more haha).

631657013.name: Exotic and rustic
631657013.author: a TripAdvisor user
631657013.reviewBody: Wow!!! Hour from P Escondido and 20 minute beautiful boat ride...ask for guy named Hamburger.  Bungalo on little islands muy tranquilo.  No a/c or hot water but such a treat

628170944.name: got completely Scammed and didn\'t get to see birds in the mangroves, nor bioluminescence
628170944.author: a TripAdvisor user
628170944.reviewBody:
arrived with two friends in Zapolite by taxi, where a boat driver welcomed and lead us to his boats.
his english speaking colleage told us the prices: 1500 pesos to Chacaua by boat, and 2000 pesos pick up the next day including a tour. we were surprised about the high prices, but he insisted is was the correct price (total 3500 pesos per boat return ticket ncl. 1:20h mangroves tour). we agreed, not knowing how far the boat ride was. it took maybe 35 minutes and we arrived, depleted of money, in chacahua, there the driver of the boat organized us a hotel room, right at the entrance, the room was sparse and very low standard, and they charges us 500 pesos for it. the boat driver was supposed to pick us up at 7am the next day, so we could see the birds in the morning hour before the sun goes up, which is what we read in several travel guides. chacaua itself is fine, i honestly have seen nicer beaches, it's pretty touristy, it was off season though so it was pretty quiet. however, there isn't much to do. i recommend taking the little boat for 10 pesos to the side of the lighthouse and hike up the light house, the view is amazing. i loved seeing the locals fishing in the laguna, which is filled with millions of fish. we took a small boat (100 pesos per person) to see the bioluminescence at night, but didn't get lucky (suppose bc it was raining, or because the moon was pretty bright?) they entire stay at chacaua was sort of boring, as other reviews have pointed out. i was hoping for more nature.
next morning, we were ready to see the birds, and waited, and waited. until at 7:30 our boat showed up. the first ten minuted we saw a lot of birds, but as soon as the sun came out (7:40?) there was no bird left to see. we did a meandering drive through the manginess, which were deprived of birds. earlier you could see them sit so dense i have never seen it before. out boat arrived back at zapolite at 8.20, the ride took 50 minutes and a lot of the stops and areas we were pointed out the day before on a map we supposedly would stop at, we didn't stop at. sadly about our missed chance for bird watching, we told the english speaking boat guy from the day before that we asked to be picked up at 7 for that reason – all of a sudden he didn't speak english anymore. walking out I found a sign on their office listing the prices: 1500 pesos return ticket, 2000 pesos return ticket including a tour, and 2500 pesos return ticket including a 5 hour long tour.
We had payed 3500 pesos return without the promised tour. when pointing out the sign the guy became visibly angry and told us "vale, vale" and waves us to leave. 
this was one of the most hostile scammers i have experienced visiting mexico so far.
we were scammed by 2000 pesos, just for the boat!

btw - the guy from the plate is Jeimmy, the second name form the top of the picture i posted.

there was a taxi already waiting for us, which was asking for 1000 pesos (we had payed 600 pesos the day before for the ride to zapolite). we happily declined, and walked up to the main road, trying to catch a taxi from there – there taxi driver had heard already how we got scammed (apparently there must me nothing much else to talk about in this village), and we found one driver who drove us home for 300 pesos. 

we later found out that the hotel we payed 500 pesos for, officially costs 250 pesos. 

I hope this review will help local agents and business offering services to tourists to understand the importance of making prices fair for everyone, if they want this region to grow and be sustainable touristically in the future. Negative experiences like ours contribute to less tourists coming in the future.

627280339.name: A truly remarkable trip through mangrove islands to paradise
627280339.author: a TripAdvisor user
627280339.reviewBody: Because it was early in the season my husband and I hired the very capable Gina Machorro ( ginainpuerto@yahoo.com ) to come with us as a guide. The ride to El Zapotalito from Puerto Escondido was about 45 mins. by collectivo and then a short taxi ride. We met our boat and guide, Adan Hernandez Arguelles ( tel. 954 161 35 70 ), arranged by Gina and began an hour\'s tour through the mangrove islands, visiting communities along the way and stopping to see the amazing bird life. \nWhen we arrived at the delta we walked to the crocodile reserve for a look and then re-boarded the boat to go to the other side of the Laguna for a delicious lunch served by Alba ( the second restaurant from the Laguna). Alba y Hector as well as Dona Meche also rent cabanas for very little cost.\nThis area is very beautiful and it is a very good thing it is protected in a national park. The beach goes on for miles. Take the time and effort, if you can, to make a day trip or stay overnight. Gina would be happy to assist you with information and accompany you if you wish. Adan is a safe boatman and has good English skills. We highly recommend both!

572241639.name: Excellent tour to spend all day
572241639.author: a TripAdvisor user
572241639.reviewBody: you can spend a wonderful day and see a lot of nature good food and animals, you will experience birds and a lot sea creatures

559463758.name: Beautiful lagoon, poor tour company
559463758.author: a TripAdvisor user
559463758.reviewBody: Booked this tour with the Pascon Agency at our hotel. 7 English speakers on the tour and our guide claimed his english was poor. The bus trip and lagoon boat trip were great for sight seeing but a very long time sitting. A tour of a government sponsored alligator "sanctuary" was extremely depressing to see. Small pens overcrowded with poor reptiles sentenced to years of extreme boredom. We were then taken to a "beach" area, just a strip of sand along the lagoon\'s water outflow, lined with small local restaurants. The menus had no prices and suddenly our guide couldn\'t even help us ask the prices. We felt that were all taken advantage of and over charged (600pesos for each fish dinner). The ocean beach here was a short walk away, small and unswimable.

552940436.name: Best Place on Earth!
552940436.author: a TripAdvisor user
552940436.reviewBody: If you can find a kid in town named Brandon, get him to take you over.  He is the sweetest boat captain you could ever hope to meet.  Took care of our car, came and got us way early in the morning, added a fantastic lagoon tour.  Super Bright, Honest Industrious kid!

546306636.name: Experience ruined by idiot on jet ski
546306636.author: a TripAdvisor user
546306636.reviewBody: Our group of four adults went to Parque Nacional Lagunas de Chacahua with Lalo Ecotours, based in Puerto Escondido.  The tour company provided transportation for ten passengers in a very nice van.  Traveling from Pto. Escondido to the national park took about an hour, a bit longer than I had expected.  The driver drove very fast on the 2-lane road, both going and returning, and there were a few close calls with oncoming vehicles.  The actual tour was very pleasant, In a lancha with ten seats and sun shade, on a beautiful day in December.  We had no idea what to expect.  It was interesting to learn about the mangroves, the wildlife of the region, the depth of the water and the effects of tidal changes.  All of the interpretive information was given in Spanish.  Fortunately I\'m bilingual and was able to interpret for the German- and English-speaking passengers.  Toward the end of our tour, we stopped at a village where the Mexican federal government has a project to re-populate the cocodrilo (crocodile) in various parts of the country.  There were enclosures containing three different species of crocodiles.  We had hoped to see these animals in the wild, so it was a disappointment to see them in captivity.  We were passing through a narrow channel among the dense mangroves when our idyllic experience was ruined by an idiot on a jet ski.  This guy and his girlfriend/wife went flying around our boat on the port side, creating a huge wake and spraying us with water.  One of the women in my group was drenched and her phone/camera was temporarily put out of order.  The tranquil and peaceful ambiance was destroyed by one person.  Another jet ski came along a few minutes later, but that driver was respectful and cautious, barely leaving a wake.  My opinion is that the national park should not allow jet skis on the waters of Lagunas de Chacahua.  They could take an example from the Boundary Waters Canoe Area in northern Minnesota, USA, allowing only un-motorized watercraft except for the licensed and permitted tour guides and the fishermen who make their living harvesting fish, shrimp, and clams from the laguna.  We had a nice lunch at a place on the beach, albeit with VERY slow and inattentive service.  Several of the people in our boat took advantage of the beautiful (and deserted) beach for a swim.
