The boat ride back to the dock was fast and uneventful.  It would be nice if Lalo could provide bilingual guides.  But the best improvement in the entire experience would be to prohibit jet skis from the national park.

471875904.name: Brilliant Day!
471875904.author: a TripAdvisor user
471875904.reviewBody: We took a tour with Gregorio from Pascon Tours at the Posada Real. After an informative, friendly trip to the National Park with little stops along the way to sightsee or buy local snacks, we ventured out into this huge national park of seven vast interlinked lagoons. We traversed two and viewed thousands of birds, enjoyed cool breezes and the deep greens of the mangroves, whose very existence keeps our endangered planet breathing. We even passed a little fishing village deep in the lagoon, where a lonely hydro wire was one of the few links to "civilization.\nEnjoyed seeing fishers working in the lagoon and on the canals in their tiny little boats. It was like seeing a living world somewhat frozen in time. We stopped at a series of little palapa restaurants near the ocean to enjoy a walk, swim, some beers and fresh snapper grilled over wood-as fresh as can be imagined. Even saw a young man dig out shellfish from the little bay and deliver them to diners on the beach! This was a brilliant, educational, relaxing day in a world so very different from our daily lives. Gregorio felt it was necessary simply to recharge and reconnect with our natural world. Could not agree more! Long may we preserve treasures like this!

470312771.name: Not the piece of paradise I was hoping for
470312771.author: a TripAdvisor user
470312771.reviewBody:
Before you read my review I must point out that I'm definitely not one of those people who is hard to please (we've seen those reviews stand out a mile from the others), and neither am I someone who can't cope without all the comforts of a comparatively luxurious first world life back home. I am fine with hostels and shared facilities, and this is not my first experience of travelling on a budget in a developing country.
That being said, I came to Chacahua for the promise of nature, beauty and tranquility, and a fellow traveller recommended this place as a special highlight of her trip, so I was pretty sold on the idea and decided it was worth the extra hassle created by the journey to get here. Now, I want to be really honest and objective for anyone like me, who us looking for a piece of heaven, off the beaten track.
Personally, this place has not lived up to my expectations, and while I wouldn't discourage anyone from coming here I can't honestly rave about it either.
It's a small village set in between a pretty lagoon and a great beach, and while it does have a certain underdeveloped charm about it you should also be prepared for the accompanying features - such as woefully poor standard of accommodation, seriously limited or non existent communications (which is great for anyone who enjoys that level of isolation), and a fairly basic selection of food options. If you enjoy simple fresh fish or seafood then you will be satisfied, but be warned that you will have to contend with very persistent flies and the scourge of mosquitoes. There is no shortage of dog turds to avoid as you walk along the beach (I kept my flip flops on), and the peace and tranquility is regularly broken by motorboats (lanchas) whizzing up and down the lagoon, locals playing music loud enough for the benefit of all the immediate neighbours, and bursts of what can only be described as obnoxiously loud but thankfully short broadcasts on mounted speakers, presumably advertising current offerings of food or activities. My Spanish is not good enough to fully understand the content but having travelled extensively throughout SE Asia these outbursts brought to mind the frequent Islamic calls to prayer that everyone is made to endure in Muslim dominated areas.
People are certainly friendly and, besides surfing, there is precious little to do besides take a boat trip among the mangrove tunnels, which is pleasant but not what I would consider unmissable. The water bioluminescence that can be seen at night is certainly magical but I was not enchanted enough to stay any longer than the 2 nights I originally planned.

455775057.name: Paradise!!!
455775057.author: a TripAdvisor user
455775057.reviewBody:
Where do I begin????

To get there, you must ride a small boat that takes you allong a mangrove maze..... 

Endless bay beach, with blue water.... to my left...
To my right, a wonderfull shallow lagoon.
The most welcoming and lovely people, willing to help, show, brag or patiently listen to your endless chat.
The place has basic services. Do not expect high end hotels, in fact, you must bring your soap, shampoo, toillet paper and towels to your " cabin"
Cement floors, two beds, and the most simple bathroom/ shower you can see.
No internet... Except in a few meters in the island....
You can only enjoy nature!!
Filled with all type of birds, surrounded by turtles, whales, and fish....

In the different palm roof restaurants with hammocks, you eat fresh fish ( huge fresh fish dishes) all the time. Simple recepies, with such wonderfull flavours..... With laughable prices!
Azucena's cebiche, in the "Pulpo Enamorado" restaurant was one of the best I have ever eaten.  

Joyfull children, lovelly and smiling men and women live in a very colourfull little town. If you like photography, that is the place to go....

Turtles spawn in Chacahua beaches...men, women and children look after their eggs.  I had the absolute pleasure to help just hatched baby turtles get close to the roaring sea to begin their life journey

By night, the star filled sky on top of you....while you row in a luminicent lagoon..... Incredible, simply magical!!!

393384097.name: Magical Chacahua
393384097.author: a TripAdvisor user
393384097.reviewBody:
Wow. What a place. We planned
to visit for a day and ended up staying for 3. We completely fell in love. I don't usually leave many reviews (and I want to keep this place to myself) but Chacahua really is one of those special places.
We stayed at a lovely cabana on the lagoon (ask for Ray). Cheap and basic but the view was to die for and you can jump straight off the pier into the lagoon.
We ate at a few places but our favourite was Manuel & Connies place on the beach (las hamacas) about 3 or 4 along from the road. They are truly lovely people and Connie is an amazing cook. Manuel took us on a great tour of the lagoon as well. Go there and see them, they are so nice :) 
You really have to be there to understand chacahua and what it's about. It's not for everyone - if you don't know how to relax or chill and need constant entertainment then this isn't the place for you. But for anyone else, it's magical and will stay with you for a long time. Enjoy :)

383133789.name: Coconut and chile sauce
383133789.author: a TripAdvisor user
383133789.reviewBody: A perfect break from town wildlife, beach food and cold beer and a a visit to a real lagoon town. A place just to chill chill and chill

361891252.name: Really good to avoid te crowd during semana santa
361891252.author: a TripAdvisor user
361891252.reviewBody: It\'s a bit difficult to get there: plan 01H30 from Puerto Escondido but it definitely worth the trip. After a lovely boat ride you will get to a wonderful beach with only a few people. Moreover if you want to do surf there is a fine right you can enjoy with only locals in the water.

361484997.name: The real Oaxaca
361484997.author: a TripAdvisor user
361484997.reviewBody: This is an all-day tour and lets you see a little bit of everything about Oaxaca. You drive along the old highway to Acapulco, and see the agriculture industry of the region: coconut palms, papaya, mango, and cattle. You experience real villages and the authentic way of life of the people, including a remote island where solar panels provide the electricity (if they can do it, why can\'t we??) and a village with African descendants. The best part was lolling in the estuary waters and gazing out to sea while waiting for a lunch of freshly caught fish to be prepared for us.

349524373.name: Really lovely and low key place
349524373.author: a TripAdvisor user
349524373.reviewBody:
We enjoyed our 2 nights stay here. We stayed at Restaurant 7 Mares. 

The accomodation is very basic but cheap. The whole affair is pretty low key (with it's good sides and bad sides). 

Transport to get there can be a bit tedious. You have to get to Zapolito, and then take a boat. The locals will encourage you to take a boat all the way to Chacahua as they can charge you 500 pesos per person ... But if you are keen on a cheaper option, insist on taking the "terreste" option which means taking a short boat trip (30 pesos pp) and then a collectivo (30 pesos pp). Despite what they might say, the "terreste" option will be available most of the time. 

In any case, it is a great beach to chill out on for a few days.

342625678.name: Isolated, chill, cheap, really nice, untouched nature
342625678.author: a TripAdvisor user
342625678.reviewBody: Spent a very good time on the beach here. This is not a tourist destination, so don\'t expect fancy accommodation, clean toilets and other facilities. There is no phone signal or WIFI whatsoever. It\'s a very isolated place, called Chacahua, you can reach from Pto Escondido with 2 colectivos and a $25 boat over the big lagoon, or your own car and a $10 boat over the small lagoon (bear in mind the last piece of road is 30km of dirt road in fair condition but dusty and you need to leave your car/moto far away from the village). \n\nThe place is an island of tranquility, quite pricey in food (so bring your own), only a small store with little variety of stock, and not many things to do but relax. Surfing is an option (you can rent a board) or taking a boat to see wild crocs, or the mangrove forest full of critters and birds, or the bioluminiscent shoreline. Great place to disconnect from the world for a few days.

339196447.name: There are pros and cons
339196447.author: a TripAdvisor user
339196447.reviewBody:
I gave Chacahua a rating of 3, which was an average of low rating for lodging and basic sanitation and a high for natural beauty and seclusion.  Also, I'm going to focus on lodging and meals, which aren't well covered in other TA reviews.    But first, don't hesitate to take public transportation.  This is from someone who doesn't speak Spanish and is a first time visitor.  You'll just have to research your starting point well.  Try a visit to the bus station the day prior to get your bearings and ask questions.  Now on to lodging.

If you don't have any, don't tell the colectivo driver or he'll drop you off at a house to look at his or a friend's room then you'll have to drag your stuff to the beach/lagoon area.  Someone clearly slept in the room offered to us.  There were clothes strewn all over, sheets awry, etc but they could clean up in five minutes.  Sure.  

Wait to get off until the very last stop where there is a dirt cul-de-sac and a parallel tables (for local Saturday night games) set up in the middle.  The lagoon should be on your right and the ocean ahead.

If you're backpacking, you will be able to set up UNDER a restaurant dining flap for free.  You will be expected to buy meals and drinks there.  I don't know what your shower and toilet arrangements will be but suggest you look before committing.  It will be hot with little breeze but your stuff will be safe.  

We stayed in a private room.  There are two that you might be interested in.  The first is at the Restaurant de 7 mares which is at the western most end of the beach, facing the beach and not the lagoon.  If you got off at the end of the line, walk straight to the beach and the restaurant will be on your left and the rooms on the right.  We saw several older people (like us) staying there and caught a glimpse into one of the rooms, which was rudimentary but probably adequate.  I suggest this venue because the restaurant is very well kept up and has good food.  Table clothes, flowers on the table, napkins provided without asking, a hand washing area at the restaurant with soap and even a towel, and clean bathrooms that are locked and only for use of people patronizing the place.   Perhaps the rooms are treated with similar pride.

The other is at Restaurant Chacahua.  Turn left at Restaurant de 7 Mares and walk perhaps 10 or 15 restaurants which will be on your left.  Look for a three story building.  The other buildings are two story so you shouldn't have a problem finding it.  Cast your eyes up and you'll see the third story room facing the ocean.  This is where we stayed.  The best I can say about it is the view and breeze but the rest is probably typical.  The sheets and pillowcases looked used, use water sparingly or you'll run out, and the toilet and shower weren't clean.  We had to ask 3 times for a top sheet (which we used as a bottom sheet), soap, towels, and toilet paper and pretty much stood there the last time until we got them.  And the bathroom, well just try not to focus your eyes anywhere.  The view and breeze provided the trade off however.   And like I said, it may have been one of the better rooms in the village for all I know.  Price was $7.50 U.S. per person.  Bed was hard but what the heck.  Food was good there but after I saw the proprietor stick her finger in her mouth twice to rub a gum or toothache, we ate elsewhere.  

Chacahua is no longer the ideal it probably once was.  There are now over 3000 people living there.  There is a lot of clear cutting along the entry road.  The lagoon is over-fished and shrimp haven't been there for about 2 years.  May I suggest that you pass on ordering them?  There is a lot of trash outside of the tourist area and people are poor but don't hassle you selling stuff.  The positives are the beautiful beach, good swimming and surf, the lagoon, luminescent algae, and the peace and quiet.  You truly just lose yourself there.  

For amenities, bring a travel pillow or stuff sack to use as one, hand and face towel, a flashlight (yes, we too lost power), and small bills.  No 500 peso notes.  Change is an issue.  Also bring a positive attitude and a willingness to overlook a trickle for a shower, dirty toilets, and a sink that looks like it may fall off the wall.  To many people here, these would be wonderful to have.  Ask to see several rooms and be prepared to walk if you don't like what you see.  Oh, you might want to avoid mentioning that you're from the States or your tour will go up 100 pesos.  

I apologize for the length but felt prior reviews passed on the many items we had questions on or were alerted to once there.

317482421.name: Amazing Chacahua <3
317482421.author: a TripAdvisor user
317482421.reviewBody: Great place to get away from absolutely everything. Nice people on the restaurants, I loved the tour on the manglares, the sky at night, the beach, the view from the lighthouse... everything. <3 \nAlso, I\'ve heard it\'s great for surfing.

302151859.name: Absolutely amazing unspoiled place to visit
302151859.author: a TripAdvisor user
302151859.reviewBody:
This really is an amazing place to visit. 

With no telephone or internet reception and just the few cabanas and simple restaurants scattered along the beach, this really makes for the perfect get away. We were here for 3 nights and had the most relaxing and peaceful escape. 

The local people here are extremely friendly, it's cheap, and has great surf too.

We swam in the lagoons with the luminescent plankton, went with a local guide through the mangroves and relaxed on the beach.

The croc sanctuary was not very appealing, as there are loads of crocs in tiny little pens where they spend many years so we left after 5 minutes as don't support that.

All in all an amazing few days and would go back in a heartbeat.

293328964.name: A M A Z I N G
293328964.author: a TripAdvisor user
293328964.reviewBody:
It is a beautiful place!!!

I stayed in cabaña "siete mares" , the man working there is such a nice person! The food is delicious!

Later, I ate in "zahmar" (I believe that was the name) the boys took us to see the fluorescense in the middle of the night, that was just an exceptional experience! the sky full of stars, I was mesmerized by the colors in the lagoon.

This place is a MUST GO !

284222837.name: Beautiful lagoons
284222837.author: a TripAdvisor user
284222837.reviewBody: These lagoons are beautiful is worth the trip the only down side is that is run by a cooperative so all the boats have the same price there is no competition then the take you to a small restaurant on the beach that they get a comision you can skipped these part is not wort the time

223656051.name: Croc Zoo
223656051.author: a TripAdvisor user
223656051.reviewBody: It\'s nice but really far off the beaten path. If you have a couple days to spend out there it would be worth going. Beautiful beach and hardly any tourists around. Be careful. Check out the crocodile zoo...free but give a generous tip!

192295808.name: amazingly beautiful
192295808.author: a TripAdvisor user
192295808.reviewBody: We went there and the combination of the lagune, the river and the sea is amazing. you can really chill there and there wont be many people. the trip to go there is already amazing. we stayed the first nights in the "center" and once during the day we walked along the beach like 2 hours (slowly) till we came to a place with lot of palm trees and a house. There lives a family in the middle of nowhere which is happy to let u camp there and is doing a fire with you on the beach, they gave us some coconuts and in the morning they did breakfast for us. they dont ask for money but of course we left like 200 pesos there (thats all we had left we were 4 people). really nice people and a beautiful experience for us.

153977260.name: Far far away
153977260.author: a TripAdvisor user
153977260.reviewBody: It\'s my paradise spot near Puerto. I return every time to "escape": for a few days...accomodation very cheap, food very delicious, place very magical!

144840353.name: not worth to go
144840353.author: a TripAdvisor user
144840353.reviewBody: To far, surf is not extraordinary, only dirty accomdations, too many moskitos (denguee problems), unsafe. I would not recomend it.

129151707.name: amazing National Park near Pto Escondido
129151707.author: a TripAdvisor user
129151707.reviewBody:
my first time in Chacagua was in '92 when the bar was close now is open so the lagoon goes into the bay.
i crashed again with el General (Hector) all have funny nick names in town...you can do some volunteer work with el General and stay for free,..you will learn how they live very simple & happy.
grab a coconut from the palm tree,cut it,drink it and then use it to make fire and cook your own fresh fish...but first learn how to clean it (they dont have fancy stoves)
take a night tour boat with him...dont leave your nice boardshorts drying on the line all nite long.
super good waves for surfing!

122163273.name: Good people, 100% natural
122163273.author: a TripAdvisor user
122163273.reviewBody: You have to camp next to the beach,  Facilities and ambiance is really rustic if you do not have trouble with that you[ll be fine.  People is honest, kind and compromised with your stay.  Tichinda tamales are the best (river clamshell) only 5 pesos, unbelievable.  Lot of youth.  Probably we were the oldest.  Night is for young people, but during the day you\'ll discover the great nature of mangroves, during night we went with fisherman\'s to catch some shrimps.

113441417.name: Fantastic.
113441417.author: a TripAdvisor user
113441417.reviewBody: Myself and a few guys from P.E. went for a day and nite there to see something different and we have heard about the beauty of the area. If your leaving for the day leave early because it takes a couple of different steps to get there if your going by public transportation and not driving on your own. Had a good time once we got there, did a little fishing, ate some good food, swam, beach walked.Seen some crocs. went for a couple of boat rides. Lots of stuff to do, or just laze the day.A little word of advice. Be prepared for an onslaught of mosquitoes when it gets dark. More than any where else I have been in Mexico. Fast and then they mellow out later on. Bring plenty of mosquitoe repellent. But you should have a great adventure, try it.

66762059.name: Unspoiled beauty!
66762059.author: a TripAdvisor user
66762059.reviewBody:
My husband and another 2 couples spent a wonderful week-end in Chacahua at the end of May 2010. 

To get there we hired a van from the airport ($600 pesos) to Zapotalito and got a private boat ($600 pesos) to Chacahua from there. The boat tour took approximately 1h through beautiful sites of mangroves and birds and our guide told us wonderful local legends and stories.

Once in Chacahua you have the choice of renting rustic cabins or camp. We camped and stayed with a very nice lady named Cira on the ocean side of town. We pitched our tents under a thatched roof and used Cira's hammocks and rudimentary bathrooms. She didn't charge us since we were having her cook for us. We ate wonderful fish filets and shrimp prepared al mojo de ajo (garlic sauce) or a la diabla (spicy) and had delicious sopes, entomatadas (like enchiladas but with a tomato sauce) and enfrijoladas (in a bean sauce). She had a fridge and kept cold beers, sodas and water in there. There are a couple of stores in town that sell essentials and food.

Our days were spent swimming in the ocean and river, napping and reading in the hammocks, walking on the beach and around the village, eating great food and having good conversations.

Chacahua is a wonderful paradise, a perfect place to rest and be away from it all!

Note: the only downside to our stay was the heat and mosquitos. Make sure you bring lots of bug spray and keep your tent as aerated as possible at night...

22642177.name: lost little civilizations
22642177.author: a TripAdvisor user
22642177.reviewBody: beautiful tiny place with few inhabitants... surf was not great in December, but a great place to get away from EVERYTHING\n\nLeave yourself plenty of time to get there, don\'t drive the backroads - military hang out on the (very) bumpy dirt samblance of a road.  Take the boat in if you can help it, its cheap, safer and an awesome sightseeing opportunity through the mangroves. Beware of the seassnakes too!

5204451.name: nice beach
5204451.author: a TripAdvisor user
5204451.reviewBody: chacaqua, what a great place. Pretty beaches great surfing good food. the birds love why should\'nt you?\n

2879050.name: Loved the unspoiled Beauty
2879050.author: a TripAdvisor user
2879050.reviewBody:
So many of the beautiful bays have been developed by major chains or even small developers.
I was so pleased to see the Chacagua Bay to be more or less undeveloped. 
I was able to see "Fisher Eagles" Ospreys, and endangered Wood Storks at a velocity that was too hot for the birdwatchers, but amazing anyway.  And then to laze on a beach hammock after having eaten a shrimp coctail that was more of a sundae than a coctail.  Then just to lie back in the water and let it lull you to oblivion.  If you're a bird watcher, go with an appropriate trip, otherwise the thrillseekers will make you speeed through these beautiful habitats.

827883.name: Excentric Place
827883.author: a TripAdvisor user
827883.reviewBody:
Its a nice place to stay, there's a good looking around, and also the place is unhabited (just the people of the place) , so thats the cool thing, that if you enjoy places where the only thing that you want its to stay calmed, relaxed, and thinking or reading or everything that could be done in silence and tranquility, is well done there.
Also the view is amazing.
The only thing that might be a problem is the way to get there, because if you dont speak spanish and no well informated about getting there, Truly you will get lost.
Im not trying to scare you but, even for me (mexican guy) was hard.
Well, hope you met this place.

671700998.name: A glorious, laidback, no-frills beach
671700998.author: a TripAdvisor user
671700998.reviewBody: This is a wonderfully beach, and a little quieter than some of the others nearby. It has a slight rundown charm, thanks to the remains of what looks like a water park and beach bar towards the back \u2013 but the sand is clean and the water is fantastic (great for waves like all of Puerto).\nThere is little natural shade, so it\'s best to bring a parasol if you have one, otherwise you can grab a bit of space under the trees with other beachgoers.\nA great spot along what is really a world-class coast line.

651105127.name: Great Locals Beach
651105127.author: a TripAdvisor user
651105127.reviewBody: This is also known as Hidden Beach, you have to walk down a hill to get here so those with mobility issues this might not be a great place to visit. The water is super blue and the sand is really white, very beautiful spot. It\'s more of a locals beach so not as many people come here, never crowded which is nice. We did some snorkeling here and saw lots of fish!

643878565.name: Cool visit
643878565.author: a TripAdvisor user
643878565.reviewBody: Cool place to visit, some very rocky areas where it is advised you shouldnt swim. Isolated from other areas which is ideal

635850032.name: Lovely little beach
635850032.author: a TripAdvisor user
635850032.reviewBody: This is a great little beach to visit but a tad difficult to get to down a windey sandy cliff path.  No bathrooms available nor restaurants but great for simple enjoyment of the beach, waves and water.

607995521.name: Beach
607995521.author: a TripAdvisor user
607995521.reviewBody: It\'s normal beach. I don\'t liked very much cause the sand it\'s dark and hard. It\'s not than blue... It\'s better Cancun.

570631407.name: Picture Perfect beach-but beware topless sun bathers
570631407.author: a TripAdvisor user
570631407.reviewBody: We loved this beach once we discovered it. It\'s more difficult to get to, thus the reason it isnt crowded at all. To access you walk down a steep hill, no stairs, but a dusty trail. You can also access from the Bacocho side. The surf can be big, but not so much that you can\'t get into the water. It\'s a protected cove, but not as much as Carizalillo. The only problem we had, as we have children with us, is that there was a bit of a younger crowd and there was some topless bathing. Not sure if the beach is known for that or if it was just a random thing. But, heads up if that\'s a concern for you. Also, there are no amentities except for a run down waterpark. The waterpark features are falling apart, but you can pay to use the pool or the bathroom. There are no pool chairs or anything like that though.

566700095.name: The only place to be!
566700095.author: a TripAdvisor user
566700095.reviewBody: This ended up being our beach of choice - went there approximately 12 times.  Beach is only about 200 yards in length but seems bigger.  A crowded day there had about 15 people.  It is the place to be if you piece and quiet.  Never saw anyone surf there, just the odd fisherman.  Water was calm enough to swim without any major waves knocking you over.  Great place to watch the sun set!

562029328.name: steep beach
562029328.author: a TripAdvisor user
562029328.reviewBody: the trail in is pretty steep as is the beach. you have to be a decent swimmer to go in the water because you will be in over your head rather quickly,.strong backwash.the beach is pretty nice and not too crowded. good place to watch the sunset.

558671525.name: Secluded beach!
558671525.author: a TripAdvisor user
558671525.reviewBody: I would recommend going to Playa Coral after 4:00 as there is not a lot of shaded areas. \nThis beach is great for swimming and is not overcrowded.

555061930.name: Private beach
555061930.author: a TripAdvisor user
555061930.reviewBody: Peaceful beach that is a small hike to get to. Be aware of the waves. They can get very strong and overwhelming. Not suitable swimming for children.

554820823.name: Little beauty!
554820823.author: a TripAdvisor user
554820823.reviewBody: Very nice spot, beautiful water, and refreshing on a very warm day. Easy to get to, food and drink just a walk away

546858866.name: Quiet beach that\'s a little harder to find
546858866.author: a TripAdvisor user
546858866.reviewBody: Great little beach with a short hike down  The hike is easy for those in shape but moderate for those less so.  Swimmable beach but with bigger waves/ breaks than Playa Carrizalillo the few times we visited.  No services but that\'s what makes it quiet and thus attractive. Take lots of water, snacks and sunscreen so you can stay awhile.

542613197.name: beautiful
542613197.author: a TripAdvisor user
542613197.reviewBody: A small beach tucked in the rocks with great photo oportunities.\nThis is quiet except for the sound of the surf.

517669055.name: Robinson Cruzo\u00e9
517669055.author: a TripAdvisor user
517669055.reviewBody: Playa coral is a hidden paradise, very few people come here because there are almost no restaurants or services. But you can come loaded with water and snacks to snuggle away with your partner. These days there is an old hotel which has a little swimming pool and can prepare you a combo that comes with a burger and a drink beer or soda, you can also choose to only consume drinks. \nThe waves are gentle but there are some rocks at the beginning as you enter into the sea, watch out and be careful. After that you can swim and snorkel. If you want some adventure you can climb the rocks and get to playa Bacocho where there is another restaurant. \nReally loved it here!

486286887.name: A small hidden beach
486286887.author: a TripAdvisor user
486286887.reviewBody: Not easy to find the way to reach it but this beach is very nice.. alost no one in may ... and some natural shadow \n\nGreat place

462125256.name: Best Kept Secret\ud83e\udd14
462125256.author: a TripAdvisor user
462125256.reviewBody: Nothing here but an awesome little fairly private beach. Great swimming. Take water, snacks, hats or umbrella\ud83c\udf1eHead over the rocks to the right & there are 2 beach clubs/ restaurants. Can shower \ud83d\udebfby the pool & taxi home from there.\u2714

453192612.name: Remote, quiet and all-around paradisiac
453192612.author: a TripAdvisor user
453192612.reviewBody: Just went there this morning to find a few pelicans quietly sitting on the water right next to the surf. Blue/light green water, white-ish sand, barely anyone there.... So amazing, I was swimming and the pelicans were literally about 10-15 ft away from me diving for their fish. Wonderful place.

443909550.name: Snorkeling is mediocre
443909550.author: a TripAdvisor user
443909550.reviewBody: Best fish viewing is on the rocky east side of this small beach accessible by a dirt path descending from Blvd Benito Juarez next to a washed out drainage canyon. A moderate variety of fish and only a small amount of coral.

411977405.name: Very quiet, private beach with great snorkelling and safe swimming.
411977405.author: a TripAdvisor user
411977405.reviewBody: This is a fantastic beach if you want to get away from the crowds. It is just to the left of Playa Baccocho and you can taxi to Baccocho and walk back around the rocks to the left. Or cut through the hotel Viva Mexicana if you want to sit by their pool.... or not! I walk there most days from the Carrazalillo area. Some shade by the beach but not much. Hat & water is never a bad idea. :-D

366549105.name: Pirates Cove Treasures
366549105.author: a TripAdvisor user
366549105.reviewBody:
We were a party of four that booked a four hour ATV tour with Issys tours.  Luis was our guide and he took us to several beaches including playa coral and pirates cove.  While the beach was beautiful and empty, the day was stunning.

Just off the beach, within swimming distance, is a small island with a cave.  There are stairs leading to the cave. On the top of the island is a flag pole with a pirates flag.

The waters are crystal clear for snorkeling or diving.  The is a great spot to spend the afternoon.

343796862.name: Watch the local spear fishermen
343796862.author: a TripAdvisor user
343796862.reviewBody: Scenic little beach with coral reefs for snorkeling. Water gets deep very close to shore. Not for novice swimmer

343699631.name: Private Cove Beach
343699631.author: a TripAdvisor user
343699631.reviewBody: This little cove at the east end of Bacocho Beach, often has calmer waters that allow for safer swimming & snorkeling, but the abandoned hotel and water park is quite an eyesore.

240618287.name: Worth the walk
240618287.author: a TripAdvisor user
240618287.reviewBody: Not too easy to find or get to, but it is very beautiful and usually very quiet. Check out Google maps to see where it is-eastern end of Playa Bacocho. There is a path down from the road above it just where it says \'no pasar\' or you can walk down the road to Playa Bacocho and walk back across the rocks. Just a walk, no climbing. Depending on the surf, good snorkelling up against the rocks. Shade in the morning. Early morning is best for peace and shade.

189160860.name: Beautiful and un crowded.
189160860.author: a TripAdvisor user
189160860.reviewBody: After seeing the crowds at Zicatela and Principal beaches, we fully appreciate how lovely and quiet Playa Coral is. The Beach Clubs (two) seem to be the only business on this beach. As for swimming, it is not ideal for children or elderly, as the surf is quite powerful and can knock you around a lot. Having said that, we did swim here every day and survived, but people should be careful.

176179221.name: beautiful hidden beach
176179221.author: a TripAdvisor user
176179221.reviewBody:
Just following a little pad down hill at Bacocho area is Playa Coral where you can swim and snorkel without strong currents or just walking to the end and back.
You'll find huge rocks on the right side and climb them up or take a bath in one natural swimming pool full of little fishes.
On the back is located one hotel with slide both not in good condition.
Very quiet and peaceful beach.

677236263.name: Turtles release
677236263.author: a TripAdvisor user
677236263.reviewBody: We went to Playa Bacocho for the turtle release which was an amazing experience. It is best (and the cheapest) to take a taxi there yourself and just pay the 100 Pesos as a donation for the rescue center. The beach is beautiful and very clean and the releasing of the turtles was a beautiful and informative experience!

676683819.name: Turtle Release
676683819.author: a TripAdvisor user
676683819.reviewBody: 5pm everyday offered by Vive Mar - educational and fulfilling experience\n\nAbout an hour and half total time

672285643.name: clean
672285643.author: a TripAdvisor user
672285643.reviewBody: An excellent beach to relax and enjoy an incredible view of the beautiful sunset sea and can also release small turtles. FUN FUN FUN

669513118.name: Baby Turtle Release
669513118.author: a TripAdvisor user
669513118.reviewBody: On April 25, 2019, I went to Playa Bacocho to participate in the Baby Turtle Release.  Upon arrival, I found the area to "adopt" a Baby Turtle.  The cost was 120 Pesos which is about $5.30 U.S..  I named my Baby Turtle \'Sundancer\'.  The turtle was given to me in a Shell and I was to go to the release area and when I felt it time, to let \'Sundancer\' make his trek to the Ocean.  What a fun and wonderful experience.  Upon completion, I put some pesos in the donation jar they had set out.  Would I do it again....No Doubt!

667904314.name: Best Beach in Puerto to get away from it all
667904314.author: a TripAdvisor user
667904314.reviewBody: This beach is on the Northwest coast of Puerto Escondico.\nwhen you get tp the beack you be at South East end.  I suggest to start walking Northwest toward the Colorado Cliffs at the far end of the bech.  It is called Caolrado Point   As you walk toward the point you will leave the beach goers behind.  You will have the whole beach to your self.  No rip tides.  You will think you are on your own private beaah. fun func

663322201.name: Very lovely beach
663322201.author: a TripAdvisor user
663322201.reviewBody: The thing about Puerto Escondido is that it is a top location for surfers and if you don\'t surf, could have a difficult time getting in the water without getting swept out into the waves

660299654.name: Visited the Beach
660299654.author: a TripAdvisor user
660299654.reviewBody: I visited this beach, however it wasn\'t for swimming, it was just to check it out.  I think that they way they help the turtles there is pretty amazing.  Then a few days later, I visited and spent the day at Coco Beach Club, and I thought that was amazing, and from there you have access to Playa Bacocho, and at that point of the beach I could go in swimming where the current was reasonable, and the water was super nice!

654358851.name: Quiet Beach
654358851.author: a TripAdvisor user
654358851.reviewBody: Beautiful nice beach to take a nice stroll on.  There are 2 private clubs you can access for fee and use the chairs, tables and pool.  We went to Club Villasol and really enjoyed it.  The $200 peso per person go towards your food or drinks.

652426794.name: Stunning beach!
652426794.author: a TripAdvisor user
652426794.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach although not great for swimming. In some parts of it you can definitely play in the surf, with caution. No amenities unless you pay to access two Clubs that are on the beach - VillaSol or Club Cocas. VillaSol is clean with pools, tennis courts, ping pong, restaurant and bar and outdoor shower to clean off the salt/sand from the beach. Cocos was ok. Pool not that clean, food ok, receptionist seemed bored and did not say a word to us. Drinks - mediocre. But the palapas on the beach were great and the wait staff we had was super. Loved the sunset at night and the beautiful scenery of the beach!

650915505.name: Beach restaurant
650915505.author: a TripAdvisor user
650915505.reviewBody: Went for supper before the movie on the beach ....food was good. The staff speak very little English so we had to think a bit lol.

644813598.name: Great Beach; Strong Waves
644813598.author: a TripAdvisor user
644813598.reviewBody: Bacocho is a great beach and has nice beach clubs nearby. However, if you want to swim be aware that the waves can be quite strong.

643858059.name: One of the nicer beaches
643858059.author: a TripAdvisor user
643858059.reviewBody: One of the nicer beaches in PE, there is a real disprecancy between the beaches as some are super crowded (feels like India) and others are slightly harder to get to but way nicer. This one is one of the nicer one with great photo opps

641706382.name: Almost desert spot in an upperclass neighborhood
641706382.author: a TripAdvisor user
641706382.reviewBody:
You feel this place almost belongs to you!
We went at Xmas and literally almost alone on the beach.

A great spot to take long walks and sip a.drink under your umbrella.

But the beach was red flagged upon our visit. Don't know if it's always the case but this was one the heaviest under current I had experienced ever

636351980.name: A great outing with Manglar Bird Watching
636351980.author: a TripAdvisor user
636351980.reviewBody:
Uplifting turtle release with Manglar Bird Watch

636330761

We were picked up from our hotel, and returned, in a comfortable van. It took about 30 minutes to drive to the beach (the road down to the beach if very rough). There were about 10 of us in the tour, and it cost 250 pesos each, not including VTA. Overall, it was about a 3 hour tour. When we arrived there, we had some time to enjoy the beach, and then the guide arrived on a quad. (He must live nearby.) He went into the enclosure where they keep the turtle eggs and brought out a pan containing maybe 50 freshly hatched eggs. What darlings! He gave us a talk, in Spanish, of which I caught only snippets. Then we walked down closer to the water, about 30 feet away, and he made a trench in the sand, like the mother turtle would have done. Then he gave each of us half a coconut shell, and placed two babies inside. We then set them on the sand, and watched them head to the sea, some more quickly than others. Some of them needed help, like scooping them up in the shell and taking them closer. Others raced (well, as much as a baby turtle can race!) for the ocean. Once a wave caught them they were good to go. We hung around for about 15 more minutes, waiting to see if any of them were washed ashore. A great night!

635427635.name: Gorgeous Beach
635427635.author: a TripAdvisor user
635427635.reviewBody: Pack sun screen, water, snacks and your beach towel. This is a gorgeous beach however, at this time there are no amenities available.

631059382.name: Help the turtles and send them home
631059382.author: a TripAdvisor user
631059382.reviewBody: Get down there for 5 o\'clock every day and help rescue the turtles. 100 pesos donation and you can send a turtle back in to the sea to live their lives. Well worth doing. Lovely sunset whilst doing so too.

620099821.name: Setting the baby turtles free!
620099821.author: a TripAdvisor user
620099821.reviewBody: Angela, my wife, is passionate in her love of turtles and this was an opportunity we couldn\'t pass up. There was an informative talk and a q&a session and then it was time to release the turtles! For the modest sum of 100 pesos/person we received a bowl carved from a coconut containing a 1hr old turtle and were instructed on how, where, and when to release it. I would recommend this experience to anyone who is interested  in environmental issues and wildlife preservation. One cannot have this experience without cheering the little guys on their way to an uncertain but perhaps wonderful future.

610922726.name: White Sand Warm Water
610922726.author: a TripAdvisor user
610922726.reviewBody: One of the mot beautiful beaches in Puerto, soft sand and very walkable.  I was a guest at the Beach Club where you buy a seasonal pass and a beverage which is pretty common, settle under a palapa with a good book and beverage or take a very long walk along the beach

596566601.name: Beautiful at Sunset
596566601.author: a TripAdvisor user
596566601.reviewBody: Very clean, and away from the crowds. Just a 35-peso (one-way) cab ride from Chedraui, in the direction of the airport.  Arrive at 5:00 p.m. for the sea turtle release- noble conservation work of locals that is as cool as \u2018merica under Trump, only way, way better. The sun sets right down the beach. Really, really nice. Enjoy it!

594697922.name: A very clean mostly virgin beach
594697922.author: a TripAdvisor user
594697922.reviewBody: This large beach is a very nice place to visit. The sea is a little wild, but you can swim if you are good swimmer. There are only two beach clubs and no other place to hide from the sun around, so you must pay the entrance fee of the club to be able to have a shade. The view is very nice and the sea very clean.

588649721.name: Beautiful beach with rocks
588649721.author: a TripAdvisor user
588649721.reviewBody: Watch the waves swirl around the rocks and observe the pelicans and other sea birds often found fishing near the shore. But keep an eye on the tide and remember there are no lifeguards on this beach. Not suitable for children and swim at your own risk. But a fantastic place for photographs and there\'s two private beach clubs with great amenities right there. Also baby turtle releases in season.

588586471.name: Quiet, Perfect place for a day at the beach
588586471.author: a TripAdvisor user
588586471.reviewBody: Playa Carrizalillo was small and self-enclosed with several small, local restaurants, and was great for swimming. Playa Zicatela was great for nightlife and restaurants. But Playa Bacocho was probably my favorite. It is not commercialized, except for one resort that you can buy beer, water and food from. We only saw a handful of other people throughout the day, so we pretty much had the beach to ourselves. Towards the end of the afternoon, we participated in the Baby Sea Turtle release. We were also lucky that some locals came by to play volleyball, and let us join. I think they go every Thursday. Watch out for the big waves though! You will need to swim out a bit past the break to avoid potential injury.

583679600.name: Astonishing
583679600.author: a TripAdvisor user
583679600.reviewBody: Best beach in Puerto Escondido, whine sand and not very crowded. Some local people was there but not with many tourist.

578905088.name: Amazing Experience with the Turtles!
578905088.author: a TripAdvisor user
578905088.reviewBody: We went to this beach to experience the turtle release which is done at 5pm daily. For 100 pesos you can learn about the way they rescue the eggs and then release them when ready to live in the ocean.  It is so amazing and have your kids experience this process.  Take lots of pics!!

576664618.name: Peaceful and lovely place
576664618.author: a TripAdvisor user
576664618.reviewBody: Excellent place to visit. Turtle release every day at 5 pm. Nice beach to walk and see the sunset, peaceful place.

570860880.name: Release the turtles!
570860880.author: a TripAdvisor user
570860880.reviewBody: A great little beach that is really quiet and hasn\'t been hit by the tourist restaurants like Zicatela. Amazing sunsets.\nAt 5pm every day you can help release baby turtles into the sea. Run by Vive Mar, it is part of a conservation program to help save the turtles and it\'s an amazing experience. It is 100 pesos to release a turtle with the money going towards the conservation. Don\'t do a tour - they charge around 500 pesos. A taxi from any of the surrounding beaches is around 50 pesos so easier to go yourself and you aren\'t limited for time. You could even spend the money releasing more turtles! We loved it so much we went twice!

569275583.name: Great experience, cute turtles!
569275583.author: a TripAdvisor user
569275583.reviewBody: Because of the turtle release we visited this beach and were very positively surprised. It was very uncrowded and the atmosphere was nice as well. It\u2019s possible to drive by car directly to the turtle place which we marked now on maps.me (calculated walking distance is accurate). We were easily and it took us for example from the ADO bus station about 30-40min. It\u2019s easy to find, turn left after the big resort \u2018Posada Real\u2019, then follow the path. As it\u2019s been stated by others it\u2019s not a classic beach to swim, the waves are quite big.\n\nThe turtle release starts at 5pm and this experience for 100pesos per turtle is well worth it. These volunteers do a great job! Furthermore, you can enjoy a beautiful sunset afterwards with just little crowds on this beach. After the sunset we still had enough time to walk back before it got dark. Overall, it was a great afternoon and we would recommend it.

568711726.name: Turtle release was the highlight
568711726.author: a TripAdvisor user
568711726.reviewBody: Came to Playa Bacocho, went to Club Viva Sol.  200 pesos to enter, food and drink are deducted from the price.  Service was very attentive, only negative thing (to me) was they had so many umbrellas crowded together, the whole place was shade.  There are a couple palapas on the beach but the seating was very uncomfortable.  Beach is beautiful but unswimmable so the pool is very welcome.  Had an order of nachos for a snack, it was like something I would get at Taco Bell, orange concession stand cheese and just some chopped up tomato\u2019s, no pico de gallo  or anything with spice.  Beers were great and cold, margarita was horrible.  Only redeeming thing of the day was the turtle release down the beach.

568353941.name: Amazing
568353941.author: a TripAdvisor user
568353941.reviewBody: Love the rock formations, the pounding of the sea and the long almost secluded stretch of beach . Add the extra bonus of turtle releasing every night between 5-6  where  you can watch for free or participate (100 pesos) in releasing the turtles and it is perfectly wonderful

567759386.name: Lazy afternoons by the pool with ocean breezes
567759386.author: a TripAdvisor user
567759386.reviewBody: Go to the public Beach club (Club Playa?) right next to the fancy private hotel beach club.  200 pesos/person gets you a lounge chair facing the pool or the ocean.  Food and drink are deducted from the 200 peso entrance fee, so a couple of margaritas or beers and an appetizer and your entrance is free.  Try the margarita Oaxacana made with mescal...when in Rome...much better than typical margarita.  Stay for the unbelievable sunset, try not to ask yourself: "Who lives like this?"

566735904.name: Great place for a walk!
566735904.author: a TripAdvisor user
566735904.reviewBody: My wife and I truly enjoyed walking along Playa Bacocho.  It can last 30 minutes or 90 minutes or more - depending on how much time you have.  It is also a great place to see a sunset or watch turtles being released.  Can\'t wait to visit it again.

565099991.name: come to release baby sea turtles- 100 pesos
565099991.author: a TripAdvisor user
565099991.reviewBody: Not a swimmable beach but there were skim boarders and some people enjoying the empty beach. We also saw joggers. We came here at 5pm to release baby sea turtles with Vive Mar. Great organization with great people. 10 minute educational talk then we each got a turtles and released them. you have to stand behind a rope and let the turtles make their way to the sea. Great experience.

564451837.name: Beautiful beach for walking
564451837.author: a TripAdvisor user
564451837.reviewBody: Not for walking but too rough for swimming. Whales off shore put on quite a performance and the turtle sanctuary gives tour.

563449739.name: Beautiful beach
563449739.author: a TripAdvisor user
563449739.reviewBody: Lots of waves, but go cheer the turtles at 5 P.M.,when they are released into the ocean, it\'s a thrill.  Cristal Beach to the left has more swimmable waters.

558924304.name: Stunning
558924304.author: a TripAdvisor user
558924304.reviewBody: This quiet beach is absolutely beautiful.... pick your swimming spot carefully as the undertow can be dangerous.  It\u2019s a great place for an early morning walk, never crowded.

558321034.name: A mile of beach
558321034.author: a TripAdvisor user
558321034.reviewBody:
A great place for and early morning walk where you can experience big waves crashing onto the shore. We were lucky enough to see breaching whales from the beach. There's also a place where they release baby turtles everyday around 5:00pm. back to the sea. 
At the far end of the beach there is a rock cliff that you can climb, bring your shoes, and have a view of the next beach. 
There is a small swimming area near the Posada Real property.

557577616.name: Early, early morning is best
557577616.author: a TripAdvisor user
557577616.reviewBody: You can drive part of the way down to this beach, or walk the road.  Its when you hit all the sand that things start heating up.  Beautiful, and plan on a break before you leave, with lots of water.  Some swim here depending on the day, but as always with the ocean be careful.

555994627.name: Beach club reviews
555994627.author: a TripAdvisor user
555994627.reviewBody:
You've likely read prior reviews, so you know what a nice, secluded beach this is.  We went numerous times during our month long visit and highly recommend the location.  In addition to the beach, there are two beach clubs.  

We prefer, and recommend, Club Villasol.  Entry fee is 200 pesos per person but this goes towards anything you eat or drink during the day.  There's are two pools, a pool bar, lots of beach and pool chairs, good umbrellas for shade, nice bathrooms, a really good beach menu, a large expanse of shallow pool for infants, an adjacent restaurant where you can work off your 200 pesos if you'd prefer, and immediate access to the beach.  This is good for a walk or, if you walk to the left as you face the ocean, a swim on the public beach by the second club that is somewhat protected by rocks against the waves and undertow.  I was careful in joining the twenty or so people already swimming and spent over a confident hour splashing around.  Just check the conditions against your ability before you jump in.

You won't have any trouble working off your entry fee.  The menu is surprisingly good.  Try the ceviche, the chicken skewers, or the stuffed avocado.  All good and reasonably priced.  For better availability of the best beach/pool chairs, go early or avoid the weekends.

On to Club Coco, which I don't recommend.  You either have to either pay 175 pesos each as a cover charge with food and drinks ON TOP of that, or pay 450 pesos each that covers food or drink.  Yep, 450 pesos - 900 for two people.  Re-read the charge above at Club Villasol and wonder why anyone would go to Club Coco to begin with.  Unfortunately, due to a misunderstanding at the desk, we paid the 175 pesos each thinking we'd work off the amount with food and drink.  We were very upset to find this not the case.  Totally our error due to poor Spanish but I do wish they'd been more explicit in stating their exclusions.  Left us with a bad taste.

Anyway, I hope you enjoy the review and the range of beach options available to you at Playa Bacocho.  Enjoy!

555572162.name: Quiet and out of the way
555572162.author: a TripAdvisor user
555572162.reviewBody: Lovely beach away from town and crowds. Beautiful sand and water, not many people around, nice place to stroll and have some time away from the tourists. Apparently late afternoon is an attraction here, which we weren\'t here for - maybe next time

542611851.name: Stunning
542611851.author: a TripAdvisor user
542611851.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach, very photogenic, The waves crashing on the rocks and sending spray into the air is something I can watch all day. Then a long stretch of clean sand with the sound of the surf.\nAs in this is not all enough, there is the baby sea turtle release from 5:00 until 6:00 P.M.\nIn off season people say the turtles may not be released daily. Sunday is popular with about a hundred people particiapating in the event.

540043003.name: a quick getaway
540043003.author: a TripAdvisor user
540043003.reviewBody:
The bad news: almost nothing there. The good news: almost nothing there.
If you want to get away from the crowds of Playa Zicatella, this could be the place for you. This morning I walked the whole length and saw 1 other person. Wild surf- not safe to swim- all to yourself. 
At the far eastern end is Playa Coral, gorgeous in initself, and then over the rocks to Bacocho where it is only a 20 minute walk to the end at the point. You can climb up the rocks and get to a path that takes you further west to another beach if you are adventurous.
There is a private club at the eastern end (part of the Posada Real) and next door a club with pools and a restaurant (Club de Playa Villa de Sol) you can get free entry if you buy food or drinks ( 100 pesos per person). This is also near the place that they release turtles daily during the right season (now in November).

To get there, you can find a path down to Playa coral near the Hotel Viva Mexico- a bit steep and marked private- and then you have to climb over the rocks to Bacocho. Or, walk (or take a taxi) down the road just past the Posada Real and walk though the Club de Play Villa Sol or go another 50 meters to where the road comes out to the beach. Take your own water.

538306607.name: Beach forever
538306607.author: a TripAdvisor user
538306607.reviewBody: We had the whole beach to ourselves . The waves are very strong , we didn\u2019t go into the water , beautiful .

521221149.name: Turtle release on a big, quiet beach
521221149.author: a TripAdvisor user
521221149.reviewBody:
We came to Bacocho to take part in the daily Turtle Release at 5pm. You have to take a taxi here if you don't have your own vehicle but the beach was lovely - lots of sand, large and quiet, though without any shade.

There is a local government-sponsored  (apparently) turtle release programme running here every day at 5pm. 100 pesos pp, and you get to set a baby turtle free. Lots of fun.

The taxi was 40 pesos from Benito Juarez and 50 to Playa Zicatela.

520754590.name: Free the turtles!
520754590.author: a TripAdvisor user
520754590.reviewBody: A beautiful beach, clean and easily accessible with turtle liberation daily from 5 pm to 6 pm. Perfect for watching the sunset!

506587930.name: Relaxing
506587930.author: a TripAdvisor user
506587930.reviewBody: Playa Bacocho is ideal for relaxing and getting away from the Zicatela crowd. They have two beach clubs where you can enjoy palapas and drinks. However the seats are not that comfortable.

500073164.name: Playa Bacocho
500073164.author: a TripAdvisor user
500073164.reviewBody: We have a home about 10 minutes from the beach club.  We spent a lot of time there.  The manager was a very nice lady from Chile.  She made us feel very welcome.  They have great parking right there at the club.  The food is great and you can get a massage  if you want it.  At 5 in the afternoon you can make a donation and set baby sea turtles loose back into the ocean.  The pool is perfect.  If you get a chance to visit there you will love it.  If you are driving a car down the hill to get there be careful. The road is a winding and the speed bumps are very high. A car can bottom out.

494433784.name: Beautiful!
494433784.author: a TripAdvisor user
494433784.reviewBody: This beach is where we spent most of our weekend, because it was so beautiful and peaceful! The VillaSol Suites has a beach club here and the service, food and drinks are great!

476624528.name: Nice and quiet beach
476624528.author: a TripAdvisor user
476624528.reviewBody: The beach is on of the quiet beaches in Puerto Escondido. Great for long walks. The can release little baby turtles into the ocean. Great experience! It starts at 5 pm.

475034208.name: Waves!
475034208.author: a TripAdvisor user
475034208.reviewBody: This beach is one of the most quiet and beautiful of the area. There is restaurants walking distance, hotels and wow, what a view.. We loved playa bacocho so much that we cant wait to go back in November!

473056811.name: Beach clubs, burgers, micheladas.
473056811.author: a TripAdvisor user
473056811.reviewBody: Great drinks, great prices.  Movie nights on Wednesdays where they screen flicks on a large projector screen on the beach.

472952399.name: Isolated Splendour
472952399.author: a TripAdvisor user
472952399.reviewBody: This is a generally, quiet isolated beach below the Posada Real. It is wide, long, beautiful, unique and dangerous in which to swim. There are two beach clubs nearby and the only flag that you will see is a red one, so heed it. Waves are powerful, brilliant to watch and hear, but very unpredictable. \nLooking towards the ocean on the left is a series of strangely shaped rocks, some around small rock pools, where the brave may try the waves and locals do some fishing. In the middle there is a turtle release facility and to the right is a rocky point with cave like structures. A lovely wild place to restore one\'s faith in the power and beauty of nature!

469887675.name: Really nice & deserted during the week.
469887675.author: a TripAdvisor user
469887675.reviewBody: Beautiful, huge, soft sandy beach accented by huge jagged cliffs & rocks -- wow!  And hardly anybody there!  Swimming is possible, but not recommended... Heavy waves and undertow... be careful. There is a lifeguard.  Also a beach club that was very nice for $3 per day!  Yes 60 pesos = $3 admission.  Unbelievable!  Nice pools, tables, chairs, umbrellas, restaurant & service.  Otherwise, not much shade; no facilities or food/drink on the beach.  There is a dirt path down the hillside from the end of Rinconada... and swimming/snorkeling in that area is nice/protected.  Don\'t miss this beach if in Escondido.

467823520.name: the most pristine beach in this area
467823520.author: a TripAdvisor user
467823520.reviewBody: Expansive white sand beach. Relatively under serviced, hence the least crowded to the point of almost deserted; especially the northern (western) 3/4 stretch. At the southern (eastern) end, 2 hotel-run beach clubs (Villasol & Coco\'s) tastefully set back in the treeline, open to non-residents for very reasonable fee, daily/season passes. At the extreme eastern (south) end a hotel (Mexicano Villas) serviced stretch of beach, popular with Mexican tour groups (& busy). Otherwise, scenic, great sunsets, space, privacy, heavy surf/swell & undertow. Take your own picnic if you want. Casual bar, cafe just west of beach clubs. Apply common sense, avoid really \'deserted\' stretches of beach at dusk/dark; muggings very rare but have happened (still safer than in Canada)

467623209.name: Great place to see turtle release
467623209.author: a TripAdvisor user
467623209.reviewBody: Wonderful experience of seeing and participating in the baby turtle release at 5:00 pm daily. The beach however, is like \nZicatela, with strong surf and waves. I cannot recommend for swimming as the waves have a very strong undertow. And I lost a pair of eye glasses because of that.

467284979.name: Powerful Beach for Picture Taking
467284979.author: a TripAdvisor user
467284979.reviewBody: This is a mostly deserted beach and excellent for a long secluded walk.  The picture taking on the rocks is amazing.  They are spectacular with the waves crashing in and the salt spray leaping up!   You can get some really great shots.  Generally too rough for swimming, Another wonderful find in the area

465369250.name: Nice quiet beach but can\'t swim here
465369250.author: a TripAdvisor user
465369250.reviewBody: Lovely beach for walks and relaxing but you can\'t swim here because of the rocks.  A couple of nice bars/cafes

464476878.name: Relaxing beach
464476878.author: a TripAdvisor user
464476878.reviewBody: We really like this beach and appreciate the fact that it is not crowded...you can take nice long walks on this beach, eat in one of the beach side hotel...a must!

464102722.name: My Favourite Walk
464102722.author: a TripAdvisor user
464102722.reviewBody: My favourite beach for a walk - miles of white sand and crashing waves.  If you enjoy a beach for solitude this a good one to go walk on

463273066.name: Beach, good food, and baby turtles!
463273066.author: a TripAdvisor user
463273066.reviewBody: For 60 pesos you can\'t get a better deal.  A palapas, drinks, pool, beach and clear blue skies made our trip there with our daughters truly enjoyable and relaxing.  The high-lite of the day was watching the release of baby turtles into the ocean; a truly wonderful experience.  Can\'t wait to visit it again when we return to Puerto Escondido.

461980868.name: Beach to Ourselves
461980868.author: a TripAdvisor user
461980868.reviewBody: Great Beach - There was 2 people on the beach only. Great for a morning walking and on the beach is a restaurant called Pez Gallo

461040906.name: Beautiful beach and a place where you can help baby turtle make it\'s way to the ocean
461040906.author: a TripAdvisor user
461040906.reviewBody: The beach itself is beautiful, the waves are often to big to swim (check the conditions first) but then they\'re good to surf. There is a place where you can help baby turtles make their way to the ocean, please remember not to touch them though. To do this, come at 5pm (donation of 50 peso per person is required) You can get there with a taxi for 50 peso from Punta and 40 peso from Playa Zicatela.

457218737.name: Posada Real Beach Club, and the beach
457218737.author: a TripAdvisor user
457218737.reviewBody: The beach is pretty nice- endless, really,- but not always good for swimming. I don\'t care about the turtles. We take a cab shortly after 10 a.m. and pay 60 pesos each to spend the day at the " Beach Club "- part of Posada Real. We get chairs and a table in the sand, under a palapa, and just enjoy reading and the beach breeze. The pools are nice.\nThe service is attentive; they\'ll call you a cab for your return. My complaint is the very weak drinks and the really pretty poor food. After we\'d eaten everything we could stand off the menu ( on many days! ) we brought our own sandwiches but were told we\'d be charged if we didn\'t keep them hidden... then make better food!  So now we make sure we eat before we go there...

456767948.name: Beautifull!
456767948.author: a TripAdvisor user
456767948.reviewBody: Incredibly long white sand beach can often be unsafe for swimming but during my stay we were always in the ocean for a swim. Surf can be rough but it was safe in January.

456514656.name: Nice place to walk
456514656.author: a TripAdvisor user
456514656.reviewBody: No crowds, just sand and water. Only problem is getting there. Must take taxi. Once there you can walk for hours. Turtles washed up from sea and moray eels

456265364.name: Quiet Long Beach
456265364.author: a TripAdvisor user
456265364.reviewBody: Great to take a long morning walk along, bring water or buy something to drink at the 2 different hotels along the beach.

454866698.name: Great beach walking
454866698.author: a TripAdvisor user
454866698.reviewBody: We really enjoy going down to Bococho beach for an early morning walk.  Waves area always fascinating to watch.  There is often a turtle release there as well.  Not a swimming beach.

454394093.name: A great beach - nice exposed surf with few people
454394093.author: a TripAdvisor user
454394093.reviewBody: Probably the least populated of any of the Puerto Escondido city beaches - this has some exposed surf.  Lifeguards patrol a part of the beach.  It\'s easy to find sand to one\'s self, relax, swim and watch the Pelicans dive for fish!

451478086.name: Best walking beach
451478086.author: a TripAdvisor user
451478086.reviewBody: Great place to sit back and watch the ocean. Great spot to stretch your legs walking west to the rocks.

449933840.name: Beaches for a far as the eye can see.
449933840.author: a TripAdvisor user
449933840.reviewBody: The beaches north of Puerto Escondido while only a few miles away, are always deserted. The beaches in this part of Mexico are the best beaches in Mexico

445022779.name: Beautiful beach with very few people
445022779.author: a TripAdvisor user
445022779.reviewBody: A beautiful, sandy beach with few bathers.  That does mean no lifeguards when you get away from the hotel so be careful.  The sunsets are magnificent!  I really recommend spending the 50 pesos to release a turtle at that facility which is a fun and memorable diversion.

441390061.name: Amazing beach
441390061.author: a TripAdvisor user
441390061.reviewBody: I loved visiting this beach was amazing to set free the turtles at 5pm for a beautiful sunset also. Would recommend a trip here and is only about  5 minutes walk down from the road it is so worth it. Walk a little further to an abandoned hotel where there\'s a little private beach only one other person was chilling there. If your in Puerto Escondido i would recommend a trip to this beach.

440238814.name: Patricio
440238814.author: a TripAdvisor user
440238814.reviewBody: The sunsets!! Bacocho is a relatively empty beach that goes forever. The waves are fun to play in but you never want to turn your back on them! They will stand up and smash you into the sand if you aren\'t ready for them. Not for a weak swimmer

439615600.name: Stunning
439615600.author: a TripAdvisor user
439615600.reviewBody: This beach is miles of wonderfully soft white sand, clean water and rolling waves.  Not only is that perfect, there is rarely anybody there! Take the time to walk the 2 km from one point to the next.

437544733.name: Big surfing waves. Not recommended for swimming.
437544733.author: a TripAdvisor user
437544733.reviewBody: Zicatela is a humongous beach! The scenery is formidable. You can sit in one of the many caba\u00f1as and sip a drink or have lunch taken to you. Can\'t miss the sunsets. Espectacular!!! It\'s not recommended or even allowed by the rescue guards to go in swimming. If you\'re early enough you\'ll get to see the best of the best surfers worldwide. Don\'t miss it.

431953254.name: Mostly deserted beach
431953254.author: a TripAdvisor user
431953254.reviewBody: Heard many good things about this beach. Unfortunately, the day we visited the water was brown and a scuzzy foam washing up on the beach. Unappealing. Walking was good and two resorts at end if you wanted a beer or call a cab. Best to arrange a time with cab that dropped you off. Also, late in the afternoon, baby turtles are sometimes released.

403086101.name: Long stunning beach with so few people.
403086101.author: a TripAdvisor user
403086101.reviewBody: This is a long beach that you can walk on for an hour or so & see nobody. I walked down from my rental in Carrizalillo area often. There is a small hidden trail that the locals use to get down to Playa de Coral & then walk 5 mins. to the west to Playa Bacocho. Alternatively you can follow the road down or take a taxi. There is a beach club you can go to if you buy some drinks in their beautiful beachside bar/ restaurant. Always take water & a hat because there isn\'t a lot of shade near the beach. Also be careful swimming unless you are near the big rocks where there are natural little pools to swim in safely. I love it because of how few people seem to go there.

387346991.name: Stunning walk on the beach
387346991.author: a TripAdvisor user
387346991.reviewBody: The white sand is endless. All quiet except for the crash of the waves. The undertow makes swimming a little dangerous, but the quietude and isolation enhance the spirit.\nA lovely restaurant at one end where you can cool yourself off with a beef and tasty burger.also the Blues on the beach concerts make you want to kick up your fee and dance.

378624043.name: Our favourite beach by far!
378624043.author: a TripAdvisor user
378624043.reviewBody: We fell in love with this beach. An easy taxi ride from Playa Zicatela ($40 MXP) to Villa Sol Beach Club we paid the $60 MXP per person, we were able to enjoy the shaded beach chairs, pools, showers, washrooms and food/drink service (very reasonably priced). It was was super chill, with little to no vendors bothering you. And if you stick around until 5pm, you can help release baby turtles into the ocean ($50 MXP per person).

363244353.name: beauty
363244353.author: a TripAdvisor user
363244353.reviewBody: Very beautiful beach, unfortunately it is not the nearest.\nThey have a Turtle project and the beach is cleaned on a regular basis, so always very nice.

357610816.name: Baby Turtle release
357610816.author: a TripAdvisor user
357610816.reviewBody: Our family went out to Bacocho at 5 pm for the baby turtle release, which happens every day! Golfo and Green turtles. The guide spoke only Spanish so we didn\'t learn much because we only speak English, but the kids had fun letting baby turtles go in the sand and watch them make it all the way to the ocean.

354595853.name: Superb beach for walking next to the ocean.
354595853.author: a TripAdvisor user
354595853.reviewBody: There is yet another empty beach beyond the headland at the end, if you don\'t mind a little climb up a rock step. It has a lagoon with warning signs about crocodiles 4.5 to 6 meters long. Don\'t swim there!

351147936.name: Fabulous beach
351147936.author: a TripAdvisor user
351147936.reviewBody: We took a cab (there are many in PE and very inexpensive).  We paid a minimal amount to stay at the beach club for the day and enjoyed some drinks and lunch there overlooking the water.  Lovely pool and lounge chairs.  The Playa Bacocho is spectacular - flat, hard-packed sand and very, very long with no hotels or houses.  It is dangerous to swim due to the tides but you can wade along the beach.\nWhat a treat!

348721509.name: great beach to release baby turtles
348721509.author: a TripAdvisor user
348721509.reviewBody: Long Sandy beach, Palm trees behind and you can pay 50 pesos to release baby turtles into the sea. \nCouple of hotels on the front. Very scenic

348285237.name: Beautiful and quiet beach
348285237.author: a TripAdvisor user
348285237.reviewBody: If you\'re looking for a spot to relax and read a book with nothing but the sound of the ocean as the soundtrack, this is the place! Bacocho was a 20 minute walk from the place I was staying in Playa Carrizalillo and worth the descend through the bushes. I went on a Tuesday morning and, besides a few locals, basically had it to myself. Make sure to bring food and drinks  and maybe some sort of sun shield if you want to spend the whole day as there are no bars, just two hotel/resort type of thing and I\'m not sure they serve non guests.

345588587.name: Great Beach but Difficult to Reach
345588587.author: a TripAdvisor user
345588587.reviewBody: Playa Bacocho has always been a favourite, but the Hotel Posada Real and the Hotel Villa Sol make it difficult to reach.  You cannot cut through their properties to get to the beach, so you have take a path that first timers might have difficulty finding.  Take a taxi and he\'ll take you as close as possible.  To get back to town, ask at the desk of Coco\'s Beach Club of the Posada Real to call a taxi for you.  The climb up the hill is steep.

343796471.name: Great hiking spot
343796471.author: a TripAdvisor user
343796471.reviewBody: Had the beach to ourselves. Good exercise to walk the 6000 meter beach. Hugh turtle and moray eel washed up on beach.

343650716.name: The Least Spoiled Beach in PE
343650716.author: a TripAdvisor user
343650716.reviewBody: A long, white sand beach with a single low-key resort and public restaurant. Has severe riptides so the swimming is a bit perilous.

343639902.name: Beautiful beach with baby tortuga release
343639902.author: a TripAdvisor user
343639902.reviewBody: A long gorgeous beach with baby tortuga a released daily at 5pm for 50 pesos. My kids absolutely loved the turtles! The waves are rough and undertow pretty strong so the kids didn\'t swim here. Lots of big rocks to search for crabs and seashells everywhere. Great spot for sunsets.

342955926.name: Gorgeous and un crowded beach- be careful swimming
342955926.author: a TripAdvisor user
342955926.reviewBody: We stayed up the hill from this beach last time we were in Puerto Escondido. It is a lovely, peaceful place, not developed or crowded. You can take a very long walk and not see anything but sand and sea. There are places to eat at the end closest to town. There is a beach club with a pool and a restaurant /bar where you can sit and relax. We spent hours every day, relaxing at this beautiful place. There is only one problem.\nIf you are not a strong swimmer this beach could be dangerous. The surf is quite strong and there is a definite undertow. There were people in swimming, my husband and I included. Just be cautious.

341254353.name: \'Wave\' bon voyage to turtles
341254353.author: a TripAdvisor user
341254353.reviewBody: The loveliness is in keeping with the Peurto Escondido area, however, this beach is essentially undeveloped. That provides the advantage to offer the turtle release program where, for a donation, you received a hatchling turtle to release on the beach - the presence of an audience for the hatchlings\' race to the water probably prevents gulls from feasting on them. The waves at Bacocho demand respect and can be strong - if not careful, you can find the experience likened to the spin cycle of a washing machine. This is not a good beach for children nor weak or grandiose swimmers. Surfers would probably enjoy the challenge of the waves. The beach area is less developed and more pristine so you will need to plan for seating and food - there is not the vendors you find on many other beaches. It is a great site for a relatively private beach walk and romantic picnic to view the sunset.

340049179.name: Best Beach for a Long Walk
340049179.author: a TripAdvisor user
340049179.reviewBody: Great beach to simply walk to the end and back. Quite possibly the best beach walk in Mexico. Today I walked the length and crossed paths with two people. Fantastic.

337846764.name: Pretty, but limited access
337846764.author: a TripAdvisor user
337846764.reviewBody: The beach itself is quite lovely, but just not easy to access. There is one very narrow path down, that\'s also not easy to find. Otherwise access is only via expensive "beach clubs". Plus, it\'s not a swimming beach - great sand, but violent waves.\nGood place to watch the locals fishing.\nThere are beaches close by which are so much better.

313812405.name: Beatiful beach
313812405.author: a TripAdvisor user
313812405.reviewBody: Undecelop beach, great if you want to go and watch de sunset! Is an open ocean so is not good for swimming. Strong waves. There are 2 beach clubes where you could spend the day. If you want a more calm beach Carrizalillo or Angelitos beach

295859176.name: Day at Via Sole Beach Club.
295859176.author: a TripAdvisor user
295859176.reviewBody: Our family of four had an amazing day at the Via Sol Beach club   Naranjada\'s and Guacamole were perfect the beach side accommodations pools and restrooms make a day at the beach peaceful and effortless.  This is our second vacation in PE and Via Sol is on our list of must visit locations each time.

289284401.name: Abandoned resort on beach
289284401.author: a TripAdvisor user
289284401.reviewBody: Took a taxi out to Coco\'s beach today from Zicatela and we came across an abandoned (what look to be) resort with huge water slides, pools etc right on the beach. Can anyone enlighten me on what it was, what is was called and when it was in use etc? \n\nCheers

266478126.name: Releasing turtles
266478126.author: a TripAdvisor user
266478126.reviewBody: We paid 50 MX each to experience releasing turtles into the ocean. Around sunset people gather on the beach and watch the guide dig out the eggs from the reserve. We then were able to touch the babies and have photos before we released them. It was an unforgettable experience and the turtles were so cute!

260330248.name: Long walks on serene beach
260330248.author: a TripAdvisor user
260330248.reviewBody: If you are traveling to get away from it all, try the Playa\'s of Bacocho. Located on the edge of town in Puerto Escondido, take the Street Benito Juarez down to the sea. Follow the signs to VillaSol on the beach. You will find an uninhabited beach to the right where you can take long walks next to the sea. The waves are strong and not for children to swim in, but the view is amazing. Returning from your walk you can enter the VillaSol resort at a small price to use there swimming pool and bar that is set against the shore.

258267860.name: Worth the 10-15min trip out for sunset and to see the power of the Pacific
258267860.author: a TripAdvisor user
258267860.reviewBody: We walked out to this beach to catch a really nice sunset one evening and hung around for a while watching local fishermen and some young bodyboarders tackling the very impressive force of the Pacific. I even tried to go in for a swim coming from the Atlantic ocean, but even as a confident swimmer, the waves were very impressive/intimidating and now I fully understand the washing machine effect that surfers go on about!
