Nice long beach for a chilled stroll and to take in the beauty of nature.

251824965.name: Bacocho Paradise
251824965.author: a TripAdvisor user
251824965.reviewBody: The beach is pristine and beautiful and seemingly endless.  Great spot for walking.  The water is clear and perfect for swimming.  The beach club Villa Sol is a great place to while away the day, have a little bite to eat, shower off after swimming in the ocean and relax in a hammock.

247861034.name: Big Beautiful Beach with Very Few People
247861034.author: a TripAdvisor user
247861034.reviewBody: An easy way to enjoy this beach is to spend a little money and go to the Coco Beach Club. To find the beach go away from town on Blvd. Benito Juarez, past the long strip of stores and restaurants on the Rinconada. Go right at the end of the straight away and then make a couple quick lefts and rights following the main road until you get to Posada Real, a big hotel. The Coco\'s Beach Club on the beach is part of the hotel\'s facilities. You get to the club by going just past the hotel grounds and taking a left turn down a concrete road. On the left on the way down to the beach you will see a sign and a walkway on the left to Coco Beach Club. if you don\'t take the walkway to Cocos you just get to the beach down the road a bit. You can get a day pass at Cocos for about $5 USD. The cashier is at the end of the bar on the right when you walk in. Some of the other hotels (Villa Mozart Y Macondo) have free day passes for those staying a while. The cashier will give you a paper bracelet. There is fairly lousy but edible, expensive food available. The bar has burgers and snacks and they serve a buffet about 2pm. In Jan. 2015 the buffet was M$250. So it\'s not cheap if you do the buffet but you are now with lounge chairs under thatch (get there early for a good spot at peak season) with bar service. At this time of year (January) people were swimming on the beach in a couple places. And there is a pool for cooling off other times of the year, outdoor shower and decent restrooms. The beach is pretty glorious.

244893470.name: not great swimming and no restaurants
244893470.author: a TripAdvisor user
244893470.reviewBody: Great place for a walk but bring your own food.  Long nearly empty beach.  Not much of a swimming beach and no services.

244472860.name: Playa Carranzalillo
244472860.author: a TripAdvisor user
244472860.reviewBody: Actually the best beach seems not to be on list, or another name, Playa Carranzallilo or something like that, very near the big newish street of many restaurants/services, Avenida Benito Juarez. Playa Caranazallilo is just perfect, with less boats and noise than some others, totally gentle surf, people with shade palappas, drinks, chaise and chairs at your disposal. Lots of up scale condos and apts to rent above and around it

241214240.name: DRAMATIC WILD UNEXPLORED BEACH- FANTASYLAND
241214240.author: a TripAdvisor user
241214240.reviewBody: this remote deserted beach, is one of the more dramatic beautiful beaches we have visited, unspoiled natures play garden, very quiet, colorful rocks in different shapes and forms mingle with the white sand, tropical vegetation, and a deep agitated ocean, make you fly with your imagination and fantasy. just don\'t spoil it, it is really a hidden treasure

238648355.name: A wild beach to get away from the crowds
238648355.author: a TripAdvisor user
238648355.reviewBody: Other than 2 quiet beach clubs there is nothing at Playa Bachoco, just a long sand beach with big waves, quiet (except for the surf) and most often solitude. Very different than Zicatella where there are always lots of people. Over the rocks at the town end is Playa Coral which offers good snorkelling and quiet. At the other end, if you climb up over the rocks (not too easy) is Playa Colorado which goes on forever. All are worth the longish walk there.

223656542.name: Is this a real beach?
223656542.author: a TripAdvisor user
223656542.reviewBody: Seriously couldn\'t find this beach or least we couldn\'t access it without entering some fancy beach club. Go to Angelito or Manzanillo instead.

222274863.name: Lovely
222274863.author: a TripAdvisor user
222274863.reviewBody: Arriving by Posada Real to see the view.........breathtaking! After go down steps to the coco\'s club (you must pay to spend the day but worthwile) or to the Villa Sol beach club that I do not know but seems to be very in.

203219995.name: The place for upper style beach clubs
203219995.author: a TripAdvisor user
203219995.reviewBody: you cannot swim in the sea, but the beach clubs have nice swimming pools. The landscape is great with the rocks in the sea, but that is why going into the water is difficult, no surfers here

197812139.name: Lonely beach
197812139.author: a TripAdvisor user
197812139.reviewBody:
This far beach is located after Carrizalillo and Coral Beach,you can take a very long walk all way to Punta Colorada (Red Point) and hike it if you want,behind the point is a little lagoon where you can spot small crocodiles.
Waves break very fast and currents are strong...not safe for swimming.
They are two beach club's Posada Real and Villasol where you can use toilette facilities or have a cold drink.
Good option for beach lovers(almost empty)

195324712.name: Puerto Escondido\'s best kept secret
195324712.author: a TripAdvisor user
195324712.reviewBody: We did a morning walk the length of Playa Bacocho several days during our stay in PE. It is a very peaceful and clean beach. Swimming can be a bit dangerous if the surf is up.

188051845.name: Beaches nearby beat Bacocho easily out.
188051845.author: a TripAdvisor user
188051845.reviewBody: Absolutely worthless to drive down as there is just a hotel beach club there and that\'s pretty it. manzanillo and Carazalillo are beating out Bacocho in a second easily and swimming at Bacocho was not possible at that day so went back to Carazalillo.

186951584.name: Spa experience
186951584.author: a TripAdvisor user
186951584.reviewBody: If you need a day of poolside pampering, or swinging in a hammock beach side, then Bacocho is your place. The undertow is dangerous so stay in the shallow water.

156418792.name: Exotic beach
156418792.author: a TripAdvisor user
156418792.reviewBody: Very quite, long sandy beach, clear sea water, not crowded.Beach club with many amenities if needed.

154850633.name: Beautiful solitude
154850633.author: a TripAdvisor user
154850633.reviewBody: Along this gorgeous 3 km (2 mi) stretch of sand you\'ll often meet only one or two other wanderers. It\'s not ideal for swimming because of the strong undertow, but the oyster divers can been seen all day just offshore. There are two facilities on this beach both near the north end. Cocos which is the beach club for the Posada Inn (all inclusive hotel) or VillaSol beach club. Better off taking a taxi to VillaSol and for 50 pesos get a full day of visitor services including the pool, patio lounges, beach palapas and hammocks where 400 pesos can get you an hour massage with an authentic surf sound-track.

154018551.name: Playa Bacocho,Early morning walks
154018551.author: a TripAdvisor user
154018551.reviewBody:
Playa Bacocho is a lovely beach for an early morning walk. It is a very flat beach so it is easy to walk on the wet sand, which makes for better footing. Some days you may be the only people on the beach. This is one of the more northern of the beaches in Puerto Escondido. These beaches have some of the finest sand particles that I have ever come across. There is always a good chance that you will see whales and or dolphins while you are on your walk. It takes me about half an hour to walk from one end of the beach to the other, so you get about an hours worth of solitude and pleasure. If you do meet joggers or walkers on the beach they are always very friendly, although the joggers seem to be more interested in running than wanting to stop and chat. You can access the beach by taxi which will drop you off close to one of the beach clubs, or you can walk down the foot path to Playa Corel and then walk the short distance to Playa Bacocho. Playa Corel is south of Bacocho.

If you want a quiet, reflective, easy walk, Bacocho is the place. Take drinking water with you. The best time to walk in my opinion is early morning.

 Except for two beach clubs, one of which is only open to people staying at a resort, there is no place along this beach to buy refreshment. If you visit Puerto Escondido, try this beach out. 

Rick banks

153907324.name: Great beach, no amenities
153907324.author: a TripAdvisor user
153907324.reviewBody: Bacocho Beach club \u2013 Might be an ok option if you make a day of it and pay the 350 peso entrance including drinks and food?   Arriving in the afternoon the price just seemed a bit high (even the 110 peso entrance for the pool only) to sit at a pool when there are so many fantastic beaches in the area.   Unfortunately, there are no other amenities at this fantastic beach for food and drinks  (besides one other beach club just a little further down) making it a little less attractive destination for a beach outing.  So the options are:  go early and pay the entrance fee, try the next beach club for 40 pesos (pool usage only) or if you are the type that goes to the beach to enjoy the beach - try a different location\u2026.

148846635.name: Relaxing with out people wanting to sell stuff to you.
148846635.author: a TripAdvisor user
148846635.reviewBody: This is a great beach to go for a walk on or to watch the sunset from. \nAlso if you have access to a 4x4 vehicle its one of the only beaches in Puerto Escondido that will permit you to take on the dunes.

148807721.name: Exciting early morning beach walk
148807721.author: a TripAdvisor user
148807721.reviewBody: Thunderous waves. Brilliant skies. Walking "to the end" takes longer than you think. It is very hot,open. Bring water start early.

123038336.name: Worth the steep hill
123038336.author: a TripAdvisor user
123038336.reviewBody: I visited Cocos Beach club and thought it was a nice getaway

122372446.name: Beach
122372446.author: a TripAdvisor user
122372446.reviewBody: Nice beach to walk on.  The sand is very clean and it is a great place to go

663631004.name: 1/2 day trip was good
663631004.author: a TripAdvisor user
663631004.reviewBody: This was my second time on a fishing charter in Mexico.  The crew was awesome, the boat ride fantastic.  There were 3 of us on the boat to fish.  First guy got a real nice sail fish.  I got a mahi mahi, couldn\'t believe the fight that little guy put up.  And someone also caught another pretty fish.  But that was all we caught on our 1/2 day trip.  Weather and great of course, and no sea sickness.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

660300533.name: We Went......
660300533.author: a TripAdvisor user
660300533.reviewBody: It was a great day on the water, but for a woman, there are no bathroom facilities on the boats, and we were on the water for 4+ hours.  We did not catch any fish, and I found it rather expensive for a group of 4.  But it was a nice day on the water.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

580269411.name: Great fishing experience
580269411.author: a TripAdvisor user
580269411.reviewBody: Israel and Oso are the best guides in town. The Dorothea is a 26ft wide boat with plenty of shade and surely the best gear you\u2019ll find in Puerto Escondido. They know the waters like the palm if their hand  and are very clever in finding the best chqnces for a successful trip. \nVery formal and service oriented.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

571958266.name: Dolphin and turtle watching with Carlos in Puerto Escondido!
571958266.author: a TripAdvisor user
571958266.reviewBody: We were two families and booked a boat trip with Carlos hoping to see a few dolphins and turtles. He picked us up on time at 7am at our hotel and first showed us tons of turtles and some phosphorescent plankton. Then he took us far out to a sardine feeding ground where we saw around fifty dolphins jumping and playing round our boat, which was incredible. As if that wasn\'t enough, we had the magical bonus experience of seeing a humpback whale breaching not far from us. It was truly a fantastic trip and one the children will always remember. Carlos was a brilliant guide (and speaks good English) and would highly recommend his boat trip for all ages. A definite highlight of any visit to Puerto Escondido.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

563415456.name: Wonderful morning out on the water
563415456.author: a TripAdvisor user
563415456.reviewBody: Robert was a true professional who was punctual, polite, and clearly an expert at providing a singular experience for his clients. \n\nAfter a couple of beautiful hours on the water we saw SCORES of dolphins, three humpback whales, several sea turtles, and countless birds. Robert and his partner Miguel were full of information about and enthusiasm for the wildlife, which made our experience all the more rich. Additionally, they were adept at handling the boat and were very friendly throughout our experience in Mexico. Highly recommend!

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

516723658.name: A series of unfortunate events
516723658.author: a TripAdvisor user
516723658.reviewBody:
A group of 4 - we waited out the front as he was to meet us at 6.40.. to get on the boat by 7. He arrived at the hotel at 7 then we waited on the beach for about an hour until finally we got on the boat. 
Only 3 fishing rods for 4 people - turns out that didn't matter as we didn't even get to touch the bloody rods! 
Positives - we saw lots of dolphins and turtles!
Negatives - we didn't get to actually fish - there wasn't any communication really.. no fish were caught (we get this happens you're not always lucky) but before we got back to shore he stopped half way and demanded the money (no discount and no apology) and after talking to others we certainly paid top top dollar (2500 pesos). I won't name names just shop around and get a recommendation!

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

508803934.name: Blue Marlin!!!!!!
508803934.author: a TripAdvisor user
508803934.reviewBody:
You want to fish big fish, well that's the place. I went fishing with a local, They call him Yésus and that guy is a real Blue Marlin fisherman.

After 2 hours of fishing, BANG 450 pounds blue Marlin, fighting for 2 hours in alternation with my friend and himself Yésus! What a trill!!!!!!!!

ASK For Yésus at the Marina Nacional

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

445011388.name: Great fishing experience with exceptional guides.
445011388.author: a TripAdvisor user
445011388.reviewBody: Our 2 days started with a taxi to Playa Puerto Angelito at 6:00.  When we arrived our guides, Israel and Juan, were fully ready to go and we were off immediately.  After getting bait from a boat in the bay we headed out roughly 14 miles to the fishing area.  The seas were calm and the weather fair.  Our first day featured several hook-ups for sailfish with one to the boat and released after photos.  That day we thought our dolphin experience was as good as it could get.  The second day the dolphins were absolutely amazing, far exceeding the first day.  Both days we also saw several turtles.  On day 2 we boated and kept a very nice sailfish and had a few others on.  Two spectacular days on the water.  Our guides have a new boat and a new business.  You won\'t go wrong with these 2 guys and their boat the Dorothea.  The great thing about their boat is a large sunshade which keeps everyone cool and comfortable.  That was the main reason we chose these guys and we were very happy we did. We contacted them through Israel at 954-129-67-22 after meeting them on the beach.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

401825033.name: go fishing and see turtles and dolphins
401825033.author: a TripAdvisor user
401825033.reviewBody: get up at 7 am and go to the boat and then we went fishing and everybody get a big Tuna and then we saw snakes and turtles and dolphins i really could recommend the tour

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

354354456.name: Amazing Day
354354456.author: a TripAdvisor user
354354456.reviewBody: Best fishing experience of my life. I am not an avid fishermen but this day I had so much fun. We landed Yellowfin Tuna, and my mate caught a Sail Fish. Arms got a work out. The best fishing experience I think I will ever have.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

332067604.name: I will not go again
332067604.author: a TripAdvisor user
332067604.reviewBody: The boat that we were on was not in the best of shape, it was very uncomfortable for a 4-5 hr fishing trip. I would not do it again.  I did see lots of sea life, which was cool.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

294138426.name: Rooster Fish
294138426.author: a TripAdvisor user
294138426.reviewBody: Levi arranged for us to be picked up at the Vivo Resort. Our goal was to do some light tackle fishing and try to catch Rooster fish since we had already caught a Black Marlin and Sailfish in Huatulco. We left from the Marinero Bay Levi and his assistant were very professional spoke great English and they were very patient and helpful with my sons. We did casting close to shore and where able to catch a couple of Rooster fish and a needle fish. I will definitely be back to fish with Levi.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

197197730.name: Fishing with Rudolfo
197197730.author: a TripAdvisor user
197197730.reviewBody: I\'ve read all the reviews and know most of the fishing captains in PE as I have owned a vacation home there for 7 years now. But I must say Rudolfo is by far the most knowledgeable fishing quide on the sea. Ask anyone in PE including other captains and they always bow to Rudolfo. If approached on the beach to go fishing and you mention his name the sales pitch ends abrutly so even if you do not intend to go fishing and just want to stop the "beach offers" just mention Rudolfo\'s name! We have come to love the man, and the each expediton with him.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

194775095.name: Best 90.00 per couple hands down
194775095.author: a TripAdvisor user
194775095.reviewBody: Where else can you see up close sea turtles, dolphins and humpback whales for 4 hours at this price. No fish but that\'s why they call it fishing. George picked us up at hotel and everything was great. if your searching for large fishing charters and yachts this isn\'t the place to be. If your looking for a close to the water experience, authenticity, kind people this is the place.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

159355577.name: Chon is still a great guy to fish with!!
159355577.author: a TripAdvisor user
159355577.reviewBody: We again fished with Chon during this years trip (2013) to Puerto Escondido.  Again, great service and a super time out on the water.  We (2 couples) fished with Chon 2 days, and caught and released 2 sailfish each day, and it\'s nice to see that he keeps investing back into his business, as his equipment continues to be upgraded each year we fish with him...and it\'s so nice to be treated so well each time out.  And Chon won\'t "blow smoke" at you either.  If the fishing\'s been slow he will tell you...if "green water" has moved into the area he will tell you, and let you know it may be slow...or if it will take a longer ride to find blue water (and thus the pelagic fishes like sailfish and mahi).  But fortunately, finding blue water and fish usually isn\'t a problem in Puerto.  I highly recommend Chon for a quality outing...but keep in mind that he fishes from a panga (24 foot v-hulled boat with a tiller steered outboard) and not some "fancy" cruiser...but it\'s comfortable, and it\'s a fun time with a knowledgeable, very nice man....and you won\'t just be "taken for a boat ride" like some other self-proclaimed guides in the area.  He can be reached at chon.mar@hotmail.com.  And be patient, as sometimes it takes 2 or 3 days for him to get back to you.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

151342833.name: A Great day
151342833.author: a TripAdvisor user
151342833.reviewBody: We very much enjoyed our day fishing with Captain Chon. He knows the spots to go too & will noit head out if the weather is not looking so good. Highly recomend him.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

150627950.name: Captain Chon
150627950.author: a TripAdvisor user
150627950.reviewBody: This wonderful man who speaks good English has his boat (launcha) named Yadira, at Puerto Angelita , but  Chon can be found at Carrizalillo beach during the day. We have known Chon for five years and have gone dolphin, turtle,whale watching with him many times. He only takes people out to sea when he thinks there will be sealife to see. Chon will answer every question you may have on the beach or on the sea. He readily will answer cultural questions and is a special fellow to meet. Look for Chon if you wish to fish or to see sealife. He is an A+ guy.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

150307734.name: Capitan Chon
150307734.author: a TripAdvisor user
150307734.reviewBody: Look for Chon or his boat, Yadira. Great guide and great company. He will not drag you out if there if the fishing is poor.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

150024614.name: The best fishing/ nature experience ever!!
150024614.author: a TripAdvisor user
150024614.reviewBody: I have fished throughout the Caribbean and Gulf Coast and I have never had a better day on the water. Landed a sail fish, tune, mahi and witnessed a school of dolphins, sea turtles and a whale as we coasted through the blue calm waters off Puerto Escondido. This is a MUST for everyone who visits this wonderful place.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

146480273.name: Good ocean fishing at reasonable cost
146480273.author: a TripAdvisor user
146480273.reviewBody: I have been fishing in Puerto Escondido for approximately 15 years and seldom come away with no fish.  Sail fish, dorado and tuna are the primarly sport fisheries and generally you can pick up one or a few of some fish.  The waters are generally calm and just a beautiful place to fish.  Often you will see turtles, whales or dolphins while fishing.  A great experience.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

146476806.name: Robert\'s Sportfishing
146476806.author: a TripAdvisor user
146476806.reviewBody: We\'ve made 5 trips to Puerto Escondido over the past 4 years.  We love the place.  For sportfishing and dolphin watching there is no better guide than Roberto Martinez Bautista.  Roberto.  He speaks English well, has excellent equipment and knows how to find dolphins, turtles, manta ray or if sportfishing the big one...   You can generally find Roberto at Playa Carrizalillo or Playa Manzanillo.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

125898434.name: Lorenzo is numero uno!
125898434.author: a TripAdvisor user
125898434.reviewBody:
Best day ever!!  We had such a great time we went twice.  Lorenzo is an extremely competent, experienced fisherman.  His boat is a 26 foot with a 250 HP out board.  The boat is very comfortable with great seating and he supplied sandwiches, cold water, soft drinks and beer.  We caught sailfish, tuna and had an amazing dolphin show.

He has good English and is very professional and accommodating.   He even came and picked us up!  His price was $60 per hour which was what most charged.  He's the man!

He can be reached at[--]

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

121856226.name: Peurto fishing is exciting
121856226.author: a TripAdvisor user
121856226.reviewBody: Puerto Escondido fishing offers many opportunities to anglers.  You don\'t have to be a die-hard angler to enjoy a day on the water because there are plenty of things to see besides fish, i.e. turtles, dolphins, whales, and many species of birds.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

121732504.name: Omars Sport fishing is the best
121732504.author: a TripAdvisor user
121732504.reviewBody: I have been out with Omar and Isreal twice and I must say that it was simply an awesome experience both times.  Omar tells me when it is time to go out so there is an excellent chance to catch sailfish and dorado.  If he thinks the time is not good he freely tells me that. How honest is that?  Very professional very patient good english and super knowledge.  If you are looking for a wonderful fishing experience in Puerto Escondido, in my opinion, you can do no better than my friends Omar and Isreal.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

120065535.name: Amazing experience!
120065535.author: a TripAdvisor user
120065535.reviewBody: Never caught such big fish: 10lb mahi mahi, yellowfin tuna. Lots of fun

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

119860188.name: awesome
119860188.author: a TripAdvisor user
119860188.reviewBody: Puerto escondido is a place(1 1/2 hr bus ride) from Huatulco, you can spend months.has evrything, from surfing to fishing and nigth life..been to Puerto 8 yrs in a row now..just love it.best is the Zicatela strip..many restaraunt to choose from..Weather?no place in the world so sure of  sun evry day,,,onother place to visit that is only 1/2hr from Huatulco is Zepolite....is a nudist beach,,but is nude is optional...very nice place

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

118075292.name: Chon is a great guy to fish with when Puerto Escondido
118075292.author: a TripAdvisor user
118075292.reviewBody:
If you are looking for a very nice and competent guide to fish with in Puerto Escondido, Capt. Chon Cruz will serve you well.  We have have used Chon's services for 3 years, encompassing 6 fishing trips, and have enjoyed every outing.

Chon prefers bluewater fishing (i.e. dorado (mahi-mahi), sailfish, tuna), and that is his expertise.  You fish from a panga (24 foot v-bottom boat with a bimini top) that can hold up to 4 people plus him and his 1st mate.  He supplies reasonably good equipment and line, the tackle, fuel, and bait, all for a reasonable price.  We paid 400 pesos per hour (4 hour minimum) last February for a 5 hour trip for 4 of us (so about $185 US total plus a nice tip).  We boated 3 dorado, all right at 45 lbs and caught and released 3 sailfish.  The previous week we went out for 4 hours and caught 1 nice dorado of around 25 lbs.  We were skunked on only 1 trip out with him in February 2010, but at that time there was not any good bluewater to be found.

Another good point of fishing there is you typically only go 5 to 10 miles offshore...and sometimes not that to find fish...and usually get to see 2 or 3 species of dolphins, dozens of Olive-Ridleys sea turtles, offshore sea birds...if you are into such things (I am as a biologist).

To get hold of Chon go to Playa Carrazalillo where his wife runs a small restaurant and ask around for him or his email is:  chon.mar@hotmail.com.  He is a very nice man and competent guide.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

74683566.name: We had a GREAT time...
74683566.author: a TripAdvisor user
74683566.reviewBody:
Went fishing with Lorenzo.  Great time.  Caught a Yellow Fin Tuna.

We went back to a restaurant on the beach and they prepared tuna tartare and grilled tuna for us.

Great day.  Ready to go again.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

54826778.name: You need to ask for RAY!
54826778.author: a TripAdvisor user
54826778.reviewBody: Ray is by far the best person to go fishing with, he can be found at Playa Angelita or Carrazilillo Beach, just ask for Ray.  There is also a restaurant down at Angelita that will cook your fish.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion 2 Norte num. 617

667254282.name: Very clean and interesting
667254282.author: a TripAdvisor user
667254282.reviewBody: A great selection of fruit, veg and fish.   Flowers were also really wonderful.  The people were very helpful and gracious. I got 2 nice sunglass cases that were a special Oaxacan type of weaving. \nThey filleted 2 red snapper for us that we bbq\'d and were delicious

658137304.name: Great place experience local foods.
658137304.author: a TripAdvisor user
658137304.reviewBody: Great place to experience authentic Mexican traditional foods and restaurants. Also, fantastic place to shop for fresh fruits, vegetables, seafood, and spices. We usually visited the market a minimum of once a week. The venders re always friendly and helpful.

652427080.name: Disappointing
652427080.author: a TripAdvisor user
652427080.reviewBody: Having been to other markets, I found this one disappointing although large. Great selection of fruits, vegetables, meats, etc, but the rest was of poor quality for the most part. Found nothing to purchase except the amazing fresh fruit and vegetables.

643879672.name: Cool place
643879672.author: a TripAdvisor user
643879672.reviewBody: Lots of different food to try and random souvenirs can be purchased here too. Would recommend if in area

640245942.name: Great Market
640245942.author: a TripAdvisor user
640245942.reviewBody: One of the better markets in Mexico.  Lots of fresh fish and vegetables. Bring a big mercardo bag when you go.

611963764.name: Full sensory explosion- Sunday morning at the market
611963764.author: a TripAdvisor user
611963764.reviewBody: Just as you finish climbing up the initial stairs to enter the market you are hit with the full display of amazing fresh cut flowers, the sweet smell of fresh guava, herbs and chilies that make your taste buds tingle just by seeing them... Then,  you realize that you will never want to leave this place. \nThe people were very welcoming, patient and not pushy at all. All obviously proud of their products. Great food and people.

607708625.name: Disappointing at best
607708625.author: a TripAdvisor user
607708625.reviewBody: Do not expect a full on mercado.  Buncha restos and aisles of repetitive bolsas, shirts and trinkets from China.  Not one of the great mercados as in Merida (Leon) or in CDMX.  Not worth the time.

554278319.name: Big Market, Center of Town. Go there.
554278319.author: a TripAdvisor user
554278319.reviewBody: You definitely need to check-out this market and the surrounding neighborhood when you\'re in town. If you are lucky, you will taste some amazing tamales, some crunchy grasshoppers and some killer mole. Those of you who have kitchens and like to cook have zero excuses. BTW. You don\'t have to wait for the weekend, the market is open everyday.

546732953.name: Food and souvenirs
546732953.author: a TripAdvisor user
546732953.reviewBody: The market has basically food, clothing, daily essentials ans souvenirs.  I recommend souvenirs.  If you want a Puerto Escondido t-shirt "El Mercado is the spot to buy"

542790861.name: Huge market
542790861.author: a TripAdvisor user
542790861.reviewBody: Located in el centro this is a large number of stalls under a corrugated , or actually two roofs. There are dozens of stalls with seating to consume some local cuisine, many locals enjoying their meals.\nThe market is clean and although as Canadians we are not accustomed to seeing all parts of the animal out on display that is how beef , pork, chicken, goat, turkey, and fish are presented here. The abundance of fresh vegetables and fruits stacked beautifully and such variety is amazing as is the quality of these items. Fresh herbs looking just picked and vast arrays of flowers appeal to your sense of smell. There is also some local mezcal with some containing even a scorpion.\nAs we continue on we find a barber shop , hand knitted baby clothes and local honey along side the usual cheap tshirts and various souvenir offerings.

472955875.name: Rich Human Experience
472955875.author: a TripAdvisor user
472955875.reviewBody: We visited this bustling Oaxacan market with Gina Machorro whose knowledge and contacts are superb. She first gave us the proper local way to visit by putting us aboard a local collectivo, a unique experience all in itself. Gina, a wonderful local guide, took us through the various sections of this well-organized sprawling market, showing us what was being displayed, leading us on a very generous tasting tour and filling our bags ( again provided by Gina and still being used back at home), with all sorts of courtesy treats, fruits, vegetables etc. This was a high energy, low risk, colourful cultural experience that immersed us in the wonderful local Oaxaca community. For a few minutes, we were no longer strangers or tourists, but participants in a fine community experience. Interesting, apparently, a second market is soon to open very close\n to Playa Zicatela. And yes, we did enjoy the roasted grasshoppers, and the licuados, and the bananas, and the ......!

457188664.name: The real shopping mall
457188664.author: a TripAdvisor user
457188664.reviewBody: This is the place to see how true shopping malls function. Give at least an hour to wander over all of the stalls to watch the action, see what everyone is selling and even make a few purchases (bring pesos). The place is a treasure from the past. I hope it never changes (there is also a shiny new huge grocery store in town).

403033748.name: Benito Juarez Mercado
403033748.author: a TripAdvisor user
403033748.reviewBody:
A wonderful place to walk around and enjoy the entire experience. It is a true local mercado so appreciate even the unknown. I tasted Chapulín ( grasshopper) today for the first time. Crunchy, spicy, salty & apparently a delicacy & very high protein.
Go to one of the juice stalls & let them make you a delicious Green drink or a wonderful fruit one. You can stay & take in all the hustle and bustle or they'll offer a giant to go cup.
Best place to buy seafood, fresh Oaxacan cheeses, fruit, veggies & flowers. You can eat there or close to it for very little.
I have a wee bit of trouble walking through the meat section because I don't eat it & it hangs without refrigeration.
In the rear is a section for gifts & trinkets. Some textiles as well.
I love the mercado & try to go often. A real taste of Mexico & the wonderful people there!👌💃🌶

391849474.name: Chef\'s delight
391849474.author: a TripAdvisor user
391849474.reviewBody: We immensely enjoyed walking around El Mercado picking up fish, Oaxaca cheese, and fruit.  It\'s a must if you like seeing new things.

388887986.name: Immerse yourself in culture
388887986.author: a TripAdvisor user
388887986.reviewBody:
It's not just shopping, it's an experience!  

Tips: 
-Visit on a Saturday or Wednesday morning.
-Bring shopping bags, save the planet!
-Stroll up and down ALL of the aisles and don't miss anything
-It's a feast for your eyes so became full where you walk, the ground is a maze.
-If you don't leave with fresh food or a new hat you missed out!
-Buy a liquidado at the end to keep
you cool.
-Walk up the road a bit and buy the best coffee beans ever!  
-Lastly, take a stroll downhill on Oaxaca Ave. and take in the culture.

375183544.name: Such a great experience
375183544.author: a TripAdvisor user
375183544.reviewBody:
The Mercado ( market) is a really cool place for everyone. Being from Canada it is not something we were use toseeing.
You can get everything from seafood, meats fresh vegetables/fruits, cheeses, handcrafted items, clothes, toys flowers, etc
The market is covered but open aired. Best time to go is in the morning when it is not too hot and there is more selection. 
It is open seven days a weeks. Very clean
Some chefs from a couple of local restaurants and cooking schools offer tours on Saturday mornings
I believe El Mexykan cooking school and Almoraduz restaurant offer this tour.
Spend a couple of hours here, it is very interesting.

343654410.name: The Best Open-Air Market in Mexico
343654410.author: a TripAdvisor user
343654410.reviewBody: An endless array of fresh fruits & vegetables, fish, poultry, air-dried meats, spices & condiments, Oaxacan coffee, chocolate, and Mescal, plus a massive number of food stands and juice bars. You can also find textiles, clothes, shoes, bags, and toys for the kids. Go in the morning when things are in full gear and plan on spending 2-3 hours at least.

335259958.name: Lively market
335259958.author: a TripAdvisor user
335259958.reviewBody: It is far away from everything else but it is worth visiting to see a real local market. I always go to the chocolate store right outside the Mercado to pick up coffee, hot chocolate mixes, and mole sauce. Inside the market, you can find every possible produce for very cheap.

258267396.name: Worth a visit if you want a nice cheap lunch in a comedor or to stroll around for a while.
258267396.author: a TripAdvisor user
258267396.reviewBody: Its a bit away from everything else, but worth it if you want to get away from the beach for a half day. The comedores in the market will give a nice local tasty lunch for a great price, and you can stroll around the market for a while after to pick up some souvenirs, t-shirts, etc.

249248742.name: Don\'t miss it!
249248742.author: a TripAdvisor user
249248742.reviewBody: We visited El Mercado on a busy Saturday morning, shopping for fresh fruits and vegetables for our ten-day stay.  We bought lots of great food, including a large fillet of mahi mahi (enough for two delicious meals).  We also bought a few other things, but all in all what a great experience!

246429220.name: Great Place to Shop and Browse
246429220.author: a TripAdvisor user
246429220.reviewBody: we spent 5 weeks in Puerto and shopped for our vegetables and fruit on a regular basis at the Mercado. You can find any type of fruit and vegetables under the sun and they are always fresh. We were amazed as to how much we could bye for very little money. The visit alone is very worthwhile as you will see species of fruit and vegetables that you won\'t find elsewhere.\nI even sampled dried and salted grasshoppers. You name it they got it at this amazing market. Open seven days a week. Tortillas made by hand, freshly squeezed juices, fish, prawns, meat etc. Go early in the morning as it can get warm under the permanent roof.

245171644.name: Very Clean
245171644.author: a TripAdvisor user
245171644.reviewBody: We have been to Mercado\'s in Acapulco and many other places in the world this was by far the cleanest on we have been in it is very fun to seel all the little booths with there goods no need to speak allot of Spanish you can just walk around and take in the views

173644562.name: Real Mexican market!
173644562.author: a TripAdvisor user
173644562.reviewBody: This is what you want to experience real culture! It is an amazing place to see artisans, food, produce, clothing, jewelry and more. We loved walking around and just seeing all the different things. We also bought our produce there because it looked much better than the local supermarket. We bought hand made tortillas here as we\'ll and they were fantastic!\nNot so sure I\'d want to buy meat here... Very extreme compared to Canadian health standards! \nWe also ate at one of the little restaurants in the food court and it was very good.

148073504.name: Exciting array of lovely food and strange accessories for the beach and home
148073504.author: a TripAdvisor user
148073504.reviewBody: Goto shop or go to look. So much variety offered by vendors. It\'s koto haggle here. Magnificent oaxaca ( string) cheese is the freshest In puerto - when you ask! Flowers are their best on Saturday and beautiful everyday. Go early morning or the heat will overwhelm you.

672266848.name: The sweetest of retreats
672266848.author: a TripAdvisor user
672266848.reviewBody: As an aerialist, I\u2019m no stranger to pushing my own limits and meeting new, fantastic people. My trip to Casa Chango was that and so much more! The training was phenomenal, the food was exquisite, and the experiences were unforgettable. My aerialist family is even bigger now, and I can\u2019t wait to go back and visit them!

address.streetAddress: Heroes Oaxaquenos S/N

670115297.name: Great active vacation in beautiful place with amazing people
670115297.author: a TripAdvisor user
670115297.reviewBody: I spent a week training for aerial silks at casa chango and loved it! Worked on some skills, met some great people, enjoyed some delicious fresh local healthy cuisine, chilled by the pool or at the beach, went to see baby turtles go to the sea, swam in a bioluminescent lagoon... So many memories. The place is beautiful and it\'s a great opportunity to train and vacay. I\'ll admit it was a bit too hot for me but it didn\'t seem to bother anyone else so go for it.

address.streetAddress: Heroes Oaxaquenos S/N

665090558.name: Best thing I\'ve done for myself
665090558.author: a TripAdvisor user
665090558.reviewBody: I had a week at Sweet Retreats when I was going through a tough time. I can\'t think of a better thing to do. Worked out, eat amazing food, sleep and enjoyed the company and beautiful beach every day. Best therapy as well as the best fitness retreat. Keri always have a different tip and perspective to teach. Going back for 2 weeks this year. Can\'t wait.

address.streetAddress: Heroes Oaxaquenos S/N

664366153.name: Best adventurous family vacation ever!
664366153.author: a TripAdvisor user
664366153.reviewBody: Sweet Retreats and Casa Chango hosted a fantastically fun week for my kids and me. As a hobby aerialist, I was drawn to booking the trip because it was the unique mix of what I was looking for in a vacation\u2014 sun, swimming, beaches, fitness, delicious healthy food, and plenty of kid activities. I got what I was hoping for and more. Adult time training (and date nights if you go with a partner) while my kids were thoroughly entertained. And family time swimming at the beach, releasing baby sea turtles, family Acro yoga and more. The accommodations are safe and clean. The food is fresh and each meal has so much variety that even picky eaters will be appeased. As an added bonus, the other families and the hosts\u2014 Kerri and Stu and guest teacher Chloe \u2014were super fun to hang out with! My kids loved the vacation as much as I did. Mom win!

address.streetAddress: Heroes Oaxaquenos S/N

664104867.name: Amazing and life changing aerial retreat!
664104867.author: a TripAdvisor user
664104867.reviewBody: What an amazing experience! Kerri and Stuart made everything about this so easy - from providing detailed information and transportation, to cooking delicious, healthy food, and welcoming us all with open arms. The classes with Jenn Bruyer were phenomenal and I learned so much! The optional excursions/activities and the photo shoots were incredibly fun icing on the cake. I can\'t wait to go back!

address.streetAddress: Heroes Oaxaquenos S/N

664049546.name: Great Times, Great People
664049546.author: a TripAdvisor user
664049546.reviewBody:
Casa Chango was an amazing experience !!!
I had a great time learning new skills at the workshop and I met some nice people ! 
Loved my time at Casa Chango, the food was delicious, already missing it. 

Jenn Bruyer is a great teacher and an amazing aerialist ! Thank you Jenn for everything you taught us.  

The activities in our day off were all you could ask for !!! Thankyou for an awesome week !!!

address.streetAddress: Heroes Oaxaquenos S/N

664021048.name: Sweet Retreats is your way to fun, health, play and relaxation!
664021048.author: a TripAdvisor user
664021048.reviewBody:
Absolutely the best time you will have in your life!! Aerialist or not there is a retreat to fit that of anyone looking into doing something great for your body and having fun while at it. Truly a treat for the mind, body and soul! Bring the family along as they offer a retreat alongside with the children and bond with a class each day that doesn't seem like a workout at all! You are being taught by fantastic, knowledgeable instructors that know what they are doing.

The meals included are freshly prepared and can be catered to dietary need, restriction, etc. Stuart and his sous chef definitely whip up delicious, healthy nourishment after those workouts. Another perk to looking forward to! Have your meals at the common grounds and be ready to meet some wonderful people. I'm missing it all already as well as the food!

Beautiful grounds all around and the staff are accommodating and hospitable. Any need or concern during your stay they have you covered. Extra activities, excursion, amenities they will lead you in the right direction. At the end of your stay you'll be looking forward to returning. Rest assured you will be feeling relaxed, rejuvenated and in absolute bliss. This place makes you feel at welcome and at home. Thank you Kerri and Stu for your kindness, warmth and hospitality. I will be back.

address.streetAddress: Heroes Oaxaquenos S/N

657194188.name: Locals Beach
657194188.author: a TripAdvisor user
657194188.reviewBody: Walk or take a cab down the long road to the beach from Calle Benito Juarez. This is a locals beach with a protective point sheltering a small fishing boat harbor. Very safe for swimming and snorkeling. Many beachfront restaurants with nice views.

654849713.name: Lovely beach
654849713.author: a TripAdvisor user
654849713.reviewBody: Great beach, not to many steps down to it, but it can be busy.\nLots of boats going in and out. east side seems to be quieter.

654361285.name: Local Beach
654361285.author: a TripAdvisor user
654361285.reviewBody: Beautiful view from up top.  A few restaurants to hangout at.  A number of fishing boats are tied down in the water so it can be busy in the morning or early evening as they come and go.  Steep walk up and down.

653571061.name: Nice beach for swimming
653571061.author: a TripAdvisor user
653571061.reviewBody: It took us about 30 minutes to get there from Zicatela. we went on a Sunday and as it is a public beach we found it very crowded and extremely noisy, we did not swim there. All around  there are many beach restaurants, we chose one and the waitress sat us in a dirty uneven table in a dark corner, promising to give us a better place but after 20 minutes waiting we better left. Then we went to another restaurant where we ate but the food was not good and we believe expensive for a rustic place like that. When we left late afternoon,it was completely dark outside and full of mosquitoes, fortunately we kept the cell phone number  of the taxi that drove us there so we called him and he picked us up about 30 minutes later. We sae many people desperate for a taxi. Maybe it is nice in weekdays but we do not know so far so we chose not to go again. We do not recommend this beach, neither the restaurants there.

653282767.name: Boat trips and snorkling
653282767.author: a TripAdvisor user
653282767.reviewBody: A lovely small beach where you can snorkle at a living reef just by wading in! We took a boat trip with Omar\'s Fishing Trips to see dolphins and other sea life, and then stayed at this beach when we finished.

649747901.name: This is where to catch a panga for fishing.
649747901.author: a TripAdvisor user
649747901.reviewBody: Beautiful little cove with boats coming and going all the time.  I had a great fishing trip with Johnny, who is an associate of Omar.  They have a nice boat with a sun roof.  Johnny actually likes fishing -- this is not always guaranteed with guides.  400 pesos.

642922189.name: Please save yourself!!
642922189.author: a TripAdvisor user
642922189.reviewBody: The beach is lovely, but if you eat at the first restaurant as you come down the to your right, you may see your meal later. In the state of amazing Oaxacan cuisine, this was food prepared by an angry auto mechanic.

642109798.name: Snorkelling Haven
642109798.author: a TripAdvisor user
642109798.reviewBody: Only a few stairs, great calm bay area to snorkel and swim. Shallow for a while, beautiful waters and not too many stairs. Highly recommend!

636724994.name: One of the prettiest beaches around and with good snorkeling!
636724994.author: a TripAdvisor user
636724994.reviewBody: We actually went to Playa Manzanillo, adjacent to Angelito. The beaches are in a nice little bay. We sat in lounge chairs under the shade of palm trees in La Palapa de Carrasco Restaurante. We left our belongings there, and went snorkeling, on the left side, away from the boats. The boats are mostly over at Puerto Angelito.  The water was a little murky, and it was little wavy, but we saw lots of fish. If it hadn\'t been wavy we would\'ve gone amongst the rocks on the left, and it would\'ve been better.

622241159.name: Hanging at the ocean
622241159.author: a TripAdvisor user
622241159.reviewBody: If you want to experience authentic Mexico, head to Playa Angelito. Swim, watch the fishing boats come and go or hang at one of the authentic Mexican restaurants!

621595746.name: Great little hideaway.
621595746.author: a TripAdvisor user
621595746.reviewBody: This place is paradise. Easy to get to. Quite a few restaurants and businesses for fishing. You can relax there all day and have some a Margarita or two. A little bit of a walk down to the beach from the parking lot. The parking lot is in rough shape especially after heavy rains.

591043996.name: Escondido Sport Fishing with Ray Sanchez!
591043996.author: a TripAdvisor user
591043996.reviewBody: Wow!  What an amazing morning of adventure.  Not only did we get to swim with dolphins, witness sea turtles mating, and enjoy being out on the water with an experienced and engaging captain, but we also caught 3 different types of fish!  Upon returning to shore with our haul, Captain Ray Sanchez arranged for the fish to be cleaned a cooked at Restaurante Edith, located on Playa Angelito.  This was truly the highlight of our culinary pursuits in PE!  We highly recommend this experience.  Looking forward it next time we are in Puerto Escondido!

583913020.name: Too crowed but nice, no beach lounge chairs and umbrellas
583913020.author: a TripAdvisor user
583913020.reviewBody: The only places to seat and relax is at the restaurants that have chairs and tables and good food, but no lounge chairs and umbrellas by the beach.

568542442.name: One night in town.
568542442.author: a TripAdvisor user
568542442.reviewBody:
We stayed at Hotel Cordelia which could only be on the water if it were in the water :).

So small and picturesque.  We ate at the palapa / restaurant under the hotel for dinner and breakfast.  Total for oceanfront room and two meals was less than $100 us. 

Room was spartan - but in a very positive way.  Clean - nice balcony.

Amazing find, tough road from airport...but totally worth the effort!

Pictures below: from beach, from balcony, and friendly beach dog at the restaurant.

566939391.name: Great place when boats not around.
566939391.author: a TripAdvisor user
566939391.reviewBody: Beautiful place to go when the fishing boats are not around (smell of gas and oil can be very strong).  Water is beautiful and a great place to relax and swim.

566735541.name: Nice beach to visit.
566735541.author: a TripAdvisor user
566735541.reviewBody: Truly enjoyed our stay at the beach when the fishing boats were not in use.  Calm water to swim in, even snorkel.  However, when the fishing boats are active, the smell of burning gas/oil is a real turnoff. No boats = excellent place to relax, enjoy food and wobbly pops or drinks.

565652665.name: Beach
565652665.author: a TripAdvisor user
565652665.reviewBody: A great area to swim and relax. Inexpensive beach umbrellas with good food and friendly people. Just a short walk from taxi drop off.

564110276.name: Beach Nice
564110276.author: a TripAdvisor user
564110276.reviewBody: Beach was very nice. We rented a chair from the first vendor crossing from manzanillo beach. Drinks were good but thank god we did not eat anything. Rent chair drink then use bathroom, all part of deal. I asked to use the facilities and it as out back, totally expected & normal. Told me it was black hut again not surprised, however opened door & flies were buzzing around a feces covered toilet & I decided I would decline. On way back the offered an area for me to wash so of course I took then up on it. No soap is sight anywhere so now I\u2019m wondering on them using said facilities & serving food. Oh my I would certainly never suggest anyone stop at this vendor. I have traveled most of Mexico & Central America but this was one of the worst.

564028668.name: Great beach
564028668.author: a TripAdvisor user
564028668.reviewBody: This is a beach used mainly by locals and Mexican tourists and family\'s. There are several food places with very friendly locals. And surprisingly, some of the best snorkeling I\'ve ever seen. You can rent masks and fins from any cafe and just walk into the water. It\'s teeming with fish of all sorts.

563789980.name: booked fishing trip
563789980.author: a TripAdvisor user
563789980.reviewBody: walked down early in the morning and was able to book a fishing trip (5 hrs) for only $140.00 .captain freddie was very nice and worked hard but alas we struck out. still had a nice time (my wife didn\'t get sea sick).

562971980.name: Fresh fried oysters!
562971980.author: a TripAdvisor user
562971980.reviewBody: We walked from our hotel to Restaurant Bozum (not sure if I spelled it correctly) on the right edge of the beach.   We asked for oysters and we had to wait for someone to catch them - not very long and they were fantastic!   We were very impressed and happy!

559764072.name: Best vibe in Puerto Escondido
559764072.author: a TripAdvisor user
559764072.reviewBody: Love love love the Beach. It\'s quaint fun pretty and full of love laughter families and friendship and literally the freshest Seafood I have eaten in my life.... Minutes old! It\'s an easy beach to get there we would walk but you can take a cheap taxi from anywhere in the city to get there. Street signage is very good for Puerto Anjelo. It\'s such an alive Beach Fisher men fishing, children swimming, families eating and playing, so full of joy, I love this beach. It\'s not very long more of a destination beach find a spot and park your butt. The food offered here is exceptional. The vibe is relaxed What a wonderful way to spend a day.

558342992.name: Dirty beach and expensive services
558342992.author: a TripAdvisor user
558342992.reviewBody: As a national tourist I was really upset to see human waste floating on the beach, and trash in the sand. On top of that, the services are very expensive in this and most of the bahias in Oaxaca I and my family visited. They sell very expensive tours to supposedly watch dolphins and turtles, and at most, you see a couple of turtles copulating, nothing else. They also don\'t provide good safety vests, especially for kids. It was so sad and unfortunate to see this happening in one of the most beautiful states of my country, Oaxaca. The government needs to do something to clean the beaches, and to get rid of predatory behaviors of the locals towards the tourists, regulating prices and forcing them to offer a 100% safe experience as well as avoid selling experiences that you\'re not likely to have (e.g. charging a lot because you\'re assured to watch dolphins and turtles, when the probability of watching them is very low).

556391512.name: Loaded with buses
556391512.author: a TripAdvisor user
556391512.reviewBody: Supposedly a nice area, the beach is a small bay with clear waters and nice sand. Perfect for swimming, but..... it is the place where buses loaded of people come to spend the day. There are kiosks with food from one end of the beach to the other end, some with loud music, tons of tables and chairs to accommodate everyone. If you are looking for a quiet and not totally crowded beach, avoid this one.

555569961.name: Amazing Spot!!!
555569961.author: a TripAdvisor user
555569961.reviewBody: Beautiful place to sit and relax - white sand, blue water, not too many people when we were there. A few people were in the water, and plenty of seafood around

555062121.name: Playa manzanillo
555062121.author: a TripAdvisor user
555062121.reviewBody: The other half of the beach to playa Angelito is mazanillo. Same but better for swimming as no boats on this side. Lovely family friendly beach with restaurants and snorkel rental facilities. Also one of the only beaches in the area with no strong waves.

548620175.name: Lovely little beach with some parking
548620175.author: a TripAdvisor user
548620175.reviewBody: You can park a bit closer to this beach and avoid some stairs but you still need to walk quite a ways to get to the water.  It is a port so lots of fishing boats and little restaurants to eat at that offer shade to customers.

533248207.name: Great place to have a beer and watch the fisherman launch their boats
533248207.author: a TripAdvisor user
533248207.reviewBody: This little Bay is mainly for a fisherman to store and launch their boats. I enjoyed a beer while watching them launch. Be prepared to help because everybody jumps up when they start pushing the boat towards the water. Not a great place to hang out but fun to watch the action!

517415177.name: More a port than a beach
517415177.author: a TripAdvisor user
517415177.reviewBody: Puerto angelito has it\'s charm for lunch and whenever you want to take a bote to go fishing, see the dolphins in the morning or other. It is not such a nice place to be only in the beach it has a much more comercial aspect and many vendors that will interrupt your peace. Come only if necessary. \nThis beach has no waves so if you have kids this can be an option!

516421078.name: Sweet little beach!
516421078.author: a TripAdvisor user
516421078.reviewBody: I always get to this beach a couple of times on every visit. \nLittle baby waves, a small cove ringed by seafood restaurants, boat rides available, but there\'s nothing like sitting by the water\'s edge and letting the gentle little waves wash over you. \nLove it!

514489237.name: Great bay and food
514489237.author: a TripAdvisor user
514489237.reviewBody: We went to the left side as you come down to the beach. That is MANZANILLO beach. Slightly less crowded and with an adorable view. We ate and used the lounges at Isla Manzanillo Restaurant. Good food and great coconuts.\n\n

513819776.name: Almost Virgin
513819776.author: a TripAdvisor user
513819776.reviewBody: Nice quiet beach to see the bravery of de "pacific" ocean. Basic need satisfactors available : wc services, food, beer and wifi. Highly recommended.

511869887.name: no longer has charm
511869887.author: a TripAdvisor user
511869887.reviewBody: visited this beach many years ago. Now it is overcrowded and although it has natural beauty crowding makes it unpleasant. I wish I never returned to see it the way it is now

494433538.name: Nice Beach w/ Overpriced Food
494433538.author: a TripAdvisor user
494433538.reviewBody: We drove to the beach from our hotel (about 15-20 minutes from downtown Puerto Escondido). The beach is good for swimming because the waves are not too big. The downside is that there are a lot of boat tours which means the boats take up half the beach. You either have to pay for parking or pay to eat at a restaurant, so we sat at a restaurant table... but the food was ok at best and it was way overpriced. \n* We did take a private one hour boat ride to see the Sea Turtles in the ocean and get a tour of the other nearby beaches for 500 pesos. Totally worth it!

488440557.name: Too crowded to be fun.
488440557.author: a TripAdvisor user
488440557.reviewBody: There are three great beaches near each other here, and this one was pretty much seething with people. Better to go to Playa Carrizalillo instead.

483830919.name: beautiful clear waters in a pleasant cove
483830919.author: a TripAdvisor user
483830919.reviewBody: This small beach is good for swimming and if like seafood there\'s plenty. If you give spanish a try and ask for any help the locals are more than willing to help you along. You can reach this cove by boat from the main playa principal beach of Puerto Escondido or walk to it down long and fairly steep paved steps. It is worth the walk. It is beautiful. It\'s usually fairly quiet here but Sunday tends to be "Beach day" for all the local Mexicans. They love enjoying themselves adults and children alike but if you would rather a more tranquil experience choose a working day.

475322327.name: Beautiful beach
475322327.author: a TripAdvisor user
475322327.reviewBody: Watch out for the boats! But otherwise it is really beautiful beach with crystal clear water. Nice for both swimming and snorkeling

467892809.name: February
467892809.author: a TripAdvisor user
467892809.reviewBody: Beach very good restaurant very bad we sit and wait to have drink but take 30 minutes to take our drinks order to have a food 2 hours we love the beach , but that\'s it .

462664445.name: Smaller beach good for swimming
462664445.author: a TripAdvisor user
462664445.reviewBody: We are staying in zicatela but the waves are too strong for swimming so we tried out Angelita. Took a taxi there. There are a few restaurants along the beach. Ours wanted us to spend 400 pesos in order to use their lawn chairs for free.  We ended up only spending 315 pesos and they didn\'t squabble about it. We went during the week Nd it was busy. I understand diet is very packed on the weekends when the local families come for the day.

460005688.name: Small beach that\'s great for families
460005688.author: a TripAdvisor user
460005688.reviewBody:
I was drawn to this beach because the waves in zicatela can be intimidating at the least. When I arrived I realized that this looked more like a pool than a beach and it was packed with people. It was difficult to even find a section of water to swim in. 

There are a lot of locals around here as well as families with their kids...I can see how they would be attracted to a place like this. Since it was crowded, it was tough to find a place to leave my belongings where I wasn't afraid that someone was going to steal it...this definitely took away from my experience. I ate some fish at one of the nearby restaurants (advertising wifi) and had one of the worst pieces of fish in my life. 

People will try to sell you things, just like anywhere you visit...what shocked me is how often the same person will ask you the same thing...just a heads up if you're sensitive to that kind of thing. Oh and it also costs 5 pesos to go to the bathroom...unless you don't mind the sea :/

459461599.name: Best day on quiet beach.
459461599.author: a TripAdvisor user
459461599.reviewBody: Nice little beach with warm clean water, little restaurants and amazing views. Have a delicious coconut or beer and watch beautiful sunset.

456598778.name: This was our departure point for a boat cruise, so glad we stayed for food (garlic shrimp) and tequila sunrises.
456598778.author: a TripAdvisor user
456598778.reviewBody: This is a rare beach in Puerto Escondido where the waves are not strong. It is a picturesque cove with gentle water where the locals seem to come to the beach. Power boats pull in and out all the time, but know how to avoid the swimmers.  There are a couple little restaurants, we had such a nice time... it\'s beyond pretty.

453201794.name: Favorite small beach ....steps down and closes up at dark.
453201794.author: a TripAdvisor user
453201794.reviewBody: This special quaint beach has local families with their palapas serving food and drinks for years. The prices are economical and we always feel welcome. The bay is generally calm so perfect for snorkeling with few surfers. We loved having a swim and cerviche here everyday during our stay at Hotel Ben-zaa which is just up the hill - approx 15 minute walk. We love supporting the local Mexican economy while visiting Mexico

448401278.name: Great food but overcrowded
448401278.author: a TripAdvisor user
448401278.reviewBody: Worth visiting if you in Puerto for few days, mainly food wise. Beach is thiny and unbelievably overcrowded.

446577650.name: Busy, crowded and not great for swimming
446577650.author: a TripAdvisor user
446577650.reviewBody: This is a busy port for some of the commercial and sport fishing fleet in Puerto Escondido.  There is a lot of traffic on the water which all comes ashore eventually since there is no actual dock.  It\'s a busy place and, as such, the beach isn\'t really great for sunning and/or swimming.  The boaters seem very aware of the few swimmers in the water but it is still an unsafe situation for swimming.  There are many facilities around the beach for eating and drinking and there are some businesses for water sport rentals.

446289712.name: Not a nice beach
446289712.author: a TripAdvisor user
446289712.reviewBody: This beach is crowded with people and boats. It is small and not well maintained. I would look for another beach

437253102.name: Dirty
437253102.author: a TripAdvisor user
437253102.reviewBody: Don\'t waste time going to Puerto Angelito/Manzanillo - just go to Playa Carrizalillo if you want to swim. There are a TON of boats here, and you are apparently supposed to just swim in between them. There is garbage in the water, dead fish on shore, and green algae...or something...all over the place. There\'s also a bunch of restuarant owners that accost you as soon as you drive or walk up to the beach trying to drag you into their restaurant. Overall, not at all a quiet, relaxing beach.

435576619.name: Perfect for families
435576619.author: a TripAdvisor user
435576619.reviewBody: A beautiful beach with calmer water, snorkel rentals, food and tidal pools to see a wide variety of fish. Parking in the street is free even though some may ask you pay. There is a dirt lot above that is free too and has an easy to walk path to both sides of the beach.

432002217.name: Puerto Angelito
432002217.author: a TripAdvisor user
432002217.reviewBody: I hire a taxi to take me to the beach rather than walk down the the loads of tourist buses. I also arrived early to beat the bulk of tourists who come from all over. It was a hot day and still school holidays so it was busy. it was definietly worth going though and enjoyed the sights and sounds of Mexican beach life.You can rent boats, order food, sunbed, drinks , be serenaded and the usual antics. Fun atmosphere. I got an ear infection after swimming here so not sure if it was the water... but had a great day out anyway.

421893343.name: Amzing
421893343.author: a TripAdvisor user
421893343.reviewBody: Amazing and beautiful beach the restaurants there are good and very welcoming. The water are good not too stormy and you can snorkel there (it\'s a good place to snorkel)

374893065.name: Beach is OK but too many boats
374893065.author: a TripAdvisor user
374893065.reviewBody: Puerto Angelito is itself not a great beach but just walk 3 minutes to Puerto Manzanillo is much better\nAngelito has too many boats in and out and on the weekends is very crowded. Manzanillo, part of the same cove is very nice especially during the weekdays. And has very few boats coming in and letting people off/on

370735996.name: Gross!!!!
370735996.author: a TripAdvisor user
370735996.reviewBody: This beach is dirty. There is a roped off for swimmers but there are constantly boats going into the area without warning. Just walking down the beach makes you feel nasty.

361486650.name: Great for famlies
361486650.author: a TripAdvisor user
361486650.reviewBody: This beach gets crowded with local tourists, so if you want privacy, go somewhere else. The water is better for swimming than at Playa Principal, and there are several restaurants that provide beach umbrellas, lounge chairs, and tables for you to camp out all day and enjoy food and drink at the beach.

359040130.name: Fun getaway
359040130.author: a TripAdvisor user
359040130.reviewBody: I enjoyed visiting Puerto Angelito for beach and snorking during a trip to Puerto Escondido. Waves and undertow are not as bad as Zicatela beach so you can actually get in and enjoy the water. Gorgeous spot!

359017458.name: Local swimming hole
359017458.author: a TripAdvisor user
359017458.reviewBody: Locals and tourist frequent this location. Tour buses drop off the tourist and they spend time at the beach. Lined with local vendors and fast food shops you are able to buy artifacts and trinkets hats and souvenirs. On the beach you can be served with seating, drinks, food and other amenities. The water was not so clean mixed with local fishing boat oil and gas with occasional odors of engine smoke. This took away from the beauty of this location.

357948325.name: Favorite Day-Trip
357948325.author: a TripAdvisor user
357948325.reviewBody: Awesome beach - good eats - really fine place to relax, swim and enjoy life. There are a variety of places to get an umbrella and chairs. Take your pick, you won\'t be disappointed.

357257564.name: Little bay, awesome food!
357257564.author: a TripAdvisor user
357257564.reviewBody:
This is a fisherman's marina, so there is a lot of boats parked and harder to chill or swim in one half of the bay, but the other half of the bay is free to swim and leisure. 

There is a plenty of awesome seafood restaurants around the beach that provides chairs or comfy sofas in the shadow and super duper seafood! Cevice from all kind of fish, salads de pulpo y camarones, grilled pulpo, camarones de chipotlle, etc😊

We enjoyed food festival with tasting here in December and it was so much fun. Judges leaded by Señorita Puerto Escondido were walking around restaurants and searching for the best food taste and the best presentation. Oh my god, everything was beautiful and delicious!

352101611.name: Great for kids.
352101611.author: a TripAdvisor user
352101611.reviewBody: There are no big waves like on other beaches, not too deep and really calm waters. Grate to take kids who could get scared by waves.

349652781.name: Crowded, Local Beach
349652781.author: a TripAdvisor user
349652781.reviewBody: This beach becomes incredibly congested sometimes, especially on the weekends. Add to the fact that there are always fishing boats in the bay, leading to a thin, oily film, it\'s really only a place enjoyed by the locals who don\'t care about pollution or trash. The bay as a whole looks more beautiful than Carrizalillo from the water, but it\'s not where you go to relax.

349201877.name: Not thrilled
349201877.author: a TripAdvisor user
349201877.reviewBody: Perhaps the waves stirred up the water but the snorkeling did not seem as good as at Playa La Entrega in Huatulco.  We did see some different kinds of fish and 2 eels.  The beach is small and the waves were a bit rough when we were there - it certainly seemed popular.  There are palappa restaurants with tables, umbrellas and lounge chairs.  The washroom we saw was not very clean.  The area of Puerto Angelito is made up of 2 beaches: Playa Manzanillo & Playa Angelito which are separated by a small rock outcrop but in reality it is one beach with access from 2 sets of steps.

345950477.name: Local family beach ideal for swimming and beach play
345950477.author: a TripAdvisor user
345950477.reviewBody: Easily accessible by taxi from Puerto Escondido ($30 Pesos).  Plenty of restaurant choices, "retail" opportunities from beach vendors - BUT not in the least pushy.  Showers and washrooms available - very modest charges.

341048279.name: Small and cozy
341048279.author: a TripAdvisor user
341048279.reviewBody: Small and cozy beach. Lot of small boats, great for snorkeling.\nTook paddle board course from here to Carrizarillo beach, was perfect!

339145132.name: Pablo\'s Palapa
339145132.author: a TripAdvisor user
339145132.reviewBody: Enjoyed the "less busy" end of Playa Manzanillo at Puerto Angelito...as you head south, Pablo\'s place is the first palapa restaurant past the fishing boats on the beach...very laid back, warm hospitality

337849957.name: Angelito is good, Manzanillo is better
337849957.author: a TripAdvisor user
337849957.reviewBody: This is a pair of beaches, separated by some rocks. Both are really attractive, and both have several restaurants. Anglelito is more popular with the locals, but it can be busy. But, if you like oysters, the restaurant at the very end is where the oyster divers come ashore, with their catch. They don\'t come any fresher. However, across the rocks (a very short walk) is Manzanillo Beach.  Be there early, and the beach is yours. Fabulous water and sand... But, there\'s also Carizalillo (?) Beach, close by, which is even better. Same thing - gorgeous, but be early, as by afternoon it can get busy

335251795.name: Too crowded
335251795.author: a TripAdvisor user
335251795.reviewBody: The beach water is pretty clear and warm but this time is too crowded and is difficult to swim. I recommend not to come on holidays, I have been here in a different month and it is amazing.

326160206.name: NICE
326160206.author: a TripAdvisor user
326160206.reviewBody: Beatiful beach, really relaxing and definitely beautiful warm blue clear water.  Also sitting on a lounge chair drinking a beer and seeing that water is a vacation for sure.  What a way to relax!!!!!

301514630.name: Did not like it.
301514630.author: a TripAdvisor user
301514630.reviewBody: Too crowded for a small beach with tons of stairs to go there, and still big waves...not for swimming.

294259286.name: disapointment
294259286.author: a TripAdvisor user
294259286.reviewBody: we came to see Puerto angelito immediately we were accosted by people selling things and wanting us to go to specific restaurants. it was not very clean and totally over crowded by boats and pushy sales.

283366526.name: Beautiful Swim beach
283366526.author: a TripAdvisor user
283366526.reviewBody: My new favorite beach to sun bake and swim.  The waves are really small so not great for surfing... But an awesome white sand swimming location.  Best beaches in the world right in Puerto Escondido!!

264326451.name: Too much people....
264326451.author: a TripAdvisor user
264326451.reviewBody: This place was crowded... there are other beaches more beautiful than this one. Although is a great place if you want to experience a very local beach and food.

262753254.name: Still gorgeous, after 30 years. (The beach, not me!)
262753254.author: a TripAdvisor user
262753254.reviewBody: Thirty years ago the only way to get to Playa Angelito was by water taxi from town, and there were only two little Palapa restaurants. Now there is a road, and many restaurants, and WiFi. And it is as beautiful as ever!\nA 25 peso (about $2.10 Canadian) taxi from town will bring you to the two little beaches of  Manzanilla and Angelito. Walk along Playa Manzanilla and over the path across the rock outcrop, to get to Playa Angelito: less crowded and fewer boats on the beach. Pick a restaurant, plunk yourself down in a shaded beach chair, and you have a place for the day, as long as you purchase some food or drink. They will watch your stuff while you swim or snorkel, or take a boat tour to see dolphins and turtles. The little bay there is always calm, although when we were there in March high waves in the Puerto Escondido area made the water murky for snorkeling. We got there about 11:00 a.m. on a Wednesday, and Angelito only had a half dozen or so people there. By 3:00 it was busier, but not at all crowded. The food and drink prices were reasonable, probably because there is so much competition. The restaurant owners keep the beach pretty clean, and there are big signs insisting that people clean up after their dogs. It\'s cleaner than it was the times I went there 30 years ago. It is a lovely place to while away a day swimming, snorkeling, eating tasty Mexican food and drinking icy cervezas, watching pelicans, and looking at the view. Go!

259195751.name: Return visit 42 years later!
259195751.author: a TripAdvisor user
259195751.reviewBody: It is TRUE. You can never go back.  In 1973 we  slept on the point under the stars in hammocks. Below  the hammocks a midden of Pre-Colombian polychrome Zapotec pottery shards 4 or 500 years old. We at at Manuel\'s the one and only little thatched beach cafe. Now it is an attractive cove jammed with boats and restaurants and joined by a walk way to it\'s continuation Playa Manzanita. Snorkelling is the best you\'ll find of the beach in the Escondido area. \nAfter a few days I forgot the wonders of being a pioneer tourist in a totally undiscovered area and really enjoyed the pleasures of today offered by these 2 beaches.

258560839.name: Mexican Beach Scene
258560839.author: a TripAdvisor user
258560839.reviewBody: This is where most of the Mexican tourist go. Be prepared to be overrun by the bus loads of big families that come from places beyond the ocean. It is a joy to watch all the enthusiasm. The beach food here is some of the best.

258303681.name: Beautiful
258303681.author: a TripAdvisor user
258303681.reviewBody:
We spent the afternoon here having lunch and enjoying the beach.  The water was amazing. The beach is small and somewhat crowded - there are plenty of boats in the water. 

There was very little English spoken here - make sure you have some Spanish in your back pocket. 

This is a beautiful place.  I will definitely go back.

257470641.name: It\'s a small city along this beach!
257470641.author: a TripAdvisor user
257470641.reviewBody: As we headed down the small road to Puerto Angelito and saw tour buses parked up top we knew it was going to be busy, but when you get down to the beach itself it\'s almost Disneyland for the crowds, vendors, activities.  It\'s a beautiful beach without all the stuff and the people, but you can\'t get away from those.  We turned around and went back to (gorgeous) Playa Carrizalillo.

246567189.name: Relaxing Beach
246567189.author: a TripAdvisor user
246567189.reviewBody: A very nice and wonderful beach for some days of relaxing pleasure. \nThe warm waters and the quietness, makes this one of the most enjoyable beaches I\'ve ever been.

243631265.name: Family time
243631265.author: a TripAdvisor user
243631265.reviewBody: This is a pretty beach and the surf is gentle to none which makes it perfect for taking the kids. BUT it is packed with umbrellas and street vendors. Overall it\'s worth it visiting it if the surf is big in Zicatela  or la Punta

241499658.name: Take a boat trip to snorkel with turtles
241499658.author: a TripAdvisor user
241499658.reviewBody: Loved the boat trip to snorkel with a giant sea turtle.  This was followed by a stop for snorkeling where we spotted another turtle.  Lots of fish and lots of fun.

240241683.name: Lively Mexican beach
240241683.author: a TripAdvisor user
240241683.reviewBody:
The beach is packed (at least at the weekend when I went it was) but it was a great atmosphere. Lots of people and lots of music.

Lots of restaurants and little shops.

Beautiful couple of sandy beaches that I would imagine look absolutely gorgeous without the crowds.

238649632.name: a nice mexicano beach
238649632.author: a TripAdvisor user
238649632.reviewBody: Angelito is on the same small bay as Playa Manzanillo with just some rocks separating them. As of 2013 there is a good walkway between the two beaches. You can drive or take a taxi to Angelito, whereas to get to Manzanillo, you have to walk down stairs at the end of Calle Quinta Sur, or walk over from Angelito.
