Because of this Angelito is much busier, especially on the weekends. Both have lots of palapa restaurants and boat operators offering to take you out for a tour. Both beaches are generally good for swimming due to the bays orientation that does not allow big waves to come in as they do on Zicatella (the surf beach)

237308600.name: No waves, perfect to swim
237308600.author: a TripAdvisor user
237308600.reviewBody: This is a perfect beach to swim and chill.\nThere is a lot of local people here and here we found the best see food in Puerto Escondido and people was also very friendly and is not as crowded as Carrizalillo or Zicatela.

237120639.name: Good Beach
237120639.author: a TripAdvisor user
237120639.reviewBody: This beach is not as busy as Carrizalillo. Many locals here. Very friendly. Several beach restaurants for a snack and a beer.

226768242.name: puerto angelito
226768242.author: a TripAdvisor user
226768242.reviewBody: nice beach without to many waves, perfect for swimming with locals and snorkeling.\nAlso departure zone for game fishing and dolphin tours.

221654749.name: Great Beach
221654749.author: a TripAdvisor user
221654749.reviewBody: You need to go to this beach and enjoy your day with nice restaurants, warm sea, banana boat, trip to see turtles, etc. Don\'t miss it! And also go to beaches around Puerto Angelito.

221066773.name: Cozy family beach
221066773.author: a TripAdvisor user
221066773.reviewBody: A nice place to visit with your family, it has all the services nearby.  The waves are small so you can swim without a problem.

203927702.name: Gorgeous spot for families....
203927702.author: a TripAdvisor user
203927702.reviewBody: Great white sand, clear turquoise water, calm waves for families in warm bay. Many vendors supply lounge chairs, local cuisine, fishing/snorkeling boating; all good food, lovely people. Expats come here, so friendly environment.

203221051.name: combined with playa Manzanillo
203221051.author: a TripAdvisor user
203221051.reviewBody: Playa Manzanillo is the left portion of that beaches, there are no boats coming in, so you can better swim and snorkel, and restaurants are equally good. you only do not have the touri shops behind and have to steo down a way with stairs.

200526878.name: Beautiful Beach
200526878.author: a TripAdvisor user
200526878.reviewBody: Best place to relax and go with your family, very friendly people and excellent weather, stayed during the month of october and the place was very calm, very few tourist which made our stay even more pleasent, got a $30 dollar rate for an ocean front hotel.

193276040.name: forget playa principal or zicatela
193276040.author: a TripAdvisor user
193276040.reviewBody: you like a nice tropical beach to swim, eat and drink? take a cab or the walk around the lighthouse and go lay back at playa angelito :)

188052222.name: Playa Manzanillo - Perfect rest plus drinks at the beach!
188052222.author: a TripAdvisor user
188052222.reviewBody: Puerto Angelito and Playa Manzanillo are actually located at the very same bay and offer calm waters to swim and dive in as well as plenty of options to drink and eat while laying there. Enjoyed the margaritas and the fresh fish we ordered there and paid little for it.\n

181970824.name: BEST FOOD
181970824.author: a TripAdvisor user
181970824.reviewBody: We were in Puerto Escondido for 3 days and returned to Puerto Angelito 4 times.  There is a restaurant on the beach called Los Buzos and it had the best seafood that we had on our entire 11 day trip.

167954979.name: Beautiful beach with many boats
167954979.author: a TripAdvisor user
167954979.reviewBody: Gorgeous beach that is nice for wading, but a lot of boats docked so less ideal for body surfing, etc.

166058112.name: Crowded beach
166058112.author: a TripAdvisor user
166058112.reviewBody: It\'s a very crowded beach but the water is relatively calm and good for swimming. This is where the fishing boats are stationed and you can go on a sport fishing tour out on the water from here. There are some shops around this beach too (which you won\'t find in the other beaches) so if you need something like beachwear, then you should go to this beach.

165449300.name: It\u00b4s paradise!
165449300.author: a TripAdvisor user
165449300.reviewBody: Best place in PE if you like swimming and snorkling. Clear, clean waters, great food and people. You CANNOT miss visiting this beach if you go to PE. About 5 minutes in taxi from the main Bahia.

164744421.name: For snorkelling and swimming...
164744421.author: a TripAdvisor user
164744421.reviewBody: Wonderful beach for snorkeling or swimming.  It has easy access from parking.  Find a beach chair you like but know that you should buy a drink (love the pina or coconut drinks) from the vendors who own the chairs.

156807436.name: great little beach, highly recommend going there!
156807436.author: a TripAdvisor user
156807436.reviewBody: We walked (20-25 min) and took cabs (5 min and super inexpensive) to get to this cute little beach several times. A protected cove with rocks to explore, clear water for swimming, and great snacks (shrimp on tortillas with avocado....mmmmm) at the little restaurants at the back of the beach

154852233.name: Seafood from boat to table
154852233.author: a TripAdvisor user
154852233.reviewBody: There\'s lots of activity in this beautiful bay from boats leaving and arriving for recreation, tours and fishing. Easily accessible by taxi, Puerto Angelito is a must visit place for superb fresh seafood meals, until dusk, at Buszcos. One of the few places you can gorge yourself on oysters empanada for those that don\'t prefer them raw. For a quieter beach, hike over to Playa Carizalillo.

140562309.name: beautiful bay side retreat
140562309.author: a TripAdvisor user
140562309.reviewBody:
Spectacular
We left from here with Omars SportFishing and came back and swam in the crystal waters and ate our catch cooked by one of the restaurants under the palapas.
A few Coronas later and it was time for siesta!!

Yep its a must!!!!

138455485.name: Small, remote, locals beach
138455485.author: a TripAdvisor user
138455485.reviewBody: This beach was crowded with small eating establishments ... rough, choppy water even in this isolated cove.  We questioned how snorkeling would be possible even in the protected waters.  Locals seem to love this beach and the small restaurants seemed geared toward them, but for everyone, this beach presents a wonderful contrast to Zicatela and Carrizalillo ... it\'s packed, nice sand, small and intimate, and lots of boat and local activity to watch ...

122878904.name: Puerto Angelito good seafood!
122878904.author: a TripAdvisor user
122878904.reviewBody: Beach is okay but we liked Carizallilo and Zicatella better. The beach is quite crowded with boats who also arrive quite fast on the shore so if you are swimming you better watch out.\nGreat to have a lunch, especially in Buscos (or Buzcos), something like that. Fantastic shrimp cocktails and oysters superfresh from the ocean.

122435545.name: Best snorkeling in Puerto Escondido
122435545.author: a TripAdvisor user
122435545.reviewBody: This beach is about a fifteen minute walk from the middle of Puerto Escondido or a quick taxi ride. It gets a little crowded during the day since buses seem to drop off groups at the nearby parking lot. We turned left and walked past the rocks where there rather fewer people. The snorkeling in this area was the best we saw, with lots of brightly colored fish darting around the rocks just under the surface. Some coral too.

121508289.name: another paradise..
121508289.author: a TripAdvisor user
121508289.reviewBody: went to puerto angelito to go for a ride around the beaches and to go and swim with the turtles... Mexicans there are veeery helpful.. a calm clean and beautiful playa.. with spectacular views and scenery..

934014.name: watch your step
934014.author: a TripAdvisor user
934014.reviewBody: puerto angelito is gorgeous you will find small family owned restaurants right on the beach that serve great food and lots of drinks. my husband ordered the fishi had guacamole and chips also there was a little girl who sold the best plantains in the world-served with sweetened condensed milk-yum the water is great for snorkling and is really nice for small children who are love the water but are more fearful of the ocean (especially playa zicatella-large under tow)you can get there by boat or by taxi, but if you go by taxi i must warn you - you will have to climb lots and lots of steps down to the beach-it is worth it but it is a hard climb back up the steps(we went with my husbands grandparents and they couldn\'t make it all the way up the steps so they ended up climbing back down and taking a boat back home)also-there are no public bathrooms down at the beach  you have to  climb back up all of the steps when you are up at the top of the hill, be sure to stop by the cafacito-fabulous food, this is a chain from the original cafecito at the playa zicatella

638246900.name: nice and calm place
638246900.author: a TripAdvisor user
638246900.reviewBody: well designed place from well known architects! \n\n*visiting only with guided tours (in spanish) on special dates, online booking required - so prepare your tour in the middle of nowhere carefully*

address.streetAddress: Kilometro 113 Carretera Federal 200 Villa de Tututepec de Melchor Ocampo

550492809.name: A spectacular architectural find
550492809.author: a TripAdvisor user
550492809.reviewBody: Casa Wabi foundation is a beautiful contemporary architectural find 30 minutes outside Puerto Escondido. An artist residency for international artists, with a contemporary art gallery. The buildings themselves are spectacular with great site lines. We spent a couple of hours on the tour through the buildings and gardens. Brilliant. This place is great for everyone who is mobile. Couples, family, groups...

address.streetAddress: Kilometro 113 Carretera Federal 200 Villa de Tututepec de Melchor Ocampo

672697813.name: Must stay for 1 night
672697813.author: a TripAdvisor user
672697813.reviewBody: If you go to Puerto Escondido you should at least visit Playa Zicatela for a day. There are plenty of restaurants, and if you go with your partner, I recommend walking by the beach all the way to Punta Zicatela, watch the sunset and grab dinner afterwards.

670808920.name: Great place to surf \ud83c\udfc4\ud83c\udffb\u200d\u2642\ufe0f \ud83c\udfc4\u200d\u2640\ufe0f \ud83c\udf0a
670808920.author: a TripAdvisor user
670808920.reviewBody:
A great beach with an ideal sea for surfing better than for swimming (it can be dangerous) 

/ 

Una gran playa con un tipo de mar ideal para surfear pero no para nadar

665908264.name: Great beach, big waves
665908264.author: a TripAdvisor user
665908264.reviewBody: The beach is beautiful,  not crowded,  you can stay all day, there is service,  for food,  drinks and bathrooms. The waves are big(it\'s the Pacific!) But the water is nice.

664318286.name: Great for walking on the beach unless you are a strong surfer
664318286.author: a TripAdvisor user
664318286.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, great restaurants to take advantage of. Chairs and umbrellas for rent. They take the amount of pesos that you pay for the chair etc. off your meal price. \nLong beach to walk on, gorgeous views. Water can be rough, not for the feint hearted.

664078849.name: Only for surfing
664078849.author: a TripAdvisor user
664078849.reviewBody: Great Long beach ! But the waves can be really strong, so definitely not for swimming. It is great for pro surfers though ! There are a few restaurants along the beach

663630079.name: Great Views
663630079.author: a TripAdvisor user
663630079.reviewBody: We quickly visited this area on a tour and then went back for a meal at one of the many awesome restaurants.  I would love to spend more time in and around the beach, after all that is what has put this place on the map.

660300043.name: Great Beach for walking... HUGE SURF
660300043.author: a TripAdvisor user
660300043.reviewBody: I am not a surfer, so swimming or enjoying a beach day here was difficult, however we stayed in a beach house South of Zicatela so would often walk the beach to get to the shops and restaurants on Zicatela.  Zicatela is a nice area, and I felt very safe there, however... DO NOT GO ON THE BEACHES AT NIGHT!!!  I have heard and witnessed the Municipal police there being not so honest!

660174395.name: Surfing class
660174395.author: a TripAdvisor user
660174395.reviewBody: This place is wonderful for surfing classes and there are all kind of restaurants. It is rural and very clean\n

659565230.name: Puerto Escondido and the Playa Zicatela-A wonderful, exciting beach
659565230.author: a TripAdvisor user
659565230.reviewBody:
I am not a beach person. Perhaps it is a genetic fault or I was badly sunburnt in a former life. Until I came to Playa Zicatela.

Zicatela is a longish beach about 4 kilometres. On the town end it butts up to the Playa Principal, the main town beach for Puerto Escondido (PE). 

As you head away from town there is the Avenida del Morro, it is full of smaller, older hotels, no Hiltons, Red Roofs, or Marriotts because, at least, PE is still a Mexican town. Morro has beachside restaurants. Eating breakfast at one I saw whale feeding offshore. I understand it can be a bit loud at night but the area seemed ok to me. 

As you walk farther the building along the beach are a mix of simple homes, hostals, half built grey concrete apartments, mutistory homes in white and dogs. There are a lot of dogs on the beach. Most of the time this might be of concern but these guys are really laid back canines. It is sad that there are so many strays but no one bothers you and they go about surviving and playing. Farther back from the beach are hotels like the Casamar where I stayed. 

As you walk on the sand the type of people you see starts to change. There Still older couple, men and women walking ther dogs, bodies stretched out to brown, but the closer you get to La Punta the beach’s terminus you see the surfers, volleyballers, seekers of zen states, and sunset watchers ridiculously healthy, fit, tanned people who look very content and happy. 

It made me think about what I liked most about PE.  I decided it was the possibility that the because absolute stratification of resort towns was less pronounced it seemed real to me. I can watch surfers, drink my Victoria cerveza oscura as I watch pelicans coexist with sunbathers on the beach, see a truck full of with soldiers following two police cars which drive sedately with no sense of urgency that automatic weapons usually bring to a situation. 

Or I could go to the older middle class reverse image of La Punta in the Rinconada near the Playa Carrizalillo. But even there, besides the everpresence mucho perros, I was open to the still laid back, white wine fueled calmness and enjoyment of the moment.  It is a nice place.

658128498.name: great beach walk
658128498.author: a TripAdvisor user
658128498.reviewBody: great location for a walk on the beach - go in the morning before the sand gets too hot!  Watched the surfers, had a snack and walked and walked and walked.

657910765.name: Great place to walk.
657910765.author: a TripAdvisor user
657910765.reviewBody: My wife and I loved walking the beach at Playa Zicatela.  So relaxing.  Many places along the way to stop for a drink or meal. A must do in P.E.

657193498.name: Wide Open Beach
657193498.author: a TripAdvisor user
657193498.reviewBody: Very nice beach. Due to it\'s width and length bring flip flops for the very hot sand. One of the top surfing spots in the world on \'Up\' days. Point break at the end (La Punta) good for beginners on up. Tough shore break along the whole beach so not recommended for children.

656896685.name: Caution on Zicatela at night
656896685.author: a TripAdvisor user
656896685.reviewBody: Exercise caution when walking around Zicatela at night for the usual threats of robbery etc - but also more concerningly it\u2019s the federal police you should be wary of. My companion and I were cornered, searched, and harassed on two separate occasions by heavily armed officers looking for drugs. We have also heard stories of tourists being bribed over possession. Keep your pockets clean when out for the night or face potentially serious consequences!

656144291.name: Over 2.7 Miles of Wide, Clean Beach along th Majestic Pacific Ocean!
656144291.author: a TripAdvisor user
656144291.reviewBody: The beach is long, wide, and clean. The low thundering waves end in spectacular white foam with aqua-turquoise highlights just after the waves break. All this against the dark, blue background of the Pacific stretching to the western horizon. The north end of the beach leads right into the beautiful city of Puerto Escondido. As you approach the city you can pick one of three or more beach front restaurants and bars for a drink, breakfast, lunch, or dinner. The restaurants all have excellent seating for dining in the cool, breezy shade of the restaurant proper. In the sand in front of these restaurants are tables and chairs with colorful umbrellas, canopy covered beds and comfortable pillow laden couches. Closer to the ocean these places feature chaise lounges with umbrellas and small tables for drinks and food. No matter where you sit, a waiter or waitress will come with a menu ready to take your order. The high tides sweep the beach clean every night but the beach is free of litter along length and width. We\u2019ve seen no man made trash in any form on the beach. On your walks along the beach you will see plenty of pelicans and other sea birds. You will see fisherman with nets, reels and rods. My favorite was a young man that fished from his surf board. There are more beach restaurants at the south end of the beach, just before the beach ends in mountainous rocks covered with plants and cactus. The adventurous can climb a path up the rocks and across the ridge to rocks way out in the ocean. It is a wonderful place to be.

654849338.name: BIG BEACH !!!
654849338.author: a TripAdvisor user
654849338.reviewBody: Great place to watch surfing and sunsets.\nBeach is huge, water is rough...its a surfing beach!\nGreat place to hang out at, never crowded, you can always find a quite spot.

654843386.name: Long Beach
654843386.author: a TripAdvisor user
654843386.reviewBody: What a great beach to walk.  The beach is at least a couple of km long and is an easy walk.  Close to the water the sand is smooth and hard which makes for an easier walk.  If you want the soft sand just move away from the water.  Not only is the beach long it is also wide with numerous restaurants and pubs.  Listen to the waves crash, watch the surfers or the pelcan dive into the water as they feed on fish.

652986992.name: Fantastic place
652986992.author: a TripAdvisor user
652986992.reviewBody: Zicatella always was a Mecca for surfers and not for nothing! It\'s extremely beautiful, waves are very strong and it has all the amenities for relaxing! You should definitely try!

652430051.name: Surfing Beach
652430051.author: a TripAdvisor user
652430051.reviewBody: It\'s hard to know how to rate Playa Zicatela. It is beautiful. It goes on for kilometers (4?), the surf is stunning, it is not conducive to swimming. Closer to town beach bars and restaurants line the beach, but the beach is so big that they are not close to the oceans edge (which is great). The sunsets here are beautiful. But if you\'re not a surfer, walking and admiring the view and splashing in the surf is about the extent of what to do. Winter surfing is for beginners and intermediates; summer surf - intermediates and advanced. Amazing if you are a surfer or love watching it as we did. We are not into the beach bar scene except for a sunset drink.

652252760.name: Mexican adventure
652252760.author: a TripAdvisor user
652252760.reviewBody: Amazing place, big waves big smile. Spent the whole day on the beach, we were there during low season so it was pretty calm making it that much better! \n

651831903.name: Beautiful natural beach
651831903.author: a TripAdvisor user
651831903.reviewBody: We loved Zicatela, and widely recommend this beautiful still natural place. The ambiance, the restaurants, the beach, the weather everything is gorgeous, though it is important to note that the sea is not safe for swimming due to the underwater currents and there is always marked with red flags. We saw only a few surfers and some people swimming in the only small bay ahead.

651104226.name: Big waves!
651104226.author: a TripAdvisor user
651104226.reviewBody: Awesome beach to visit! It goes on for several kilometers and is nice and wide and spacious so it\'s never over crowded. The waves are some of the biggest in the world so not great for swimming but on days when the waves are smaller it can be fun to play in them.

650915838.name: Beautiful beach!
650915838.author: a TripAdvisor user
650915838.reviewBody: Miles and miles of beautiful beach to walk! Not a swimming beach due to the waves and undertow but if you are a surfer it\u2019s the place to be! We loved walking the beach and watching the surfers every day!

650718836.name: lovely long beach
650718836.author: a TripAdvisor user
650718836.reviewBody: This is a lovely long beach and while we visited it was very quiet.  It\u2019s a good place to watch the surfing.  \n\nThe only negative is that there are hawkers who regularly approach.  It\u2019s a little irritating after a while but they are not overly pushy.

649361075.name: only 2 places that are swimable but great beach to walk
649361075.author: a TripAdvisor user
649361075.reviewBody: love the area and really got a kick out of the surfer vibe and hippies.  food on the strip was good, but we did some research in advance.

648525510.name: Beautiful long, wide beach with pounding waves. Great for a nice long walk.
648525510.author: a TripAdvisor user
648525510.reviewBody: Compared to the other beaches in Pto. Escondido, Playa Zicatela is long and wide and uncrowded. It\'s great for a long walk with the pounding surf at your side. On the day we were here, two sets of sky divers landed on the middle of th beach, which was cool, and it was fun to watch the surfers at the far east end do their thing. Be sure to check out the hip and cool neighborhood at the surfer\'s end of the beach. Nice vibe there.

648416816.name: The best place to visit
648416816.author: a TripAdvisor user
648416816.reviewBody: We went to playa Zicatela on Puerto Edcondido Oaxaca, it\u2019s an amazing place to stay, people is great and you can find restaurants and bars to have an incredible vacation. We love Thai Food @ Wok-xaca, in front of Hotel Santafe. Thank you for an excellent experience.

646074316.name: Great Relaxing Vacation
646074316.author: a TripAdvisor user
646074316.reviewBody: Loved this little town. I can\'t wait to go back. Food was excellent and so were the waves. 2 of my favorite things.

645244908.name: Thank zicatela for...
645244908.author: a TripAdvisor user
645244908.reviewBody: Three great beach runs, lots of fun waves, perfect water temperature, and a view of the sun (and both men and women) to die for.

644813826.name: Famous and Fun
644813826.author: a TripAdvisor user
644813826.reviewBody: Zicatela is a great spot to hang out. As with most of Puerto beaches there are a lot of great beach bars/ restaurants that will bring you anything you need on the beach. The waves can be quite strong, so be careful.

644624655.name: Awesome!
644624655.author: a TripAdvisor user
644624655.reviewBody: This is just another one of my favorite beaches, waves are tough but the view is just awesome got to see some whales and great surf waves came around!

643878237.name: Long beach
643878237.author: a TripAdvisor user
643878237.reviewBody: The main beach of PE with all the nightlife, water activities, skydiving. Worth going to visit whilst in PE

643093259.name: Beautiful beach, Powerful waves!
643093259.author: a TripAdvisor user
643093259.reviewBody: We hung out on this beach for several days - reserving an umbrella with lounge chairs for $250 pesos a day. This included service from the restaurant, but we brought much of our own food/drinks along.

642636324.name: beautiful
642636324.author: a TripAdvisor user
642636324.reviewBody: Stayed at the Hotel Ines and every morning and evening I was able to watch the waves from balcony.\nBeautiful Beach and it was cleaned (along with the streets) regularly by the shopkeepers\n

642537053.name: Surf, swim or walk
642537053.author: a TripAdvisor user
642537053.reviewBody: Nice long stretch of beach, with something in it for everyone. Surfers, swimmers, walkers or just gazers-of-the-sea.

642109642.name: Beautiful. but don\'t swim here!
642109642.author: a TripAdvisor user
642109642.reviewBody: Beautiful spot to watch waves and sunset, but don\'t swim here! Deadly rip currents. Just ask the locals! Great place to play beach soccer, volleyball, and just watch the waves though. Close to attraction with shops in restaurants called Zicatela Strip.

641704871.name: Beautiful spot, heavy tide
641704871.author: a TripAdvisor user
641704871.reviewBody: Should you look.for a beach just to lay in the sun or play with friends and family or just to simply enjoy a walk after shopping/eating good stuff, Zicaleta is your spot!\n\nHowever the tide cam be heavy so should you look for a place to.go swimming I would recommend to pick a quieter/safer beach

640354496.name: Surfing at the Beach
640354496.author: a TripAdvisor user
640354496.reviewBody: We attended Zicatela Beach and watched  the weekend surfing competition.  Although the waves were not large for this noted competition, the surfing was still fantastic to watch.  The ocean water and sand were beautiful.  The availability of restaurants stretched out along the beach was welcoming.  The hot sun made the sand hot to walk on, so flip flops were needed for the beach walks.  Nice problem to have!! :-)

636369915.name: Not good for swiming
636369915.author: a TripAdvisor user
636369915.reviewBody: It nice, but not good for swiming. Waves are really big and dangerous. \nNext to this beach, there is another beach for swiming :)

636352403.name: Great surfing action early in the morning
636352403.author: a TripAdvisor user
636352403.reviewBody: I went to the beach at sunrise, and watched some fishermen head out and watched surfers. There were two men fishing off the rocks, with waves washing over them. Audacious!

635666053.name: Zica tela beach
635666053.author: a TripAdvisor user
635666053.reviewBody: Nice waves, food, people and vibesss!!! The weather is sweet and the water super warm, so surfing is in boardshorts!!!

635113337.name: Beautiful beach, restaurants and shops
635113337.author: a TripAdvisor user
635113337.reviewBody: Playa Zicatela has everything you need to enjoy a day at the beach! You can come early and run, or walk and enjoy its beauty! The waves are big and it is exciting to watch the surfers! We found plenty of great restaurants like Fresh. One place to avoid is restaurant Maurilio\'s! Our server lied about fresh seafood on the menu! They served us frozen shrimp and fake crab. He wouldn\'t even talk to us about our complaint! He spoke perfect English BTW. This beach deserves five stars except Maurilio\'s left a bad taste in our mouth\ud83d\ude15

633512751.name: Impressive
633512751.author: a TripAdvisor user
633512751.reviewBody: Loved watching the huge waves and the surfers , really impressive to watch.  The beach is huge and very very clean.  Sunsets are always incredible

631654865.name: Big waves
631654865.author: a TripAdvisor user
631654865.reviewBody: Enjoyes very big wide beach.  Lots of surfers riding the waves.  Lots of beach bars and restaurants. Fun.

629098262.name: Nice long stretch of beach with great beach side restaurants and bars.
629098262.author: a TripAdvisor user
629098262.reviewBody: Nice long stretch of beach with great restaurants and bars right on the beach. The main place in Puerto escondido with a lot of hotels.

622984386.name: A miles-long beach with sof white sand and very clean
622984386.author: a TripAdvisor user
622984386.reviewBody: This is the largest beach in the Puerto Escondido area. The views of the Pacific are fantastic all day, and at sunset they are are extraordinary. The sand is very soft and white, easy to walk. The waves can be very large. Along the beach there are many informal restaurants where you can have fish and seafood plus drinks, rent a coach and umbrella to sit by the sea, or spend time listening to music.

621595186.name: Fun fun fun anytime!
621595186.author: a TripAdvisor user
621595186.reviewBody: Beautiful surfing paradise. Lots of shops, restaurants and nightclubs. People are very friendly. Romantic sunsets!

615268122.name: not a surfer but really had fun!
615268122.author: a TripAdvisor user
615268122.reviewBody: what can go wrong when youre in a beach in mexico? This place is magical, great to relax, have a couple of beers and enjoy the day!

611964284.name: relax with a cocktail on the beach
611964284.author: a TripAdvisor user
611964284.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful place that does not have the horrible high rise hotels - just family style fun, surfing and great beach bars along the whole stretch.

599041047.name: Better If You\'re A Surfer Bro
599041047.author: a TripAdvisor user
599041047.reviewBody: Lots of Business Bros on holiday here. The waves are super if you\'re into surfing but pretty rough if you just want to swim. Prepare to overhear lots of phone conversations about people\'s "roles" and "significant growth" and "how to connect with clients on a personal level."

595105062.name: World Class Surfing Destination
595105062.author: a TripAdvisor user
595105062.reviewBody: We just go to watch and eat and drink. We love the beach, the surf, the surfers, and the restaurants and palapa bars. La Punta in particular is frequented by surfers, and the restaurants and bars are very reasonably priced.

594698625.name: Nice wild beach
594698625.author: a TripAdvisor user
594698625.reviewBody: Is a nice and large beach in open sea. Waves are huge and wild. Only surfers dare to swim in it, but the view is nice and the place is clean and mostly quiet. There are many beach bars with shades that you can rent or use while eating or drinking there.

593447555.name: Great beach with fantastic waves
593447555.author: a TripAdvisor user
593447555.reviewBody: If you a surfer, or just a Nature lover- it is definitely your place! Powerful waves, kilometres of sand, very few people in Autumn. We have been there for 3 months, unforgettable times. Great beach walk to Puerto Esconfdido, where you can order a delicious meal and the price is reasonable. Just look where locals go. Highly recommend the beach, this is where World surfers\' championship goes on every year. If you watch my videos, you will see more.

583912351.name: Beatiful place, cater to foreings
583912351.author: a TripAdvisor user
583912351.reviewBody: If you like to feel like you\'re in South beach Florida, Santa Monica California, or even Las Vegas Nevada with out the gambling this is the place to go,

582801863.name: Cowabunga
582801863.author: a TripAdvisor user
582801863.reviewBody: Big Barrels, cheap food, cold beer. One of the most amazing waves in the world. The surrounding bays and little towns are worth the 2$ bus ride

582334027.name: Nice beach
582334027.author: a TripAdvisor user
582334027.reviewBody: Nice beach in a bay. The swell is nice and not to strong. You could surf there. The beach is clean and not too crowdy. There\u2019s beach chairs and umbrellas.

581772306.name: Wonderful beach
581772306.author: a TripAdvisor user
581772306.reviewBody: My boyfriend and I were lucky enough to come in off season to mexico. Playa Zicatela does not disappoint. Beach is definately not for swimming and surfing only as waves even in low season can get to 10ft. The beach has a variety of cafes, bars and restaurants for all budgets and needa. Would recommend to anyone who wants to get away for a week.

578905964.name: Best Beach to Watch Surfers
578905964.author: a TripAdvisor user
578905964.reviewBody: While we would never go surf in those waters, its so impressive to watch these surfers do their thing. You can watch from several restaurants or right at the edge of the beach.  Either way its hours of enjoyment!! Its also a great beach to do long walks, watch sunsets, take pics, exercise - offers a lot and has tons of places to eat and chill.

576147835.name: Off season lack of nightlife at Zicatela
576147835.author: a TripAdvisor user
576147835.reviewBody: Scant nightlife off-season. \ud83d\ude22 Walking the lomg beach is entertaining. A surfer\'s beach for sure. Good place to relax for non-surfers.

572264456.name: What a surf spot!
572264456.author: a TripAdvisor user
572264456.reviewBody:
Spectators may just follow the surf action in one of the most spectacular surf spots in North America. 

Wave height varies with the seasons, best in Summer!

Check youtube or similar for a first impression.

569277044.name: Quiet during the day, friendly people!
569277044.author: a TripAdvisor user
569277044.reviewBody: For a wednesday afternoon (before semana santa) we decided to walk along this beautiful beach and it was very quiet what we liked. What we really appreciated were the very friendly people who asked only very casually and just ONCE if we want to use a service (what we definitely experienced way more annoying from other beaches). Overall it was a nice walk what we would recommend. In the evening the sunsets must be stunning. The restaurants looked very inviting and the atmosphere was laid-back, would definitely come again, we saw beaches which were way less relaxed than this one here. Probably it was the silence before easter week..?! ;-) definitely worth a visit!

568713534.name: Great surfing beach
568713534.author: a TripAdvisor user
568713534.reviewBody: Great long stretch of beach for surfing or walking, not for swimming.  Plenty of restaurants or bars to park yourself on for the day, some with bettet service than otbers.   Great way to spend the day, with a cold cerveza and listening to the waves pounding.

567757441.name: One of the great beaches of Puerto Escondido
567757441.author: a TripAdvisor user
567757441.reviewBody: Take a cab  to Punto Zicatela, the end of the beach where the funky surf village is.  Watch the surfers and  pelicans play in the ocean then walk the length of the beach to playa Marinero (?) about 1.5 hours of sun, sand and surf.  When you reach the end you will be ready for the shade and refreshments available beach side.

565366137.name: Great waves
565366137.author: a TripAdvisor user
565366137.reviewBody: It is a beautiful beach for good swimmers. There are really nice restaurants around and you will hear the waves.

564759945.name: Surfers Delight
564759945.author: a TripAdvisor user
564759945.reviewBody: This is where you go If you can handle the big waves . Depending on the time of year you are there the waves will change . Very little shade so bring your own , no restaurants  , but beautiful rugged rocks with a lovely sandy beach . Don\'t miss the cave at the end of the beach .

564454977.name: A Walk on the Beach
564454977.author: a TripAdvisor user
564454977.reviewBody: While ita great for surfwrs not ao greay for swimmers. But thw walk and the vistas srw unbeatable. Para\u013awl to the beach is an assortment of shops restaurants and bars good for nightlife. Palm trees glistening azure water and wild rollers delight even the most jaded beachgoers. Wear a hat proper sunscreen and carry water because from one end of the beach to the other can be a blistering trek.\n

564243719.name: Beautiful but too Rough
564243719.author: a TripAdvisor user
564243719.reviewBody: Just had a visit to puerto Escondido and stayed  within a few minutes walk of this beach. Very long & beautiful, one end great for surfers & the other great for boggie boards, however not swimming. So a look but don\u2019t touch kind of beach for most. We loved watching the surfers hey were amazing & well worth watching. Very beautiful & worth visiting.

564072505.name: Zicatela Beach
564072505.author: a TripAdvisor user
564072505.reviewBody: Zicatela Beach in known for surfing and lined with fine bars, restaurants and hotels. Packed with back packers, Americans and Canadians

562581066.name: Amazing sunset
562581066.author: a TripAdvisor user
562581066.reviewBody: We have loved the beach especially after 4 o clock is so charming and not to busy! There are a few beach bars were you can grab a drink and watch the sunset! It is really worth the stay!

562158002.name: Just a lovely beach and assortment of places to eat
562158002.author: a TripAdvisor user
562158002.reviewBody: Wonderful hotels so beautiful lots of activity Split Coconut great bands bbq food on the beach......One fall back the Esmeralda beach restaurant loud music till to late people can\'t sleep and they yell constantly for people to come in Harrassment indeed bad taste

561940283.name: Looong beach
561940283.author: a TripAdvisor user
561940283.reviewBody: First of all, Zicatela is a surfers beach not a swimming beach so its not recommended for families.\nThe water is pretty clean, soft sand and lots of restaurants that cater to tourists, not bad but not good either.\nAt least visit this beach once and watch the sunset because ita the only beach you can see the full sunset.

561794975.name: Great beach Great Restaurants Very inexpensive
561794975.author: a TripAdvisor user
561794975.reviewBody: the waves were not pounding the shore during my visit but you could hear and see the power in this water. the long beach is awe-inspiring and BTW many nice places for food and drink

561463113.name: Great walking and surfing beach, limited swimming
561463113.author: a TripAdvisor user
561463113.reviewBody: A beautiful beach to walk and to sit at any of the many restaurants and bars along the beach to enjoy the view and ocean breeze.  This is a surfing location and the waves, undertow and riptides are strong, and so this is not a safe beach for swimming...beware and heed the \u201cno nadar / no swimming\u201d signs!!  There are a couple places at either end of the beach that are safer for swimming...look to see where there is a group doing so down by La Punta at the southwest end of the beach (ok SOMETIMES) or up at the other end by the main town where the boats are (I would say the safer area to swim but still be cautious).  I enjoyed a 1+ hour walk here daily during my 10 day stay in Zicatela, as well as sunning on the beach and watching the surfers.  Zicatela is a relaxing place to stay, lots of little restaurants and bars along Calle Morro (the Main Street that runs parallel to the beach) as well as up on the side streets above Calle Morro.  I felt safe as a solo traveler.

561356337.name: Serious surf
561356337.author: a TripAdvisor user
561356337.reviewBody: The waves here can reach 15 feet outside of high surf season; just spectacular to watch and even more thrilling to ride.

561326345.name: Beautiful to look at but no swimming for any but experts
561326345.author: a TripAdvisor user
561326345.reviewBody: Fabulous waves but usually only surfers go out here because it is intimidating for the average swimmer.

560724584.name: ZICACONSTRUCTION
560724584.author: a TripAdvisor user
560724584.reviewBody: I have been in ZICATELA for 2 months and the entire district is in construction. The moment you get out of your hotel it is noise and ciment, same if you go to the beach.\nAll Zica, from the beginning of the strip up to La Ponta they are building all kind of unfinished monuments, some are very impressing by their size...Many restaurants are closed for ever so expect to walk or ride cabs.Beside the beach and the weather not much to impress.  Last time for sure .15-2-18

560125301.name: nice beach, strong surf, fun to watch surfers
560125301.author: a TripAdvisor user
560125301.reviewBody: The boardwalk here is so much fun, 2 excellent jewelry stores, many other beach-y items in other stores..many restaurants, some with huge tv for watching sports and having a beer, nightclubs for the young set...the beach is lovely...I\'ve never seen it crowded...when there\'s lots of surf it is fun to watch the surfers who congregate at one end of the beach, the surf on any day may be more than some people like, the beach beside Zicatela seems calm and quite comfortable, the whole place-- beach and boardwalk-- are great for people watching,, if that\'s one of your hobbies...I enjoy Puerto Escondito...

559762320.name: A must in Puerto Escondido
559762320.author: a TripAdvisor user
559762320.reviewBody: We have been in Puerto Escondido for the last 2 weeks and Zicatela has been one of the best parts of our mornings. We were able to find great food drink Mind-blowing scenery Massages shops Music, Zicatela offees everything for every budget and every taste. Wonderful walking beach long and relaxing. It\'s a very deep beach with relatively hot sand before you hit the water line so I suggest water shoes. We\'ve ran it in bare feet flicked through it in flip flops and strolled in water shoes. Oh Ya and go up to the OXOX and get a beverage for your walk it gets hot here, and the beach is long enough to walk for hours.

558831957.name: Beach views
558831957.author: a TripAdvisor user
558831957.reviewBody: A LOT of sand! Big waves, but, at this time of year apparently not big enough for good surfing. Not a swimming beach, and not a beach for lounging in a chair under an umbrella. You can go to one of the many beach restaurants to sit and look out at the ocean. There are many shops, restaurants along the strip. We visited during the heat of the day, but apparently there is a lot of activity at night.

558681784.name: Fabulous wild sea views most days
558681784.author: a TripAdvisor user
558681784.reviewBody: Always plan at least one day to watch the incredible surf of Zicatela...the Mexican Pipeline...in the top 10 of the world\u2019s surfing beaches.

558668719.name: A must do while in Puerto Escondido!
558668719.author: a TripAdvisor user
558668719.reviewBody: I would recommend getting to Playa Zicatela around 3:00 for a bit of shopping then get an sunbrella from a restaurant/bar on the beach to watch the surfers around 5:00; it is very entertaining! The drink and appetizer were also delicious.

557649563.name: Surfers paradise
557649563.author: a TripAdvisor user
557649563.reviewBody: Nice long beach, strong surf. We saw many surfers in action. For strong swimmers only. Many bars and restaurants along the beach.

557603413.name: Awesome surf beach
557603413.author: a TripAdvisor user
557603413.reviewBody: Cool vibe, hot sand, not crowded at all. There are many beach front restaurants. Not a beach built for swimming because of a strong undertow. Not hassled by a lot of pedlars.

557438120.name: Playa Zicetela
557438120.author: a TripAdvisor user
557438120.reviewBody: What a great beach..lots of bars..beautiful sand..great watching surfers . would not recommend swimming but thesun set isamazing...restaurants are amazing..

555484283.name: Beautiful beach
555484283.author: a TripAdvisor user
555484283.reviewBody: Zicatela is one of the best surf breaks \nYou see surfers from all over the world to come and try to surf this Mexican pipeline

555282416.name: Great just amazing
555282416.author: a TripAdvisor user
555282416.reviewBody: This beach is the truly meaning of a place to relax and enjoy the quietness and beautiful nature the sunrise and sunset is amazing and the tranquillity can be beat

555061375.name: Scary waves
555061375.author: a TripAdvisor user
555061375.reviewBody: Lovely big beach with lots of bars/restaurants. Water is not suitable for swimming. It looks inviting but the waves can grow out of nowhere.

554666993.name: Lots to see and do - and drink!
554666993.author: a TripAdvisor user
554666993.reviewBody: It\'s a nice long stroll - or short, if you want - all along the esplanade. plenty of places to stop and have a drink or a bite to eat.

553631004.name: Wow huge beach goes for miles
553631004.author: a TripAdvisor user
553631004.reviewBody: Wondered over to playa Zacatecas on first day great long beach .lots of choices to sit and watch or swim or be entertained by the skydivers group of about 18 jumping from 14000ft landing on beach seemed to jumped 3rounds really cool to watch

552871774.name: Lots to do and see on the Playa Zicatela.
552871774.author: a TripAdvisor user
552871774.reviewBody: The surfers are a highlight. There are lots of places to eat on the strip. We will be back in Feb 2018

551908101.name: Grear great beach
551908101.author: a TripAdvisor user
551908101.reviewBody: It\'s just too large. There shouldn\'t be beaches like that. it\'s more than 4 km of beach. And place for anyone and everyone. There is a bar area in the beginning of the beach, then you have a big empty beach until you get to the end, where all the cool people are - surfing, young people, travel junkies, beach bums...

549293695.name: Great late-year sunsets!
549293695.author: a TripAdvisor user
549293695.reviewBody: Spent a lovely Christmas here with the family. I recommend getting there early and taking a walk along the coast. The sun is very strong after 12 pm. Most restaurants are really nice and are reasonably priced. We took two "Lalo ecotours" trips, to the bioluminescence and to Mazunte-Puerto \u00c1ngel, which were really nice ($300 p/p and $700 p/p).

548770810.name: Looks good on paper
548770810.author: a TripAdvisor user
548770810.reviewBody: And much, much better in person. If you have it in you to try Mexico outside of a resort, you will love it here. I am looking forward to many more trips there.

546880173.name: Great beach to stroll, not for swimming
546880173.author: a TripAdvisor user
546880173.reviewBody: The surf, and the sound it makes at Playa Zicatela is truly awesome! Walks on this beach offer rewarding views. Caution: the surfing here is for the pros only, and riptides make swimming dangerous. But the whole Zicatela area is a lot of fun, if also very tourist- centric and pricier than the rest of Puerto. Hostels and hotels, restaurants and surf shops make it a toursity but worthwhile visit while on your stay in Puerto.

546507309.name: Beach life!
546507309.author: a TripAdvisor user
546507309.reviewBody: This place is where I would love to live in! It is beautiful! Very organized, clean and not saturated.  Recommend the beautiful november sunsets!   It\'s a dream!

546038472.name: my trip
546038472.author: a TripAdvisor user
546038472.reviewBody: great beech for walks, learning to surf and just sunbathing good resturants. a great place to be you dont want to leave once youve been here a few days

545555787.name: Nice beach walks
545555787.author: a TripAdvisor user
545555787.reviewBody: Beautiful, unspoiled strech of beach. Amazing sunsets, perfect for happy hours or just to enjoy the sun!

545285398.name: Breathtaking Views
545285398.author: a TripAdvisor user
545285398.reviewBody: Zicatela Beach is a peaceful and relaxing place to wind down and watch God\u2019s outstanding creation. The waves are intense and the birds that fly over the water are unique creatures of Oaxaca\u2019s wildlife. You can also watch local surfers in the early mornings and evenings. There are restaurants with hammocks and lounge chairs to sit and drink coffee or fruit smoothies and juices. There are numerous hotels to choose from right across the street from the beach. Zicatela is a must when visiting Puerto Escondido!

542906567.name: Perfect Beach
542906567.author: a TripAdvisor user
542906567.reviewBody: Great tourist beach. Incredible surf and absolutely stunning sunsets. Street is very well lit at night.

542633369.name: Pro Surf Spot
542633369.author: a TripAdvisor user
542633369.reviewBody: Large main beach with pro surf spot and lots of cafes and restaurants at the very begining (hotel Santa Fe)

541972130.name: old time beach resort
541972130.author: a TripAdvisor user
541972130.reviewBody: Walking the beach is very hot out in the sun but there are many unique bars and restaurants along the way. Some even have hammocks to laze the day away. The surf is magnificent and those partaking of the activity are certainly well above the level of tourist surfers. Watching them ride inside the curl reminds you of surfing you see in movies. Across the street there are an abundance of hotels primarily as you would have found thirty years past. There is a beach culture to this place that you will not find in other vacation destinations.

540900838.name: Miss M
540900838.author: a TripAdvisor user
540900838.reviewBody: Beautiful, stretching sandy beach for miles. Good for experienced surfers and boogie boarders. On beach drink/food/ umbrellas and chairs if needed.

539543827.name: Young and buffed
539543827.author: a TripAdvisor user
539543827.reviewBody: This is the you persons beach. Lots of surfers- buffed, both women and men-lots of restaurantes and bars, surf shops etc. The place to be for the under 70 crowd. Big choice of places to eat on the beach and a great place for sunset.

538304952.name: Surfer hippie beach
538304952.author: a TripAdvisor user
538304952.reviewBody: A must visit if you are in the area . Fantastic little dirt road and sand floor restaurants. Love the vibe of this area .

535792715.name: Beautiful beach, nice surfing spot
535792715.author: a TripAdvisor user
535792715.reviewBody: Yes, the beach is beautiful. Loads of bars and restaurants, the ones directly on the beach being a bit more expansive. If\'re you\'re looking for a quieter, more autenthic spot, try la Punta.

534734662.name: Gorgeous beach and strong undertow.
534734662.author: a TripAdvisor user
534734662.reviewBody: We enjoyed watching surfing, sunsets and playing on the clean beach. The undertow is strong so we didn\'t spend much time in it (I have physical limitations so didn\'t want to.push it! Lol).\n

533908515.name: On Tour with the McLintons
533908515.author: a TripAdvisor user
533908515.reviewBody: At times this place made me feel a bit uneasy when we were waiting for our shuttle back to our resort.  But there is great shopping to be had and lots of restaurants and bars to choose from.

533781901.name: Beach, Adult Beverages and Surfers
533781901.author: a TripAdvisor user
533781901.reviewBody: Been going to Zicatela for 26 yrs now and although it definitely has grown, it\'s still a great place to hang out before heading back to Huatulco.   Surf competitions in May & Nov!  Good times!

532331719.name: Great place to surf or watch surfing!
532331719.author: a TripAdvisor user
532331719.reviewBody: These humongous waves are incredible to watch especially when some brave soul is riding it on a six foot fiberglass board!

531200387.name: Waves
531200387.author: a TripAdvisor user
531200387.reviewBody: One of the best waves on the world os right here. You can shred the gnar on this water walls. Nasty!!\nSome times local people get crazy. But they share if you know what are you doing. Bless!

516417329.name: Beautiful beach
516417329.author: a TripAdvisor user
516417329.reviewBody: Great beach for a walk, numerous good restaurants and shops. Very popular with surfers, low-rent hotels along this strip. Lovely!

515286166.name: The latest news
515286166.author: a TripAdvisor user
515286166.reviewBody: Greetings Travelers!  So you made it this far south and want to know where its happening. Zicatela is really good and international.  Great food, good music, and a mellow scene.  HOWEVER....I am writing this as a heads up.  Be super careful in the water because on the southern end of this beach, as well as a little north in Bacocho, as well as the river at La Barra, crocodiles have been coming up on the beach.  Several people have been bitten badly.  Especially do not go in the water at La Barra.  This is an unusual happening but it is happening so just be aware.  Friendly locals have told me the story and you should know this too.  This is no joke.  Do not let this keep you away from this great beach spot, because it is a real gem.  Enjoy!!!!

508799535.name: Surf spot
508799535.author: a TripAdvisor user
508799535.reviewBody:
July is the spot in the world to surf big waves!!!! Great wind from the ocean 20 to 30 foot waves, nice barrels.

People are super nice, service on the beach from the restaurant are really nice. 
Going back next year.
If you want to surf big wave, ITS THE PLACE

508106932.name: great place to part
508106932.author: a TripAdvisor user
508106932.reviewBody: if your into bars at the beach this is the right place with bars all over te beah even with pools. if you like quiet. low season is perfect with better prices and the beach all for yourself

507024117.name: Great for surf
507024117.author: a TripAdvisor user
507024117.reviewBody: The place is really good for sure or even if you like to swim on big waves mostly. A lot of businesses are opening shop and there is pretty much anything you\'d need nearby. \n\nThe only issue is that most locals litter all around the place, and they seem to not care about that at all...

506612018.name: A must
506612018.author: a TripAdvisor user
506612018.reviewBody: Zicatela is a blend of surfers, young people, beach clubs, bars and great food. The beach is a long strip of approximately 3km. A place to enjoy and chill.

504174846.name: Amazing beach
504174846.author: a TripAdvisor user
504174846.reviewBody: The beach is amazing and pretty long, not crowded at all. There are some big waves that are really fun to play with, but be careful as it can be really strong ones.

504051021.name: Greta waves great people!
504051021.author: a TripAdvisor user
504051021.reviewBody: Amazing waves guys, deff not for beginners, sunsets in this water just makes you travel to a diff world! Deff going back next year!

503938277.name: Topsurf, great peoplewatching
503938277.author: a TripAdvisor user
503938277.reviewBody: Long stretch of beach with forbidding vawes, you might not be able to go in the water unless you are an excellent surfer.\nHowever, it\'s great for hanging out, choose any small beach palapa restaurant with  beachservice umbrellas and sunbed. Hang out the whole day checking out thelifeguards, surfers, beachdogs or move to another palapa after a while for fresh perspectives

502231790.name: Very nice beach
502231790.author: a TripAdvisor user
502231790.reviewBody: Very nice beach with a chill out atmosphere. You get a wide array of things to do, eat, drink, see and experience. From surf, to skydive, relax, sunbathe, shopping

501265682.name: Beautiful beach perfect for Surfers!
501265682.author: a TripAdvisor user
501265682.reviewBody: I\'m not a surfer but I had a beautiful stay on this beach, the view is beautiful and there is a Beach Club named "Kabbalah", which is the best!\nWe couldn\'t swim in the sea due the dangerous waves but I definitily come back!

483833649.name: beautiful waves but only for boards, great bars, sights and hammocks
483833649.author: a TripAdvisor user
483833649.reviewBody: I\'m not a surfer so I wouldn\'t go into these waters. It\'s not for swimming as there are very dangerous under currents but most of the palapa bars have sunbeds/hammocks and showers to rinse off the extreme heat. There is a friendly surfer and old hippy vibe at most of the beach bars and most of them will russle you up some food when you choose. cocktails are fairly cheap but prices have been rising in the last few years due to an influx of more wealthy tourists that are only there for a week or two and can afford to splash out the cash. Still I reckon it\'s a travellers "must see". Try \'Esmereldas\'

482078996.name: Beautiful beach
482078996.author: a TripAdvisor user
482078996.reviewBody: Huge waves! Such an intimidating beach but beautiful.  We arrived early in the afternoon and were told to wait until later in the evening to watch the surfers.  We ate at a great restaurant on the beach with a bucket of Coronas.  Such a great afternoon.

480291145.name: Great waves
480291145.author: a TripAdvisor user
480291145.reviewBody:
We went to check out Zicatela Beach on a Saturday afternoon.  Tourist season was winding down but it was still busy.  There are tons of places to sit and just watch the awesome surf pound the beach, as well as bars and restaurants on the beach.  The surf, at least for people from the Midwest, is just plain fun to watch. 

I'm not a worldly traveler, but I have travelled and even lived in Mexico for a bit over the last 25+ years. I found the actual Zicatela Beach strip to be too busy and noisy for my taste, and I think "seedy" might be an appropriate term for that particular part of PE but I think using common sense and going at appropriate times one would be just fine.

478960882.name: Monster surf on a beautiful beach.
478960882.author: a TripAdvisor user
478960882.reviewBody: Depending on the time of year you get between huge surf and monstrously frightening surf.  There can be a killer (no pun intended) rip that will drag you out, down then beat you like few others.  Complete washing machine.\nNot for the feint hearted.\nIf you\'re going to surf, make certain you have a couple extra boards and one mistake will chew a board in a flash.

477299345.name: Zicatela is a must!
477299345.author: a TripAdvisor user
477299345.reviewBody: I just love what a wonderful beach and place this is. Lots of places to eat, the beach is utterly clean, at least when I was there and the area is pretty safe.\nI would love to give it a go once again.

476623554.name: Main Beach in Puerto
476623554.author: a TripAdvisor user
476623554.reviewBody: Playa Zicatela is the Main Beach in Puerto Escondido. It is right next to all Bars, Clubs and Restaurants in Puerto Escondido.

476288281.name: Zicatela at Night
476288281.author: a TripAdvisor user
476288281.reviewBody:
On the day, Zicatela is on the common / not so pretty side. A long beach devoid of palms, with waves that need expert level (on most occasions) to swim. 

But on the evening / night is another thing! You can walk all El Morro Avenue and see the local shops, crafts, and food: Tlayudas at Mamá Malu near the OXXO convenience store about Las Olas street and Hotel Acuario are a must! Or have a fancy dinner in any of the multiple restaurants there. Also a lot of them have tables at the beach, live music, lights, all for a great night! 

If you chose a seaside table, go stand up at the sea's lip, wash your feet in the warm water, and FEEL the weight of the waves hitting the ground. It's a very powerful thing! (Have care NOT to try to swim, people die regularly at this beach even when there's daylight). 

Locals are always happy to receive you, please don't act like a gringo springbreaker and be considerate of others. Remember Oaxaca has been hit hard by our local crisis. 
Smoking cannabis is illegal in Mexico, so beware of cops (they will rob you blind if they catch you), but locals are mostly ok, provided you're being discreet about it. 

Very safe.

474842978.name: Beautiful view
474842978.author: a TripAdvisor user
474842978.reviewBody: We spend only 4 day all was great,we love the beach clear water people very friendly and helpful, excellent food \nwill comeback soon.

474738413.name: waves!
474738413.author: a TripAdvisor user
474738413.reviewBody: You want to find some fun and killer waves? Zicatela is your beach! We had one of the best days during our visit there :)

473203398.name: Crowded!
473203398.author: a TripAdvisor user
473203398.reviewBody: Absolutely crowded with beginner surfers throwing their longboards.  Great if you can get there on a day when it\'s not so busy.  Watch out for an aggressive instructor named Alejandro.  He is known for his violent temper, pushing students into rocks and other surfers.

472001022.name: Great laid back vibe
472001022.author: a TripAdvisor user
472001022.reviewBody: Came here to surf with son! Very friendly and inexpensive to eat and stay! Be sure to triple check your hotel has AC. Big waves.

470145552.name: One of the top 3 surfing beaches in the world!
470145552.author: a TripAdvisor user
470145552.reviewBody: I am not a surfer but have spoken with surfers and agree that Playa Zicatela offers it all.  There is everything to offer here.  Fishing, swimming, surfing, boating, etc.....

468107343.name: Miles of beach quaint bars , restaurants
468107343.author: a TripAdvisor user
468107343.reviewBody: Miles of beach with huge rip tide be careful!! Mainly Young hostel surfing crowd. The busiest place had maybe 40 people most bars and restaurant 5-10 people. Very quiet.  No fine dining, just go where You see lots of People that way You know food is fresh.

467661067.name: Mind altering experience!
467661067.author: a TripAdvisor user
467661067.reviewBody: I thought I had seen big waves before but the power of these waves (and we went in March which is low season) was something to behold. In the morning, we enjoyed getting a coffee and watching the surfers and grabbing a bottle of wine each evening to watch the sunset and surfers too. The power and movement of the waves made us feel like we were watching a water show. This beach is definitely a "must see". I have a new respect for the ocean.

467278338.name: surfing
467278338.author: a TripAdvisor user
467278338.reviewBody: expansive beach. world class surfing. Expert surfers only. See the surfboard graveyard. Lifeguards. No swimming allowed. Plenty of beach cafes/bars, beach facilities etc. for families and everyone. Main Zicatela drag just off the beach. Hotels, stores, restaurants, bars and so on. Very busy, most touristy area in. Puerto Escondido, but largely retains the local essence of the town.

467119292.name: Wow
467119292.author: a TripAdvisor user
467119292.reviewBody: Yes a fantastic beach for surfing, and of coarse watching the huge waves coming in. Not a swimming beach, nice breezes off the water, long sunset walks, our favorite was dinner in one of the many restaurants on the beach with our feet in the sand, drinking Margaritas. \nThere is everything you need right on this strip, very layer back just like we like it. A definitely a redo next year.

466116000.name: Nice Beach
466116000.author: a TripAdvisor user
466116000.reviewBody: We visited in early March and after a leisurely breakfast, we would go sit on lunge chairs on the beach for a few hours.  These chairs are associated with small bars.  We noted that on two days, we literally were the only tourists for as far as we could see.  The beach is very nice with good surf.\n\nThere were a couple hawkers trying to sell us tourist junk, but the were not overly pushy.

465898113.name: Great place to relax and enjoy the beach!
465898113.author: a TripAdvisor user
465898113.reviewBody: Truly enjoyed our time in Playa Zicatela.  Everything you needed was within walking distance - sometimes only 10-15 metres!  Spent many a relaxing day there and would not hesitate to go back!

465368986.name: Fabulous Surfing Beach
465368986.author: a TripAdvisor user
465368986.reviewBody: This is a spectacular surfing beach.  I don\'t surf but spent a great day watching the surfers and walking/relaxing on the beach.  Great restaurants, bars and some nice shops.

464102309.name: A happening Place
464102309.author: a TripAdvisor user
464102309.reviewBody: Always lots to see and do, great food and shopping.  Lots of beach to walk along and interesting sights to see if you enjoy people\n

462124115.name: Long and gorgeous!
462124115.author: a TripAdvisor user
462124115.reviewBody: Incredible beach for all activities at one place or another. Swimming is safest only in certain areas. Watch other swimmers but at Principal & Marinero Bays on the north end and La Punta on the south end are good swimming. Watch the surfers in the middle section.\u2714\ud83c\udfc4\u200d\u2640\ufe0f\ud83c\udfc4\ud83c\udffe

461040389.name: Great surfing spot
461040389.author: a TripAdvisor user
461040389.reviewBody: This is a great surfing spot and a place where bars, surfing schools, diving schools and hotels are concentrated. You will also find plenty of offers for excursions. I especially recommend Deep Blue Diving school (also organizing whale/dolphin watching trips and snorkeling) and Lalo EcoTours due to well informed, honest and good english-speaking crew and environment friendly approach.

457733900.name: Very nice quiet and fine beach
457733900.author: a TripAdvisor user
457733900.reviewBody: The beach is quite long, really good for walking around, sun bathing or simply watch the sunset which is stunning

457728680.name: Cool beach with lots of cool bars
457728680.author: a TripAdvisor user
457728680.reviewBody: Zicatela is a HUGE beach with endless beach clubs and restaurants to choose from. Find yourself a sun chair, order a couple cocktails and prepare for a day of relaxation. \n\nThe beach is patrolled but I wouldn\'t recommend taking on the water unless you\'re a keen swimmer. There is quite a few rips that can take you by surprise.

456767593.name: watching the surfers
456767593.author: a TripAdvisor user
456767593.reviewBody: Excellent beach for watching  surfing action. Endless beach walking as well. Not crowded at all and lots of restaurants for food and relaxing.

456765047.name: Spectacular area
456765047.author: a TripAdvisor user
456765047.reviewBody: Beautiful, very LONG beach!  Loved the area, the sand and beach is spotless, exceptionally clean.  Plenty of restaurants along the beach to kick back, relax over drinks, lunch or dinner.  Very trendy!

456723597.name: Fun & Beauty in One Spot
456723597.author: a TripAdvisor user
456723597.reviewBody: This beach has a traditional look and has more tourist nearby, but still worth visiting for the late night entertainment.

456264625.name: Long Beach
456264625.author: a TripAdvisor user
456264625.reviewBody: Not for swimming but fun to watch wakeboarders and surfers. Restaurants along the beach and main road.

455615276.name: Awesome Beach
455615276.author: a TripAdvisor user
455615276.reviewBody:
Probably my favorite beach in the world. Long, curving, just perfect. 
Just enough activity and services, a couple of little stores with friendly people who remember your face, incredible food too. 
Also, no giant hotels filled with demanding, one-week-package tourists. 
It's a place you might come to for what you think will be 4-5 days, which stretches to 2-3 weeks. 
I was here for 3 weeks in November, 2016, then came back ( right now I'm in my hammock, as the sun starts to hit the sand) for another month-long stay. 
Nothing else to say, really. 
Oh, an ATM would be nice, but it gives you a reason to go into town (less than two dollars) to get cash, and go to the big store for groceries.

453398565.name: Beautiful!
453398565.author: a TripAdvisor user
453398565.reviewBody: While you can\'t swim there, this is a beautiful beach to sit at one of the many restaurants and have an ice cold beverage while watching the waves

453318079.name: Pure magic
453318079.author: a TripAdvisor user
453318079.reviewBody: Amazing waves, nice beach and very friendly people. Going to Puerto Escondido, you cannot miss this. Did some surfing for the first time in my life, and don\'t regret it!

452849285.name: Spectacular Surf
452849285.author: a TripAdvisor user
452849285.reviewBody: This is supposedly one of the worlds more renowned surfing beaches and even though we were there in the off season for surfing there was evidence of the oceans power. Lots of restaurants and accommodation along the beach.

452258032.name: Beautiful beach, but not for swimming
452258032.author: a TripAdvisor user
452258032.reviewBody: The beach is very nice, and it\'s nice to watch the sunset, but it\'s not suitable for swimming, or anything much in the water except surfing. There are various good restaurants and beach clubs, however.

451588295.name: Relax
451588295.author: a TripAdvisor user
451588295.reviewBody: Beautiful beach where you can just relax on the sand or walk along it.\nLots of bars and restaurants some of them with live music.

450848050.name: Big, beautiful beach
450848050.author: a TripAdvisor user
450848050.reviewBody: Find an umbrella, bring your pesos, interact with the locals and enjoy ocean-side treats like fresh-squeezed orange juice and tropical cocktails. You can\'t swim much on this beach - the waves are too rough. But the pleasant breeze and umbrella shade provides the perfect level of comfort from the blazing sun.

450819669.name: Cool place
450819669.author: a TripAdvisor user
450819669.reviewBody: Very cool place in the cool village of Puerto Escondido. There are big waves in the sea, so this place is eden for surfers and it is not ideal place for swimming, but if you like jumping into the waves it can be nice experience for you. Be careful,there are strong water streams. \n

449932546.name: My favorite place in Mexico
449932546.author: a TripAdvisor user
449932546.reviewBody: The title says it all. We have driven over 10K miles throughout Mexico over the years, and this beach has the best vibe. Old school Hawaii vibe.

448521987.name: Party place
448521987.author: a TripAdvisor user
448521987.reviewBody: Great for partying at night on the beach! Lots of international ppl. Try Bar Fly. They had great music. Not a quiet and relaxed vibe though...more upbeat and wild.

448400686.name: Great for surfing
448400686.author: a TripAdvisor user
448400686.reviewBody: Great for surfers, not suitable for swimming which was quite dissapointing. Good restaurants around the area.

446745412.name: Great surfing!
446745412.author: a TripAdvisor user
446745412.reviewBody: The beach is amazing and the waves are fun to play in but watch for the undertow on this beach. Lifeguards are always on the watch and very helpful.

445130299.name: Nice long and wide beach which clean sand with some moderate surf
445130299.author: a TripAdvisor user
445130299.reviewBody: The sand was hot and the water comfortable.  Took a bit to get used to the casual vendors selling anything they can carry, but after a while it becomes normal just to say no and for them to move on.  There are more vendors on Puerto Vallarta, Cabo and Cancun beaches than here, and the beach is nicer.

439988747.name: Good for a quick visit
439988747.author: a TripAdvisor user
439988747.reviewBody: The beach was so crouded that in a moment was too much. I don\'t know if it was because of the fishing tournament but we did not enjoy too much the experience. Even thoug we get to a very good restaruant called Sabor a Mar just in the corner between Zicaleta and the main bay.

439639226.name: Good Beach, But It Gets Hot.
439639226.author: a TripAdvisor user
439639226.reviewBody: We visited in late November. The beach and waves look like Southern California beaches where the sea temperatures are rarely over 70F, but here the water temp is in the 80\'s. So expect hot humid days.  May not seem that uncomfortable to many travelers, but I\'m a weather wimp from SoCal. The sunsets and nights were beautiful. No fancy hotels or restaurants but we enjoyed numerous eateries right on the beach. We were very impressed by the cleanliness of the beach and all the businesses.

439458092.name: Best beach to chill and enjoy
439458092.author: a TripAdvisor user
439458092.reviewBody: This place is great to visit on regular weekdays or weekends. No crowds and the restaurants and bars are very always available to enjoy.\nThe people of this town is very friendly and it is great to see people from all over the world in such a great harmony.\nThis place is a must.

439395400.name: Lots of action
439395400.author: a TripAdvisor user
439395400.reviewBody: Right at the surfing hub this beach sees a lot of action - be careful swimming though, it is really meant for surfing! The whole place is buzzing in November for the sailfish tournament.

437251769.name: World Famous Surfing Beach
437251769.author: a TripAdvisor user
437251769.reviewBody: This is a long beautiful beach that is world-famous for surfing. The waves are intense so you can\'t go swimming, but its mesmerizing just to look at and watch the waves crash, or go for a long walk.

435467205.name: Great for surfing or a walk not to swim
435467205.author: a TripAdvisor user
435467205.reviewBody: Great place to do or watch surfers, not for beguinners. Also nice to go for a walk early on the morning before 8 or in the eve. Not good if you would like to swim

435449197.name: Great beach, and good eats
435449197.author: a TripAdvisor user
435449197.reviewBody: Just walk along, you will find some place great to eat or drink, There is some good boutique shopping, but not lots.

435422971.name: Zicatela is just great
435422971.author: a TripAdvisor user
435422971.reviewBody: One of the best beaches of M\u00e9xico. Perfect for surfing, running or just hang out and chill. Favorite amonung everyone. Good food near by. A "must".

434257204.name: Awesome laid back beach.
434257204.author: a TripAdvisor user
434257204.reviewBody: Love this place .   Not like Cancun, Acapulco, Huatulco.   Peaceful laid back place. Beach is a surf beach. Great for long walks and sucking up the sun.

432713746.name: World best beach brake. One of big wave beach.
432713746.author: a TripAdvisor user
432713746.reviewBody: Beach has waves, except Dec. Surfers go to La Barra this season. Restaurants and accommodations are along side of long beach. Monthly rent is cheap here. Big wave on May, June. Surfing on Nov. Body board in summer.

432274384.name: Great for surfing! Waves are pretty intense!
432274384.author: a TripAdvisor user
432274384.reviewBody: This beach is beautiful; we walked up and down, and waded no more than a few meters in. If you are a surfer, this is the place to be. The annual surfing competition is in November - which says a lot about the quality and strength of the waves. The current is strong, I would recommend going to Playa Zipolite about 45 min away for a more playful and safe swimming experience. Great vibe, and good restaurants along the way.

432012853.name: Beautiful beach and amenities
432012853.author: a TripAdvisor user
432012853.reviewBody:
We booked our trip based on Trip Advisor reviews about Puerto Escondido that seem to have catered to a youth hostel crowd - without us figuring out the clues. We stayed in a different area to Playa Zicatela and if we could do it over again, this would have been a nicer place to stay. For instance, more of these hotels have air conditioning! Nothing near us does, except one local grocer. 
This beach is meant to be touristy yes, but in October it's been empty and we've been here for a beautiful season with the place to ourselves! 
The amenities are just different - much more like the resort you expect on a vacation. 
The people everywhere here are lovely so we had a nice time regardless. But I think this area is more what couples might have in mind when you're past the backpacking stage of life!

432001643.name: Great if you surf but not so much if you don\'t
432001643.author: a TripAdvisor user
432001643.reviewBody: I went to Zicatela knowing it was known as the Mexican Pipeline but didn\'t realise I wouldn\'t be able to swim there at all. I arrived at night to stay at a small bungalow which was advertised as being super friendly but i found it small, the guests were mostly volunteers eating dinner together and didn\'t even offer me the opportunity to purchase a meal, so all in all rude. So i left the next day and found a hotel with a pool and super friendly staff. Apart from a few restaurants, you really need to head to other places to enjoy this area (again unless you are surfing), I visited Puerto Angelita (and think I picked up a bad ear infection from the water) and Puerto Escondido markets. I had a nice 10 days relaxing which was badly needed after packing up work and home in Australia and moving to Mexico. I think there are better places out there and I am looking forward to visiting Zacetecas, Guanjajoto and Michoachan for starters. Oh and Im off to Sayulita so will keep you posted.

431957512.name: Long and hot
431957512.author: a TripAdvisor user
431957512.reviewBody: Better viewed from a distance with cold beer in hand. Many restaurants and bars along beach. Our hotel had a 6th floor terrace which gave us a lovely view.  Zicatela is known for its big waves. Not suitable for non swimmers or kids. Good for surfers. Walking would be great early in the morning.  One morning, the water turned brown. Haven\'t found the explanation for that yet but even the locals departed with their surfboards.

431625764.name: Great beach for surfing or people watching.
431625764.author: a TripAdvisor user
431625764.reviewBody: I love this beach. It is central to the town of Puerto escondido. There are ots of shops and restaurants that line the beach. Not very good for swimming but great to splash in the shallows or better to go for a surf.

426854581.name: Serious Waves!
426854581.author: a TripAdvisor user
426854581.reviewBody: Nice beach for a stroll or to watch the towering waves crashing in!  Lined with restaurants and bars and fairly clean.  Wasn\'t particularly busy during my visit but I can see how the potential to be crowded is there.

422551375.name: Great clean beach
422551375.author: a TripAdvisor user
422551375.reviewBody: We were there for off season and it still had a great vibe - great drinks and restaurants along the beach. We had fun chilling out there for a few days

421891796.name: Awesome
421891796.author: a TripAdvisor user
421891796.reviewBody: Great beach for surfers, great waves!!\nYou can\'t just go to the water the waves are too strong but the restaurants are good.

420831658.name: Just chill!
420831658.author: a TripAdvisor user
420831658.reviewBody: If you enjoy of have fun without pretentions zicatela is for you. You can have party all night long every day of the week and if you want to be in touch with yourself you cab go for a walk in the beach at morning or the afternoon. Also is full of good restaurants at a reasonable cost.

411568526.name: Clean with plenty of options
411568526.author: a TripAdvisor user
411568526.reviewBody: Shady hammocks, fresh food restaurants (sidewalk cafes to more elegant choices), street art worth taking pics, surfers, sun worshipping, art stores... it\u00b4s all here.

410317574.name: Only for Surf
410317574.author: a TripAdvisor user
410317574.reviewBody: Unfortunately the sea on this beach makes it unsuitable to swim. It super rough and the lifeguards forbid you to even paddle. Look at the other beaches if you just want to relax and swim

403439765.name: great gold jewewlry!
403439765.author: a TripAdvisor user
403439765.reviewBody: bring pesos, very humid - even in December. And try and find a group that releases sea turtles - awesome experience!

403081199.name: Wow, great waves!
403081199.author: a TripAdvisor user
403081199.reviewBody:
I walked from the west side to the east to (La Punta) & it is a long beautiful, sandy beach with giant waves. Not a great swimming beach but so fun to watch the surfers.
There are many restaurants & shops so I would give it some time to explore & sightsee.
El Cafecito is a very popular restaurant  on the Zicatela stretch  although often has lineups but there are plenty of other great choices.
