Many independent vendors pop up along the street selling handmade jewellry, handicrafts & food etc. in the morning & stay as long as the weather permits. Sometimes because of the heat & this time of year, a summer shower could come out of nowhere. Rainy season is not a bad time to come because there are so many less people than the winter. It does get humid but wear cotton or linen that is sleeveless, light coloured & loose.✔️

401731318.name: great surf real mexican beach.
401731318.author: a TripAdvisor user
401731318.reviewBody: Arrived in high season, we love it. This beach at la punta is great for surfing! Good food, clean. Care for your valuables like any other places do not leave temptations!  Great fun.

397129682.name: Awesome place to watch the waves
397129682.author: a TripAdvisor user
397129682.reviewBody: The swell was fairly high when my girlfriend and I got to the beach so we just relaxed in one of the many restaurants that lines the beach to watch the waves crash down. Awesome way to spend the day!

392629469.name: Good surf
392629469.author: a TripAdvisor user
392629469.reviewBody: Great place to surf or bogie board the big waves, or watch if you prefer.  The beach is very clean and a great hang out spot for locals during sunset.

392246364.name: Beautiful Beach wonderful place for pictures
392246364.author: a TripAdvisor user
392246364.reviewBody: Puerto Escondido has beautiful beaches, I love Zicatela the most because it has a lot going on and there are tons of restaurants and it has massive waves.

387481903.name: Sleepy Surf town, not hopping in Summer
387481903.author: a TripAdvisor user
387481903.reviewBody: It may be fun in Winter, but there are too many half built hotels and the town didn\'t regulate the building and there isn\'t enough tourism clearly to support the hotels. Too bad. Wish the local government would be smart with it\'s building, but they were not.

387349095.name: Touristy
387349095.author: a TripAdvisor user
387349095.reviewBody: Lot of high end jewelry shops. Great for surfers to hang out. Restaurants not much better than Rinconada. Great night life for youth.

383133035.name: What more can you want
383133035.author: a TripAdvisor user
383133035.reviewBody: Perfect pLace to chill surf and sky dive. Or if you want to hang out there\'s plenty street food and perfect margaritas on the beach. Look out for the flute man amongst other local music.

381281736.name: a magical playa and is great for surfing too
381281736.author: a TripAdvisor user
381281736.reviewBody: best playa around Puerto Escondido. plenty of restaurants and merch. you can take surfing lessons (not that expensive). not a good spot for swimming though.

378623039.name: Great for surf watching, not swimming.
378623039.author: a TripAdvisor user
378623039.reviewBody: Great long beach for walking and surf / surfer watching. Loads of restaurants which offer shaded chairs for lounging on the beach (often based on consumption). Unfortunately not a great beach for swimming.

378471934.name: A place to relax and enjoy the coastal beauty
378471934.author: a TripAdvisor user
378471934.reviewBody: There is plenty of beach for everyone at Playa Zicatela. Whether you want to walk along the water or enjoy a fresh fruit juice while relaxing with your feet in the sand at one of the little beach front restaurants. There are plenty of souvenir shops in the mix of eclectic restaurants and coffee shops. We always visit Zicatela while visiting Puerto Escondido. The location is just beautiful and inviting!

376520092.name: A hidden gem in Mexico!
376520092.author: a TripAdvisor user
376520092.reviewBody: Zicatela is the best option for those looking for either waves, natural attractions, healthy food or just a place to relax. I must admit that every restaurant that my friends and I tried here was the best option we could make, moreover I loved the multicultural and kind of hippie atmosphere that Zicatela has to offer to its tourists!

374296580.name: Beautiful golden sands and massive surf
374296580.author: a TripAdvisor user
374296580.reviewBody: Zicatela is a stunning long beach with world famous surf and funky chiringueto style cafes on the sands and a laid back Bali tropical  atmosphere

371638721.name: Beautiful beach
371638721.author: a TripAdvisor user
371638721.reviewBody: This beach was very clean. It\'s also had plenty of restaurants right on the beach with areas to lounge and enjoy the scenery! It also had plenty of shopping and restaurants on the Main Street.

370740200.name: Beautiful views
370740200.author: a TripAdvisor user
370740200.reviewBody: This is a surfer\'s paradise. Beautiful to watch the waves. Some great restaurants and friendly people.  Wonderful to watch surfing.

369549991.name: Fun to watch!
369549991.author: a TripAdvisor user
369549991.reviewBody: Fun watching the giant waves come in, and watch the surfers. The waves here crash hard! Neat to experience, but we traveled to safer areas to swim!

367927334.name: So you wana be a ZicaChiller
367927334.author: a TripAdvisor user
367927334.reviewBody: I was staying half way betweenal Oaxaca dishes, catering to whatever your tastes. La Punta and Zicatela and so I came here most days. It has a whole bunch of beach front bars, where you can buy a few cervezas and spend the day lazing in beach chairs watching the waves and spectacular sunsets. An amazing neon red like I have never seen. Scattered along the streets and surf board hire shops, hotels, hippy/surf clothes chops and a whole bunch of restaurants offering beautiful fish tacos and street food serving traditional Oaxaca food, catering to whatever your tastes.

367177216.name: Beachwalking and people watching
367177216.author: a TripAdvisor user
367177216.reviewBody: Famous for surfing, Zicatela beach offers many restaurants geared towards helping you to kick back and relax with shade and a cool drink. The surf is too rough for swimming though.

366455062.name: Rough Seas in April, not great for swimming
366455062.author: a TripAdvisor user
366455062.reviewBody: we were staying down the road but the couple of times we visited this was a washing machinee and completely unsafe for swimming - even for experienced swimmers. I think even the surfers were preferring la punta. The area is nice tho with lots of nice bars and restaurants

365769946.name: Surf and party
365769946.author: a TripAdvisor user
365769946.reviewBody: Nice and big waves, even when its small is nice...but you got to be prepared for strongs wipeouts...\nAt night its the best place to be, cold beer, nice food and a lots of people in the streets

364806529.name: great surf
364806529.author: a TripAdvisor user
364806529.reviewBody: I had this beach right in front of my hotel Olas Altas. Loved every minute of it. There are many small bodegas, bars and restaurants with beach view close by, so no need to pack a picnic. Just bring a towel, and possibly a surf board, and have a blast.

363048299.name: Great beach - good for surfers, yet fairly quiet
363048299.author: a TripAdvisor user
363048299.reviewBody: This was our nearest beach and we loved it.  It\'s a small bay, away from the main beach.  Surfers (which we are not) obviously liked it, but it was far from crowded when we went: ideal.  There are cafes where you can sit at a table in the shade all day as long as you buy the  odd drink or two.

361483628.name: The perfect beach
361483628.author: a TripAdvisor user
361483628.reviewBody: Great for walking morning and evening, and has many places to sit under an umbrella and drink something cool during the afternoon while watching surfers.

361333786.name: Love this Beach
361333786.author: a TripAdvisor user
361333786.reviewBody: This is my favourite beach in Puerto Escondido. Great place to get some sun and watch the HUGE waves. There are some good restaurant on the beach too like Fresh.

360487842.name: Amazing waves
360487842.author: a TripAdvisor user
360487842.reviewBody: This is the favourite beach for surfers from around the globe.  The waves are spectacular.   Nice places to eat all along the beach.  Would not recommend swimming but great way to spend the day

357468963.name: Beautiful
357468963.author: a TripAdvisor user
357468963.reviewBody: Not much more to say. Just gorgeous. Not a beach for swimming since it has big surf. But great for walking, surfing, or just worshipping the sun.

357435521.name: Nice Beach
357435521.author: a TripAdvisor user
357435521.reviewBody: This beach has big surf too dangerous for swimming but lots of great wave for experienced surfers.  There are many great restaurants and a some with live music!

357014484.name: Great vibe!
357014484.author: a TripAdvisor user
357014484.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, very clean with lots of places right on the beach to enjoy a morning coffee or beverage later on. We were only here for 3 days, waves are huge so take extreme caution if going for a swim! Lifeguards are on duty all day and many restaurants keep the sand raked and sifted for debris. I can certainly see why many photographers frequent Playa Zicatela! Vibe is great, people are great. Many great spots to eat or drink. The most beautiful sunsets i  have seen!!

354574632.name: Gorgeous!
354574632.author: a TripAdvisor user
354574632.reviewBody: This is a very pretty beach to stroll and a serious walk if you go end to end.I don\'t know about swimming in the waves,but for a beach walk it\'s wonderful and visually stunning.

354355127.name: Great waves
354355127.author: a TripAdvisor user
354355127.reviewBody: We came here for the surf and it didnt disappoint at all. We caught wave after wave 10 plus feet, clean shore breakers. Very nice long beach.

352843640.name: Great walking beach
352843640.author: a TripAdvisor user
352843640.reviewBody: What a great beach to walk. What we liked best was the fact that at night the restaurants turn spot lights on so that the beach is illuminated. It was nice to be able to sit on the beach long after sunset and not feel like you needed to be seated at a restaurant to enjoy the evenings. Wish more destinations would do that.

352608040.name: Beautiful Beach
352608040.author: a TripAdvisor user
352608040.reviewBody: During a recent motorcycle journey to Puerto Escondido I stayed near Playa Zicatela. I have to say, I was impressed by the size and quality of the playa (beach). It\'s wide, long and clean. The beach bars/restaurants are spaced out nicely and have good service out to the beach area. The ocean is a bit rough for swimming but if you like to surf or boogyboard, it\'s great.

351982752.name: A beautiful long, quiet beach - but no swimming
351982752.author: a TripAdvisor user
351982752.reviewBody: The beach sand is silky, the sea clean and turquoise green. But there are strong undercurrents which make it dangerous to swim. You can however watch experts surfing while drinking or eating with your feet in the sand. Of course, if you are a surfer, you\'ll already know all about this beach!

351170091.name: Wonderful
351170091.author: a TripAdvisor user
351170091.reviewBody: Beautiful beach.  Use the restaurant to the left at the base of the stairs and ask for Jose\'s tables.  He\'ll take excellent care of you day after day if you\'re not stingy with your tips.  Try learing to paddle board or surf.   Good for snorkeling with turtle sightings fairly regular.

350811012.name: Long wide beach with big waves
350811012.author: a TripAdvisor user
350811012.reviewBody: Playa Zicatela is world renowned for its big wave action and surfers from all over the world come here to try their hand (or feet) at it. The waves that make it great for surfing also make it very dangerous for swimming. In addition to the big waves, the ocean currents here are very strong; this means that the red danger flags are flying along the beach most days. Do not ignore these warnings - this beach is for surfing, body-boarding, or wading only. The sandy beach is about a mile or two long and very wide; at its mid-point there are some beach side restaurants and bars with umbrellas and loungers. If you want to sit on the beach, I\'d advise bringing your own umbrella for shade - there are no trees or anything else to protect you from the very strong sun here. If you\'re walking, it\'s best to get out there before 9 am - it\'s hot in Puerto Escondido! Sometimes horses canter along the beach. Pelicans are plentiful, too.

350006057.name: Interesting stretch of beach
350006057.author: a TripAdvisor user
350006057.reviewBody: Long beach area with places safe for swimming, fishing boats come up on the beaches and a good boogie / surfing beach. Great place for early morning walks before the sun becomes too hot. Nice views.

349651039.name: Strong Wind and Waves
349651039.author: a TripAdvisor user
349651039.reviewBody: The beach stretch is absolutely beautiful. The water is a brilliant blue with warm, soft sand. We enjoyed the fun atmosphere and jumping into the powerful waves, and some rough surfing on good days. However, when the wind picks up, staying there is not an option as the long, open stretch of beach has no obstructions, leading to some serious sand-blasting. The best times to go to avoid the heat, sun, and wind would be the morning before 9 and the afternoon after 3.

348718117.name: Will never go back
348718117.author: a TripAdvisor user
348718117.reviewBody: I am a beach lover and did not like Zipolite at all. There was no character and culture. Just a nude beach that I would never recommend or go back to, ever.

348619625.name: Dog heaven
348619625.author: a TripAdvisor user
348619625.reviewBody: The beach is incredible and long. If you can\'t manage waves or have small children, consider other places. Also, if you don\'t like or are afraid of them, not a place for you. They are everywhere, free and though really well care for they hang out in pack. Poop, yes, there is some but not much and nobody will die from it. They play on the beach with each other at sunset and are quite cute. Mexicans really take care of their pet. If you dream of surfing, this is the place for you. Choose your school wisely. The people are nice, friendly and even beach vendor will not insist. Great place, would go back anytime.

347022972.name: Loved watching the surfers
347022972.author: a TripAdvisor user
347022972.reviewBody: What a great way to spend the day. Beach is wide. Lots of places to get something to eat or drink and escape the sun. The surf was high but not crazy so not as intimidating as we thought. I think the really big waves come closer to summer. Loved watching the surfers. Great time :)

346080722.name: BIG Surf, not for kids
346080722.author: a TripAdvisor user
346080722.reviewBody:
Beautiful pounding big rolling surf.  A mecca for Surfers (Top 10 in World)

This is NOT a swimming Beach unless you're strong or the surf is low, the end furthest from town is more sheltered but can still be a challenge to get in and out.

Bring lots of WATER... it's warm under the sun.

The sound of the pounding surf is delightful, watching birds soar up and down the crest of the waves and spectacular sunsets.  Has two miles plus of wide, white sandy beach and lots of entertainment at the end closer to town.  

Bars, loud music and shops late into the night make it an adult only destination.

There are much safer beaches in Puerto Escondido for families and children.

345953201.name: Our local beach, not suitable for children but OK for a swim when the surf and undertow were abated
345953201.author: a TripAdvisor user
345953201.reviewBody: Zicatela is primarily a surf beach although the high surf was not in evidence during our time in January, 2016.\nOur hotel being steps away it was the focus of our walks and the focus of our dining activity during the two weeks were were in Puerto Escondido.  The selection of restaurants, bars, cafes and hotels makes Zicatela a preferred location.  Many establishments offer live music which, combined with generous (multi hour) Happy Hours is most enjoyable.

345604523.name: AMAZING BEACH!
345604523.author: a TripAdvisor user
345604523.reviewBody: Zicatela is the best beach if you want to surf and to enjoy the nightlife.\nPlenty of restaurant and clubs are waiting for you every day and night to enjoy from breakfast to late drinks.\nEnjoy a cerveza or a margarita watching the sun going down, walk on the beach, take a rest or a sunbath, eat fish, dance, enjoy life and enjoy Zicatela!

345589378.name: Big Surf, Unsafe Swimming
345589378.author: a TripAdvisor user
345589378.reviewBody: For years I\'ve been going to Puerto Escondido and every year there are drownings on Playa Zicatela.  It\'s a great place to watch the surfers, but the undertow is usually always there.  Take a beach blanket and catch some sun and watch the world go by, but be careful if you swim.  The lifeguards are not always on duty.  They\'re there usually on holidays and maybe weekends.  It\'s easy to go to the concessions and by drinks and food.

343797990.name: Great beach for walking
343797990.author: a TripAdvisor user
343797990.reviewBody: Walk all of the way to point and back for five mile hike! Saw turtles and sea snakes. Lot of surfers

343648708.name: Wrong-headed Development
343648708.author: a TripAdvisor user
343648708.reviewBody: The newly built beach-side restaurants & bars block a view of the ocean in many places...a big mistake!

343070153.name: Cool place for watching the surfers!
343070153.author: a TripAdvisor user
343070153.reviewBody: Great place to grab a beer and watch the surfers risk life and limb!!        Sp many great places to choose from too.  Miss it already!

341696343.name: seemingly endless beach and endless waves
341696343.author: a TripAdvisor user
341696343.reviewBody: Playa Zicatela provides a broad expanse of sand  and surf. The waves are varied so gauge their strength - they can be strong enough for surfing so take care with younger children and weak swimmers. For a nominal commitment to purchase food/beverages or for a flat rental fee, you can have use of seating and shade. The usual vendors are present with a range of food items, crafts and some services - the massages are well worth it!  The vendors respect a simple decline to purchase. Zicatela seems a prime location to watch those brave enough to parasail. Take advantage of a walk along the beach between swims. It\'s a short walk to the main street where shops and restaurant offer a range of items.

341049154.name: Loooooooong beach
341049154.author: a TripAdvisor user
341049154.reviewBody:
This is one of the longest beaches I've ever been at.
Perfect to watch the surfers in the morning, and the sunset at the evening.
A lot of bars and restaurants along the beach.

The only down side is all the loose wild dogs strolling around.

339803312.name: Get your bearings in Puerto
339803312.author: a TripAdvisor user
339803312.reviewBody: Playa Zicatela is the spot to relax, people watch and shop while in Puerto. \nThere are many restaurants to choose from depending on your taste and budget. Some places on the beach offer covered lounges close to the water as well as more regular restaurant style dining.\nThe ocean here is famous for the waves so that usually means a wade for me.  The break is strong and too far out for swimming.  Surfing is big here, no mistake about it!

337928951.name: Still spectacular!
337928951.author: a TripAdvisor user
337928951.reviewBody: Beautiful wide bay with great, daunting surfswells, not for beginners.\nStrewn with beachrestaurants renting chairs and selling food and the street opposite full of surfstores, souvenirshops, restaurants this is a must on any stop in Puerto Escondido

337845487.name: Great for surfing, or watching
337845487.author: a TripAdvisor user
337845487.reviewBody: We are not surfers, but enjoy watching them on this huge beach. The waves are too rough for comfort, so we just stay in the edge. But the beach is lovely, very uncrowded, and  with loungers, under umbrellas, with good food/drink service. It\'s also slap next to so many stores and restaurants - and a great place to hace dinner, and watch the sunset.

337650159.name: The Best of Puerto Escondido
337650159.author: a TripAdvisor user
337650159.reviewBody: A lovely beach, awesome little places to eat and a great nightlife make Zicatela the best option in Puerto. It is ok during high season, although it can be a bit crowded. Trust me, during the low season, it is really paradise, both for fun and relaxation. \n\nA warning: the beach restaurants may try to trick you into paying too much for a sunbed, so ask before settling down.

337099550.name: Nice
337099550.author: a TripAdvisor user
337099550.reviewBody: It\'s a big beach where you can have fun, swimming, eating and drinking. The most popular and urbanized beach. I really prefer the others than this one but you mustn\'t miss it.

336680941.name: Beautiful but no swimming
336680941.author: a TripAdvisor user
336680941.reviewBody: Gorgeous beach but for surfers and waders only. Dangerous undertow. An amazing place for sunset watching!!

336666037.name: My little slice of heaven.
336666037.author: a TripAdvisor user
336666037.reviewBody: Not much to say. I have been coming here for years and it\'s amazing. All of it, the food, the people, the beach, the vibe, all of it. I live in China now and I just came back here to spend New Years, it\'s that awesome.

336228595.name: Great!
336228595.author: a TripAdvisor user
336228595.reviewBody: Just great!!! Love this beach!!! Is not totally for swing because of the waves. It\'s most likely to surf! Very good beach for surf!!!

335855593.name: Great sand, great waves, clean
335855593.author: a TripAdvisor user
335855593.reviewBody: I loves Zicatela. One of Mexico\'s best surf spots, but too popular for its own good. Lots of young people but not great for kids. If you have kids walk to Punta or stay in Puerto

335128530.name: Popular beach for tourists
335128530.author: a TripAdvisor user
335128530.reviewBody: Great beach to find little restaurants and cafes with a grand view of the ocean and people surfing. Restaurants are right on the sand and have palapa roofs to keep you cool in the heat. Also there are shops to find local souvenirs.

334497476.name: Big and quiet...
334497476.author: a TripAdvisor user
334497476.reviewBody: My guide book said not safe for swimming. Hut there are lifeguards  and I talked to them and they said sometimes the ocean is very rough. The beach is very big with a lot of restaurants looking over the ocean. In the evening you can rent a horse and ride along the ocean.

333041897.name: Bohemianism alive and well.
333041897.author: a TripAdvisor user
333041897.reviewBody: The Playa Zicatela neighborhood is a gem on the east end of the beach.  Some great little restaurants and a myriad of different places to stay.  Locals surf break also.  Very eclectic and international, both in expats and travelers.

332067150.name: Great beach
332067150.author: a TripAdvisor user
332067150.reviewBody: A must see, spent the day there swimming and having very good drinks.  The people are very attentive there.

331514278.name: Great beach but not good for swimming
331514278.author: a TripAdvisor user
331514278.reviewBody: If you\'re a surfer you will love it but if you are looking for a lovely little swim you have come to the wrong place. \n\nGreat sunset, great for surfing and thats good enough for me.

330704441.name: Busy, trendy neighborhood
330704441.author: a TripAdvisor user
330704441.reviewBody: Great neighborhood to take a stroll through all the beach front restaurants and shops. Surf is a bit rough for swimming, but we braved it!

328858546.name: Holiday in Puerto Escondido
328858546.author: a TripAdvisor user
328858546.reviewBody: This is avery nice beach but very dangerous for non-swimmers as the waves are very strong. The beach is lined with restaurants. The surf is excellent.

322206036.name: Surfers paradise
322206036.author: a TripAdvisor user
322206036.reviewBody: Beautiful sunset nice to stroll during the evening.\nIt is quiet late october but very nice.\nFew great places for a drink like Barfly, Sativa for Food.

316018054.name: Awesome beach
316018054.author: a TripAdvisor user
316018054.reviewBody: The whole area here is amazing, and one of the most beautiful beaches I have seen. I can see why surfers like the area, because on some days, there were some incredible waves!

311441648.name: The waves are huge
311441648.author: a TripAdvisor user
311441648.reviewBody: If you visit Puerto escondido you definitely have to stop by zicatela if you like surfing this is the place to be. Plus must of the good restaurants and the international community hangs here. Best views

306488899.name: Chilled out
306488899.author: a TripAdvisor user
306488899.reviewBody: Great beach to spend the day relaxing, surfing and swimming. Do be careful of the little stingrays though. There are also lots of activities to do on the beach.

306312601.name: Not for swimming
306312601.author: a TripAdvisor user
306312601.reviewBody: If you like to go in the water and are not a very strong swimmer then forget going to Zicatela. Stay somewhere else, recommend near Playa Carizalillo, where you can swim, and go to Zicatela in the evening to have a bite to eat and walk the beach. But if you just like to walk the beach and watch surfing Zicatela is great. Stay at the Hotel Santa Fe, they have affordable deals in the off season.

302551084.name: Sweet beach to chill
302551084.author: a TripAdvisor user
302551084.reviewBody: Nice beach, pretty busy, lots of surf, La Punta is great with little restaurants, cafes, more chilled etc

301513732.name: Beautiful beach
301513732.author: a TripAdvisor user
301513732.reviewBody: Really pretty, but not for swimming.  You can get good food as well and good attention by very friendly people.  Mainly meant for surfing.

289888367.name: Sunny and chilling evenings
289888367.author: a TripAdvisor user
289888367.reviewBody: I don\'t surf anymore but I love sunset at La Punta. One of my favourite spot to enjoy a Pacifico Clara beer :)

288593115.name: Not really for the beginner
288593115.author: a TripAdvisor user
288593115.reviewBody: This is a lovely long surf beach. Strong currents and undertows. Not for the beginner it is known as Mexicos Pipeline so mainly a surf spot.

284224962.name: Great beach
284224962.author: a TripAdvisor user
284224962.reviewBody: These is the best place for surfing with great waves\nI have been coming here for a few years and love it\nThe thing is that they are building every we\'re and is taking the charm away

276546790.name: Great if you surf
276546790.author: a TripAdvisor user
276546790.reviewBody: Playa Zicatela is not the perfect place to lay on the sand and go for occasional dips in the ocean. The huge waves  and underwater currents make the latter a struggle more than a enjoyment.\nThe northern part of the beach is slightly more touristy with a number of bars in all price ranges. We enjoyed chilling here and watching the very experienced surfers catching the biggest waves we\'ve ever seen. There are also several good restaurants, shops and mini-markets in the area, so you can have all your needs met.\nThe southern part of the beach (a.k.a. La Punta) is more quiet, even though there are enough bars and a few eating places to choose from. I took some intermediate surfing lessons here as the waves in that part are much more bearable for non-experts. I did not have to book in advance, I just showed up on the beach well before the high tide and ask around for surf instructors. There are many, so you can easily negotiate both the price down and the duration of the lessons up.

275729338.name: Excellent all Around
275729338.author: a TripAdvisor user
275729338.reviewBody: My wife and I might not be the best seers but the cuisine around thus beach and the powerful waves create such a relaxing atmosphere.

273628913.name: Great local surf scene
273628913.author: a TripAdvisor user
273628913.reviewBody: Great local scene for surfing.  We booked a half day lesson with someone suggested by our host and my daughter tore it up

272821506.name: Big waves
272821506.author: a TripAdvisor user
272821506.reviewBody: Nice beach, not a lot of choices to hang out for the day, when we were there it had massive waves , so big that it was unsafe to swim, but we would go back

272810487.name: Some good bars and eateries but pretty dirty
272810487.author: a TripAdvisor user
272810487.reviewBody: You can\'t swim at this beach, which we already knew, because it is for advanced surfers only. However it is fun to get a beer at one of the beach bars and watch the surfers in action. The beach itself is a little dirty which kills the ambience a bit though. Lots of nightlife although it was a bit scattered and hard to find a bar with a good vibe going on. Some good eateries, but also some super average ones. Overall it was fine but we much preferred Playa Carrizalillo which was a beginner surf beach, had safe water to swim in, and a much more chilled vibe. Nothing really happens in Carrizalillo at night but Zicatela is only a short taxi ride away.

272662491.name: Wonderful small town
272662491.author: a TripAdvisor user
272662491.reviewBody: wonderful small town, amazing beach, powerful waves, great vibes, delicious foods and warm welcome places, hotels and restaurantes, nice locals and plenty to see. Beach Resort Ines is the best.

266715361.name: Fun surfer beach and swimmers areas too
266715361.author: a TripAdvisor user
266715361.reviewBody: Great eye candy of young fit people! A long walk along the beach or road from the main beach- bring lots of liquids!! I saw there and walked around very relaxing even when highly populated which is rare!!

265747176.name: Beautiful beach
265747176.author: a TripAdvisor user
265747176.reviewBody: I liked to walk on the long beach. The waves are too rough for swimming, but excellent for surfers. Lots to see!

264920986.name: Where man meets wild waters
264920986.author: a TripAdvisor user
264920986.reviewBody: Great beautiful beach for surfing \ud83c\udfc4 come and try. There restaurants and a 7 eleven wanna be store Call oxo which has a lot things.

263600734.name: Playa Zicatela: Surfers, Waves, Sunsets...
263600734.author: a TripAdvisor user
263600734.reviewBody:
Playa Zicatela is a giant stretch of beach east of Puerto Escondido, with (from what the locals said) one of the most challenging surf breaks in the world.   I've personally never seen waves that huge in my travels to surf spots across the world.   Which is awesome, cause people head out to the beach in the morning to watch the surfers, and then again at sunset the beach attracts people enjoying both incredible surfer acrobatics with breathtaking, sunset views.   

It's totally chill, gorgeous, and was a truly amazing vibe.   I spent every night on the beach at sunset, from 4:30pm until about 7:30, with a few ice cold Modelos.   In late March, it was not crowded at all, felt sometimes like you and a few choice others had the place to yourself.

During the day, you can sit under some umbrellas and casually order refreshments.   All the guys selling drinks were young, cool, not pushy and a killer Michelada was roughly 30-35 pesos.

During the day it's awesome to hop in and cool off, however the undertow is incredibly strong, so if you're not a good swimmer stay out of the water.

The stretch of shops along the Zicatela seemed to attract sufers, European beach-goers, and locals.   Not too big, but once the super highway is open between Oaxaca City and Puerto Escondido, the Zicatela will undoubtedly blow up.   See it before it changes even more than it probably has the past 15-20 years.

Highly recommended.

263053055.name: very nice
263053055.author: a TripAdvisor user
263053055.reviewBody: very nice - plenty of space. Water is a little rough. Gorgeous.\nIf you like beaches you willow this one.

262308852.name: Fine beach particularly if you like waves
262308852.author: a TripAdvisor user
262308852.reviewBody: Zicatela is famous for surfers and it is immediately clear why when you arrive. The water is cold and the sand is not that great, so I wouldn\'t say it is an amazing beach but it has its charm.

261255195.name: The main strip
261255195.author: a TripAdvisor user
261255195.reviewBody: Food, music, and fun. Watch the surfers, walk the beach. Not a swimming beach but fun to walk and see people.

260162635.name: Stunning surf
260162635.author: a TripAdvisor user
260162635.reviewBody: Have Mexican scrambled eggs, fresh orange juice, and a coffee at a beach side restaurant and watch the crashing waves. Just while away the morning.

259869844.name: Paradise for surfers
259869844.author: a TripAdvisor user
259869844.reviewBody: Zicatela is a large beach of Puerto Escondido. The sea is known as a paradise for surfers, with big waves, a lot of competitions... At the right side of the beach (when looking to the sea) there\'s an observatory where you can have a wonderful view of the beach and in the afternoon also is possible to appreciate one of the most beautiful sunsets of the world!

258668353.name: Lovely beach
258668353.author: a TripAdvisor user
258668353.reviewBody: This beach was directly in front of the Hotel Santa Fe where we stayed. The water was quite warm and it had good enough waves for surfing. Several vendors walk up and down the beach, unobtrusively offering you delicious snacks ranging from ice cream to ceviche.

258266839.name: Nice for walks. Water is only for surfers, waves are too strong. Avoid on hot days.
258266839.author: a TripAdvisor user
258266839.reviewBody: Main beach in P. Escondido. Nice for walks and a long nice beach to enjoy. Surf is very strong so it is not really enjoyable to enter the water without a board. There are nicer quieter beaches such as Carrizalillo that are better to chill out on.

257674022.name: Srufs up dude!
257674022.author: a TripAdvisor user
257674022.reviewBody: We stayed literally in front of it, its the main tourist beach and a cool place to wake up to every morning, stand outside the balcony and see the morning surfers

257470260.name: Great beach for walking and sunsets.
257470260.author: a TripAdvisor user
257470260.reviewBody: Great for sunsets and walking along the beach - can walk for quite some time.  Surf is rough so make sure you\'re a comfortable swimmer and only swim where you see others in.  There are lifeguards in some places as well

256618362.name: Amazing beach for walking
256618362.author: a TripAdvisor user
256618362.reviewBody: Just an amazing beach only for surfers! But what a womder for a great walk. Hard sand! Beautiful waves

256011589.name: The Place to Chill
256011589.author: a TripAdvisor user
256011589.reviewBody: Just got back from Zicatela and I am pleased to say it hasn\'t changed too much in the 25 years I have been going there. The waves are great and uncrowded for surfing or body boarding, SUP is now all the rage in Puerto Escondido. Restaurants on the beach serve fresh seafood and local specialties - this is the place to eat fish not beef. Prices are far less than in the big Mexican resort towns and the local people are very trustworthy. My brother left his camera on the table at Greko\'s restuarant on the beach and they had it for him when we came back the next day.\n\nTo catch waves or just relax in a hammock, this is a good place.

254779407.name: Surf!
254779407.author: a TripAdvisor user
254779407.reviewBody: This beach has some of the best surf in the world topped of with some great restaurants and a little of everything.

254323846.name: An upside surprise
254323846.author: a TripAdvisor user
254323846.reviewBody: My Mexican friend told me to avoid Puerto Escondido, but this beach in Puerto as well as the main beach are great beaches, and the admittedly over-commercialized strip along the beaches was clean, with decent-looking hotels and decent restaurants.\n\nYou might want to avoid it in high season - and Playa Manzanillo in this town is a total dump - but Zicatela was pleasant and worth a day trip or short stay. Only two hours from Huatulco, and 1 hour from Mazunte/San Augustinillo.

251824301.name: Zicatela
251824301.author: a TripAdvisor user
251824301.reviewBody: Very busy strip of restaurants, bars and beach pubs.  Surf isn\'t generally suitable for swimming unless you\'re a strong swimmer who doesn\'t mind a sand washing.

251680938.name: Beautiful Beach
251680938.author: a TripAdvisor user
251680938.reviewBody:
This is a lovely mile long stretch with a wide sandy beach, clear, clean water and relatively calm surf in January, but with some fun swells for body or board surfing.  The friendly locals fish off the beach and lots of local families visit.  Between the street and the water there are a long line of open air restaurants, with pizza, local food and excellent fresh seafood.  They all serve drinks, alcoholic and non-alcoholic and beer and wine.  Some evenings there are bands that play.  Prices are quite reasonable, the food pretty good and people who work there pay attention to cleanliness.  

Across from the beach there are a number of boutique hotels and hostels offering rooms for every price range.  There are also shops, bars coffee places and surf-board rental shops.  There are also several small markets where you can buy snacks, water, beer liquor etc.

Most of the beach restaurants have umbrella covered lounge chairs that you can use to enjoy the sun and surf for the nominal cost of a drink or a small meal.  Good for families and lots of pedestrian traffic late into the night.

251605444.name: Beautiful long beach
251605444.author: a TripAdvisor user
251605444.reviewBody: The Zicatela is a beautiful white sand beach.  It varies depending on where you are. The closer to the Punta, the bigger the waves and more surfers. As you near the town, it becomes calmer for swimming.   There are many places along the beach to find chairs, umbrellas and service...food and drinks. Most people pick a spot and hang out for the day...service is almost always great...they want your business!  Just be careful where you swim, the waves and u Denton CAN be dangerous.

249510978.name: Great rock formations
249510978.author: a TripAdvisor user
249510978.reviewBody: This was a beautiful beach with lots of character.  The rock formations added a lot for great pictures.

249219482.name: great!
249219482.author: a TripAdvisor user
249219482.reviewBody: Wonderful beach!  Lots of restaurants where you can rent umbrellas and chairs for the entire day for the cost of a meal.

248882887.name: Fantastic wide beach and great waves.
248882887.author: a TripAdvisor user
248882887.reviewBody: One of Mexico\'s surfers paradise but with all the beach club services.  Nice restaurants and easy access right downtown Puerto Escondido.

246430070.name: Long Long Beach.
246430070.author: a TripAdvisor user
246430070.reviewBody: walk forever. huge waves that only experienced surfers could handle. were there for the surfing contest and it was pretty amazing. We saw a sea snake washed up on the beach one day. A local said that they wash up when they are dying due to the change in the salidity of the ocean after the rainy season.

246041119.name: All in one
246041119.author: a TripAdvisor user
246041119.reviewBody: Zicatela is the all in one area for. Puerto escondido traveller\'s included the food diversity h\u00f4tel small and big beach front shopping or just for night bar hoping in the high season with still this very small mexicain Oaxaca beautifull shoreline surfer quiet community that keep attracting people from all over the world

245168210.name: Big and Wide
245168210.author: a TripAdvisor user
245168210.reviewBody: This is a great beach it is about 3 miles long large surf near town there are alot of beach clubs if you walk north it leads into Playa Principal in the center of town  we stayed across the street the only thin if you are not used to large surf  the rip tide is very strong so be careful out in the water

244939222.name: Great surf and people watching
244939222.author: a TripAdvisor user
244939222.reviewBody: Incredable surfing right by great palapa food , drinks and shopping. Very clean beach area. Some of the best surfing in the world. Miles of open beach for walking or just relaxing under one of the beach palapas with 2 lounge chairs and beach drink service.

244893353.name: a bit crazy at Christmas and Easter, but lots of life and people
244893353.author: a TripAdvisor user
244893353.reviewBody: quite a number of restaurants some quite good, such as Hotel Inez. Not all the beach bars are good, but a large choice such as Mana on the beach.  Not so heavy with major tourists except at Christmas and Easter.  Great beach but the waves are dangerous.

244729810.name: Great Surfing Beach
244729810.author: a TripAdvisor user
244729810.reviewBody: We were hoping for the BIG waves, but found out they are bigger in September.  One of the best surfing beaches in the world...at the right time!

244046174.name: Fabulous beach!
244046174.author: a TripAdvisor user
244046174.reviewBody: What a great beach, for so many reasons. If you are a surfer, it is one of the top ten surfing spots in the world. If you are a walker, there are miles and miles of beach to stroll. In December, there are few people on the beach, so it is quite a solo experienpce which is lovely. There are great photo opportunities as well, lots of surf and birds as well as surfers for subjects. Wear your sunblock and take water !

242846409.name: Heavy tubes, hot chicks and cheap thrills...
242846409.author: a TripAdvisor user
242846409.reviewBody: Loved the big barrels/disliked nearly drowning...Get Amongst It!!!!!!Playa zicaatela is not for the learners/people that think they can surf .

242175877.name: Great scenic surfing beach
242175877.author: a TripAdvisor user
242175877.reviewBody: Lovely relaxed night life, with great bars and restaurants. The beach is beautiful, the sunsets breathtaking. Still not over run or touristy love huge hotels.

241893718.name: beach in the city
241893718.author: a TripAdvisor user
241893718.reviewBody: in the heart of the city, plenty of restaurants, washrooms and places to buy drinks and souvenirs. Cobblestone streets down centre of town gave it a clean look, especially the buildings which are all painted in light pastel colours.

241694059.name: My friend learned to surf
241694059.author: a TripAdvisor user
241694059.reviewBody: It\'s a great beach for watching "pro" surfers and getting lessons on surfing.  Plus one can play in the water as long as you stay close to shore.  Lots of choices for food here, also.

241210567.name: number 1 beach in puerto escondido
241210567.author: a TripAdvisor user
241210567.reviewBody: a magnificent wide and clean beach, very enjoyable, a lot of activities for everybody, a real dream. just go there and enjoy, either surfing for professionals, playing with your kids, taking a sun tan while having a frozen margarita, and enjoying the deliceous seafood, fresh brought directly from the ocean to your plate.\nFANTASTICO

240147897.name: Nice beach
240147897.author: a TripAdvisor user
240147897.reviewBody: Great beach. There was no surf when I was here so swimming was not an issue. Great little beach restaurants and bars everywhere.\n\nNice white sand and warm water - great!

238601158.name: great beach for surfers.
238601158.author: a TripAdvisor user
238601158.reviewBody: this is one of the top beachs in the world for surfers,or just to hang out with good restaurants and shopping.

237308953.name: Surf beach, not swimming
237308953.author: a TripAdvisor user
237308953.reviewBody: This beach is perfect for surfers, but not as much for swimmees because the waves are big and strong, but you can still enjoy a nice day on the beach and an amazing sunset.

237119837.name: Great Surf Beach
237119837.author: a TripAdvisor user
237119837.reviewBody: This is always fun to go and watch the surfers. Several good spots along the beach with a 2 for 1 happy hour.

236847190.name: Nice to sit and watch, but not for swimming.
236847190.author: a TripAdvisor user
236847190.reviewBody: If you dont surf yourself, there isnt much you can do than watch other people doing it. And at least, when I was there, the surfing wasnt that exiting..The beach itself, I wouldnt count among the top 100, I have been worldwide. So its ok, its even nice, but not exiting.

230765960.name: Zicatela Zen
230765960.author: a TripAdvisor user
230765960.reviewBody: The beach is mellow, the waves are insane. If the surfing at Zicatela is too intimidating, there are plenty of places where you can pull up a chair under a palapa and enjoy a handful of drinks as you watch aquatic gladiators eat it in the thumping surf.

226704399.name: watch the waves...and the surfers
226704399.author: a TripAdvisor user
226704399.reviewBody: great beach to walk or take sun. good to people watch and it\'s located right in town. too powerful for swimming is a dislike

226563354.name: one stop shop
226563354.author: a TripAdvisor user
226563354.reviewBody: hot weather, good waves, G-strings in the water, Beers and ceviche crawling distance from the break for a mile stretch

225165474.name: Good place to watch the surfers
225165474.author: a TripAdvisor user
225165474.reviewBody: While Zicatela wasn\'t my favorite beach in the region, it is the place to be. With bars stretching onto the beach you can watch brave surfers go head to head with the dauntingly beautiful pipe. definitely worth a look.

224092206.name: Everything a beach should be
224092206.author: a TripAdvisor user
224092206.reviewBody: This is a massive stretch of beach with excellent swimming along every inch. The surf is good for surfing, but without making it too rough or unpleasant for swimming.  If you want a large swimming pool, go elsewhere.  But if you want interesting waves and a bit of fun in the water, this is the place.  The beach itself is wide and clean, and there are restaurants and bars along the whole length.  Come to Zicatela for a true Mexican beach experience...

222274524.name: Surf
222274524.author: a TripAdvisor user
222274524.reviewBody: Not a good place for swimming but for walking, watching, eating, shopping and taking time to see the lige go by. It is the spot for the young and the surfers and the night life, but also fine restaurants

221413062.name: Go surfing!
221413062.author: a TripAdvisor user
221413062.reviewBody: This is the best place to surf in Oaxaca. It is a fast and dangerous beach break so if you aren\'t experienced I recommend you try somewhere else.  It is a board breaker. \nThere are also lots of hotels and great restaurants if your not into surfing.

221384935.name: Beautiful beach!
221384935.author: a TripAdvisor user
221384935.reviewBody: Hip, Santa Cruz vibe. You need to be a great swimmer and experienced surfer but just a novice beachcomber to to enjoy the beach side restaurants and bars. I highly recommend grabbing a table on the beach to take in a sunset while you\'re there.

221067368.name: Surfer\'s paradise!
221067368.author: a TripAdvisor user
221067368.reviewBody: If you are into surfing this is your place to go. It also has the main strip behind it. The waves are said to be the 3rd tallest in the world. They have nice restaurants to take a bite.

213521017.name: Beautiful Beach for Surf and People Watching
213521017.author: a TripAdvisor user
213521017.reviewBody: This is one of the nicest beaches on the Oaxacan coast.  Wide sand, big waves, lots of chairs and umbrellas. And lots of surfing. Not good for swimming, but a great place to sit and spend the day.

213087157.name: Beautiful But Dangerous Beach
213087157.author: a TripAdvisor user
213087157.reviewBody: This is a gorgeous stretch of beach but unless you are a surfer or and extremely strong swimmer do not swim here. The waves and the under current will definitely sweep you away. We just walk on the beach and watch the surfers.

211259816.name: Nice beach.
211259816.author: a TripAdvisor user
211259816.reviewBody: Very private beach, clean and very few people. practically had the whole ocean to ourselves. Strong surf and undertow not safe for swimming, but nice waves.

208740991.name: Not for swimming but nice atmosphere!
208740991.author: a TripAdvisor user
208740991.reviewBody: If you\'re not a surfer and are only there to swim be very cautious. The current and waves are quite unpredictable. Flash rips are infamous at this beach. Aside from this, the atmosphere on the beach in early morning and late afternoon is very social and friendly. During the day when it is stinking hot and no surf, the beach is empty! Enjoy :)

203927403.name: Beautiful beach, but be careful!
203927403.author: a TripAdvisor user
203927403.reviewBody: Gorgeous sand and water. Ideal for surfers and beachfront dining and sunsets. More than once we saw people scramble when unexpected surf crashed on them! Strong waves, so not good for wading/little ones. But a beautiful spot, and surfers round the clock.

203219781.name: La Punta is the hit
203219781.author: a TripAdvisor user
203219781.reviewBody: Its easier to go into the water at La punta and their all day surfers try the waves - its nice to watch them. Ask in the beach restaurants for sun roofs and chairs. Then you only have to pay what you rink or eat and they have nothing against that you bring also some drinks by your own. The chair renterts nearer to the surfers want 100 Peso per long chair....

202640807.name: Big waves
202640807.author: a TripAdvisor user
202640807.reviewBody: Beautiful long beach, great for walking, not so great for swimming. Lots of surfing, beautiful sunsets and horseback riding at sunset. It was also vey hot, so not much shade unless you were under a palapa that belonged to a restaurant and bought beer or food to be able to stay there.

201241610.name: Playa Zicatela, Home from Home
201241610.author: a TripAdvisor user
201241610.reviewBody:
I lived on this beach for almost 3 years. If you surf, this place has intermediate level left point-break waves on the south end and heavy, hollow beach-break waves on the north end.
If you enjoy running 4 miles on smooth sand (2 miles back and forth), with stunning sunsets and beautiful women in bikinis, it's a must.
If you love excellent seafood and shellfish, go there.
And if you just like to kick back and savor a cold beer and take in some of the best things in life, i.e. happy people hanging out and playing on the beach, Zicatela is calling you.

197211924.name: The beach that wants you to walk it.
197211924.author: a TripAdvisor user
197211924.reviewBody: A great beach to walk if that\'s your thing. A nice fine sand, with a small, ocean worn rock from time to time. It\'s real quiet in places. Great to get a beer and watch the stars from sand on a clear night with some friends.

193548508.name: Apparently #2 or #3 for surfing globally
193548508.author: a TripAdvisor user
193548508.reviewBody: But only at the right time of year..... Were not surfers so we did not care about that. It was a fairly busy place with many restaraunts and beach clubs providing shade umbrellas as well as food and drink services.

193369835.name: Relaxing beach, beautiful sunset
193369835.author: a TripAdvisor user
193369835.reviewBody: While not the most spectacular beach in Puerto Escondido, it\'s definitely got more than enough to keep you happy. Lots of bars and lounges with service right up to the waters edge. It\'s beautiful to watch the sunset from here, and the water is clean and warm. It\'s great to see fishermen with nets right on the shore. There are a lot of dogs on the beach (stray and not), which is a little strange if you\'re not used to it. Definitely worth a walk along the beach at sunset.

193015842.name: so nice
193015842.author: a TripAdvisor user
193015842.reviewBody: just go there, play in the warm waves, relax in the sand. And eventually enjoy a magnificient sunset

190886906.name: Some like it hot!
190886906.author: a TripAdvisor user
190886906.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach and almost a mile long! Can be dangerous for swimming to due current and waves. You can rent shade or just buy a drink and food and then the use of the beach chairs and umbrellas is included. It is very hot year-round with almost no wind except in the morning when there is an off-shore breeze. Exercise before 9am and enjoy the sunsets at dusk!

188885519.name: excellent beach!
188885519.author: a TripAdvisor user
188885519.reviewBody: wide expanse of sand, excellent waves to play, great service form the several local restaurants (not sophisticated fare, but good basic stuff). This is one of the best Pacific beaches in Southern Mexico.

186951485.name: Surfing heaven
186951485.author: a TripAdvisor user
186951485.reviewBody: If you love to watch the action of early morning surfing and body boarding, this beach is for you. By lunch time you will need to take cover under a beach umbrella and force yourself to drink a cerveza. Don\'t swim here. The undertow is wicked.

186772669.name: Surfing beach!
186772669.author: a TripAdvisor user
186772669.reviewBody: This beach is picturesque! Huge wide plains of sand with crashing waves! Surfers paradise for sure! Only reason it\'s not 5 all the way is because the waves are so perfect for surfing sometimes, you can\'t swim. So beautiful and incredible, walk at night to experience the sound of the waves uninterrupted!

185083185.name: Some of my best surf memories.
185083185.author: a TripAdvisor user
185083185.reviewBody: I had some of the best times of my life surfing here with international people. I took lessons with Oasis, Robert was awesome!!! Met people from Argentina and it was the most gorgeous setting with the hills in the background! I hope to return one day!

182718135.name: One of the best beaches in the world
182718135.author: a TripAdvisor user
182718135.reviewBody: I LOVE this beach and I\'ve been to a lot of beaches. There are plenty of eating and drinking options but the best part is the waves and the sunsets. It is not the greatest swimming beach as it is a little rough but it is spectacular watching the surfers trying to negotiate the massive waves.

181816283.name: The best sun bath in Puerto Escondido
181816283.author: a TripAdvisor user
181816283.reviewBody: The longest and most broadly liked beach of the many beautiful ones in Puerto Escondido. We enjoy the possibility of walking along the beach and then stopping for a cold drink, particularly a cold coconut.

178637345.name: Amazing Waves and View
178637345.author: a TripAdvisor user
178637345.reviewBody: The beach itself is absolutely amazing.  A must try if you are a surfer.  But my wife and I are are not, so we enjoyed the waves as spectators with a small amount of swimming.  We came in the offseason and many of the restaurants were closed down or very, very slow.  We were not overly impressed with the two we tried eating at (Samuray Sushi and Rosarito) for both food and drink, but again... it\'s more about the spectacular view.  Great for a couple hour stroll and swim with your loved one(s).  Be careful though - these waves are serious!

175626337.name: The number ONE beach for SURF!
175626337.author: a TripAdvisor user
175626337.reviewBody: I just can say that the trip to Puerto Escondido, Oaxaca, Mexico was AWESOME I did enjoy the Zicatela Beach, I saw one of the biggest waves in my life, there are hundreds of international turists, the food is AAA. You can also go to Carrizalliyo beach and you can enjoy a very nice food, view and Surf. But the one is Zicatela.

169679570.name: Core Attraction
169679570.author: a TripAdvisor user
169679570.reviewBody: Zicatela, the main surfing beach, is at the center of the Puerto Escondido experience. It may not be for the inexperienced surfer but is a great place watch while tanning, or from the shade of a beach restaurant while having a cool drink and shrimp. Its also a great people watching place with an international flavor while retaining its Mexican character. There are many restaurants and adequate nightlife. The beach area may be sometimes more noisy than you might want, but there are lots of hotels at a various price points along the beach and close by in somewhat more quiet neighborhoods. The playa maintains a little edge left over from its surfing frontier days, but  its suitable for any variety travelers tastes and needs. Be sure to spend some time in the other areas of Puerto, a great small town on the southernmost Mexican Pacific.

168191065.name: The best beach in Mexico
168191065.author: a TripAdvisor user
168191065.reviewBody: Atmosphere and people is the best of Zicatela. You can spent a relaxed time in the day and a few drinks in the night. Share with people all over the world

167953932.name: Surfer beach
167953932.author: a TripAdvisor user
167953932.reviewBody: Great beach to watch surfers.  Big waves and strong current made it less ideal for swimming.  Great seaside restaurants to cater to your needs.

166304671.name: Watching the big waves
166304671.author: a TripAdvisor user
166304671.reviewBody: Although it was "off" season for surfing, there were enough out there to make it interesting to watch. The waves at their lowest are bigger than most beaches have. Too dangerous for swimming, though.

166057167.name: Okay Beach
166057167.author: a TripAdvisor user
166057167.reviewBody: It\'s a nice beach but there are better ones! Playa Carrazillio is much nicer. The water is really rough (but it is rough all over the coast of Pt Escondido) and it is not the most scenic of beaches.

165449063.name: It\u00b4s paradise!
165449063.author: a TripAdvisor user
165449063.reviewBody: Great views, unfortunately if not for swimming but great for surfing, however, it\u00b4s right next to the main Bahia in which you can swim.

164744255.name: A beach for walking and surfing...
164744255.author: a TripAdvisor user
164744255.reviewBody: A great beach for a morning or evening stroll.  This is not a beach for swimming as the surf and rip tide are too strong.

162994313.name: Surf, surf, awesome bodies...and danger!!
162994313.author: a TripAdvisor user
162994313.reviewBody:
The beach is a blast. That´s it. Nothing more to say. You are sorrounded by all these awesome bodies, girls and guys with their surfboards, aand this nice reggae atmosphere. 

but all over you see signals telling you about the dangers of swimming here, tides, and stuff, I guess sharks too? and you kinda feel you need to stay alert.

On the overall, one of the best beaches I´ve ever seen in + 20 countries.

162206744.name: impressive waves
162206744.author: a TripAdvisor user
162206744.reviewBody: Big beach with lots of wave action, surfers and places to eat.  We took off our shoes and walked along the water enjoying the sea air.  Seems to be a favourite activity of others.  Off season but still surfing season apparently.

161176858.name: Great surf beach
161176858.author: a TripAdvisor user
161176858.reviewBody: Good selection bars and restaurants.  Great area to be \nLocated in Puerto Escondido, Mexican pipeline for the many surfers that surf here, waves are huge

158927863.name: excelent place to visit , chill  and hang out
158927863.author: a TripAdvisor user
158927863.reviewBody: layback atmosphere with lots of things to do but not for swimming. Best beach for that is Manzanillo- a 10 minute 25 pesos taxi ride. Also nice to spend the day there as there are also many restaurants on the beach.\nWe spent near two weeks in this area  and loved it. However if you are looking for hilton type accomodation, you are better off moving down to Bahias de Huatulco- more upscale. This area is certainly for a specific type of traveller.

157374048.name: World Class
157374048.author: a TripAdvisor user
157374048.reviewBody: Zicatela is fantastic! either you are a surfer or just to appreciate the spectacle in the water. Hence people from all over the world has been there

155457524.name: Great beach, dangerous surf
155457524.author: a TripAdvisor user
155457524.reviewBody: This is an amazing beach, wide, long and beautiful.  It\'s a wonderful place to walk, and there are usually surfers and boogie board riders.  The sunsets are amazing!  The surf is beautiful, but can be dangerous.  It changes every day.  I swam there almost every day for nearly two weeks, but on our last day I got swept out in a rip tide and was rescued by the lifeguards.  I\'m a good swimmer, and could probably have gotten back in myself, but truly, it was amazing how swiftly - literally in seconds - I got swept well out into the ocean.  Fortunately a surfer was there with a board to support me, and then the lifeguards came, first with a belt, then a waverunner.  So be careful!  If no one is swimming, there\'s probably a reason!  Down the far end near at La Punta the surf is gentler, and much safer.  But for walking, you can\'t beat this long, gorgeous strand.

154849323.name: Thundering surf
154849323.author: a TripAdvisor user
154849323.reviewBody: Lots of beach related services in this part of town but the beach is so deep that its a really long hike for cervesas if you don\'t rent a palapa. Food is quite good along Zicatela but the best is along the Rinconada.

154799309.name: Top Surf Spot
154799309.author: a TripAdvisor user
154799309.reviewBody: Most mornings we went out to the main surf break at Zicatela to watch the surfers and body boarders and one of the world\'s most famous beach breaks.  The beach is long so you can walk or run it.  When you get near the port people hassle you to try to sell you a sport fishing excursion.\nOverall this beach is nice and fairly quiet.

154017320.name: Zicatela Surf Beach
154017320.author: a TripAdvisor user
154017320.reviewBody:
My wife and I spent three months in Puerto Escondido from Dec. 2012 to Feb. 2013. We like to take early morning walks along the different beaches in the Puerto Escondido area. One of our favorite walks is along the surf beach at Zicatela. At the time of year that we were there, the surf and the pipeline that is formed is not very large. There are still many surfers out on the water having fun. The surfers and boggy boarders put on a very interesting show. The beach is easy to walk on and you can walk for over an hour without running out of beach. I suggest going for walks between 07:00 and 10:00 AM.. After ten o'clock, in my opinion it gets too hot. There are many restaurants along the north end of the beach and if you need shade and a drink they are available. I suggest that if you are going for a long walk that you bring water with you. Zicatela also has many hotels, bars, restaurants, and shops along the north end of the beach. 

There are people walking or jogging along the beach all the time in the morning. People are very friendly and easy to talk too. It is easy to spot the visitors to Puerto Escondido on the beach, they are the people who, for the most part do not have good tans. A warning for Canadian visitor who like to talk about the weather, in Puerto Escondido the weather at this time of year is always the same, hot and sunny; so there is nothing to talk about. Sometimes when you go for walks on the Puerto Escondido beaches you will see whales, and dolphins close to shore. Sometimes there are a lot of dolphins. Plays Zicatela is a wonderful place to visit and enjoy. I highly recommend it, especially the early morning walks.

Rick Banks

153977216.name: Neverending sand and ocean
153977216.author: a TripAdvisor user
153977216.reviewBody: The beach is a looong strip of sand and fantastic, gigantic, overwhelming waves. Going in is dangerous, but it\'s the best place to chill out, watch surfers (or surf if you\'re a pro), have a drink, and then come back at night for a party, every night to a different bar. THE BEST in Puerto if you\'re looking for fun!

153649295.name: Surfer\'s Paradise!
153649295.author: a TripAdvisor user
153649295.reviewBody: Great beach for walking and people watching.  Lots of restaurants on the beach with Umbrellas and chairs.  Very hot but beach not swimmable.

153442708.name: BIG Waves
153442708.author: a TripAdvisor user
153442708.reviewBody: The beach may not be great for swimming but when the big waves are coming in they are mezmerizing to watch and listen to.  Good walking beach with several restaurants to stop in at.

153129151.name: Great beach walking
153129151.author: a TripAdvisor user
153129151.reviewBody: This beach goes on forever.  It\'s great for walking with a wide berth and soft sand.  It\'s great for playing in the waves (but swimming is too dangerous).  It\'s great for hanging out on a lounger and watching the surfers or falling asleep to the sound of the crashing waves.  Paradise.

152714694.name: Surfing the Mexican Pipeline!
152714694.author: a TripAdvisor user
152714694.reviewBody:
Just got back from Mexico yesterday. Flew in to Huatulco International Airport. 

The trip to Puerto Escondido long Mex-200 (Ruta 2010) is a challenge. Watch out for the dreaded topé. These speed bumps are common around towns and villages but they are often not marked. Hitting them at speed will send you and your car flying!  The landing is not pleasant. 

Zicatela Beach, and the point are well worth exploring. We met Julio and Hector and arranged a 1.5 hr surfing lesson. $300 per person (that's in peso's so the price is less than $30USD). They earned their money!  Four adults and two younger girls (9 and 12) all had a great time. 

They spent closer to two hours with us. We tipped them well, but they would have been happy with our thanks. No trouble communicating: both spoke English very well. 

Be careful of others aggressively offering their "services". 

Don't forget your beach footwear. The sand was almost unbearable to walk on without shoes. 
Go early in the morning. The waves get pretty big (and nasty) as the tide goes out. It's also a lot cooler. Surf shorts (below the knees) are useful to reduce sand scrapes from the wax on the boards.  Check out the online surf reports for conditions the night before you go. 

All in all, I can recommend Zicatela Beach whole heartedly. It's a short drive from Puerto Escondido, but watch the speed bumps! :)

Doug

152611784.name: Visiting Puerto Escondido Again....
152611784.author: a TripAdvisor user
152611784.reviewBody:
Hands down the most relaxing place to visit. Fly into Hualtuco and then take a taxi for 1.5 hours to Puerto Escondido.Note: Taxi's offered in the airport run starting at 70 pesos, if you walk outside the gates of the airport you can get a taxi for 55-60 peso's. The taxi's are waiting outside the gate knowing you don't plan on paying airport prices. The airport is small and you can see the entrance gate, there is only one way out and there is a sidewalk that takes you there.  Yes it may be a long taxi ride but well worth the trip because you are escaping traditional tourist areas and arrving in a place with great food, slow paced, and beautiful beaches. This is a surfing town but down the coast 10 minutes by taxi or car are two beautiful swimming lagoons that have huts, food and drinks waiting for you. Playa Carizalillo and Playa Bacocho. The taxi's know the way be prepared for steps going to the beach.
They have a market in town that is best on Wednesdays and Saturdays.It has local food, fresh meats and seafood, and a flea market.  Go to the main highway thru town and catch the trucks with the white covers on them that say Mercado, it costs 8 peso's each way.  You will need to know some Spanish to survive here and will also need to know how to exchange money for goods. That also means talking money lingo because they will rip you off if you don't know how to speak money language. Mostly Spanish speaking in the area, I think some can speak English but they act like they can't. 
I always stay in Playa Zicatela because it is centrally located to most places, like restaurants and shopping. This is a relaxing places where walks down the beach are the norm.
When leaving to go back to the airport, take a taxi downtown to the bus depot buy a ticket at the booth. They have a airconditioned greyhound bus called the SUR which will say Hualtuco on the front it leaves every thirty minutes throughout the day 8-4(no night trips) costs about 9.00 one way to the airport.It takes about 2 hours on the bus but it is a way to save money.

Want more input email me? chrisb75067@yahoo.com

150910459.name: Surf at La Punta
150910459.author: a TripAdvisor user
150910459.reviewBody: We surfed at a point break called La Punta.  Amazing how hundreds of pelicans sit out there with you and do an aerial kamikaze to catch some fish.  They make quite a splash on the water when they catch fish making for quite a surreal experience as I sit on my board!\nLa Punta can get crowded and because there is only one tak off point, it gets really crazy sometimes.  Still makes for a good surf session

150438201.name: A low-key slice of paradise.
150438201.author: a TripAdvisor user
150438201.reviewBody: Puerto Escondido is just sleepy enough to charm a jaded beach goer.  It\'s no Cancun, no Cabo - and that\'s a good thing!  There seems to be a surplus of Italian restaurants on the main walking street, but I prefer cervezas or fresh-squeezed OJ from one of the cottages on the sand.  \n\nThe water\'s warm and the waves are big.  Hurry before it changes!

150215448.name: Wonderful long streach of beach!
150215448.author: a TripAdvisor user
150215448.reviewBody: Love it! Even if you dont surf, it\'s such a wonderful beach, very relaxed, clean water and beach. Great atmosphere and lots of space for everyone! Good night life right in the first thrid...(northern part of Zicatela). We\'ll come back!

148650770.name: Great place to Surf and Hangout
148650770.author: a TripAdvisor user
148650770.reviewBody:
Try the Kuhl Frozen Yoguhrt!! Surf!! and chill. This beach is great for it all.

There could be showers for travelers to get all the salt water out after a surf sesion. this is a must for all tourist destinations on the beach.

The night life is also good and super fun!

148630369.name: Mesmerizing waves and heat
148630369.author: a TripAdvisor user
148630369.reviewBody: Nice young vibe. Mostly surfers and wannabes. Many choice to eat or drink on sand or not. Shopping is a little expensive for clothing. When it is real, Silver worth a good look

148506785.name: Kind of crowded but anyway nice
148506785.author: a TripAdvisor user
148506785.reviewBody: Lots of restaurants offering shadow and space for relaxing or tanning. Service (food and drinks) mostly slow but still statisfactory.

148364004.name: Less crowded and nice swimming in winter
148364004.author: a TripAdvisor user
148364004.reviewBody:
This is a nice beach that due to it's size is much less crowded than the neighbouring beaches. 

We are here however in between Christmas and New Years so I am sure this is a very busy time for all the beaches. 

Despite being a surf beach the waves (late Dec) were fluffy and perfect for swimming, we didn't notice any rips or strong currents where we were, which was really nice.

147563271.name: Wild and relaxing
147563271.author: a TripAdvisor user
147563271.reviewBody: The beach is amazing! It\'s very long and wide and so, very impressive. I visited in the beginning of December, so there were very few people and quite some surfers to watch. Unfortunately, there\'s also quite some faeces; mostly at the start of the beach (between the street and the sand). But by the water it\'s all fine. Be aware that the ocean waves are very strong, even though they are tiny. So don\'t go deep if you want to swim.

145885433.name: Cool authentic beach
145885433.author: a TripAdvisor user
145885433.reviewBody: Big waves, bars, sand, a surf contest and pretty good places to eat as well. Easy to park there as well.  \nI liked it.

144840196.name: Beautiful beach, even if you dont surf
144840196.author: a TripAdvisor user
144840196.reviewBody: Great spot to watch surfers, to hang out and to have dinner at night. There is not much more to say! We love it!

144302512.name: Great Beach, Great Town
144302512.author: a TripAdvisor user
144302512.reviewBody: The beaches are second to none and the warmest I\'ve experienced. The surf is good for all sorts of surfing. The food is fresh and amazing. We stayed with Vivo Resorts and Casa Rubia. Out of this world 5 star accommodations. Oh did I mention...CHEAP?  It is not a yahoo town but you do have a couple of late night bars with dancing music and fun people. Oh, we saw Dolphins off the shore while eating breakfast. We are going back for sure.

143245646.name: Great beach
143245646.author: a TripAdvisor user
143245646.reviewBody: A great beach to rest, read, and have a cervesa while sitting in a free chair with umbrella.  You have to bargin some with the guys but with a promise of a few tips, they will keep the snacks & refreshments comming.

141529420.name: Nice beach, clean and very large
141529420.author: a TripAdvisor user
141529420.reviewBody: Nice beach, clean and very large great for surfing and chilling. Food is cheap and good, bars are mostly fun and have a good crowd!

140714521.name: it was ok...
140714521.author: a TripAdvisor user
140714521.reviewBody: ...specialy when it comes to surfshops (buy/rent anything around the surfsport) and restaurants. the promenade offers a lot of different restaurants which are ok and more european/american than real mexican.\n

140465254.name: Chillaxed at Escondido
140465254.author: a TripAdvisor user
140465254.reviewBody: Fabulous chilled out surf side location excellent food loads of accommodation options.\nHead to La Punta (the point) for the most relaxed vibe\n

139880276.name: Back in time
139880276.author: a TripAdvisor user
139880276.reviewBody: Like travelling back to the 60\'s, gorgeous craft shops and great people. Attractive surfers everywhere and a clean and soft beach to sink your feet in to.

138190375.name: Best Surf in town
138190375.author: a TripAdvisor user
138190375.reviewBody:
Definetely a surfer hang out.Surf in this beach is definitely for intermediate or advanced students during summer swells, During winter can be mellow.
If you don't surf this place has many good restaurnant by the beach or the main street, 
Night life is the best in town here.
I love this beach

137744015.name: My paradise
137744015.author: a TripAdvisor user
137744015.reviewBody: If you want to go to a preserved natural beach, go to Zicatela. My paradise and The paradise of surfers. The whole region has every natural beauty you can imagine. Visit the lagoon of Manialtepec, snorquel in Roca Blanca Beach, See tortois in Ventanilla. With aun adventuros hart you can explore wonders.

137448686.name: Evening surfing with Bobby Fischer and Bobby Labonte
137448686.author: a TripAdvisor user
137448686.reviewBody: The hurricanes have really impacted this large beach ... repairs are well underway on the palapas and other structures and you can only tell with difficulty where the patching has been done ... but some structures remain unusable and the beach is littered with debris (although not with the taxicabs and cars that locals say washed down from the bridge when Ernesto\'s rains washed vehicles a kilometer downstream into the bay!).  \n\nBut the real treat is spending hours in the evening on the beach with locals and hard-core surfers (some pretty beaten up) and watching the surfers beat the constant crush of 20-foot waves by riding the tube ... and watching as others get crushed.  It\'s an enthralling mix of Nascar, Survivor, 90210, and chess.

135508898.name: Loved eating at Los Tios
135508898.author: a TripAdvisor user
135508898.reviewBody: Check out Los Tios on the Beach: To eat with the thundering surf of the Mexican pipeline on the Zicatlea Beach of Puerto Escondido is an experience we will not soon forget.  The food was suprsingly cheap given the stunning location.  My wife enjoyed the shrimp enchiladas, while I sampled the thinly sliced Oaxacan style beef.  Menu was in both English and Spanish  -- a place popular, it seemed, for both tourists and locals alike.

134005639.name: Hours of entertainment
134005639.author: a TripAdvisor user
134005639.reviewBody: fabulous to watch the surfers from our deck at Tabachin

133775510.name: Casual surf-beach
133775510.author: a TripAdvisor user
133775510.reviewBody: During our visit, this beach was never crowded. There were just over a handful of surfers in the water every day, and the occasional tourist taking advantage of the outdoor drink service from the restaurants dotting the shore. The water was lovely and quite shallow, making for both pleasant swimming and surf-walks. The only downside was that during a stunning summer storm, the well-channeled off-run of water, trailing dirt and junk from the mountains was directed to pour onto the beach. Whilst this only extended to certain areas, it detracted from the beauty and appeal of the beach. It was also upsetting when thinking of the inevitable sea-ending for all that rubbish.

130497510.name: great surfer watching
130497510.author: a TripAdvisor user
130497510.reviewBody: daily treks back and forth allowed great watching of the super surfers that frequent the beach. it was also just a good place for a laid back day of sun and seaside

130188855.name: A must see !
130188855.author: a TripAdvisor user
130188855.reviewBody: It is the surfing capital of Mexico. Incredible waves, surfers and interesting people from all over the world. And the food, wow !

129669036.name: Great place for advanced surfers
129669036.author: a TripAdvisor user
129669036.reviewBody: Someday I\'ll make it out there and surf some amazing waves!

129497471.name: What a surfing spot!
129497471.author: a TripAdvisor user
129497471.reviewBody: It\'s definitely one of the best surfing spots/beaches on earth ... for advanced surfers! Don\'t (!) go there for swimming or if you\'re a surfing beginner, but choose e.g. "La Punta", if you surfed before and want to try a fast hollow point-break wave with left direction, sandy/rock bottom and normal length or "Carrizalillo", if you\'re a beginner and want a beach-break with left and right direction, sandy bottom and normal length.

129152638.name: The Mexican Pipeline
129152638.author: a TripAdvisor user
129152638.reviewBody:
great beach break for surfing...considering that is one of the top surfing spots worldwide.
if you're a good swimmer or surfer take a look of the yellow or red flag before get in or ask local surfers about the currents.
if you're beginner go to la Punta by colectivo or share a taxi.
surf up!

128560234.name: Beautiful beach, Excellent surf, a bit dangerous for swimmers
128560234.author: a TripAdvisor user
128560234.reviewBody: I\'ve been going to Puerto Escondido for the last 10 years to surf with my husband & I love it. The beach is huge, beautiful & very clean. The waves are obviously awesome for surfing but they are making swimming a dangerous andeavour, so be carefull!

127703312.name: spring break madness
127703312.author: a TripAdvisor user
127703312.reviewBody: It was great the first few days but turned in to a meat market/ fully clothed people laying down in the surf insanity during holy week

124826208.name: Superb beach
124826208.author: a TripAdvisor user
124826208.reviewBody: Super beach, warm water though current is strong.

124691657.name: Morning walks
124691657.author: a TripAdvisor user
