124691657.reviewBody: Mornings are really special for walking- but go early- in January it was getting warm by 9:00 a.m To walk on a clear sand beach, hardly a pebble to be found with the amazing waves crashing in\nis an awesome experience.

124670798.name: Do not surf here unless you are a class 5 surfer!
124670798.author: a TripAdvisor user
124670798.reviewBody: this is world class surf.  In the big surf of September beware you ha ve to swim through 20-30 over 10 foot waves to get back to shore!

124218534.name: Amazing beach if you\'re a surfer
124218534.author: a TripAdvisor user
124218534.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach, however keep in mind this is NOT a swimming beach.  In fact you will probably be dragged out before even getting in.  The waves here are huge.  Lots of eateries on this beach.  Great beach to visit for the day.

123930865.name: restaurants and waves
123930865.author: a TripAdvisor user
123930865.reviewBody: There were lots of restaurants to choose from. The beach was not crowded.

123602564.name: the sun!
123602564.author: a TripAdvisor user
123602564.reviewBody: if you like to surf or do bodybording this is a great place! the beach line is wery long, you can walk along it, and it is alot of bars and restaurant all iong the way. at the end of zicatela its a place called la punta( most of the surfers are there), there can you walk to the other side of the mountain and walk along untouchd beach;) its paradise!

123299043.name: Skydivers!!
123299043.author: a TripAdvisor user
123299043.reviewBody: The beach was nice, with a relaxed collection of cabanas attached to the various restaurants.  The waves were manageable for just basic wading.  The highlight of the day, aside from just relaxing, was that there were groups of 8 or so skydivers landing quite near us every half hour or so. Not parasailers from a boat, but seemingly experienced free-fall parachutists....was a nice diversion...I don\'t know if this was a one-day deal or what.

123173183.name: Amazing Beach
123173183.author: a TripAdvisor user
123173183.reviewBody: Nice bars, restaurants ........ Sometimes the waves are too high to swim but the beach is a great chilling place !!

122878735.name: Enjoy the waves!
122878735.author: a TripAdvisor user
122878735.reviewBody: Huge waves, great to watch the surfers early in the morning or from 5pm whilst enjoying a sundowner

122777376.name: A great place to watch surfers!
122777376.author: a TripAdvisor user
122777376.reviewBody: Huge beach. It goes on and on forever! Very beautiful! Even though its not adviced to swim here, its fun to watch the surfers!

121856333.name: Playa Zicatela is relaxing and quiet
121856333.author: a TripAdvisor user
121856333.reviewBody: If you want a beach that is not crowded, then Playa Zicatela is your beach.  It spans a little over two miles so there is plenty of room for activities and there are plenty of restaurants to serve you drinks and food all day long.

121508253.name: Amazing beach..
121508253.author: a TripAdvisor user
121508253.reviewBody: enormous beach.. clean.. wavy.. good for 1st time surfers.. good to walk and explore the rocks at the side where the lighthouse is :) surrounded by greenery.. the only prob is that u couldn\'t swim as the waves are pretty dangerous, but still enjoyable!\njust loved it..

121506843.name: Mexican Pipeline
121506843.author: a TripAdvisor user
121506843.reviewBody: Surf can get pretty big here.  Caution on the big swells.

121505298.name: international surf competition
121505298.author: a TripAdvisor user
121505298.reviewBody: We were hear for the international festival.    It sounded like Owen Wilson announcing -- wonderful flat California accent -- "he\'s riding the line."   Fun stuff!

850872.name: zicatela es la bomba
850872.author: a TripAdvisor user
850872.reviewBody: playa zicatela is absolutley gorgeous!!!!along the beach, you will find many fabulous affordable restaurants.  The cafacita seems to be the all time favorite. serving breakfast, lunch, and dinner.(don\'t leave home without a mango pastry)-great atmosphere, and very friendly servicethere is a gelato stand that serves the best gelato that I have ever had and they have a large variety of flavors to choose from, and the prices were great. you can find all of your favorite foods somewhere on the strip anything from grilled steaks/pork chops, seafood, spaghetti, pancakes, pastries, pizza and of course your traditional mexican dishes be sure to stop by the cute little coffeehouse/librarywhere you can buy coffee, tea, cold drinks and even used books(also, if you bring them one of your used books, you can trade it in for one of theirs)there are also many places to stay, anywhere from$4 and upTHe place I stay is Acali. you can either stay in a  cabanas  or bungalow.  I prefer the cabanas!! they are spacious bamboo huts with a private bathroom (except for the iguana that kept creeping in)each room has a ceiling fan and mosquito netting i you can ask for a propane stove and a 5 gallon water jug  to keep on your front porchacali has a pool, a bar, and a  full time cook eager to prepare you a meal(for a reasonable price)the best thing about Acali\'s location is THE SHADElots and lots of trees, the cabanas are very airy and hardly ever get hotIt has been 2 years since I have been there and I once heard someone say, once you go, you will always come back and it\'s true!!!  I am going back in 3 weeksoh, and of course there is the surfing!!!!!i heard it is the best but I am terrified myself to venture too far into the water everything was great except-WHERE ARE THE PUBLIC BATHROOMS WHEN YOU ARE ON THE BEACH?

540748330.name: See mexico- all in one street
540748330.author: a TripAdvisor user
540748330.reviewBody: The picture show for this attraction is the night view when many merchants set up there tables of mexican junk for sale to the tourists (mainly mexican). It is something watching them go to so much work setting out their wares, watching them wait patiently to sell a few trinkets. Then take it all down and pack it up later. It is the same stuff all the shops on this street sell day and night. You can eat in any of the many restaurants on or behind the street- ranging from the high end Pascals,  to Vitamina T (a chiste for tacos, taluydas and tortillas), cafes, tacos etc. Buy beer is a tined or a bar. Go the the upstair discos later. It is a great place to stroll in the evening as well as the place with most selection for tourist junk day or night. The street is blocked off for cars in the evening making it more relaxing than places you have to doge taxis and trucks.

390217019.name: Stroll, browse and shop.
390217019.author: a TripAdvisor user
390217019.reviewBody: This strip is filled with something for everyone and very popular at night.  It\'s so popular that they close the road down only to foot traffic.  Looking for dessert, a seafood meal or something fast to grab? This is your spot!  \nAs far as shopping, visit in the evening when all of the vendors are setting up.  Home made jewelry, Oaxacan treasures and beach gear can be found.

197922882.name: Nice walk around old downtown PE
197922882.author: a TripAdvisor user
197922882.reviewBody:
This walking boulevard has changed somewhat over the years.
Lot of shops,restaurants,hotels,handicraft markets,bars,taquerias,ice cream,language school and more...at each end are two tourist information points...police walking around speak little English.
Some restaurants have a nice ocean view of Playa Principal (Main Beach)
Very early you can find a super fresh and simple fish market on the beach.
At the east end is being built a new brand shopping mall.

157374113.name: Charming
157374113.author: a TripAdvisor user
157374113.reviewBody: Perez Gasga reminds me Playa del Carmen in Q Roo. Pto Escondido has been growing with the years but still a charming place

140788151.name: Nice Strip Commercial Boulevard with Shops and Restaurants
140788151.author: a TripAdvisor user
140788151.reviewBody: Nice place to shop and eat with many eating establishments offering views of the ocean. What makes this boulevard exceptional is the Information Booth operated by Gina the "information goddess". She is a wealth of information on everything to do in and about Puerto Escondido. For example, she told us about a turtle release function that was coming up in a few days from a turtle sanctuary located outside of town. We left her our email address and she contacted us with the date info so that we could all go together. She also told us about a restaurant in town that all the locals go to that served great food and she was right.

638463657.name: University Del Mar Botanical gardens close to Puerto Escondido
638463657.author: a TripAdvisor user
638463657.reviewBody: A group of us went and spent a couple hours climbing the paths and stairs around the nature reserve.  A lot of effort has been put in to make it interesting and entertaining.  Our guides were Spanish speakers but did their best with the English they had as we did with our limited Spanish.  We enjoyed seeing all the different trees and learning some were local but some were brought in to the country.  There was a cacti garden and an orchid garden as well.

itemReviewed.name: Jardin Botanico Universidad del Mar campus

address.streetAddress: km 244 Puerto Escondido Road Sola de Vega

564963547.name: Great side trip
564963547.author: a TripAdvisor user
564963547.reviewBody: We visited in February ... the dry season.  Not much in bloom but having a personal tour given by a student at the university was fabulous. The tour was in Spanish but our guide spoke slowly so it was good practice for us to use our phrase-book Espanol. The Jardin is more of a conservation area than a botanical garden but it was nice to see the effort to preserve local trees and plants by the local university. We were happy to support their project even if it was not very elaborate. There is no entrance fee but we did tip our guide who is a student.\n\nWe heard about the Jardin from Gina Machorro, the \'information godess\' at the tourist office on the Adoquin in Puerto Escondido.  She told us how to get the \'collectivo\' bus there and recommended going on to San Pedro on the \'collectivo\' after our garden tour. This was one of our most interesting days in Puerto Escondido.

itemReviewed.name: Jardin Botanico Universidad del Mar campus

address.streetAddress: km 244 Puerto Escondido Road Sola de Vega

443909996.name: Well worth a visit, especially for botanists
443909996.author: a TripAdvisor user
443909996.reviewBody: Just a short taxi or collectivo ride north of Puerto Escondido. Our group of 4 only spent a half hour here, but we were treated to a guided tour by a knowledgeable botanist. The Jardin is well maintained and well protected. It was a stop on our way to San Pedro and well worth it.

itemReviewed.name: Jardin Botanico Universidad del Mar campus

address.streetAddress: km 244 Puerto Escondido Road Sola de Vega

437072547.name: Nature Reserve
437072547.author: a TripAdvisor user
437072547.reviewBody:
The Botanical Garden is more of a Reserve, certainly not a Botanical Garden that you might see in the U.S. or Europe.  You will need to go with a guide and the tour will take about an hour.  The tour will be in Spanish.  The entrance and the guide are free but you can tip the guide.  The Spanish speaking guides are recent graduates from the University and are knowledgeable.

The Reserve has gone out of the way to find local medicinal plants and plant them along the trail.  If you are interested medicinal plants, especially trees, the Reserve might be of interest to you.

The Reserve also has a small collection of orchids.

I found the place to be boring and do not recommend bothering to go there, unless you have an interest in medicinal plants.

itemReviewed.name: Jardin Botanico Universidad del Mar campus

address.streetAddress: km 244 Puerto Escondido Road Sola de Vega

352601784.name: Disappointing. Poor season to visit.
352601784.author: a TripAdvisor user
352601784.reviewBody: We went there in February which is the dry season and so many of the trees etc were not in bloom. This is more of a conservation area then a botanical garden. Also not for those who have walking issues as there is a lot of climbing. Our guide was helpful and very knowledgeable but spoke no English so if no one in your party speaks Spanish expect to gain little from the visit. Some lovely vistas but overall not the best time of year to visit. Inuit.

itemReviewed.name: Jardin Botanico Universidad del Mar campus

address.streetAddress: km 244 Puerto Escondido Road Sola de Vega

658135782.name: Great place to relax!
658135782.author: a TripAdvisor user
658135782.reviewBody: Great place to relax and swim under the sun. Palapa are available. You can order drinks or food or walk a few steps to a number of great restaurants. Spent several days there.

654961445.name: beautiful calm water
654961445.author: a TripAdvisor user
654961445.reviewBody: this is a beautiful beach which offers snorkeling, some waves, and leisurely swimming. For $300 pesos you can hire 2 chairs under the shade which are sued towards consumption

635428256.name: Excellent Boogie Boarding
635428256.author: a TripAdvisor user
635428256.reviewBody: Great bay for boogie boarding. Save some $ and rent boards on the beach by the hour. A few beach side restaurants near by for beer & lunch too.

463476567.name: Don\'t miss a visit to Lizas Bar on the beach
463476567.author: a TripAdvisor user
463476567.reviewBody: Have visited Lizas bar here almost every year for the last 20 years at Christmas. Main reason the atmosphere,  the guacamole, the company, the music and I can safely say the best margarita in the world and trust me Ive tried many! It has become a tradition to just come and chill for a for a few hours on an afternoon. Lots of interesting characters on an evening and Liza is one of the nicest people I have ever met along with her long standing barman. He taught my son Reef how to make a margarita when he was only about 6 years old, and now he comes and visits and chills out with me at 17 years old. Haven\'t seen the rooms yet, but must make a point of it this chirstmas. See you then XX

390216055.name: Nice for a stroll
390216055.author: a TripAdvisor user
390216055.reviewBody: Nice for a stroll.  Start by the dock and check out the fisherman bringing in their haul.  Walk up to the statue of a mermaid and make a right.  Scale a few stairs and you will be bewildered by the view!  Get out the pano setting and take a few snaps!   The light house is to your right, Playa Zicatela to your left and the Pacific straight out!

383136380.name: Hang out and enjoy
383136380.author: a TripAdvisor user
383136380.reviewBody: The place to be to visit Lisa bar and restaurant for the best margarita and guacamole in the world and the best fresh oysters straight from the sea from the oyster men near the rocks for just a few dollars

354778613.name: Good people watching beach.
354778613.author: a TripAdvisor user
354778613.reviewBody: Lots of action if you enjoy boats and sand walkers. Safe to swim, as lifeguard chair station is 50 ft from the beach.

344865428.name: No music
344865428.author: a TripAdvisor user
344865428.reviewBody:
Nice family oriented beach without the bars that line Zicatela blaring music. Quiet, but you can still rent a chair and umbrella and get a beer.

The locals all show up after work with picnics for a pre dinner swim. 

Very nice beach.

343652401.name: A Quaint Neighborhood Beach
343652401.author: a TripAdvisor user
343652401.reviewBody: Nice mix of locals & tourists with a pay-for-shade set-up, so be prepared to pick a lounge chair and at least sip on a fresh limonada,

337853813.name: Fishing boats
337853813.author: a TripAdvisor user
337853813.reviewBody: This is the very end section of the main beach, the most in town. This is where the fishing boats come in, which can be fascinating. In the morning they approach the beach, at speed, and then glide up the beach on rollers. The selection and size of the fish they catch are amazing. However, some of the fish are then cleaned, and some of the discarded parts go back into the ocean, which is just fine by the sea birds. Interesting place to watch, but not for swimming or sunbathing.

299692499.name: Nothing special
299692499.author: a TripAdvisor user
299692499.reviewBody: You can\'t swim on this beach as it is too dangerous and only suitable for surfers. Some good restaurants though

262309059.name: Waves!
262309059.author: a TripAdvisor user
262309059.reviewBody: You can come in the morning to watch the fishermen unload fish but I was not too impressed by this beach and it is certainly not for swimming.

241634265.name: UNLESS YOU ARE A FISHERMAN- SKIP
241634265.author: a TripAdvisor user
241634265.reviewBody: a real hole , not to clean and not too pleasant, the restaurants look poor and taste worse, we tried the best looking one, and we got a fish with odd smell wholly soaked in oil. skip this part  , you have much  much better choices in puerto escondido, don\'t spoil your vacation.

220738770.name: Great to watch in the mornings
220738770.author: a TripAdvisor user
220738770.reviewBody: I don\'t swim here but in the mornings between about 7 and 8am the fishermen come back in to shore and sell their catch, straight from the boat to the buyer. Fantastic stuff, love to watch it all going on. If i ate fish, this is no doubt where I would buy it from!

190887149.name: For fishermen and locals only.
190887149.author: a TripAdvisor user
190887149.reviewBody: This could have been a great beach but it is full of fishing boats both off-shore and on the beach. However there are lots of chairs and shade umbrellas for rent and food service. No sunset viewing from here makes it a locals kind of place most tourists would rather avoid.

180951773.name: Good Swimming Beach
180951773.author: a TripAdvisor user
180951773.reviewBody: Great way to spend the day - the Mexican family that sets up on the beach will get whatever you want drinks, food etc - they send a runner to pick up whatever you order. Liza\'s makes awesome margaritas.  Everyone was friendly.  A great Mexican Beach experience>

162751430.name: Safe beach to bodyboard & swim
162751430.author: a TripAdvisor user
162751430.reviewBody: I take my young kids to swim at this beach because there is always a lifeguard on duty and fun waves to ride a bodyboard. In summer the waves are better/bigger but still a good family beach. Any afternoon their will be 20+ local kids learning to bodyboard but still plenty of room for visitors to have ago on rented equipment.

132918481.name: Our favorite beach.
132918481.author: a TripAdvisor user
132918481.reviewBody: We spend our days sitting a Restaurant Liza under palapas or on her deck and enjoy great food and drinks, watching the waves and swimming in them when it gets hot. A perfect Mexican beach experience.

130548371.name: A fine beach
130548371.author: a TripAdvisor user
130548371.reviewBody: It was a great place to relax, get lots of sun, rent an umbrella and chair, and go for a boat ride. Restaurants are nearby. It\'s all about relaxation and the swimming is safe although vigorous here as compared to the Zicatela.

20936485.name: The best beach
20936485.author: a TripAdvisor user
20936485.reviewBody: I live in Ca. But i own a trailer on the entrance to Playa Marinero. I stay down there approx. 3 mos.out of the year, and spend alot of time on Marinero.The beach is the best for swimming, boogie boarding,body surfing, and for smaller children.Water is warm, clear. It is by far the best kick back beach around.Al.

475360105.name: Could not find the gallery
475360105.author: a TripAdvisor user
475360105.reviewBody: We were very disappointed that we could not find the gallery with the map provided. We walked all around the streets were the gallery was supposed to be but no luck.

address.streetAddress: Calle Oaxaca, Col. Brisas de Zicatela Entre Justo Salvador e Hidalgo

666056764.name: Great place for small children
666056764.author: a TripAdvisor user
666056764.reviewBody: The waves are never very big-- no rip tides here-- lots of Mexicans with their children-- lots of small fishing boats over night off shore and on shore here.  Lotsof Activity. A fun active  place to be.  A bit of old Mexcio

660300878.name: Check out the Split Coconut!
660300878.author: a TripAdvisor user
660300878.reviewBody: I visited this beach many times over the 3 weeks I spent in Puerto Escondido.  The surf on this beach is lower, so it is easier for swimming.  However this is also where the fishing boats come in and out, so it is a busy area.  One can easily access the Split Coconut Bar from this beach, which offers the BEST Ribs I\'ve ever eaten, and great Canadian patrons.  There are horse shoe games every Monday and Wednesday, a great way to meet people.

657911002.name: Beautiful area.
657911002.author: a TripAdvisor user
657911002.reviewBody: Spent several afternoons here relaxing and swimming.  The access to palapas made it a worthwhile activity.  You were very close to restaurants and shopping.

654347737.name: Fishing Beach
654347737.author: a TripAdvisor user
654347737.reviewBody: A number of restaurants, pubs plus local fishing boats.  Next to the Adoquin where there is local shopping.  Nice place to visit, shop or eat.

637913051.name: Nice surfing beach
637913051.author: a TripAdvisor user
637913051.reviewBody: Puerto Escondido is known for its surfing. Not as big as north shore in Hawaii but still good surfing

636377199.name: Great photo-ops at dawn!
636377199.author: a TripAdvisor user
636377199.reviewBody: I went down there before sunrise and watched the fishermen getting ready for the day. Also lots of birds in the lagoon there. There is a small malec\u00f3n around the corner which has some good photo ops too.

622985306.name: Very nice beach by the main bay at Puerto Escondido
622985306.author: a TripAdvisor user
622985306.reviewBody: This beach is of regular size and the waves and currents are softer than at other nearby beaches like Zicatela. It is very close tothe main shopping street for tourists in Puerto Escondido. There are several restaurants frequented by locals and visitors. The only inconvenience is that some tenants may have loud speakers on their premises and this makes the place a bit noisy.

557577966.name: 7  am is the time to be here
557577966.author: a TripAdvisor user
557577966.reviewBody: You will be surprised by the level of activity you can witness on this beach so early in the morning.  The fishing boats offer plenty of opportunity for photo shoots.  Just enjoy a stroll.

542612367.name: very hot
542612367.author: a TripAdvisor user
542612367.reviewBody: With the decent to the beach from the hilly streets above you will find yourself in need of shade. Bars and restaurants are the only shade and with no breeze the way this beach is situated it becomes even hotter. The water is shallow and calm for swimming

520758333.name: A lively little beach!
520758333.author: a TripAdvisor user
520758333.reviewBody: The fishing boats bring their catch daily with many special events, swimming, snorkeling and fishing tournaments. There are many restaurants lining the beach with palm trees and the freshest fish! Enjoy the calm surf (perfect for children) and amazing sunsets.

511870702.name: lost it\'s charm
511870702.author: a TripAdvisor user
511870702.reviewBody: I visited Puerto Escondido when the principal beach was the only place where there was development. Now it is overcrowded and unfortunately there are even sewage smells in the town. There\'s still a few good restaurants but I definitely would not stay in this part of town now that there are developments further out.

506618140.name: A beach for families
506618140.author: a TripAdvisor user
506618140.reviewBody: Playa Principal is a place where local families gather. It\'s packed with boats offering tours for dolphin watching. You can also stroll along the main street, Adoquin, where you can find gorgeous crafts.

467028960.name: A great place to spend the day
467028960.author: a TripAdvisor user
467028960.reviewBody: A wonderful wide beach located between playa Ricadeli and  playa Angelita. the area closer to boat basin is good for swimming  as current is not as strong  if you head toward Ricadeli.  If you are a good swimmer it does not matter where you decide to sit. There are restaurants located at the back of beach that are decent and you can get seafood and drinks. during the week pretty much empty.Nice!!

463789463.name: Great place to relax and soak up the sun!
463789463.author: a TripAdvisor user
463789463.reviewBody: Easy walking distance from our suite.  Water was warm and inviting - waves were quite small.  A number of wonderful restaurants ring the beach.  I can\'t wait to get back.

462660691.name: Good swimming beach with lots of restaurants
462660691.author: a TripAdvisor user
462660691.reviewBody: This is the main swimming beach in Puerto Escondido. If you come for lunch or dinner or buy drinks you can use their chairs and umbrellas for free. Several good beach restaurants. The weekends get very busy with more local families.

450577463.name: Great place to relax
450577463.author: a TripAdvisor user
450577463.reviewBody: This is a great beach to find lots of little restaurants and souvenir shops. Very low key and comfortable place to unwind. There are several little restaurants that open up to the beach and have great views. There are also several great low cost hotels to choose from.

426854724.name: Ok for a walk
426854724.author: a TripAdvisor user
426854724.reviewBody: Not the best beach in town but ok for a stroll and to watch the fishermen, or help, cast off their boats from the beach in the late afternoons.

421894240.name: Black water
421894240.author: a TripAdvisor user
421894240.reviewBody: There\'s alot of boats parking there so the water are very black and you can\'t really get into it even though the waves not that big aver there like in zicatela

367632742.name: where you will find the local people enjoying a nice day at the beach
367632742.author: a TripAdvisor user
367632742.reviewBody: Busy beach full of the local people it is shared with the fisher men from the area so its full of small fishing boats.

361485662.name: Coney Island of Oaxaca
361485662.author: a TripAdvisor user
361485662.reviewBody: If you like noise, crowds, and the constant interruptions of vendors, this beach is for you. The waters are a little less wild than the surfing beach of Zicatela, but it\'s still pretty rough for swimming.

352102146.name: A little dirty and too many boats on the water.
352102146.author: a TripAdvisor user
352102146.reviewBody: I\'m not sure if it\'s because I visited between peak seasons, but there are just too many boats on the water close to the shore where people swim, I don\'t like that. Also, the beach is kinda dirty.

345949623.name: Primary beach for Puerto Escondido with the commercial fish boats
345949623.author: a TripAdvisor user
345949623.reviewBody: Walking along the beach from Zicatela one passes the lagoon and the beach restaurants before coming to the access to the main part of town,

344639946.name: Large Beach
344639946.author: a TripAdvisor user
344639946.reviewBody: This area is walkable form Casa Dans. Perfect for body surfing a good variety of places to get food and drink close by. Enjoyed sitting mom this beach to watch the amazing sunset

343797519.name: Friendly beach
343797519.author: a TripAdvisor user
343797519.reviewBody: No big waves! Easy beach for kids and novice swimmers.  Very popular beach with locals and tourists. Fun place.

343651308.name: Fishing Boats & Local Families
343651308.author: a TripAdvisor user
343651308.reviewBody: Not the most beautiful beach in PE, but charming in it\'s own way...it\'s for the locals, not the tourists. Also has some good Mexican seafood restaurants.

340056255.name: Explore the many aspects
340056255.author: a TripAdvisor user
340056255.reviewBody:
This is a nice area to spend several hours exploring.  First, it's the entrance to the cliff walk, which you should dedicate several hours to walking.  The earlier the better as it gets quite hot with the morning sun.  Check out the memorial to the three men who lost their lives to the sea.  It's at the entry.  

There are fresh fish for sale in the morning and they're piled up on the beach just waiting for customers to select the best.  The fisherman will fillet it for you and if you walk out the entrance and across the street, on the right, there's a restaurant that will cook it for you.  Ask the seller where to go, they'll provide directions.

Enjoy the sights, sounds, and smells of the beach.  There will be food for sale and ice cream always is good on a hot day.  Walk along the road parallel to the beach, Perez Gazga, also known as the Adoquin, for the many shops there.  Even if you don't buy, the window-shopping is fun.  They close the road in the afternoon, I believe from 4:00 to 6:00, for pedestrian use only.  Many vendors congregate and it's all the more fun to experience.  There are many bars and restaurants and if you're a night person, there's always Wednesday salsa night at a bar on the strip but it starts at 11:00 pm, past my bedtime but it sounds fun.  

We didn't swim but the area is swimmer friendly.  You can also continue walking towards Zicatela and enjoy the surfers and sky divers that use the area.    All totaled, it's an enjoyable experience and you'll want to explore the area at least once.

337851986.name: There are better
337851986.author: a TripAdvisor user
337851986.reviewBody: Playa Principal is just the name of one section of the long, main beach, that becomes Zicatela Beach. It\'s popular with the locals, but few tourists. It\'s next to Playa Marinero, where the fishing boats come ashore, and some fishy "bits" get into the water. However, towards the other end, by the rocks, next to Zicatela, it is fine, but doesn\'t really have any services.

335261641.name: A little rough for swimming
335261641.author: a TripAdvisor user
335261641.reviewBody: You can get umbrellas with a couple of loungers for the day for $100 pesos. You can order drinks and food from the umbrella guy but don\'t expect good quality. The beach is full of peddlers selling everything from food, accessories, toys, souvenirs, and anything you can imagine. The umbrellas are a little far from the water so I could not see my kids playing in the water. My husband and I had to rotate sitting in the sun by the water so we could keep an eye on our kids. The waves are still pretty strong for kids and this beach is right next to fishing boats and a lagoon so it does not fill clean.

335128138.name: Souvenir Spot
335128138.author: a TripAdvisor user
335128138.reviewBody: A perfect spot to purchase local souvenirs made by the Oaxacan people themselves. You can also find individuals selling items from Chiapas. Also a lot of local street food. The restaurant Benditos is also located here and is our favorite restaurant in Puerto Escondido with the most delicious pizza ever!

328858068.name: Great holidays in Puerto Escondido
328858068.author: a TripAdvisor user
328858068.reviewBody: Its a great beach for swimming specially with children. The waves are not as harsh as on the other beaches. There are restaurants close by, chairs and umbrellas for shade.

311441403.name: Not the best beach to go
311441403.author: a TripAdvisor user
311441403.reviewBody: It\'s very recognize but it\'s not as beautiful as any of the other beaches the only good thing of the bahia it\'s that you can buy fresh fish from the locals and that you can take a small Rd that goes from there to Un sue\u00f1o posible and the views are amazing.

299692865.name: Expected more...
299692865.author: a TripAdvisor user
299692865.reviewBody: The Laguna makes the beach look really dirty and unkept. Dangerous to swim on this beach too but it is close to a nice street with shops on it which is worth the look

296326622.name: fishing boats
296326622.author: a TripAdvisor user
296326622.reviewBody: check out the fishing boats racing onto shore at 7am.  You can buy the fish straight from the boat if you want.  This has less waves than zicatela and is safer to swim

262748221.name: Dirty run down beach area
262748221.author: a TripAdvisor user
262748221.reviewBody: This beach is very dirty, with run off from drains or sewers flowing on the the sand, and some over priced restaurants. Many of the  buildings along the beach are derelict. This used to be a beautiful spot, years ago. Now...Yuck.

259196033.name: Crashing Waves Pounding a Vast Clean Beach
259196033.author: a TripAdvisor user
259196033.reviewBody: Playa Zicatella is the main beach of Pto Escondido. It is famous as one of the world\'s best surfing beaches. Not good for weak swimmers since you have to get beyond the big breakers, undertows, currents, eddies close to shore. It is several miles of broad clean beige sand for wonderful walks. Watch the pelicans, cormorants and other sea birds do their surf fishing. Those ancients, the sea turtles lay their eggs there. The eggs are collected and taken to hatcheries. If you are fortunate you will see one of the many hatchling releases as the 4 inch long wee turtles scramble across the sand into the sea.

256012245.name: Where to catch a boat, but not to catch the sun
256012245.author: a TripAdvisor user
256012245.reviewBody: This beach is where the fishing boats and water taxis leave from. The water is calm but the beach is dirty in comparison to zicatela or carazilillo. Sunset view is impaired here - consider it a waypoint but not a destination.

251604816.name: A beach for the people
251604816.author: a TripAdvisor user
251604816.reviewBody: This is the beach where the fishing boats are, where children can swim safely...adults too.  The surf is calm here, no bid surf waves. You can watch the fisherman haul their boats, filet their fish...buy jewelry from beach vendors. This is the real life of the people of the town. One can watch a fotbol game with young boys every evening!   A fun beach to be a part of.

247826270.name: don\'t swim here, just walk and enjoy the people
247826270.author: a TripAdvisor user
247826270.reviewBody: The water is not so clean so avoid the swimming, but a lovely walk among the fishing boats.  Buy fresh fish on the beach.

245168456.name: Locals and Fishing beach
245168456.author: a TripAdvisor user
245168456.reviewBody: We walked this beach several times it leads into downtown one day there were having a fishing contest big crown and everybody was selling Michelada\'s we drank beers and took in all the sights it was lots of fun

243632903.name: Head to the east end
243632903.author: a TripAdvisor user
243632903.reviewBody: This is definitely not the best beach in Puerto. Take in consideration that this is more like s fishing dock where you are gonna find more boats( lanchas) \nAnyways you\'ll have to go if you are taking a boat to go fishing

237120819.name: Locals beach with some good restaurants.
237120819.author: a TripAdvisor user
237120819.reviewBody: Nice place to interact with the locals, pick up a beach soccer game, or have a happy hour on the beach followed by a good meal.

221655107.name: Average Beach
221655107.author: a TripAdvisor user
221655107.reviewBody: This beach is good, mainly at night. You can find great places to eat and shop. The beach is crowded and not that beautiful. Strong waves. Recommend go to the beaches near by!

221068883.name: Hippie style beach
221068883.author: a TripAdvisor user
221068883.reviewBody: Most of Puerto Escondido has the hippie-surfer atmosphere. And depending on your planned vacation this can be a really cool place. Most of the beaches have high waves and make it easy to learn how to surf.

209956184.name: Great beach to watch the surfers!
209956184.author: a TripAdvisor user
209956184.reviewBody: This beach does not disappoint although the currents are quite strong and are best left to just going knee deep in most places... Surfer\'s paradise which they appropriately call the Mexican Pipeline! Great place to watch the surfers do their thing... Hope this review was helpful!!!

190887045.name: Good for swimming, bad for sunsets!
190887045.author: a TripAdvisor user
190887045.reviewBody: Located next to Playa Zicotela this is a nice place for families with children. Unfortunately you can not see the sunset from here most of the year. Food and drink service on the beach is available.

176149646.name: Try Pascale\'s here
176149646.author: a TripAdvisor user
176149646.reviewBody: We went to Pascale\'s for dinner and had a table on the beach and excellent, freshly grilled seafood.  There are lots of bars nearby, nice for an evening out.

165449752.name: Freshest food
165449752.author: a TripAdvisor user
165449752.reviewBody: Every morning you can buy from \u00a8pescadores\u00a8 (fishermen) fresh catch fish and have it cook in one of the more than two dozen restaurants. Beach is beautiful however, because of the fishermen, it\u00b4s full of small boats throughout the day.

164744532.name: For walking or scuba diving...
164744532.author: a TripAdvisor user
164744532.reviewBody: This was the beach we went scuba diving from.  Right off the main street where the scuba shops are.  Boats that were fishing in the early morning are now available for scuba diving trip.  Keep in mind NO BEACH is safe when dark.

140714612.name: also ok...
140714612.author: a TripAdvisor user
140714612.reviewBody: ...when it comes to market-shopping on the promenade with lots of mexican liquors or handcrafts.\nsome very good restaurants, but also here, very focused on foreigners and therefore not much REAL mexican restaurants...

140465361.name: bay side bliss
140465361.author: a TripAdvisor user
140465361.reviewBody:
Great shopping, not all shops open every day..
Accommodation is good, Zicatela is more chilled

Gina in the Tourist Information desk is seriously one of the most helpful people on the planet!!

133775781.name: Secret stairs and boats galore
133775781.author: a TripAdvisor user
133775781.reviewBody: There were lots of low-key bars and restaurants lining this beach, and several local and tourist beach-goers alike enjoying the surf, but the fishing boats and secret staircase were the main attraction. If you circumvent the many work boats to the statue of the mermaid, there is a staircase that lines the cliffs and goes most of the way to the next beach. It made for a thrilling afternoon walk, to see the waves crashing against the rocks, but be safely on a well-traveled path.

124218392.name: The fisherman\'s beach
124218392.author: a TripAdvisor user
124218392.reviewBody: This is the beach where many fishing boats will depart from as well as dock for the night.  There are lots of restaurants here where you can grab lunch, dinner or just have a few cocktails and watch the fishermen come in with their catch.
